Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15272 Department: Operations Group Summary of Responsibilities Pembina Pipeline Corporation has an immediate opening for an Operations Engineer in our Oil Sands Business Unit (OBU) to support the operations of its pipeline assets. You will be a direct contributor to the ongoing development of Pembina’s pipeline business. The ideal candidate would be stationed in Calgary, Alberta with frequent travel to the field offices. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: Visibly demonstrate commitment and personal accountability to Pembina’s “Zero by Choice” safety culture, as well as ensuring staff and contractors are fully aware and compliant with Pembina’s safety requirements; Work with multi-disciplinary teams to develop safe, efficient and cost effective operating philosophies and solutions for customers involving pipeline operations; Troubleshoot maintenance and processing problems, identify cost effective solutions and implement to completion using Pembina’s Management of Change (MOC) process; Monitor pipeline performance and identify opportunities to reduce cost, improve safety, increase reliability and increase throughput; Work closely with Operations team to optimize existing asset performance and efficiency; Support the coordination of projects and communication between Engineering, Operations, Commercial and Finance/Accounting functional groups; Co-ordinate and manage outside engineering consultants, specialty consultants and contractors, and internal subject matter experts for the execution of design, construction and commissioning of projects; and Build and maintain a network of service providers and technical representatives to create an effective and sustainable operations environment. Qualifications Candidates will be a Professional Engineer (Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical preferred) and be registered with APEGA with a minimum 5 years’ experience in a Project Engineering or other technical role; Demonstrated knowledge of safe work practices and protocols applied in the industry; Proven success in supporting field Operations and defining, implementing and executing technical solutions to operating problems; Pipeline and oilfield maintenance, construction and commissioning experience; Working knowledge of ASME, ABSA, AER, CSA and regulatory codes related to the operation of oil and gas facilities considered an asset; Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as presentation skills; Well-organized, detail-oriented, enthusiastic and confident, with excellent problem-solving skills and a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude toward work; Driven, results-oriented individual who naturally takes responsibility for setting the standard and achieving results; Self-directed and capable of working within a continuously changing environment; Ability to lead and work effectively in a team environment; Instills confidence and creates strong relationships quickly; and Ability to prioritize and meet reporting deadlines. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Job_Description: Phoenix Technology Services is a progressive and innovative Calgary based directional drilling company. Driven by our client’s needs, we are committed to providing more efficient and cost-effective drilling operations.We have an opening for an Electrical Engineer based out of our SE Technical Centre. Reporting to the Electrical Engineering Manager (EEM), the Electrical Engineer (EE) will be a member of the Engineering department whose goal is to assure reliability, cost effectiveness and safety of proprietary technologies as well as supporting the needs of the Company. The incumbent will be responsible for a broad spectrum of initiatives involving the Engineering and Manufacturing, Reliability and Survey Domain teams as well as occasional tech support for field operations. Key areas of accountability will focus on providing analytical expertise and supporting surveying, directional drilling and calibration of MWD directional sensors.Responsibilities also include: Develop and maintain calibration infrastructure (hardware, firmware, software) relating to directional sensors and capture learnings (e.g., processes, methods, algorithms, etc.) in a knowledge base.Work with the Survey Domain team as an expert responder to inquiries and provide guidance and expertise on application of MSA (Multi-station Analysis) and research into continuous improvements.Develop work instructions, sensor verification, calibration techniques and processes associated with the fleet of directional sensors, in collaboration with Manufacturing and Service Technicians.Work with Reliability team to triage and troubleshoot directional sensor failures and document corrective actions.Analyze performance of vendor products, document findings and communicate with vendors on continuous improvements.Participate in hardware, firmware, peer design reviews, and general troubleshooting and triage activity.Prepare supplemental technical, design, specification, testing, training and procedural documentation as needed.Provide in-person training and support to groups within Phoenix as required.Provide occasional support for service and field operations.Maintain complete and comprehensive records of daily activities and report to the EEM on a weekly basis.Occasional travel may be required.The successful candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, or Engineering Physics from an accredited University or College and is a member of APEGA in good standing or eligible for licensing in Alberta. This individual will have experience with embedded firmware coding and debugging in C environment, version control systems, preferably Subversion, Altium Schematic Design and PCB layout, and demonstrated experience with Matlab and Labview tools. Knowledge in oilfield drilling operations, MWD surveying technology and applications and familiarity with Visual Studio, .net and C# language are assets. They will also have good working knowledge of electrical hardware and firmware design best practices, strong documentation skills for design, testing and reporting as well as demonstrated understanding of quality assurance methods and reliability of electronic systems. This candidate is a quick learner with strong work ethic, goal focused and attentive to detail and will also have exceptional interpersonal and written communication skills, strong troubleshooting skills, is deeply analytical, with a passion for applied mathematics (electromagnetics and kinematics).Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Electrical Engineering: 1 yearEducation:Bachelor's
Title: Electrical Engineer

Job_Description: Position Profile  The Junior Electrical Engineer/Technologist will be part of a design team working on automation and low to medium voltage electrical engineering design projects. The project types will vary in size and complexity, and may include, but not be limited to DCS, PLC, HMI, SCADA and RTU systems.  Position Accountabilities  Electrical engineering and design work on all aspects of electrical design under supervision of the project lead.  Preparation and execution of electrical design documents and related calculations, such as voltage drop, cable tray loading, conduit fill calculations, overcurrent selection, motor starting calculations and overload selection, etc.  Staging and Testing – assist in the preparation of test plans and inspect/test hardware  Drawing package preparation – prepare various electrical drawings:  Layout drawings  Control panel drawings  Power distribution schematics  I/O schematics  Loop drawings  Junction box layout & termination drawings  Single line diagrams  Motor control schematics  Grounding diagrams  Lighting/Distribution panel drawings  System architecture drawings  Marshalling termination drawings  Installation detail drawings  Construction work package preparation – produce a construction scope of work document, construction specifications and supporting documentation.  Procurement – assist with the specification and procurement of equipment. Prepare bid specifications, bid comparisons and produce recommendations for purchase.  Narratives and documentation - produce as-build narratives and shutdown keys from existing PLC code. Prepare reports on various aspects of the project.  System Architecture drawings - as-build and additions to architecture drawings and block drawings.  Candidate Profile  Diploma in Electrical Engineering Technology or B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from an accredited institution.  Registration with professional engineering association.  Canadian Citizen or Canadian Permanent Resident only.
Title: Junior Electrical Engineer/Technologist

Job_Description: Chevron is one of the world's leading energy companies, with approximately 60,000 employees working in countries around the world. We explore, produce and transport crude oil and natural gas; refine, market and distribute fuels and other energy products; manufacture and sell petrochemical products; generate power; and develop future energy resources, including biofuels and geothermal energy.  Chevron Canada Limited (Upstream) has been active in Canada for more than 75 years. Since our arrival in Alberta in 1938, our company has established a proud legacy of exploration success, innovation and growth. And throughout this time, we have continued to support the communities where we live and work. As a result, we look optimistically to the future, as we pursue our vision to grow our core assets profitably and position Chevron for new legacy assets in frontier regions and emerging unconventional resource plays.  Chevron Canada is targeting natural gas and natural gas liquids from the Duvernay shale formation in west-central Alberta, where the company holds approximately 330,000 net acres of exploration leases. In 2011, the company commenced a multi-well exploration program on these leases to assess reservoir performance and confirm proof of concept for production from this prospective wet shale gas play. Chevron Canada has been encouraged by the reservoir data and production performance achieved to date and is currently advancing an appraisal program to evaluate the potential for full-field commercial development.  Chevron Canada Resources is actively seeking an Automation Engineer to join the Canadian Business Unit (CBU). This position is based in Calgary, Alberta and will report to Automation, Electrical & Measurement Supervisor. The role will function as part of a broader collaborative multi-department Automation, Control and Operational Technology (ACOT) team made up of personnel in Engineering, Maintenance and IT. The primary role and responsibility for this position is to provide Automation discipline engineering expertise and support to CBU's unconventional developments and operations for Kaybob Duvernay and Kitimat Upstream LHR. This position will deliver engineering design, development and support for Instrumentation, Control System, SCADA, and OT solutions to improve and sustain Operational Safety, Reliability and Costs.  This position is a contract role for a period of 12 months with the potential to extend.  Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Automation Engineer located in Calgary, Alberta through Sunday, June 3, 2018 at 11:59 p.m. (Eastern Standard Time).  Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:  Design, develop and sustain Automation, Control and Operational Technology (ACOT) solutions to support Operations, Engineering and other business groups. Develop projects to improve safety, reliability and costs using Control System and/or OT solutions Direct and coordinate ACOT team resources. Support management of change processes Provide engineering support to Maintenance I&C technicians for RTU/PLC issues and 1 st level field changes Provide 2 nd level changes to RTU/PLCs, SCADA, OSI PI Historian, OSI PI AF and Visualization systems Support and/or coordinate well pad project design input, oversight, FAT and integration with existing infrastructure and applications Oversee, support and lead Capital Projects, MOCs, documentation, design, procedures and standards Provide technical and Project oversight of engineering and development by Integrators and Vendors Support Automation, Process Control and OT future state planning and development  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Electrical, Process Control, Instrumentation) or relevant degree/diploma Registered Professional Engineer in Alberta or British Columbia preferred 5 - 10 years of relevant upstream oil & gas engineering experience supporting operational facilities 5 - 10 years’ experience with the design, development and support of automation solutions using RTUs, PLCs, Safety Systems, SCADA Telecommunications, SCADA, Data Historians and Real-time analytical and visualization systems Programming such as SQL, VB/VBA, C/C++, Control languages including Ladder Logic and Function Block Knowledge of Process Control System design, tuning and optimization; Alarm management programs per ISAS18.2; Safety Systems and Functional Safety programs per IEC61511 Prefer experience with SCADA Pack RTUs and Allen Bradley PLCs. SCADA such as Wonderware, Clear SCADA and SCADAVantage. OSI PI historian and AF Analytics. Real-time Visualization tools such as OSI Vision, Siemens XHQ, Honeywell Operational Insight Knowledge of I&C systems engineering design and development including Cause/Effect Matrix, Shutdown Keys, Narratives and System Function Design Basis as well as QA/QC and Factory Acceptance Testing Demonstrated commitment to behavioral based safety programs and ensuring incident and injury free working conditions. Ability to represent Chevron’s interests in a constructive and professional manner during interactions with internal and external stakeholders. Project management development including business cases, management presentations and project approvals. Project Engineering and Project Management including team leadership, scope, schedule and cost control. Strong written/verbal and presentation skills and team/inter-team work skills Objective and structured thinker with strong aptitude towards developing processes and support systems Must be legally entitled to work in Canada  Relocation Options: Relocation will not be considered within Chevron parameters.  International Considerations: Expatriate assignments will not be considered.

Job_Description: Join Schneider Electric and power your career! Discover the opportunity to join an international, dynamic, and responsible company that fosters the development of all its people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice. Schneider Electric is looking for a Low Voltage Switchgear Quotation Specialist / Engineer. This role can be in Calgary, Edmonton or Mississauga. Review RFQ’s for clarity of request, suitability for Schneider Electric product offering, risk assessment, profitability, and time given to complete. Based on the above criteria, along with Quotation team’s loading, and with input from the sales team, to decide to bid (or not). Reviews customer specifications/drawings to ensure quote is technically compatible and competitive. Understands, analyzes, documents, and communicates contractual and technical terms and conditions relative to the company standard. Serves as peer expert for proposal questions including complex technical issues and quote strategies. Structure and assemble the proposal/bid documents in collaboration with the concerned stakeholders and subject matter experts. Job_Description: LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) JOB NUMBER: 22761  Job Overview Reporting to the Director, In Situ Strategic Technology, you will provide technology development expertise to support the progression of in situ technologies in the lab, pilot and commercial demonstration phases. Key Accountabilities Support progression of technologies from conception to commercial readiness, including both the technical and business components of the technologies Provide subsurface engineering expertise to support in situ program leads, including strategic and tactical input Influence the framing of the path to deployment for various technologies Peer review for subsurface technology projects Continuously analyze technical merit and economics of technology as new information becomes available and prepare ongoing reports to leaders Participate in planning and design development of the subsurface components of lab and field demonstration tests, including viewing and analyzing operating conditions and performance Participate in technology risk assessments, identifying potential barriers to implementation and plan accordingly Lead subsurface technical aspects with external technology partners such as other oil sands operators or technology vendors, and contractors Mentor and advise junior personnel Lead by influence across the organization to gain the support of other business areas needed to successfully progress technologies to field readiness Required Qualifications Experience and Education: 10 years or more of engineering experience in conventional oil and gas as well as EOR/SAGD Operational experience in an in situ bitumen oil sands asset Experience with external technology vendors and joint venture partners Experience in subsurface electrical and electromagnetic/radio frequency, reaction models for chemical reactions and alternative recovery concepts is an asset Experience in conventional and non-conventional reservoir engineering with a deep understanding of the fundamentals Undergraduate or advanced degree in engineering, preferably chemical, electrical or petroleum; registered or eligible to be registered as a professional engineer in Alberta Skills and Knowledge: Skilled in experimental design, with the ability to help develop and guide the execution of lab and field work to ensure the right information is captured Strong analytical skills of lab and field technology pilots Skilled in reservoir simulation including how to couple simulation with field implementation and how to use simulation results to inform business decisions Deep understanding of solvent recovery processes Standout colleague with highly developed interpersonal and communications skills to effectively collaborate with technical and managerial staff across diverse groups A self-starter able to take broad direction, description of desired outcomes, and project goals and objectives, and turn them into a series of actionable tasks to drive projects forward at a fast pace  Working Conditions Occasional travel to technology vendors, research organizations and pilot/demo sites will be required up to 5% of the time Why Suncor Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: Competitive base salary and compensation programs Attractive annual incentive program Flexible benefits package Rewarding pension and savings plans Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. Business Overview Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Job_Description: The Alberta Electric System Operator is responsible for the safe, reliable, and economic planning and operation of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System. We provide open and non-discriminatory access to Alberta’s interconnected power grid and also facilitate Alberta’s competitive wholesale electricity market which, in 2017, had 291 participants and approximately $3 Billion in annual energy transactions.  Work collaboratively across disciplines of the AESO in creating high quality load and generation study conditions for power system studies; Core member of the AESO modelling team responsible in developing on-going workflow in power system modelling process using cloud collaborative tools; Collaborate with interjurisdictional entities in the development of common base cases and study conditions; Provide training for EITs on power system modelling; Develop novel tools to support internal and external study teams.  Accountabilities:  Interfacing with study engineers and forecasting teams in preparing and reviewing load and generation study conditions Provide support for study engineers to resolve data questions and issues; Prepare WECC data submission in compliance to applicable Alberta Reliability Standards in coordination to AESO’s internal compliance program; Development of collaborative tools for maintenance of power system modelling; Active participate in interjurisdictional entities (e.g. WECC) in both provision of data and exchange of latest industry learning and practice; Provide training for EITS and other AESO staff on power system modelling and the use of modelling and operational data.  Education / Degree / Certification: BSc Electrical Engineering at minimum, graduate degree an asset Registered with APEGA as a Professional Engineer or eligibility to register  Job Experience:  Minimum 4 years of experience in transmission modelling, planning or operations; Knowledge of power system planning and operation; Knowledge of dynamic models for system components; Proven capability to perform power system analysis including, but not limited to power flow, voltage stability and dynamics; An experienced collaborator, problem solver and decision maker; Strong automation tools and programming skills; Strong computer skills and knowledge cloud collaborative tools.  Applications accepted via our careers site until May 27, 2018 The Alberta Electric System Operator, and its members, officers, employees and agents (collectively, the "AESO") is committed to protecting personal information provided to it. By submitting your personal information to the AESO for the purpose of pursuing employment with the AESO, you hereby consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the AESO, in accordance with the provisions of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act of Alberta , as amended from time to time.

Job_Description: Due to continued growth, iSolutions Consulting is looking for a System Integration Specialist with experience in the Upstream Oil & Gas and / or Power Industries to join our team.The System Integration Specialist position is an Engineering position which requires advanced knowledge in a wide range of software systems employed by iSolutions. The System Integration Specialist is responsible for commissioning these systems, implementing process graphics, constructing data integrations to and from underlying control systems such as Emerson DeltaV or Rockwell FactoryTalk. Knowledge of high availability data historian architectures is important to this role.The System Integration Specialist will be responsible for performing the duties listed below including:Plant and Corporate Historian CommissioningPlant and Corporate Historian Data IntegrationsDesigning and implementing software solutions that leverage historian dataQuality assurance/regression testing of software solutionsSystem architecture design and documentationConducting customer stakeholder meetings / solution walk-throughsLeading junior-level resources through system commissioning tasks and quality assurance proceduresIn addition to utilizing vendor-supplied integration packages, the need will occasionally arise to write custom code for interfacing with these systems. For this reason, working experience with one or more of the following software technologies is required:ASP.Net 2.0+,ADO.NetSQL Server 2005+Oracle PL/SQLSQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)The position requires a Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Process Control Engineering, Computer Science Software or Electrical Engineering or a related field and at least 4 years relevant experience. Relevant experience with the upstream Oil and Gas and or power industries is required.iSolutions services a large number of name-brand customer in the oil & gas and power domains. We offer our consultants access to interesting and challenging work assignments, performance based compensation & fast-tracked career progression for those with the drive to succeed. iSolutions Inc. is a Data Management consulting company that specializes in designing, implementing and supporting real-time, historian based, reporting and integration solutions for Oil/Gas and Power Generation/Transmission companies. Our implementations allow clients to make educated, site specific production and operational decisions based on the analysis of real time data from integrated field and plant systems.

Job_Description: An opportunity currently exists for an Electrical Engineer or Electrical Engineering Technologist with Professional Licensee P.L (Eng) designation in the Engineering team within the Project Development Department of AltaLink. Reporting to the Manager, SCADA & Telecom Engineering, the successful candidate will work with internal & external technical staff to ensure that Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) facilities are appropriately designed and integrated into existing facilities. This position will appeal to individuals with Substation Networking, Remote Supervisory, Distributed Control and Relaying skills who are looking for an opportunity to develop their engineering and leadership talents in a dynamic utility environment.  Responsibilities The successful candidate will be accountable for the following:  Provide timely and effective SCADA technical input into conceptual engineering, project scoping & estimating and project execution. This includes: Create and support writing of Design Basis memorandums (DBM) that provide sufficient detail to allow accurate estimating and clear direction to the Engineering contractor. Review technical drawings & specifications to ensure each project meets acceptable standards for operability, functionality, maintainability, reliability, durability and safety. Working as part of a project design team, complete the SCADA design of facilities including station drawings and SCADA device (e.g. RTU) configuration. Deliver accurate and thorough designs that will meet specifications in the electrical code, AltaLink standards and engineering practices; and are compatible with good construction practices and overall due diligence. Identify material and equipment required to complete projects. Install SCADA configuration files and provide technical support during construction to the site personnel completing commissioning activities. Maintain good relationships with project management personnel and contractors through the execution of projects. Develop SCADA configuration work plans and prepare supervisory change notice requests.    Qualifications The minimum qualifications for this position are, as follows:  Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Telecommunication or Computer Engineering or Technologist Diploma in Electrical with P.L. (Eng) status. Qualifies for registration as a Professional Engineer with (APEGA). At least 5 years of SCADA design, testing and configuration experience for high voltage facilities. Proven ability/experience in the above noted responsibilities. Willing to travel within the province approximately 20%of the time. Valid driver’s license. Experience with: SCADA Systems and DNP3 Ethernet and IP networks, and serial communication Power system elements and metering (e.g. Breakers, Transformers, 3 Phase Power) Microsoft Excel including the use of macros GE Energy/Harris, Cybectec/Copper Power Systems, Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, or SUBNET Solutions SCADA platforms. Config Pro 5, SMP Tools, Substation Explorer, Substation Server, AcSELerator Quickset, or AcSELerator RTAC Siemens, Hirschmann, and Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories LAN hardware. Schneider Electric and Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories Power Measurement meters. Srong communication skills with ability to work in a team environment, positively influence others, and develop strong internal and external relationships. Demonstrated strong analytical, risk assessment and problem solving skills. Strong written, reporting, graphical and oral presentation skills. Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage a wide variety of issues simultaneously. Although it is not absolutely required, preference will be given to individuals with knowledge & experience with, the following: Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Siemens and GE Multilin protection relays . Protocol analyzers ASE2000 Test Set or WireShark Computer hardware and operating systems. IEC 61850 implementation. AltaLink employees should be aware that we may contact your manager during the selection process. Applicants considered for a position may be required to meet additional qualifying criteria including but not limited to job specific assessments, criminal record checks, employment references, pre-employment medical, driver’s abstract. Safety Sensitive roles require pre-placement drug testing. Please contact the Hiring Manager or Recruiter for further clarification if required. Job_Description: We are looking for an Embedded Systems Engineer to join our first-class team engaged in bringing an amazing new product to market. You will be responsible for electronics engineering design of new systems and circuits, and the extension and support of existing systems, including component selection, embedded firmware design and implementation, schematic design and PCB implementation.  Responsibilities:  Define firmware test requirements and processes to ensure product meets customer and reliability requirements Translate high-level product requirements into technical hardware and embedded firmware specifications Develop embedded software solutions for new and existing products Design, test and debug embedded hardware designs Perform schematic capture and circuit simulations to define and verify the suitability of a design Be involved in selection of integrated circuits and peripherals Communicate with suppliers and vendors to evaluate and approve electronic components and processors for custom display systems Design for EMC and Safety compliance and understanding of current standards Participate in project planning activities, and provide work effort estimates as a member of an Agile Team Participate in high level design reviews with other team members, including review of schematics, mechanical drawings, reports and other design documentation Participate in prototyping, validation and test plan development. Partner with Application Software Engineers to integrate test code into prototypes, to test and validate functionality Work with the QA team to review, investigate, troubleshoot, and fix hardware related issues Required Qualifications:  Education: Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering degree or equivalent 5+ years of relevant embedded system design experience (including C or C++ programming) Experience with battery powered embedded consumer devices Proven record of successfully delivering complex embedded systems to production Experience with Real Time Operating Systems such as FreeRTOS or Embedded Linux Proven proficiency in communication bus logic (SPI, I2C, UART, TCP/IP, USB) Experience with common embedded systems IDE platforms such as CCS or IAR Experience with MSP430 and Cypress PSoC or similar devices Strong digital hardware design knowledge Experience using soldering equipment and building prototyping PCB assemblies Experience effectively using laboratory equipment and microcontroller debuggers to aid in development Experience with Altium Designer Working knowledge and experience of safety and EMI/EMC specifications, standards and practices Experience with product certification (CSA, UL, CE) Ability to work with minimal instructions or directions Well organized, good time management and ability to work on several parallel projects Good verbal and written communications skills Additional Desired Qualifications:  Experience with Wireless communication (ZigBee, 802.11, Bluetooth), Switch Mode Power Supply design, and PCB layout and design Knowledge of how to perform electrical signal characterization, specifically to ensure EMI/EMC compliance Previous experience in development of FPGA firmware

Job_Description: Description Calgary, AB WSP is one of the world's leading professional engineering services firms. Every day our more than 42,000 experts work to restore the natural environment and transform the built environment.  In Canada, our 8000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transport networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future. The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects. At WSP, we’re proud, professional and passionate people. Join us.   POSITION DESCRIPTION Our Facilities Engineering group works on a wide range of diverse, cutting edge oil and gas projects; from a small well tie-in to a large multi-million dollar SAGD facility.  We are looking for an experienced Control Systems Specialist who will bring his/her technical experience to our existing and future projects. The Control Systems group enjoys the synergy of working within a small team environment, but with the benefits and resources of a well-established company. Our employees enjoy being hands-on contributors and are the driving force behind the tremendous growth that the Facilities Engineering group has experienced.  Reporting to the Automation and Controls Manager, you will be responsible for providing guidance and procedural consistency to the full life cycle of Control Systems.  RESPONSIBILITIES Coordinate and work with Project Team members; Provide skills required to design plant control system architecture; Provide skills required to work independently or as a team on programming and configuration of Rockwell PLC, GE PLC, DeltaV DCS, ABB DCS, RTU programs and associated HMI’s; Provide skills in various types of communication protocols, Modbus, Devicenet, etc.; Provide wiring details and support to the Electrical designer; Provide field support, commissioning, troubleshooting and start-up facilities; Some field work will be required  QUALIFICATIONS Our successful candidate will hold an engineering degree or diploma in Instrumentation and Control or Electrical. We are looking for a candidate who has worked on both the FEED and Detailed Design phase of an oil and gas project; ideally you will have 10 years experience in a similar role. In addition you will also have: Good communication and interpersonal skills; Experience in configuration of any one or more of the following : GE PLC, Rockwell PLC, DCS –Emerson DeltaV, Honeywell Experion/TDC, HMI’s –Rockwell, Panelview Plus, RsView 32, Factorytalk View, RTU –ScadaPak, ROC, or Bristol.   Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).    To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our World of Possibilities microsite. WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Job_Description: Cima+ is looking for a Telecommunication Wireless Engineer for our Calgary, Edmonton or Vancouver office We are interested in qualified individuals, with 7 or more years of experience in multiple aspects of wireless communication. CIMA+ is involved with a various set of clients with a wide variety of requirements. Main clients include large Oil and Gas industries, transit operators, health care institutions, first responders, municipalities and colleges/Universities. If you like diversity, this position is for you. The successful candidate should have broad technical expertise in telecommunication with a special focus on wireless communication. The candidate demonstrates strong organization skills and excellent interpersonal abilities. We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic growing team. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has been rapidly expanding operations into Western Canada.  Responsibilities Be involved in all phases and types of telecommunication projects with emphasis on wireless projects including: Needs assessment; Specifications; Conceptual design; Cost Estimations; Detailed design; Procurement; Installation supervision; Test plans and validation Responsible for major account and project management Develop and maintain relationship with existing and new clients Participate actively in the proposal process Oversee the on-site system installation. Qualifications / Experience Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Minimum 7 years of relevant experience and P.Eng. Licence; Experience designing, installing and validating systems in heavy industrial environment is highly desirable. Experience in a Transit environment is considered an asset. Experience with many of the following technologies is required: Microwave point-to-point (licence and unlicensed) links. Point to Multipoint wireless technologies. Wifi / WiMax Land Mobile radio systems (P25, DMR, NXDN, TETRA) Cellular technologies including LTE and DAS. Working knowledge of Ethernet/IP Switching and routing (VLANs, OSPF, MPLS) RF Propagation analysis using modern software suites like (E.g. iBwave suite, pathloss 4.0/5.0). The candidate should demonstrate experience in building and maintaining a relationship with a client; creating network architectures; creating high level and detailed design solutions; participating in feasibility studies; creating test plans; supervising installation; validating the installed systems; project management skills. Experience in greenfield and brownfield installations. Experience working for an engineering firm would be considered an asset

Job_Description: Current ENMAX employees are encouraged to apply through their internal Workday access.   Posted: May 11, 2018 Closing Date: May 25, 2018 Position Type: Permanent Union: MP (Exempt)  Vision – To be Canada’s leader in the electricity industry.  Mission – We power the potential of people, businesses and communities by safely and responsibly providing electricity and energy services in ways that matter to them today and tomorrow.  Is this challenge for you? Imagine the possibilities.  You will be responsible for managing complex major projects through to successful completion.  Responsibilities: Manage complex distribution, substations, transmission, network, customer driven, and major projects within schedule, cost and regulatory requirements. Coordinate and lead matrixed project teams by setting clear expectations and utilizing resources efficiently. Oversee all project components including scope, cost, schedule, EHS, quality management, change management, and customer satisfaction. Develop and maintain detailed executable project plans and control of critical timelines/milestones. Effectively and accurately report project status, change requests, schedule and finances to internal and external customers. Provide guidance and leadership to project engineers, design engineers, construction managers, project controls, and supply chain management personnel. Manage qualified subcontractors as required to deliver project scopes and adhere to project schedules. Assist with development of capital business cases, budget development, monthly forecasting and variance rationale. Provide support to the management team for implementing process changes and improvements. Accountable for the safe execution of their projects.  Qualifications: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering 10+ years’ experience with a power utility with directly applicable experience in construction and project management. P.Eng status with The Association of Professionals in Engineering and Geoscientists in Alberta (APEGA). PMP designation or willingness to obtain designation. Hands on experience with heavy industrial design, construction, and project management. Demonstrated ability to deliver projects to cost, schedule, quality, and EHS objectives while also delivering high customer satisfaction. Strong computers skills in MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word) Experience using scheduling software (MS Projects, Primavera, Maximo etc…). Experience in project cost control; schedule and critical path analysis would be an asset.  Personal Qualities: Excellent analytical and organizational skills and ability to manage a wide variety of issues and multiple projects. Driven to provide predictability and a high focus on customer satisfaction. Demonstrated excellence in communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively manage project expectations and communicate with team members. Proven, strong leadership, negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Strong team player and ability to work independently. Excellent decision making abilities with sound judgment. Sound knowledge of project management with the ability to meet project objectives.  ENMAX Values – Safety, Integrity, Accountability, Service, Teamwork, Agility, Innovation  If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you.  What We Offer !  We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, non-downtown location that includes great building amenities such as free onsite fitness facility with programming geared to employees needs, onsite child care centre (upon availability, offered from our ENMAX Place location 141 – 50 Ave. SE), free parking and much more.  Location: 141 - 50th Avenue SE, Calgary, AB  Note: ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply, it is our aim to have a workplace which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. ENMAX employees are encouraged to pursue professional development opportunities through our internal Learning Centre . Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required. Two professional references will be requested. Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.   Please visit our careers page to learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.

Job_Description: LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) JOB NUMBER: 22761  Job Overview Reporting to the Director, In Situ Strategic Technology, you will provide technology development expertise to support the progression of in situ technologies in the lab, pilot and commercial demonstration phases. Key Accountabilities Support progression of technologies from conception to commercial readiness, including both the technical and business components of the technologies Provide subsurface engineering expertise to support in situ program leads, including strategic and tactical input Influence the framing of the path to deployment for various technologies Peer review for subsurface technology projects Continuously analyze technical merit and economics of technology as new information becomes available and prepare ongoing reports to leaders Participate in planning and design development of the subsurface components of lab and field demonstration tests, including viewing and analyzing operating conditions and performance Participate in technology risk assessments, identifying potential barriers to implementation and plan accordingly Lead subsurface technical aspects with external technology partners such as other oil sands operators or technology vendors, and contractors Mentor and advise junior personnel Lead by influence across the organization to gain the support of other business areas needed to successfully progress technologies to field readiness Required Qualifications Experience and Education: 10 years or more of engineering experience in conventional oil and gas as well as EOR/SAGD Operational experience in an in situ bitumen oil sands asset Experience with external technology vendors and joint venture partners Experience in subsurface electrical and electromagnetic/radio frequency, reaction models for chemical reactions and alternative recovery concepts is an asset Experience in conventional and non-conventional reservoir engineering with a deep understanding of the fundamentals Undergraduate or advanced degree in engineering, preferably chemical, electrical or petroleum; registered or eligible to be registered as a professional engineer in Alberta Skills and Knowledge: Skilled in experimental design, with the ability to help develop and guide the execution of lab and field work to ensure the right information is captured Strong analytical skills of lab and field technology pilots Skilled in reservoir simulation including how to couple simulation with field implementation and how to use simulation results to inform business decisions Deep understanding of solvent recovery processes Standout colleague with highly developed interpersonal and communications skills to effectively collaborate with technical and managerial staff across diverse groups A self-starter able to take broad direction, description of desired outcomes, and project goals and objectives, and turn them into a series of actionable tasks to drive projects forward at a fast pace  Working Conditions Occasional travel to technology vendors, research organizations and pilot/demo sites will be required up to 5% of the time Why Suncor Go ahead. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: Competitive base salary and compensation programs Attractive annual incentive program Flexible benefits package Rewarding pension and savings plans Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. Business Overview Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. Job_Description: Due to continued growth, iSolutions Consulting is looking for a System Integration Specialist with experience in the Upstream Oil & Gas and / or Power Industries to join our team.The System Integration Specialist position is an Engineering position which requires advanced knowledge in a wide range of software systems employed by iSolutions. The ideal candidate would have experience working with OSISoft PI, Aspentech IP.21 or Honeywell PHD Data historians. The System Integration Specialist is responsible for commissioning these systems, implementing process graphics, constructing data integrations to and from underlying control systems such as Emerson DeltaV or Rockwell FactoryTalk. Knowledge of high availability data historian architectures is important to this role.The System Integration Specialist will be responsible for performing the duties listed below including:Plant and Corporate Historian CommissioningPlant and Corporate Historian Data IntegrationsDesigning and implementing software solutions that leverage historian dataQuality assurance/regression testing of software solutionsSystem architecture design and documentationConducting customer stakeholder meetings / solution walk-throughsLeading junior-level resources through system commissioning tasks and quality assurance proceduresIn addition to utilizing vendor-supplied integration packages, the need will occasionally arise to write custom code for interfacing with these systems. For this reason, working experience with one or more of the following software technologies is required:ASP.Net 2.0+,ADO.NetSQL Server 2005+Oracle PL/SQLSQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)The position requires a Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Process Control Engineering, Computer Science Software or Electrical Engineering or a related field and at least 4 years relevant experience. Relevant experience with the upstream Oil and Gas and or power industries is required.iSolutions services a large number of name-brand customer in the oil & gas and power domains. We offer our consultants access to interesting and challenging work assignments, performance based compensation & fast-tracked career progression for those with the drive to succeed. iSolutions Inc. is a Data Management consulting company that specializes in designing, implementing and supporting real-time, historian based, reporting and integration solutions for Oil/Gas and Power Generation/Transmission companies. Our implementations allow clients to make educated, site specific production and operational decisions based on the analysis of real time data from integrated field and plant systems.

Job_Description: Zedi is a leading technology and services company in the field of production operations. Through technology backed by expert consultation and services, we help our customers realize their production potential. With our unique combination of award-winning software, automation, measurement, artificial lift and field services, we offer complete solutions for the challenges our customers encounter.  Zedi is seeking a Customer Solutions Engineer to join our innovative team in Calgary. This role has direct involvement with the end-to-end design of SCADA automation systems in Canadian and international markets. The ideal candidate will have a BSc. and a minimum of four years’ in this field along with a work ethic that aligns with Zedi’s Core Values-  Deliver on our promises, Reward creative teamwork, Communicate with clarity, Growth through innovation Prioritize workplace health and safety  Key Roles and Responsibilities:  End-to-end design of SCADA automation systems for Oil & Gas well sites, batteries and plant facilities in the Canadian and International markets. Generation, Review and Approval of Technical Drawings (P&ID;, electrical panel IFC drawings, network architectures, system block diagrams, etc). Creating Bills of Materials (BOMs), Rough Orders of Magnitude (ROMs) and formal proposals Creating, reviewing and approving engineering documentation such as FEED (Front-End Engineer and Design) Studies, Standard Operating Procedures, Acceptance Tests and Scopes of Work. Commissioning and Acceptance Testing various RTUs, PLCs and automation solutions back to Zedi’s web-based HMI interface, Zedi Access. Interfacing with customer management, operations, engineering and field teams during design review and project status meetings. Providing Tier 3 technical support to internal and external customers. Performing Technical Sales Support for existing and new clients with the Zedi Business Development Team. Delivering corporate and technical presentations to clients and potential partners. Modeling and analyzing production parameters and recommending appropriate Zedi Artificial Lift Solutions to achieve desired production.  The ideal candidate will possess the following:  BSc. in Engineering, Engineering Technologist or equivalent (Electrical, Computer, Mechanical or Petroleum preferred) APEGA or ASET Member (P.Eng, C.E.T., M.I.T.) Minimum 4 years’ experience in the Oil & Gas Industry Experience with SCADA/Automation systems and Field Instrumentation Experience with Ethernet, Radio, Cellular, and Satellite communication Knowledge of communication protocols and complex networking Proficient with Microsoft operating systems and program suites  Key Competencies:  Ability to work in a team environment Ability to coordinate with multiple departments Ability to take initiative and work independently Able to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities Strong written and verbal communication skills Responsibility and capability of seeing tasks through to completion Analytical and Troubleshooting skills Ability to learn new skills quickly Project Coordination Experience with programming languages such as Assembly, C, C++, Visual Basic, Ladder Logic Knowledge of safety regulations, the electrical codes and regulatory production guidelines Experience with SCADA software such ROCLink 800, Telepace, WinCCU, AutoSol Oil and Gas + SCADA/Automation field experience  Trainable Competencies:  Experience with RODSTAR, SROD or equivalent artificial lift modeling software International Business Experience  To apply please to go to www.zedisolutions.com. We thank all applicants for their interest in Zedi; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job_Description: Convergint Technologies is one of North America’s fastest growing systems integrators. With a dedicated focus on Building Automation systems, Electronic Security and Fire Alarm & Life Safety, we provide a wide range of product solutions in each business area and are committed to being the industry's best service provider.  We are currently recruiting for a BAS Engineering Specialist (Entry level) for our growing business at our Calgary location. Under general supervision, the BAS Engineering Specialist has overall responsibility for the application engineering, programming, troubleshooting, start-up, and check-out of assigned installed or retrofit projects including a variety of projects that vary in complexity. Individuals work shall be in accordance with the established quality standards. He/she is the technical support contact for our customer and is responsible for maximizing customer satisfaction with installed Building Automation Systems. The entry level BAS Engineering Specialist will ensure projects are effectively executed to budgeted cost and time schedules.  Main Job Responsibilities:   Carries out in-depth analysis of plans, functional specifications and contracts in order to determine and advise on overall project requirements; manage a variety of aspects of project including estimating, design, tracking, start up and planning phases; material and equipment procurement. Follow and maintain in-house engineering standards, libraries and procedures. Provides input, reviews and may prepare shop drawings and wiring diagrams, based on project plans and specifications, showing location of devices, equipment, and wiring etc. Liaise with project managers, clients, contractors, partners and vendors to manage and coordinate project execution to completion. Advises Project Manager regarding appropriate products needed for installation, identifying any items which have longer lead times, and track materials on an ongoing basis to ensure timely arrival/delivery to the project site. Prepares and/or reviews formal submittal booklets, containing schematics, and technical literature as necessary to support each contract. Provides on site assistance with the installation and start up, check out and turnover processes. Coordinates project schedule and field labor on all assigned projects; proactively communicates project schedules, project change proposals (as applicable) and related project activities on a regular basis with customer and seek to continuously improve customer satisfaction. Assists the Project Manager in utilizing financial systems to review actual vs. estimated job cost and to provide timely and accurate project cost reports; identify reasons for low job site productivity and determine impact on the project. Acts as “our customer’s best service provider” at all times thereby ensuring Convergint Technologies is the customer’s first choice for service.   Key Knowledge, Skills and Experience:   Diploma in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or Engineer in Training (EIT) strongly preferred Relevant trade designation (e.g. Electrician, HVAC certificate, etc.) an asset Minimum of three years of previous building automation industry experience required Minimum of 2 years of AutoCAD experience Exceptional customer focus and ability to work under pressure; ability to maintain awareness of, and seek to meet the needs and wants of the customer without being prompted Solid knowledge of engineering principles and practices related to building automation systems Solid programming skills and proven ability to troubleshoot problems and look for solutions Must be a self-starter and work well Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude (e.g. works with a variety of hand and power tools such as drill, screwdriver, wire stripper, hacksaw, crimper) Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Solid organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously Proficient computer skills including MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel); previous exposure to AutoCAD viewing software Solid networking & IT skills (Building Automation primarily)   Convergint Technologies LTD is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from candidates, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, sex, age or mental or physical disability. We Offer:  Competitive wage; Immediate comprehensive benefit plan (medical, dental, etc.); Employer contribution to RRSP; Work environment committed to safety; Reimbursement to support continuous learning We have a great company culture, engage in Corporate Social Responsibility, work hard, and promote fun & laughter on a daily basis. If you are interested in this exciting career opportunity with Convergint Technologies LTD, please submit your resume and cover letter through our website www.convergint.com/careers.
Title: BAS Engineering Specialist - Entry Level

Proven ability to meet deadlines/successful completion of deliverables. Ability to communicate and work well with other departments. Excellent time management skills. Ability to work under pressure. Title: Electrical Designer - Calgary

Job_Description: This position requires an understanding of operational processes, electrical power, electrical controls and pneumatics. The position also requires working with multiple disciplines including electrical and mechanical engineering. Designing Electrical wiring diagrams Reviewing/Updating Wiring diagrams Create bill of materials Create a process between shop worker and designers Bring up ideas and solutions to have efficient processes in place. understand HVAC/Electrical parts Candidates with a strong background in HVAC industrial controls; this includes air make up units, both direct fired, and indirect fired, Air conditioning systems, including DX systems, chillers, and evaporative will receive preference. Critical Thinking – Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Create wiring diagrams to achieve sequence of operation by project specification. Write programming scripts would be an asset Ability to use AutoCad Previous experience with programmable logic controllers (PLC) and operator interface controllers such as HMI’s or touch-screens is required; this includes at a minimum Allen Bradley, Distech and/ or Siemens Automation would be asset. Must be able to work independently and past experience should demonstrate achievements supporting a results oriented focus and use of leadership skills. Title: HVAC Electrical Designer

Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   As the Senior Systems Engineer, you will report to the Rail Systems Coordinator who has the overall responsibility for engineering, operation and maintenance of the electrical aspect of the Rail Systems, including traction power, signals & communications, and control systems. As a Department ID (DeptID) Owner, you will also be responsible and accountable for the operating budget for all maintenance service contracts (approximate annual contract values are over $5 million). Major duties include: Prepare and control engineering safety standards, specifications, design guidelines, procedures and practices to be used in the construction and maintenance of traction power systems for the Light Rail Transit (LRT) system. The process involves liaising with regulatory agencies, contractors, industrial associations and City business units. Build and lead a team of technical professionals to deliver traction power design, maintenance, and construction engineering support for transit projects. Provide technical support and advice to project engineers in Transit Capital Construction, Rail Systems and Engineering Support groups. Present Transit’s interests and concerns on maintenance and operational issues. Assist in the selection process of consultants and contractors carrying out traction power design and construction.  Qualifications An Electrical Engineering degree, and current licensure as Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA), or licensure by the first day of work. A minimum of 8 years of directly related experience, including working knowledge in traction power systems design standards, is required. You demonstrate sound knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of system engineering. This must include the application of principles related to conceptual design, requirements definition, design, testing, and project management. Success in this role requires: Expert analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to breakdown complex system problems and develop recommendations. Solid interpersonal and communication skills to build trust by consulting and liaising with others. The ability to apply a team approach as needed to achieve solutions on moderately complex technical issues. Pre-employment Requirements Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.    Union: Exempt   Business Unit: Calgary Transit Position Type: Permanent Location: 1417C 33 Street S.W. Compensation: Engineer Level F $88,307 - 148,777 per annum Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day work week, earning 1 day off in each 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week Audience: Internal/External Apply By: May 24, 2018 Amendment: Closing Date Job ID #: 300727
Title: Senior Systems Engineer - Traction Power - AMENDMENT

Job_Description: CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced Building Electrical Engineer from qualified individuals who are interested in becoming a member of our Buildings Engineering group in Edmonton and Calgary, Alberta. We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, employee-owned, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has expanded operations into Western Canada. CIMA+ is proud to have reached the prestigious Best Employers in Canada’s Platinum Level, which is exclusively reserved for organizations that have achieved the best results in the Aon Hewitt survey for six consecutive years. We offer a highly competitive compensation package with excellent benefits, merit-based bonuses as well as a flexible and friendly working environment where committed individuals can thrive.  Responsibilities Lead building electrical engineering services for commercial, institutional, educational, healthcare, government, recreational and light industrial facility projects. Lead a team of electrical engineers and technologists on assigned projects. Assist the Buildings Practice Leader with the growth and development of the electrical team. Be a technical resource in building electrical design, and leverage that knowledge to mentor and develop junior engineers and technologists. Prepare technical specifications and contract documents for bidding and construction. Conduct quality assurance reviews on building electrical design work completed by others. Keep current on new products, technologies and design processes. Coordinate work with architects, other engineering disciplines, and Owner representatives. Contribute to business development, marketing and liaising with Clients and Architects. Assist in determining the scope and fee for proposed engineering services. Lead proposal efforts for building electrical and multi-discipline project pursuits.  Qualifications Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited post-secondary institution. Professional Engineer registered in Canada, and eligible for professional registration in Alberta. 10+ years of progressive experience in building electrical design. Experience working in a consulting engineering environment. Experience as electrical design lead and able to direct and oversee a team of engineers and technologists on projects. Experience in sizing and specifying of power distribution components and primary/secondary switchgear for medium (under 35 kV) and low (600 V and under) voltage systems. Experience in sizing and specifying grounding systems and lightening protection systems. Experience in critical power systems including generators and UPS, substations, transformers, metering, motor control and motor control centers. Experience in carrying out power system studies including: short circuit, arc flash, load flow, harmonics, and grounding. Experience in hazard classification studies and the design of intrinsically safe electrical systems. Experience in lighting and lighting controls design including a strong understanding of lighting concepts and terms. Experience in low tension system design such as fire alarm, intrusion alarm, telephone, public address, nurse-call systems, data, access control and CCTV. Able to articulate the electrical design requirements and oversee the progression of electrical system layouts in Autodesk® Revit and AutoCAD MEP. Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring staff. In-depth understanding of regulations, codes and standards associated with building electrical design. General understanding of building mechanical and building structural systems. Team player and independent worker. Professional, energetic, organized and action-oriented. Experience in using Microsoft office products including MS Excel and MS Word. Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written. Experience in estimating engineering fees and schedules. Experience in writing engineering reports, proposals, letters and technical specifications. Proven success in developing business with new and existing clients, and maintaining positive relationships. Experience in project management and controls, with a proven record of client satisfaction and financial success. Experience in monitoring and adapting to industry trends and changing market conditions. Able to travel without restrictions. Willingness to engage in lifelong learning. Assets: LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP), Fellow or Green Associate. Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM). Experience in conducting field reviews and/or building condition assessments. Experience in Life Cycle Costing (LCC). Experience with electrical engineering software packages such as ETAP, AGI 32 or ElumTools. Experience on projects certified to LEED, Living Building Challenge (LBC), Passive House, and/or Green Globes.
Title: Building Electrical Engineer
