Title: Electrical Designer - Calgary

Job_Description: We have an opening for full-time Project Manager/Engineer in our Calgary office that will be responsible for executing integrated construction projects while following corporate quality standards throughout the project life cycle within our Power & Building Solutions group. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Manage large scale electrical based (low and medium voltage) projects such as Electrical and VFD buildings from quotation throughout design, construction, delivery and support. Act as project subject matter expert (SME) for supplied integrated equipment. Act as the primary point of contact for clients, subcontractors, senior management and the project team. Manage multiple stakeholders and vendors while maintaining and developing client relationships throughout the project and post-completion review. Be an active participant in the high level design, including general arrangements and optimizing building layouts. Manage and provide input on all drawing review cycles from IFA to As Built from the client, subcontractors and internal teams. Have a working knowledge of the document control process to properly expedite supplier and client data deliverables based on the approved Vendor Drawing and Data Requirements (VDDR) list. Manage project execution to ensure adherence to budget, schedule, change management, risk management, scope and specifications. Chair and manage all project meetings including kickoff meetings, pre fabrication meetings, client status reviews and executive status updates. Take an active role in the execution and construction of projects including subcontractor site visits, fabrication yard inspections and testing programs. Support the Inside Sales Team during the Request for Quotation (RFQ) process. Prepare periodic status and progress reports/presentations for clients and Tundra’s Executive Committee. Requirements Minimum 5-10 years of project management experience, focusing on industrial construction. A bachelor’s degree/diploma in engineering from an APEGA or ASET with a focus in electrical engineering. PMP Designation is an asset. Thorough understanding of electrical design, schematics, specifications and codes/standards. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills – both verbal and written. Applied understanding of document control processes and tracking change through the project life cycle. Proficiency of the Microsoft Office Suite including MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint. SAP experience an asset. Must have a valid driver’s license and passport. Minimal travel required. Benefits We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.
Title: Project Manager/Engineer

Job_Description: Senior engineer position that independently applies advanced engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work is performed with minimal supervision and has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.  Carry out the responsibilities of a Lead Engineer on small to medium sized projects or Area Lead on large sized projects or provide technical support / leadership on a project. Promote workshare execution  Perform studies and develop scope of work and execution of the engineering work  Power system studies using PSS/E, CYME, ETAP, SKM.  Power system modelling experience for the following types of studies:  Load Flow & Short Circuit.  Motor Starting (Synchronous and Induction).  Grounding.  Coordination Studies.  Power Factor Correction.  Harmonic Analysis.  Stability.  Power system modelling using EMTP/ATP or equivalent software for:  TRV.  Switching Surge.  Insulation Coordination.  Pipeline Induction.  Philosophy development, settings development and logic development for high voltage transmission line and substation protection.  Substation Physical Layout/Arrangement.  Coordinate project electrical activities with a utility and other disciplines for their area of responsibility  Develop and maintain electrical project schedule, progress reports and cost estimates. Execute change management proces  Supervise Juniors & Intermediate electrical engineers and designers. Interface with design group to monitor and control project schedule, electrical hours and electrical cost for their area of responsibilites  Ensure consistency and integrity of electrical design throughout project and review design for logic and functionalites  Perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for electrical systems  Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering required  Minimum of 7-9 years' experience with specifications, engineering, design, construction and start-up for low and medium voltage plant distribution systems with EPC consulting firms for small to large oil & gas related projects or power plant projects is required  Excellent oral and written communication skills required  Experience in motors and VFD design is required  Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required  Eligibility for a Professional Engineering certification is required  Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred  At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.
Title: Sr. HV Substation Engineer

Job_Description: Job Description  Shift Energy is growing and we are looking for an Optimization Engineer/Technician to join us. Responsibilities Design and develop advanced control sequences for energy saving in large buildings including venues, hospitals etc. Implement EOS in buildings, including collecting technical documentation, determining building schedules, choosing appropriate energy saving strategies, configuring EOS’s optimization logic for a particular building and writing custom code as required Train building operators on the use of EOS. Communicate the changes that EOS will make to buildings to building operators and owners. Respond to customer complaints and concerns. Measure the energy savings from EOS implementations. Travel to EOS customer sites as required Qualifications  Mechanical or Electrical engineering diploma or degree Strong grades or demonstrated aptitude for computer programming, thermodynamics, controls, and electric circuits Building/Industrial controls familiarity – HVAC, Chillers, Ice Plants, etc. Knowledge & Experience with Java based programming (groovy scripting) considered an asset Customer service experience preferred Key characteristics: self-starter, customer focused, goal oriented, innovative, collaborative, analytical, problem-solver Ability to quickly learn and understand new products and technologies Additional Information  null
Title: Optimization Engineer/Technican

Job_Description: Summary of Job Description: The Lead Operating Engineer supervises, leads and supports operation, inspection, and maintenance processes to mechanical, electrical and plumbing equipment and systems in assigned facilities. Performs inspections and repairs to assigned property interior and exterior areas, including walls and flooring, installed fixtures, roofing systems, lighting, etc.  Responsibilities  Insuries that work performed is accomplished efficiently with a minimum amount of disruption and inconvenience. Supervises and implements the preventative maintenance program. Specific duties include but are not limited to: scheduling of preventative maintenance with a minimum disruption of building services, performing and/or delegating preventative maintenance tasks to the appropriately qualified maintenance staff member, orders parts and equipment required for repair, maintenance and installation of new equipment and facilities, and maintains inventory. Provides training and supervision aimed at expanding the capabilities of the operations staff.  Specific duties include, but not limited to: Demonstrating the proper use and care of tools and instruments, giving hands on instruction in basic maintenance, safety, and trouble shooting procedures, recommending relevant outside engineering courses for enrollment and instilling an overall level of professionalism in manner and appearance. Complies with departmental policy for the safe storage, usage, and disposal of hazardous materials. Maintains a clean and safe workplace. Plans and manages budget, allowing for appropriate control over, and utilization of institutional resources. Recommends and estimates facilities repairs and improvements for inclusion in the annual budget. Insures the availability of an adequate operating inventory of tools and supplies. Specific duties include, but not limited to: Preparing and submitting purchase order requests, developing sources for stock materials and performing periodic checks for supplies. Performs additional duties as requested.  Qualifications Candidate must possess and maintain a valid state driver’s license and pass MVR check. Special knowledge and skills – Experience with HVAC, fluid handling/pumping, fluid filtering, mechanical systems, welding, and electrical systems engineering and operation Completion of an applicable technical training program is strongly preferred. Minimum of five years of applicable working experience in general building repair and maintenance, basic plumbing, and basic electrical with at least 2 years in a lead or supervisory role Must have ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs., use ladders up to 30 ft, possess mechanical and electrical aptitude, and have excellent communication skills, both oral and written. High school diploma or GED equivalent Ability to comply with both JLL and client-directed Policies & Procedures. Successful candidate must be self-motivated who can work independently or on a team. Candidate must have basic knowledge of Microsoft Outlook and internet usage and navigation      JLL Is an Equal Opportunity Employer   JLL is committed to developing and maintaining a diverse workforce. JLL strongly believes in equal opportunity extended to all individuals in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, discipline, layoff, recall and termination without regard to race, color, religion, belief, creed, age, sex, pregnancy or maternity (including childbirth and related conditions), family responsibility (e.g. child care, elder care), nationality, ethnic or national origin or ancestry, citizenship, marital status, civil partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, veteran’s status, genetic information, trade union membership, social position, political view or status as a qualified individual with a disability, protected leave status or any other protected characteristic in accordance with applicable law. The company also endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodations would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business and ensures that employment decisions are based only on valid job requirements.   For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy at https://jll2.sharepoint.com/CorporatePolicies/HR%20Policies/Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20and%20Affirmative%20Action.pdf .
Title: Lead Operating Engineer

Job_Description: We are currently looking for those interested in estimating on a sub-contract basis for our Calgary Office. Working alongside with the Project Manager, the Estimator is responsible for assisting with the preparation of detailed estimates for commercial, institutional and industrial projects. This includes estimating major projects and contributing to the marketing of the company and its services.ResponsibilitiesThe Estimator is responsible for duties including:Establishing and maintaining effective relationships with suppliers, manufacturer, engineers and contractors in the industry; advising clients about new and effective products and services; and actively seeking out new opportunities, projects and clients and estimating and obtaining new projects.Assist in the preparation of electrical budgets for major projects based on preliminary sketches, specifications and other related information; preparing accurate cost estimates of resources required for tendered projects; contacting and receiving quotations from suppliers and trades; and preparing spreadsheets with supplier information and quotes.Assist with the coordination and preparing for pre-tender site tours for major projects; participating in project site visits as requested; analyzing possible cost savings for projects as requested by project managers.Setting up data for estimates in computer programs; reviewing and confirming estimate information prior to tender closing, including drawings and supplier bill of materials, analyzing disadvantages and strengths of estimates prior to submission; and prepare and evaluating closing strategies.Analyzing tender documents and contractual obligations for major projects; preparing and delivering or faxing quotation letters to client prior to closing time with relevant management approvals; obtaining feedback and results from clients with regards to quotations; contributing to pre-plan meetings.Providing senior-levels support and leadership in optimizing, maintaining and updating databases and software for estimating change order and service in relevant computer programs; maintaining and updating historical estimate database.Provide training and assistance for new and existing staff in estimating and change orders procedures and for estimating, change order and related software and acting as a mentor for estimators throughout the company.Providing an example of professionalism as a responsible and goal-oriented team player and leading by example in achieving excellence and being accountable for results and outcomes.Preferred Requirements: This position requires an individual with experience in small to medium sized electrical construction projects with an electrician’s journeyman certification and excellent current knowledge of electrical, building and municipal codes and regulations and in-depth familiarity of tender rules and processes. The ability to network, market and sell services is a key attribute of this position. Proficiency in related computer programs is a requirement.4 or more years experience as an estimator for electrical construction projects3 or more years hands on experience with electrical construction projectsCertification as estimator with Canadian and BC Construction AssociationsGood sales, marketing and networking skillsExcellent knowledge of industry products, practices and standardsKnowledge of engineering software and engineering skills an assetExperience with RSMeans estimating software is an assetExperience working with Microsoft Office applications: Outlook and ExcelDemonstrated organizational abilities and attention to detailAbility to work independently and as part of a teamExcellent ability to think critically and problem solveEffective communication skills verbal and writtenPlease include your charge rate expectations in your cover letter when submitting your interest.Job Type: ContractExperience:Estimating: 4 yearsLocation:Calgary, ABLanguage:english
Title: Electrical Estimator

Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15272 Department: Operations Group Summary of Responsibilities Pembina Pipeline Corporation has an immediate opening for an Operations Engineer in our Oil Sands Business Unit (OBU) to support the operations of its pipeline assets. You will be a direct contributor to the ongoing development of Pembina’s pipeline business. The ideal candidate would be stationed in Calgary, Alberta with frequent travel to the field offices. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: Visibly demonstrate commitment and personal accountability to Pembina’s “Zero by Choice” safety culture, as well as ensuring staff and contractors are fully aware and compliant with Pembina’s safety requirements; Work with multi-disciplinary teams to develop safe, efficient and cost effective operating philosophies and solutions for customers involving pipeline operations; Troubleshoot maintenance and processing problems, identify cost effective solutions and implement to completion using Pembina’s Management of Change (MOC) process; Monitor pipeline performance and identify opportunities to reduce cost, improve safety, increase reliability and increase throughput; Work closely with Operations team to optimize existing asset performance and efficiency; Support the coordination of projects and communication between Engineering, Operations, Commercial and Finance/Accounting functional groups; Co-ordinate and manage outside engineering consultants, specialty consultants and contractors, and internal subject matter experts for the execution of design, construction and commissioning of projects; and Build and maintain a network of service providers and technical representatives to create an effective and sustainable operations environment. Qualifications Candidates will be a Professional Engineer (Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical preferred) and be registered with APEGA with a minimum 5 years’ experience in a Project Engineering or other technical role; Demonstrated knowledge of safe work practices and protocols applied in the industry; Proven success in supporting field Operations and defining, implementing and executing technical solutions to operating problems; Pipeline and oilfield maintenance, construction and commissioning experience; Working knowledge of ASME, ABSA, AER, CSA and regulatory codes related to the operation of oil and gas facilities considered an asset; Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as presentation skills; Well-organized, detail-oriented, enthusiastic and confident, with excellent problem-solving skills and a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude toward work; Driven, results-oriented individual who naturally takes responsibility for setting the standard and achieving results; Self-directed and capable of working within a continuously changing environment; Ability to lead and work effectively in a team environment; Instills confidence and creates strong relationships quickly; and Ability to prioritize and meet reporting deadlines. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Job_Description: Join Schneider Electric and power your career! Discover the opportunity to join an international, dynamic, and responsible company that fosters the development of all its people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice. Schneider Electric is looking for a Senior Quotation Specialist/Engineer to work on large commercial bids. This role can be done from Calgary or Mississauga. Job Description: Review RFQ’s for clarity of request, suitability for Schneider Electric product offering, risk assessment, profitability, and time given to complete. Based on the above criteria, along with Quotation team’s loading, and with input from the sales team, to decide to bid (or not). Reviews customer specifications/drawings to ensure quote is technically compatible and competitive. Understands, analyzes, documents, and communicates contractual and technical terms and conditions relative to the company standard. Serves as peer expert for proposal questions including complex technical issues and quote strategies. Structure and assemble the proposal/bid documents in collaboration with the concerned stakeholders and subject matter experts. Plan and monitor the deadlines to ensure timely and accurate approvals, proposal development and submission Review bid and incorporate appropriate ‘clarifications and expectations’ in the proposal To work with the sales team members to determine specific closing strategies for each bid. To work with the Quotation/Bids Specialists or Supervisors, to determine weekly capacity and capabilities. To liaise with the Consultant Sales Representative(s) for; 1) Specification clarification requests generated by Quotations/Bids Specialists; 2) To identify specifications that are not favorable for Schneider Electric. Work with our Partners to coordinate our strategies, and leverage our strengths. Ensure all bids, are entered into BFO, by the Quotation specialists Ensure all information that assists tracking is entered into BFO, (Value Chain Players & CRM). Set and manage the agenda for quotes meetings, focusing on upcoming bid closings, following up closed bids, and any issues which are relevant to the sales cycle. Other duties as required Job Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering (Preferred) or relevant experience. Proven bid management experience (6-10 years) in the Electrical Industry. A track record in planning and delivering large project bids involving electrical distribution equipment and/or industrial automation systems will be given preference. Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to meet tight deadlines Detailed oriented and strong proof reading and communication skills both written and verbal Computer skills: MS Office (Excel, Word, Power Point) / MS Projects. Ability to travel (10%).  Care. Connect. Challenge. Commit. Our values define our company. Who we are, our customer approach, how we do business, what it’s like to work here, and the kind of people we want to attract and retain. We care for our planet, our customers, our company, our team, and ourselves. We connect to customers and colleagues; we are open and respectful. We challenge others and embrace challenges ourselves. We commit to change by leading the change.  Qualifications       Primary Location : CA-Alberta-Calgary Other Locations : CA-Ontario-Mississauga Schedule : Full-time Unposting Date : Ongoing

Job_Description: Calgary, AB Startec Refrigeration Compression & Process Solutions is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission critical compression and refrigeration systems for a variety of industries. Startec devotes their industry leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solve their clients’ most technically challenging needs. We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, which is a cornerstone of our business.  Reporting to the Engineer Manager the Project Engineer is responsible for all Project Engineering and Project Management required to deliver gas compression and process packages on budget and on schedule  QUALIFICATIONS:  8+ years Project Management experience preferably in the oil and gas industry A background in plant operations or gas compression is an asset Project Management Professional Certification (PMP or PMI) Knowledge of process simulation software e.g. Hysis, VMG Good knowledge of ASME / ANSI / API Codes, knowledge of CSA Codes, knowledge of Code requirements for overseas customers is desirable Efficient in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint), Strong technical, analytical and problem solving capabilities Experience with sizing and selection for all parts and equipment of packages Ability to work well with customers, vendors, designers and fabrication staff Strong communication skills with a good ability to influence, negotiate and resolve conflict Capable of working with minimal direct supervision  JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:  Assists the Project Manager to resolve conflict as required. Communicates clearly with various project personnel and provides technical insight for resolution of problems. Provides guidance and technical direction to the Junior Project Engineers and Engineering Technologists. As required by the Engineering Manager, takes responsibility for areas of the technical direction and development of the engineering department including drafting. Ensures appropriate quality and integrity of product design, including taking responsibility for the stamping of required drawings (P&ID, Line List, PSV Table, Piping Registration, Etc.). Acts as one of the Responsible Members for the company’s permit to practice for APEGA. Communicates effectively between various departments. Completes engineering deliverables on time and on budget. Reviews all customer specifications that are applied to the project, ensures package is as sold and as built to customer agreed specifications. Is responsible to update the project “Scheduler” and ensures engineering deliverables are completed. Is responsible for understanding the proposal and the clients’ project specifications that have been accepted. Reviews the process simulation, checks or performs all major equipment sizing – vessel- compressor, driver, separators, pumps, filters, and heat exchangers. Performs any additional process design including simulation to determine pipe sizing, and equipment blow-down rates. Prepares vessel datasheets, performs sketch of internals, determines nozzle size and location, supervises vessel design, ensures vessel drawings are approved and issued to meet the project requirements. Prepares equipment datasheets (Vessels, Exchangers, Pumps, Etc.). Prepares and issues purchase requisitions to purchasing group as required and obtains comparative pricing for equipment where agreed. Prepares draft P&IDs, supervises designers to prepare the drawing, arranges and chairs in-house P&ID review meeting going through P&ID checklist, submits P&ID to customer and arranges for revisions Prepares the Bill Of Material (BOM), performs detail sizing of PSVs, control valves, Instrumentations Etc. and insures material selection, electrical classification, certification requirements are met Issues BOM to purchasing, customer, designer and arranges for revisions. Supervises the designers during preparation of the 3D model, GA, structural drawing and spool drawings in following customer’s specific requests and customer or in-house specs. Prepares weight estimates, selects preliminary structural beam sizes and communicates with the third party structural engineer for optimization and final approval. Arranges and chairs in-house 3D model review meeting with designers and manufacturing staff going through the design review checklist. Prepares control philosophy and shutdown key. Participates in safety studies such as HAZOP’s as required. Captures and defines the scope of project change orders and communicates them to the Project Manager. Prepares all project operating and maintenance manuals. Performs project final P&ID, walkthrough and signoff off our STA-ISO-010 Manufacturing Commissioning Sheet. Completes project “Ship Loose List” in conjunction with manufacturing. Participates in project “Closeout”, start-up and “Lessons Learned” meetings by providing feedback to Project Managers. Incorporates previous projects “Lessons Learned” into the engineering of current projects. Provides support to the service group during equipment commissioning and start-up which can include potential trip to site. Prepares any other calculations and technical documentation as required. Supervises third party engineering providers, review and approving all such work (Torsional analysis, Fugitive Emission Study, Stress Analysis, Vibration/Pulsation Study) Reviews, approves and issues, via Document Control, all drawings according to Startec drawing approval procedures and in following project schedule. Reviews and approves all vendor drawings in following project schedule.  We offer competitive wages, training, flexibility and a dynamic and exciting work environment.  It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Pro.file People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below:  http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=55094 We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job_Description: Career Opportunity – Project Manager – Infrastructure Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). About The Role The Project Manager reports directly to the Senior Project Manager and will have an in-depth knowledge of Infrastructure/Civil construction projects. As a Project Manager at Graham you will: Assist in pursuing and securing new work for the company through collaboration with our work winning team; Develop, recommend, and implement the project execution plan, schedule, and budget following project award; Ensure that the project is constructed in accordance with the Client’s design, specifications, budget, and schedule; Liaising with legal counsel in conjunction with the Operations Manager, assist in the review and negotiation of contracts and subcontracts; Manage financial aspects of contracts and participate in risk management activities in order to protect the company’s interests and maintain good relationships with our clients; Identify required and optional changes in project scope; negotiate change orders with the owner; manage potential claims on a proactive basis and practice a claims avoidance approach; Ensure that the project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule Assist, review and negotiate contracts; liaising with legal counsel, as appropriate, in conjunction with Operations Manager Develop, recommend and implement the project plan, after being awarded the project Coach/mentor, provide direction, and review the performance of personnel reporting directly to the Project Manager Monitor and control progress, costs and budgets throughout the lifecycle of the project; Act to resolve disputes between the Company and our clients, or the Company and our subcontractors on a proactive basis and with a focus on building long-term relationships; Actively participate in the recruitment, retention, development, and performance management of our Project Coordinators, Field Engineers, Superintendents, and other project support staff. Qualifications/Experience: Civil, Mechanical, or Structural Engineering degree or related technical degree. A Professional Engineering designation would be considered an asset. At least 3 -5 years’ experience leading Infrastructure Projects ($5-30 million) with a General Contractor. Knowledge and experience related to water projects, wastewater projects, and bridge projects. Mechanical and electrical background would be an asset. Detailed understanding of all aspects of construction: technology, equipment, materials, bid management, claims management, safety, and quality. A willingness to travel on a temporary basis to project sites throughout Alberta is considered an asset. Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long term equity opportunities About Us What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. We're Building careers, not filling jobs. View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. Graham Management Services LP 10840 27th Street SE Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 Fax: 403.570.5190
Title: Project Manager - Infrastructure

Job_Description: Job SummaryWant to add a few thousand dollars to your income doing part-time work?Paid Training toward becoming a Transport & Equipment Operator. Learn how to fire a machine gun and throw hand grenades too!Dental Benefits & Education Benefits! A Pension!What are you waiting for? Challenge yourself!In the Army Reserves you work part-time within your community. You are not posted to another city or required to do a military relocation. We are a part-time component of the Canadian Army which is trained to augment the Regular Army and aid civilian authorities during crisis or emergency situations (floods, ice storms, forest fires, etc). However, you can volunteer to move to another Base. You may also volunteer for deployment on a military mission within or outside Canada. As a Reservist, the choice to go is always voluntary.There is no career more challenging or rewarding than serving in the Canadian Armed Forces. You will receive world-class training, develop leadership skills and make great friends along the way. There really is no other career quite like it.Income & BenefitsWe pay you! Rates increase after courses are completed, you are promoted and as you gain experience in each Rank.All uniforms and equipment are provided at no cost.Free meals and accommodations during weekend field training, summer training, deployment training, and deployment.Extra pay is earned while in the field, summer or deployment training, and deployments.Travel assistance may be available to you depending on how far away from the Armoury you live.There are education reimbursements available through the Canadian Armed Forces. The Logistics Branch, Royal Canadian Electrical & Mechanical Engineering Branch and our own Service Battalion Society have scholarships and bursaries that may be applicable toward your post-secondary education.Dental coverage (for most items) is 90%, Health Care Premiums are reimbursed and you will contribute toward a Pension which provides financial and health benefits when you retire.Plus! This just in…we guarantee that for the first 4 summers that you are a member of the Reserves, you will be provided with full-time employment ( if you are available ) completing training or assisting with courses for other soldiers. It is not mandatory at all but if you are attending University, College or a Technical School, we can help you with the costs by providing you with employment, meals and accommodations.QualificationsA successful candidate must :be a Canadian Citizenhave completed at least Grade 10 or Secondaire IV (in Quebec)have parental consent if under age 18meet Canadian Armed Forces medical standardssuccessfully complete selection process, interview, and examinationspass physical fitness testsThe Canadian military is one of the most highly trained and respected forces in the world. Above all, the Canadian Armed Forces value strength of character and team contributions. This means that regardless of your gender, religion or ethnicity, the Canadian Armed Forces invites you to be a part of its team and to explore the opportunities it has to offer.The Canadian Armed Forces have also taken great strides in safeguarding the equality of women. By adopting a “no exclusion policy,” it has become one of the only militaries in the world to remove all barriers to full and equal service for all its members. This means that women have the opportunity to work any job in the Canadian Armed Forces.CSS Trades are in search of Drivers (Mobile Support Equipment Operators or MSE Ops) to move supplies such as food, ammunition, fuel, engineering assets, and soldiers. You will train as a part-time soldier and learn how to operate various trucks and types of equipment, how to dispatch, coordinate logistics prime movers, and conduct fleet management. Reserve MSE Ops are trained on a number of vehicles including counter-balance lift trucks, and Light, Medium and Heavy Transport Vehicles including Buses, Tractor-Trailers & Refuelers. Additional courses include Ammunition & Explosives Transportation, Driver Instructor, Driver Examiner, Air Brake Instructor, Collision Investigator, and many more. The MSE Op Trade is one of the most diverse Trades in the Reserves and in high demand. There are always opportunities for “extra” employment working with the Infantry, Engineer & Armoured Regiments.Not a MovieWhat you see in the movies is not what the Canadian Armed Forces is. You will learn how to push yourself physically and mentally to new heights. You will learn how to work as a cohesive team to achieve assigned tasks. You will be taught basic military skills like preparing your uniform, military drill, camouflage, map & compass, service rifles, hand grenades and NATO Orders Format. You will be taught how to survive in the cold and the heat. You will learn skills specific to your Trade. You will be tested. You will be cold or tired and sometimes both. You will learn how to instruct, mentor, lead, plan and manage. To become a “citizen soldier”, a “weekend warrior”, a Reservist, takes commitment, loyalty, training, and effort. As a result, the Canadian Armed Forces is renowned for being a well-trained, effective force in domestic, humanitarian and combat operations.What to know more about joining?Come to one of our Information Sessions! Job_Description: TRC Canada is seeking a CAD Technician who will analyze engineering documentation, sketches, notes, and other input material to determine the best approach to prepare drawings to accomplish the desired end product with proficiency in a fast paced Engineering Firm.  Some key characteristics of the potential candidate to be successful are as follows: known to being a self-starter, a disposition that enables the individual to work in both a team and singular setting, attention to detail, willing to work periodically in the outdoors and good overall judgment. The candidate must also be able to deal with ambiguity that is essential to an often shifting target of deliverables.  Requirements: Work closely with senior design engineers to develop electrical drawings using AutoCAD, and/or Bentley Microstation.  Shall be familiar with the practices and procedures pertaining to technical matters for electric utilities, cooperatives or municipalities in one or more of the following areas: Distribution Engineering, Electric Utility Construction, GIS and Mapping.  Shall maintain a working knowledge of internal and external CADD standards and the drawing database.  Shall effectively follow written and oral instruction to accomplish the following tasks:  Revise or prepare drawings (CADD and manual) with neatness and a minimum of errors.  Assist in the gathering of survey information both in the field and in the office, and the development of plans and maps from related field notes.  Perform tasks such as digitizing, copying and scanning of drawings, prints and maps.  Assist in the acquisition of on-site field data to accomplish the design or to monitor and evaluate equipment performance.  Generate drawing transmittals as may be required.  Maintain accurate drawing records by entering and maintaining drawing database information.  Self check all work and check the work of others as required.  Shall be willing to learn about the equipment represented by the engineering package so that candidate can eventually become an effective Designer and/or System Integrator. High School Diploma or equivalent experience required.  Associates Degree preferred with one year AutoCAD experience, or t AutoCAD certification, with two years of demonstrated success in the functions outlined in the above job responsibilities.  Highly proficient in AutoCAD (experience with 3D platforms a plus).  Ability to produce accurate work with attention to detail on time and within budget.  Team oriented and willing to put in the time and effort necessary to see a project through to successful completion.  Proficient in MS Office programs.  Proficient in reading and understanding technical drawings and specifications.  Self-starter that can work with little to no supervision. Strong organizational skills, positive attitude, and an ability to learn quickly.  Must be able to use computer keyboard and focus attention to PC monitor for prolonged periods.  Must be proficient with organizational tools related to CAD storage and tracking.  Ability to operate and maintain CAD equipment, plotter and other drawing reproduction equipment.  TRC Canada offers advancement potential and a competitive compensation and benefits package including; Medical, Dental, Basic Life/AD&D;, Dependent Life, Optional Life, Short and Long Term Disability, and Extended Health Coverage.  #LI-LC1
Title: CAD Technician

Job_Description: As Software Verification & Validation (V&V) Engineer, reporting to the V&V team lead, you will influence business success by applying your extensive engineering background and expertise in software testing strategies within a high-tech industry. Your work will impact all phases of the product development and deployment lifecycle. You will support planning activities and deliverables for ongoing release cycles; supporting an exciting new range products; carry out tasks and activities across the product verification teams located in Calgary.  Responsibilities Execute test deliverables in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams and our global customer base. Develop validation and verification plans for Safety Critical Systems products. Develop test specifications, test reports, test metrics and validation protocols for integration and performance testing. Implement and document effective processes to enable robust validation and verification of software products. Execute tests using automated and manual verification methods for both software and hardware. Establish test case traceability to requirements and specifications. Support testing done across the hardware, software and systems disciplines to ensure new products meet or exceed their performance and quality goals. Collaborate with other team members to set up and execute technology demonstrations to existing and potential new customers. Conduct occasional dynamic testing of GPS/GNSS technology.  Qualifications Must-Have: Post-secondary degree in a technical field, preferably in Computer Science, Electrical, Computer, Software Engineering. Validation and Verification experience within a cross functional development team environment. Software test tool development experience (including use of C/C++, Python, LabView). 5+ years of experience in a high technology manufacturing environment. Knowledge of GPS/GNSS technology Valid Driver's License Ability to travel approximately 10% (mostly North America, possibly international) Key Success Factors: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions to others. Ability to work in a collaborative team environment. Ability to multitask and manage multiple project paths. Strong English language communication skills, both oral and written. Nice-to-Have: An understanding of real time operating systems and embedded firmware development Understanding of signal processing algorithms Knowledge of, or some experience in, the automotive industry Knowledge of ISO 26262/ASPICE PAM 3.0 NovAtel designs, manufactures and sells high precision OEM positioning technology. Our GNSS products and services are used in more than 60 countries around the globe to deliver precise positioning solutions in precision agriculture, defense, mapping, autonomous vehicles, survey and many other industries.  Apply for this job online Email this job to a friend  Share on your newsfeed
Title: Verification & Validation Engineer

Job_Description: Career Opportunity –Commissioning Manager/Engineer– Infrastructure Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). About The Role The Commissioning Manager/Engineer reports directly to the Mechanical and Electrical Manager and will have an in-depth knowledge of Construction Testing, Commissioning, and Operations. As a Commissioning Manager/Engineer at Graham you will: Participate in Engineering and Supplier Model Reviews and squad checks Represent Graham on multi stakeholder commissioning teams Ensure the Commissioning Plan is developed in line with Contract Requirements with consistent review/ auditing/ development with risk management in consultation with Project Stakeholders. Prepare demonstration test plans, incorporating all supplier warranty conditions Interrogate Process control narratives in the evolution of functional testing plans Identify, coordinate, assign and oversee all loop checks Own the functional testing process Define system limits by producing ‘Scoped System Markups’ to P&IDs Obtain stakeholder ‘buy in’ for test limits and protocols Coordinate Facility Performance testing, providing support staff, consumables, energy source management (Including LOTO), and test media. To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience: or Qualifications/Experience: Peng, CET, or certified trade in either the Mechanical, Electrical, or Instrumentation disciplines, or have similar operational certification. 10 years’ experience in field construction or operations 5 years’ experience in Commissioning in a live plant environment 5 years in a field supervisory capacity 5 years’ experience in coordinating multi-stakeholder work teams Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long-term equity opportunities About Us What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast-evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. We're Building careers, not filling jobs. View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. Graham Management Services LP 10840 27th Street SE Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 Fax: 403.570.5190 Job Code: LS-18-077 #LI-LS
Title: Commissioning Manager/Engineer - Infrastructure

Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15272 Department: Operations Group Summary of Responsibilities Pembina Pipeline Corporation has an immediate opening for an Operations Engineer in our Oil Sands Business Unit (OBU) to support the operations of its pipeline assets. You will be a direct contributor to the ongoing development of Pembina’s pipeline business. The ideal candidate would be stationed in Calgary, Alberta with frequent travel to the field offices. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: Visibly demonstrate commitment and personal accountability to Pembina’s “Zero by Choice” safety culture, as well as ensuring staff and contractors are fully aware and compliant with Pembina’s safety requirements; Work with multi-disciplinary teams to develop safe, efficient and cost effective operating philosophies and solutions for customers involving pipeline operations; Troubleshoot maintenance and processing problems, identify cost effective solutions and implement to completion using Pembina’s Management of Change (MOC) process; Monitor pipeline performance and identify opportunities to reduce cost, improve safety, increase reliability and increase throughput; Work closely with Operations team to optimize existing asset performance and efficiency; Support the coordination of projects and communication between Engineering, Operations, Commercial and Finance/Accounting functional groups; Co-ordinate and manage outside engineering consultants, specialty consultants and contractors, and internal subject matter experts for the execution of design, construction and commissioning of projects; and Build and maintain a network of service providers and technical representatives to create an effective and sustainable operations environment. Qualifications Candidates will be a Professional Engineer (Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical preferred) and be registered with APEGA with a minimum 5 years’ experience in a Project Engineering or other technical role; Demonstrated knowledge of safe work practices and protocols applied in the industry; Proven success in supporting field Operations and defining, implementing and executing technical solutions to operating problems; Pipeline and oilfield maintenance, construction and commissioning experience; Working knowledge of ASME, ABSA, AER, CSA and regulatory codes related to the operation of oil and gas facilities considered an asset; Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as presentation skills; Well-organized, detail-oriented, enthusiastic and confident, with excellent problem-solving skills and a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude toward work; Driven, results-oriented individual who naturally takes responsibility for setting the standard and achieving results; Self-directed and capable of working within a continuously changing environment; Ability to lead and work effectively in a team environment; Instills confidence and creates strong relationships quickly; and Ability to prioritize and meet reporting deadlines. No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Job_Description: Join Schneider Electric and power your career!  Discover the opportunity to join an international, dynamic, and responsible company that fosters the development of all its people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice. Schneider Electric as the global specialist in energy management and automation creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. We deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment. Sustainability is at the core of our strategy. Environment, ethics, social responsibility, and community engagement are at the top of our agenda.  Schneider-Electric Canada is looking for a OEM Solution sales expert specialized in industrial categories to lead all sales actions with assigned OEMs to maximize and complement the product & solution business. Mission. The OEM Solution sales expert is accountable for the promotion and sale of Schneider Electric products, solutions & services to OEM accounts in Calgary, AB vicinity under the direction of the Area sales manager. Develops new sales opportunities as well as addresses and services the needs of established accounts. Utilizes excellent offering, application, competitor, and customer knowledge to develop and present winning value propositions for Schneider solutions. Responsible for developing account penetration strategies to profitably grow the OEM business. What will you do?  Establish key relationships with people outside one’s area; Analyze competitors’ strengths/weaknesses in terms of strategy, relationships, pricing, products, Potential Available Market and changing dynamics; Utilize knowledge of customers global strategy to drive the company success by coaching and mentoring others; Expand the customer portfolio with prospects, direct, and indirect customers; Determine the viability and profitability of potential opportunities – what is a “good” order; Identify cross sale opportunities between segments, markets, brands or products; Build process for pricing policy or increase implementation at territory/area level; Adapt standard product configurations to meet customer application; Provide technical support for specific projects to resolve issues; Apply local codes and standards; Understand total Schneider Electric Offer; Leverage the organization to grow the customers’ business; Convert and creates customer requests into orders; Consistently work towards closing the sale; Ability to cross reference competitive products; Address business needs of all functional stakeholder to ensure that the solution sale can be closed; Leverage existing customer relationships to identify new value chain opportunities for the company which benefit the customer’s bottom line; Contribute to the tender process and the contract definitions between the company and third parties (customers, partners, subcontractors); Leverage third party offers to complete the solution; Build a relationship in which the sales person is viewed as a trusted specialist by the customer at the operations level; analyze and manage relationships at the customer to advance sales pursuits and win business; Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be! Here’s why you want to work for us. You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market. You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office. You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members. Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies Qualifications  BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus. Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+
Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2

Job_Description: Utilize your power plant knowledge, sound engineering judgement, and data automation and management skills to provide technical expertise and troubleshooting expertise to the Generation Fleet to identify ways to reduce risk and losses.  Is this challenge for you? Imagine the possibilities.  Champion the establishment, automation, sustainment, and enhancement of a global process for collection, analysis, reporting, tracking, and performance improvement of Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM) for all ENMAX Generation facilities in alignment with industry standards and bodies (IEEE, NERC, GADS, etc.) and best practices.  Major Responsibilities: Responsible for the quality, consistency, automation, accuracy, and integrity of Generation fleet RAM data analytics. Accountable for assessing and analyzing RAM data to identify and track production losses and high maintenance costs and to transform and automate the data to information and insights for management decision making Responsible for establishing/determining the Generation RAM annual KPI targets based on historical performance and industry benchmarks, and reporting and tracking of the KPI’s while explaining the technical reasons why actual performance varies from targets on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Identify and forecast losses, repetitive failures, and other problems that adversely affect plant operations. These problems include capacity, availability, reliability, heat rate, cost impact, or regulatory compliance issues. Responsible for generation fleet events data integrity, accuracy, automation and completion in alignment with Plant operations and IEEE Standard. Responsible for maintaining and enhancing Facility Characteristics databases and analytics for all facilities (including generation technology performance related info such as min-up time, ramp rate, etc. in different operating modes – min stable, baseload, duct firing, etc.) Lead the development of RAM databases, data management, and automation within ENMAX information systems. Perform analytics and forecasting using complex data analysis techniques, coding and scripting, statistical methods, modeling and prediction, fault tree analysis, Weibull analysis, and/or Six Sigma (6σ) methodologies. Using BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.), create and maintain automated analytics and reports to predict RAM performance and track KPI’s. Provides input to risk management plans that will anticipate reliability-related and non-reliability-related risks that could adversely impact plant operations. Provide technical training to all applicable personnel regarding RAM practices and techniques.  Education Required: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer/software Engineering or related degree. Masters of Science or Masters of Engineering in the related field is preferred P.Eng status with The Association of Professionals in Engineering and Geoscientists in Alberta (APEGA)  Qualifications & Experience: Minimum of 7 of experience in electricity Generation/Operations fields working with plant RAM data management, analysis, and automation Must have plant operations experience Experience in maintenance and reliability principles and practices as well as implementation experience of these programs to improve these practices Expert analytical and mathematical skills Good knowledge of application of Computerized Maintenance Monitoring Systems (MAXIMO, SAP, etc.) including management of data from these systems Expert level knowledge of power plant systems and their interaction as one asset Expert level knowledge of SQL, visual basic, .NET, C++, C#, R, Python, or other coding language. Expert level in using Excel (macro code writing), Power Pivots, Clustering, and Data integration Must have experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, SAS, etc.) Expert level knowledge in RAM analysis techniques Expert level knowledge of IEEE standards and NERC GADS in relation with RAM analytics and reporting Expert level knowledge of big data management, warehousing, relational databases  Personal Qualities: Highly detailed oriented yet be able to apply critical thinking and engineering judgment in assessing results and providing quality work Ability to work independently and provide recommendations to senior management with confidence Maintain strong working relationships with staff, clients, and stakeholders Experience working in multi-discipline groups of professional employees Capable of influencing change High level of coordination and collaboration skills Takes ownership for his/her own development needs and identifies training and learning opportunities  Did we mention the ENMAX Advantage?  We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, free parking and much more. If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you.  Location: 141 50 AVE SE Calgary, AB  Note: ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply, it is our aim to have a workplace which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. ENMAX employees are encouraged to pursue professional development opportunities through our internal Learning Centre . Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required. Two professional references will be requested. Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.  Please visit our careers page to learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.
Title: Generation RAM Data Engineer

Job_Description: The Role The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line Contribute to the development of Pason Power web applications and monitoring & control systems Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, Zigbee, etc Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms Write unit and integration tests Contribute to support for production issues Participate in team technical discussions Participate in Code Reviews Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned. Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Proficiency in any of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java or C/C++/C# Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development Experience providing leadership in technical teams Familiar with RESTful APIs Exposure to code versioning tools such as Git Exposure to Linux Ability to work in a team or as an ndividual. Familiar with container technologies (Docker) Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc) Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc) Agile/Scrum experience  Qualifications Education  Preferred Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field. Bachelors or better in Engineering - Electrical and Computer or related field. Experience  Preferred 1 year: or more of software development experience working on commercial software projects or Software development internship Meaningful or sustained contributions to open source projects or experience with substantial personal projects is considered an asset
Title: Junior Software Developer (Pason Power)

Job_Description: As a Senior Controls Specialist within our Calgary office, you will excel in in a multi-faceted role supporting our clients in the Automation Solutions space. You will develop and articulate solutions to complex client automation projects, oversee project execution at a high level providing conceptual and technical expertise, develop and maintain client relationships and provide mentorship, coaching and leadership to your team members. Ultimately, you will provide superior client experiences partnering with your internal team to cohesively deliver a vision, energy, and intensity that exceeds client expectations.  What Would a Typical Day Look Like?  Technically, Controls Specialists will both execute and partner with project team leads in areas including:  Electrical design  PLC/HMI programming  System Architecture design  System Virtualization  Startup and commissioning and testing systems at our build facility  Travel to customer site to integrate systems  Exercise Project Management skills by developing project schedules and budgets in collaboration with clients and internal project management resources, ensuring completion of all project deliverables to the satisfaction of the client while fostering a culture of safety  Provide specific technical expertise and guidance in the development of employee skills, acting as a mentor and coach for junior employees as a cohesive team player  Participate in planning sessions with the Branch and Business Development Manager that will identify opportunities for new proposals, drafting of proposals, and explain/negotiate proposals with clients as well as partake in client meetings to help solidify JMP s position and increase client confidence in the JMP team  Interface with customers and offer strong technical expertise and advisement as part of the project team  What Qualifies You for this Opportunity?  Post-secondary degree/diploma in Engineering from a recognized engineering faculty or equivalent qualification  10+ years experience in the Automation industry as an Engineer, Technologist and/or project engineer, technically delivering on projects  3+ years proven track record of establishing and fostering solid client relationships  Proven track record in the design, procurement, programming, testing, commissioning and maintenance of control systems, including PLCs (Schneider/Rockwell), DCS, SCADA (Honeywell), Instrumentation, HMIs and Information Software  Experience with network architecture design and system virtualization (VMWare)  Experience with AutoCAD, Electrical Design, and a basic knowledge of the CEC  A proven self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude who is motivated by solving complex challenges  Strong client-focused approach, dedicated to providing exceptional client experiences to our internal and external customers  Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to engage, motivate and develop a team to achieve results  Ability to multi-task, exercise good judgment and prioritize workload through outstanding organizational skills  Excellent verbal and written communication skills with highly developed relationship management expertise, able to interact with various levels within the clients organization  Proven commitment to safety  Motivated & passionate about working with people and overcoming challenges through collaboration and a win-win paradigm  Reliable transportation and an ability to travel; Controls Specialists at JMP should have the ability to travel within the US and Canada  Who is JMP?  A mature, North American company founded in 1987 with 14 business units across the US and Canada, JMP serves the Fortune 1000 space providing engineering services and turnkey solutions in the areas of process automation, control system integration, information and analytic solutions and smart robotic applications.  We are CFE Media s 4 th fastest growing Systems Integrator in the world on the 2018 System Integrator Giants list, a Best Workplaces Canada award recipient from 2013 through 2017 and the only company in the world who is a Rockwell Automation Solution Partner, CSIA and RIA Certified.  Why Join the JMP Team?  At JMP we invest in our employees. JMP provides a very challenging work environment and believes in treating all employees with respect and providing equitable compensation. We empower our employees to use their creativity and problem solving skills daily. We have a solid performance management system and a supportive leadership team to help us achieve our personal and corporate objectives.  Accommodations  JMP Engineering has an accommodation program in place that provides reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please contact Human Resources  We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior Controls Specialist

Job_Description: Summary The primary objective of this position is to help commercial and industrial program participants apply the principles of continuous improvement to energy management. This position will be responsible for coaching energy teams in identifying, evaluating and implementing energy efficiency activities in commercial and industrial facilities. Previous experience with manufacturing processes and and commercial buildings is preferred.   This position will be in the Calgary, Alberta office of CLEAResult. It will include some travel and a valid driver’s license is required.  Job Description Responsibilities of this dynamic role include leading group workshops and providing individual energy coaching for commercial and industrial faciltiies. Candidates should have extensive experience with the application of Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma principles.  Key duties and skills required for the coaching element of this position include:  Overall program management delivering consulting services to multiple customers Meticulous project management and tracking Motivating and coaching plant management and teams Guiding the development of overall continuous improvement plans Facilitating training workshops and onsite energy audits and other one-on-one events Analyzing performance of commercial and industrial processes using monitoring equipment and statistical analysis Technical report writing for technical and non-technical audiences Ability to coordinate internally and externally with a broad group of stakeholders to ensure alignment and delivery of program requirements and goals Excellent written communication skills for presentations, technical reports, e-mail, and other written documents Outstanding oral communication skills will be necessary for telephone, one-on-one communication, and presentations to groups Project management expertise to successfully deliver projects on time and budget Exceptional customer service The ability to work with a team and give and take direction to/from co-workers.  Education/Experience/Skills:  Bachelor’s degree required 5-10 years of experience in mechanical, electrical, chemical, industrial, energy or facility engineering or a related field. Experience with energy engineering principles, methods, and techniques in industrial/agricultural facilities, systems, and processes is required. A range of experience with the following systems is desired: HVAC, lighting, chillers and refrigeration, variable frequency drives, compressed air, and process equipment. Preference given to those with a Professional Engineer (PE) license, Certified Energy Manager (CEM), Certified Practitioner in Energy Management Systems (CP EnMS) or other similar certification, and willingness to pursue additional certifications and training.
