Company Profile  CIMCO specializes in the engineering, design, manufacture, installation and service of complex thermal building solutions for industrial, process cooling and recreational refrigeration and mechanical systems. For more than 100 years, CIMCOs leadership and unparalleled research, development and manufacturing programs has put us at the forefront of industry advancements and technological breakthroughs. Job_Description: CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced Building Mechanical Engineer from qualified individuals who are interested in becoming a member of our Buildings Engineering group in Edmonton or Calgary, Alberta.  We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, employee-owned, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has expanded operations into Western Canada.  CIMA+ is proud to have reached the prestigious Best Employers in Canada’s Platinum Level, which is exclusively reserved for organizations that have achieved the best results in the Aon Hewitt survey for six consecutive years. We offer a highly competitive compensation package with excellent benefits, merit-based bonuses as well as a flexible and friendly working environment where committed individuals can thrive.  Key Responsibilities  Lead building mechanical engineering services for commercial, institutional, educational, healthcare, government, recreational and light industrial facility projects.  Lead a team of mechanical engineers and technologists on assigned projects.  Assist the Buildings Practice Leader with the growth and development of the mechanical team.  Be a technical resource in building mechanical design, and leverage that knowledge to mentor and develop junior engineers and technologists.  Prepare technical specifications and contract documents for bidding and construction.  Conduct quality assurance reviews on building mechanical design work completed by others.  Keep current on new products, technologies and design processes.  Coordinate work with architects, other engineering disciplines, and Owner representatives.  Contribute to business development, marketing and liaising with Clients and Architects.  Assist in determining the scope and fee for proposed engineering services.  Lead proposal efforts for building mechanical and multi-discipline project pursuits.  Qualifications  Undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering from an accredited post-secondary institution.  Professional Engineer registered in Canada, and eligible for professional registration in Alberta.  10+ years of progressive experience in building mechanical design.  Experience working in a consulting engineering environment.  Experience as mechanical design lead and able to direct and oversee a team of engineers and technologists on projects.  Able to articulate the mechanical design requirements and oversee the progression of mechanical system layouts in Autodesk® Revit and AutoCAD MEP.  Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring staff.  In-depth understanding of regulations, codes and standards associated with building mechanical design.  General understanding of building electrical and building structural systems.  Team player and independent worker.  Professional, energetic, organized and action-oriented.  Experience in using Microsoft office products including MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.  Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in the English language.  Experience in estimating engineering fees and schedules.  Experience in writing engineering reports, proposals, letters and technical specifications.  Proven success in developing business with new and existing clients, and maintaining positive relationships.  Experience in project management and controls, with a proven record of client satisfaction and financial success.  Experience in monitoring and adapting to industry trends and changing market conditions.  Able to travel to project sites.  The following are considered assets: LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP), Fellow or Green Associate.  Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM).  Experience in conducting field reviews and/or building condition assessments.  Certified Passive House Designer (CPHD).  Experience in Life Cycle Costing (LCC).  Experience on projects certified to LEED, Living Building Challenge (LBC), Passive House, and/or Green Globes.  Experience in building energy modeling using Can-QUEST, eQUEST, EnergyPlus, Trane Trace, Carrier HAP, IES(VE) or comparable platform.
Title: Building Mechanical Engineer

Job_Description: About this job Location options: Paid relocationJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Mid-Level, SeniorRole: Full Stack DeveloperIndustry: Financial Services, FinTech, SaaSCompany size: 501-1k peopleCompany type: PublicTechnologies java, spring, rest Job description ob description Solium needs Intermediate and Senior-level Full Stack Developers who want to write great programs. Do you want to work with a system that gets a half million logins from one hundred thousand users per month? How about write code for an industry-leading financial services platform that transacts more than ten billion dollars a year? Do you think it would be cool to be a part of the team that expands this platform to transact one trillion dollars for ten million users?  Have you ever wanted to be in a Guild?  Have you yearned to hear "that sounds great go ahead and try it out"?You aren't dogmatic; you're pragmatic. You know that "agile" means adapting to deliver value to customers, not necessarily any of the individual practices surrounding it. You care about automated tests and code reviews, and when the build breaks, you don't run git blame. You find the root cause and fix it. You embrace the hard problems like localization, security, and timezones. You want to move our code, style and performance in the right direction and be an influencer.It doesn't matter if it's Ant or Gradle, Struts or Spring, jQuery or GWT - you know it or you can pick it up. You aim to build commercial products that people use - technology is just a means to an end. We are looking for developers of all experience levels to help us build a fast, reliable, secure, and resilient enterprise platform on a global scale.Things we believe:  Results matter, not the clock.     Code and technology are what we use to solve problems, not the whole of our job. Continuously Improving, learning everyday through pairing, Lunch and Learns and mentorship.      You are passionate about about what you do and you take pride in your craft. Great programmers are great programmers whether they work in Java, .Net, React Native or C++ Free tools are great unless they aren't the best. We use high-end Linux workstations with big monitors and tools like IDEA, JRebel and the Atlassian suite to keep us in the zone.  Skills & Requirements Things we like:    Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems Familiarity with technologies we use (Java, Spring, GWT, Struts, JPA, EJB, REST)      A hunger for tracking down root causes - no matter how deep the rabbit hole       A BS in CS is appreciated but not necessary with the right background  What you'll do:  Be customer focused - learn about the business to help bring value to our customers Act technology driven - design, implement, and test new functionality    Work closely with QA - we fix our own bugs       Work with Product Management to deliver material value to our clients      Do full stack dev from the DB to the UI       Use your experience to help the whole team get better  What you'll get:           Market rate salary based on experience          An amazing on-boarding experience on Shareworks, Dev Culture, How we do things and even "reforming" you from .Net to Java           Participation in annual bonus plan and stock incentives   Share Purchase Plan with company contributions (we are public and profitable!)            Casual Environment - we aren’t a bank, they just happen to be clients 20 Paid Days off + 11 stat holidays (and 5 week sabbatical after 5 years) The occasional spontaneous Nerf War Relocation Assistance available for the right candidates  If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Just send an email to dev-careers@solium.com with Intermediate OR Senior Dev Applicant in the subject and we'll talk about how your career is about to get better. These jobs are full time positions in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.  In addition to being a Canadian citizen or having permanent resident status, you must live in Calgary or be willing to move.
Title: Intermediate and Senior-level Full Stack Developers

Who you are: You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. In fact, you’re the first to rattle off which WWDC video would help your coworker. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. You have knowledge of how a RESTful web service works, what makes it RESTful and how it can be accessed from Android. You are also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. What you’ll do:  Design, program and test software. Job_Description: About this job Location options: Paid relocationJob type: Full-timeExperience level: ManagerIndustry: Financial Services, FinTech, SaaSCompany size: 501-1k peopleCompany type: PublicTechnologies java Job description About SoliumSolium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.Why work at SoliumSolium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:Software Development ManagerSolium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.         If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs   Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform  Then we are looking for you!We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software  Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build   Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Help lead the team to balance commercial viability, scalability, security, and technical innovation to evolve the Shareworks platform  Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, or Equivalent experience Familiarity with development and deployment of enterprise applications Working knowledge of management techniques and strategies 8+ years’ experience as a developer or engineer      5+ years’ experience as a development or engineering team lead (or other technical management)  If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Just send an email to dev-careers@solium.com with Software Development Manager in thesubject and we'll talk about how your career is about to get better.​​

Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$80k - 120kJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Mid-Level, SeniorRole: Full Stack DeveloperIndustry: Agile Software Development, Data & Analytics, Energy & CommoditiesCompany size: 11-50 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies c#, asp.net-mvc, sql, angular, asp.net-web-api Job description EnergyIQ is looking for a Senior Full-Stack .NET Web Developer in a full-time, permanent position to help us deliver new and enhanced functionality in all of our applications - Trusted Data Manager (TDM), IQexchange and IQinsights. These commercial applications allow data management and geoscience teams in the energy industry to create, manage, analyze and continually improve the trustworthiness and quality of their data, and the certainty of their business decisions. Our platform supports users in both on-premise and cloud environments, with a vision to be completely cloud-hosted in three years. We need to deliver a lot in 2018, so we need to add smart, fun people to our development team to get through it all.  The technology stack you’ll be working with includes ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET WebApi, SQL Server, ElasticSearch, JavaScript, KendoUI, Angular. We work in C# a lot, but we're open to other languages and tools when we see the right fit in our toolkit. We are advocates for keeping things simple, delivering end-to-end before optimizing, and reviewing designs against acceptance criteria constantly to ensure that we're delivering what is needed by users now, not over-designing for the future. We are passionate about clean, well-designed code that requires minimal maintenance and is well-tested by developers and testers alike – creating great functionality for users while keeping our quality high with automated and manual testing. A typical day in this role includes a short stand-up team meeting in the morning, coding on sprint commitments, meeting with the product owner to further define requirements or review your UI design, catching up with others over lunch, mentorship time with younger developers, and a weekly demo to the team of the new features or fixes deployed. What you’ll be doing  Hands-on coding efforts to contribute to the sprint and release commitments Develop in a highly collaborative environment side-by-side with software testers, developers and business representatives. Participation in release/iteration planning, story/bug effort estimation. Code reviews to identify required improvements, technical risks, performance impacts, and dependencies of new development efforts. Technical designs of new functionality and application enhancements.  What you need  Brains, a sense of humour, and pride in your craft. Bring proactiveness and creativity in your solutions and a passion for tech and coding. Proficiency (5+ years) in the full stack of the .NET Framework – front-end development in common JavaScript frameworks on top of middle-tier controllers and services and back-end supporting services and libraries - C# preferred. 3+ years recent experience in either Oracle or SQL Server. Hands-on experience with Angular, JavaScript, KendoUI, JQuery with good UI design.  What else we look for  Experience with current designs and implementations of RESTful APIs. Recent experience with TeamCity build tools, ReSharper code tools, and an agile software development workflow based upon JIRA and Confluence. A strong interest in collaboration and mentorship Laughing and smiling in the face of adversity, able to roll with the punches.  How do you find out more? Our interview process consists of several stages, each one allowing us get to know youbetter, professionally and technically. It is also an opportunity for you to gain a betterunderstanding of our culture and the work we do here at EnergyIQ. The process usually takes us a few weeks after we start the initial reviews. The stages include:  CV and Portfolio Review Phone Interview Face to Face Interview Reference Check  In our face-to-face interview we show you the office, our products and the architecture, and give you the chance to talk to one of the team about the role.
Title: .NET Full-Stack Web Developer

Essential Duties and Responsibilities  Work as part of an agile DevOps team, contributing towards the continued automation of Pason’s infrastructure and software deployments. Automate the deployment of new and existing services for CI, QA and Production environments Evaluate and implement cloud-orchestration tools and frameworks to support the ongoing management of Amazon Web Services such as EC2, ELB, S3, RDS, etc. Propose, validate and implement creative solutions to scaling, performance and cost problems associated with running production and test systems in AWS. Write code to improve the Continuous Delivery pipeline Write code to provision and manage infrastructure within the cloud Support the resolution of production issues Participate in design and code reviews Participate in the team’s 24/7 on-call rotation  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Proficiency in either Python or Java on Linux Experience working with configuration management technologies such as Puppet and Ansible Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc) Experience with the Git or equivalent Experience working in an agile development environment (Scrum/Kanban). Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience  Work Experience  3+ years’ of software development experience working on commercial software projects or software development internship Meaningful or sustained contributions to open source projects or experience with substantial      personal projects is considered an asset  Education  A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering

Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$48k - 69k | EquityJob type: Full-timeExperience level: Junior, Mid-Level, LeadIndustry: Enterprise Software, Security Software, Software Development / EngineeringCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: PrivateTechnologies .net, c#, database, enterprise, objective-c Job description Not your everyday software developer position. Challenging and fast moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different.   Positions Available:  Multiple positions ranging from intermediate up to team lead level (based on skill, regardless of the amount of experience or education), opening up immediately and throughout the year. Additional positions for specialists (for example, Android programming, user interface programming, etc). Tell us your strengths and we’ll go from there. Other Positions: We are also hiring for other positions (software tester, business analyst, project manager, graphic designer, and front-end GUI designer). You may apply for multiple positions separately. If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting.  Position Overview:  Full time and permanent. Fast moving in terms of variety of work and expectations. Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others). Gain valuable career experience in the newest highlevel technologies (C#, .NET 5, Java, MVC7, WCF, web services, SOA, Swift/Objective-C, Xamarin, F#). Gain experience with many advanced software engineering tools and techniques (code generation, object relational mappers, advanced .NET reflection, etc). Gain experience with both small and large projects, with involvement throughout the product life-cycle. Opportunities to be involved with higher level architecture and design. Mentoring from experienced software architects and some of the smartest peers in the country, on exciting projects that you can really sink your teeth into. A blend of programming methodologies (deliberately part way between agile, Kanban, and waterfall plus occasional extreme and pair programming methodologies). Does not involve a lot of boring technical support or fixing broken legacy applications. Most of the learning is through hands-on trying and doing and collaborating. Meetings and formal training are minimized. Rarely requires meeting with a client for those who prefer not to. Environment allows for some privacy at your workstation as well as time to concentrate without distractions when you need it.  Requirements:  Highly intelligent. Fast learner and enjoys learning. Passionate about making software and very good at it. Gets deeply involved with challenges and will persevere at length to achieve victory. Takes pride in work. A deep appreciation for reusable code and the benefits of object oriented design. No specific requirements for formal education or industry experience. We evaluate each applicant based on merit rather than formalities.  Nice To Have:  Ability to see opportunities for improvement everywhere. Experience with .NET or mobile development. Pragmatic approach to balancing perfectionism with getting the job done.  About The Work Environment:  Friendly, non-threatening, and non-political environment. Mid-sized company but retaining the speed and flexibility of a smaller company. We are a great environment for both outgoing people and those who are very shy and introverted (applicable to non-client facing positions). We strive to have every employee sitting near a window for natural light and to have plenty of plants throughout the office; we care about employee health. Free onsite massage therapy. Private nap rooms for isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night. Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch. Social events worth remembering (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics club coming soon, etc). An example of our culture: Lunch together is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. Fast paced  Applying:  What do you have to lose by exploring the possibility? Applying does not take long and we keep your application confidential (never disclosed to existing employer). Apply online today at https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com Even if you don't have your resume updated or ready to go, apply anyways, we want to hear from you! Please do not apply via email, use only the https://careers.pleasantsolutions.com link to apply.
Title: Software Developer / Programmer (Exciting and great variety)

They have a focus on using the latest technology to bring the energy industry's process into the modern era. They have a team of industry veterans and software experts backing the team up to make sure there is a clear vision and the expertise to get there. Your new role As part of a small team of back end developers, you have been doing rail development, code reviews, production support, and the occasional delve into other areas as it comes up. The team is focused on making sure that the back end works well with the mobile applications and web platforms. You will start out learning the app and platform and work with the team to master and code for success, fix pesky bugs, and work with the team to solve difficult problems. What you'll get in return You will get to work with some of the latest tech in Calgary as part of a collaborative fun team with lots of room for growth. Paid benefits, company events, and a casual office environment. If you are still reading we take it you may be interested, so you will also receive an above market base salary and lots of room for learning, and development. What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Job_Description: About this job Compensation: C$80k - 95kJob type: Full-timeExperience level: SeniorRole: Full Stack DeveloperIndustry: Aerospace, Agile Software Development, Technical ServicesCompany size: 51-200 peopleCompany type: PublicTechnologies java, angularjs, mysql, mongodb, git Job description We are building a next generation aircraft monitoring and in-flight diagnostic solution. The solution consists of both FLYHT H/W and S/W executing on the aircraft, communicating over a satellite network to a Cloud based application stack processing and disseminating the information. Communication is bidirectional and enables our customers to diagnose issues on the aircraft in real-time (we see it as equivalent to putting a mechanic on the aircraft while it’s flying). In emergency situations, the system will stream blackbox data to be stored and processed on the ground, fast tracking the investigation of accidents where retrieval of the black box is challenging. The solution will enable our customers to visualize the information received from the aircraft. We need an Senior Enterprise Software Developer to fully productize the enterprise side of the system and put the foundation in place for extending the solution with new features. We need your implementation and mentoring skills to build out our Java based software solution. You have expertise in high availability, disaster recovery and scalability. You understand how to design and implement software components with testability front of mind. You work exceptionally well with all stakeholders and development team members; people enjoy working with you. You take a pragmatic approach and balance long term vision with near term opportunities. FLYHT primarily works with open source, Java based technologies (for our enterprise projects). Responsibilities:  To implement high quality (low defect rate) code on time and within estimates To mentor team members To implement within and drive improvements to FLYHT’s software development processes  Technical Proficiencies:  Expert in Java based technologies and frameworks Expert in Scrum based agile development Expert in Cloud hosted and Java based enterprise development projects Expert in both relational and no-sql databases Strong experience with messaging frameworks  Qualifications  Completion of a B. Sc. In Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline Minimum 6 years of software development experience in a professional environment Excellent English communication skills (verbal and written) Good knowledge and understanding of different development methodologies, practices and tools such as code repositories, testing frameworks, release practices, continuous integration, and automated build servers Successful track record of defining architecture and guiding the implementation to align to the architecture  Assets  Knowledge of aeronautic industry Knowledge of avionic software development guidelines (DO-178, DO-278)
Title: Senior Enterprise Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22463 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the director of asset integrity, your knowledge and experience will guide Suncor’s direction in pressure equipment integrity management (PEIM) to enable safe, and reliable operation of our assets. You will drive operational excellence around inspection of pressure equipment by acting as leader of inspection collaboration groups and by providing your expertise across all Suncor operations on critical pressure equipment inspection programs and high risk issues. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Lead the Suncor inspection technical excellence network, a collaboration group of inspection specialists representing all Suncor facilities</li><li>Ensure rapid and quality resolution to high criticality pressure equipment inspection and materials issues when requested by a business unit, which may include failure investigations and root cause analysis, as well as recommendations to operate, repair or replace equipment.</li><li>Share any findings that may be applicable to the wider Suncor enterprise</li><li>Drive operational excellence by identifying and closing gaps in pressure equipment inspection, materials and reliability practices by preparing training or developing new documents</li><li>Evaluate, introduce, disseminate, and apply new inspection techniques, standard methodologies and insights from outside Suncor by acting as a corporate representative to industry committees and networks, such as API, AFPM, CGSB and ASNT</li><li>Manage and provide guidance on selection, deployment, implementation and upkeep of static equipment inspection database software</li><li>Provide mentorship on turnaround inspection work scope establishment, review and challenges</li><li>Promote continuous improvement by participating in audits related to best practices, standards, owner-user programs, risk based work scope reviews (RBSR) and other initiatives</li><li>Support equipment and pipeline integrity assessments, life predictions, life extension studies, and inspection interval planning</li><li>Travel to sites and go to the field when required to provide support on critical issues</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>20 or more years of inspection experience with pressure equipment in the oil refining and Oil Sands industries</li><li>Registration as a professional engineer is not required, but is an asset</li><li>API, CGSB, ASNT, CWB, AWS, NACE or other Inspection certifications are an asset</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Hands-on experience in PEIM in facilities, including quality assurance and quality control, inspection, engineering, NDE, maintenance and repair, and inspection record keeping, as well as degradation mechanisms, prevention and control.</li><li>Corrosion hazard assessments (corrosion control documents and integrity operating windows), piping and pipeline integrity management plans, equipment integrity plans, risk-based inspection programs, owner-user programs and fitness for service assessments</li><li>Process unit equipment types, operation, and the typical damage mechanisms in refineries and upgraders</li><li>Inspection turnaround scope development and planning processes</li><li>API, ASME, ASTM, AWS, NACE, NBIC, ISO, CGSB, CSA, and other codes, standards, recommended practices, or jurisdictional requirements for pressure equipment in Alberta, Ontario, Quebec, BC, and Colorado</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. Job_Description: Additional Comments:Internal and External candidates are being considered simultaneously <br/> Overview<br/><br/>The successful candidate will join NOVA Chemicals Performance Film Technical Service and Applications Development team to deliver innovative solutions focused on supporting NOVA Chemicals customers to deliver plastic products that make everyday life healthier, easier and safer. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This position will be responsible for leading various Application Development initiatives related to design and evaluation of multilayer film structures as well as package integrity testing. Responsibilities may include  <ul>   <li>Contributing to or leading projects which resolve industry and customer needs through the development of new multilayer flexible structures</li> <li>Using knowledge of Food Science to improve or develop new multilayer flexible packaging to maintain food safety, maximize shelf life and reduce food waste.</li> <li>Participating in product development efforts and translating voice of the customer requirements into those efforts</li> <li>Utilize customer input to improve project targets and influence application and new product initiatives.</li> <li>Providing technical service support to customers as appropriate for their area of focus.</li> <li>Assessing patent landscape and generate patent applications</li> <li>Engage industry associations, equipment suppliers and customers.</li> <li>Develop related sales tools, present at conferences and at customer workshops and technical meetings.</li> <li>Actively apply and support Responsible Care principals and procedures.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will possess:  <ul>   <li>Bachelor’s degree in Science, Packaging Science, Materials Science, or Engineering with 5+ years of related practical experience.</li> <li>Food Science expertise including food protection and shelf life determination to assist in the development of new or improved packaging.</li> <li>Exposure to food processing technologies</li> <li>Knowledge of new and emerging packaging trends</li> <li>Experience with flexible packaging and polymers</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a team environment.</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills</li> <li>High level of collaboration within internal technical staff and development partners.</li> <li>Innovative with proven problem-solving and trouble shooting skills.</li> <li>Highly motivated, take initiative and create opportunities.</li> <li>Effective time management and organizational skills.</li> <li>Project management skills</li> </ul> Candidates must have the following:  <ul>   <li>Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% of the time throughout the U.S and Canada.</li> </ul> <strong>NOTE:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Salary will be commensurate with education and experience.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> NOVA Chemicals develops and manufactures chemicals, plastic resins and end-products that make everyday life safer, healthier and easier. Our employees work to ensure health, safety, security and environmental stewardship through our commitment to sustainability and Responsible Care®. NOVA Chemicals, headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is a wholly owned subsidiary of The International Petroleum Investment Company (IPIC) of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. <br/><br/> The NOVA Chemicals technology center is located in Calgary, Alberta. The state-of-the-art facilities, comprised of the Centre for Applied Research and Centre for Performance Applications, focus to support technological advancements in the polyolefins and olefins fields. <br/><br/> The technology center is recognized as the largest in Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits:</strong> <br/><br/> NOVA Chemicals’ flexible benefit programs are designed to meet the diverse needs of our employees, because when it comes to benefits, everyone has different priorities. Our benefits offerings will vary based on your work location, and are an element of the “Total Rewards” package used to reward employees.
Title: Packaging Engineer

Job_Description: Sargent & Lundy is a worldwide leader in professional services for the electric power industry. Our distinctive capabilities provide domestic and international clients and partners with a thoroughly reliable source of comprehensive expertise. We continuously strive to build dynamic teams to support our future growth. We provide opportunity, challenge and competitive compensation within a positive work environment that motivates employees to build careers within our company. <br/><br/> Rapid expansion of our business in Canada has created an opportunity for an engineering manager to get in on the ground floor of an opportunity to open and grow an office in Calgary. The position would include marketing, business development, and coordination of work with our corporate office. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Project Director, this role will be primarily accountable for project development and growing the office. You would be responsible for integrating the new office and staff members with the home office. This includes design and efficiency of business processes and procedures. Mentoring and training new employees. <br/><br/> Other duties include: Interfacing with existing company resources to increase business development opportunities within Alberta; managing external relationships with engineering consultants and contractors, as well as joint venture relationships and executing project work plans. <br/><br/> * Must possess a Bachelor of Science in an Engineering discipline. <br/><br/> * 15+ years of experience in the design of engineering systems for non-commercial, heavy industrial plants (power preferred), with a focus on integrated, detailed system design for new plants, modifications, or replacements. Experience must include the selection of equipment, control philosophy and the preparation of calculations and specifications. <br/><br/> * Extensive experience managing large engineering projects including combined cycle and co-generation <br/><br/> * Experience leading business development efforts to capture work. <br/><br/> * Extensive knowledge and applied experience in all aspects of project engineering & design. <br/><br/> * Experience serving as firm/client liaison in a support or lead engineering role. <br/><br/> * Strong leadership skills and the ability to create and motivate staff. <br/><br/> * Experience in reviewing design drawings. <br/><br/> * Excellent written and verbal communication skills. <br/><br/> * Extensive work experience in Alberta is essential. <br/><br/> * P-eng License preferred. <br/><br/> * Highly preferred but not required is experience in construction and start-up. <br/><br/> #LI-LISL INDEEDSL
Title: Engineering Manager

Job_Description: Benevity is seeking a Tools and Infrastructure Engineer to join a team that is responsible for solving challenges around developing software at scale without sacrificing stability, quality, velocity or code health. This position empowers you to build elegant tools that enable the entire engineering organization to be more productive and efficient. It exposes you to a wide array of interesting technical challenges due to increased visibility into every other engineering team and their systems. You'll engage in helping and mentoring them to take benefit of a shared tool ecosystem. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Better Work and a Better World: at Benevity that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes - we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline. We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us. <br/><br/> We’re not Bono, just a passionate crew of workhorses out to change the world. We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love (ok, some people – you know who you are!) – and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and environmental standards. <br/><br/> You’ll join a dedicated, passionate team that creates innovative solutions for our raving fans (er, clients). And you’ll get to rub shoulders with some of the most iconic and notable companies and charities in the world to help them make a difference (in even better ways). Our entrepreneurial environment appeals to self-driven, flexible team players who learn quickly, aren’t afraid to tackle hard problems and don’t mind wearing jeans to work. Sound cool? Join us! What You'll Do <br/><br/> <strong>What You Will Do</strong>  <ul> <li>Lead/contribute to engineering efforts from design to implementation, solving complex technical challenges around developer and engineering productivity and velocity</li> <li>Design and build advanced automated build, test and release infrastructure</li> <li>Work closely with internal users throughout the development and testing process to understand their needs and rapidly iterate on solutions</li> <li>Integrate, extend, and maintain existing tools and infrastructure</li> <li>Create and improve automation of the Jenkins pipeline and optimize it based on various KPIs</li> <li>Provision and support various environments used during the development and test lifecycle</li> <li>Develop CLIs, GUIs, and APIs to address different needs and types of stakeholders</li> <li>Identify opportunities to adopt and adapt new tools and techniques from the industry</li> <li>Actively participate in regular team meetings, discussing issues related to productivity, process, workflow and quality</li> <li>Ensure that the tools are scalable, well documented and easy to understand</li> </ul> <strong>What You Bring</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary diploma, certificate or degree in an IT-related discipline</li> <li>3 to 5 years of development experience with a strong coding skillset in at least one of Java, Go, JavaScript or PHP</li> <li>Experience with containerization/virtualization technologies like Docker, Vagrant and VMware</li> <li>Experience with Amazon Web Services ecosystem: EC2, S3, RDS (MySQL), VPC and IAMs</li> <li>Experience with Configuration Management tools like Ansible (preferred), Chef or Puppet</li>   <li>Proven ability to quickly learn and work with new tools and technologies</li> <li>Comfortable with Linux Shell/Command Line and Shell scripting</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of Git version control</li> <li>Experience with continuous integration and/or deployment tools like Jenkins</li> <li>Strong ability to work independently as well as with cross-functional teams</li> <li>Excellent verbal, written, analytical and communication skills</li> <li>Demonstrated problem solving skills and initiative – you must be proactive and results driven with a proven track record</li> </ul> <strong>What You Can Expect</strong>  <ul> <li>Enjoy a fast-paced environment, with a history of proven success in a dynamic, rapidly growing company.</li> <li>Demonstrate extraordinary time-management skills and organizational capabilities.</li> <li>Be an innovative thinker, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses do things differently to get better returns on their social good programs.</li> <li>Build trust, value others, communicate effectively, drive execution, foster innovation.</li> <li>Focus on the client, collaborate with others, solve problems creatively and demonstrate high integrity.</li> <li>Professional internal and external relationships that meet company core values.</li> </ul> It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Tools and Infrastructure Engineer

Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year , we who provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Lead responsibility for technical direction of a group of engineers or functions as a technical specialist formulating and developing advanced engineering concepts, techniques, and standards. Develops solutions to complex problems that require a high degree of innovation and ingenuity. <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Carry out the responsibilities of a Lead Engineer on large sized projects and / or provide technical support / leadership on a project. Promote workshare execution</li><li>Perform studies develop scope of work and execution of the engineering work</li><li>Coordinate project electrical activities with a utility and other disciplines for their area of responsibility. Establish construction electrical deliverable types and its contents/details with the construction group</li><li>Develop and maintain electrical project schedule, progress reports and cost estimates. Execute change management process</li><li>Supervise Juniors, Intermediate & Senior electrical engineers and designers. Interface with design group to monitor and control project schedule, electrical hours and electrical cost for their area of responsibility</li><li>Ensure consistency and integrity of electrical design throughout project and review design for logic and functionality</li><li>Review / approve design of plant distribution system including protection scheme</li><li>Develop detailed electrical specifications for the project. Review and approve inquiries, evaluations and purchase requisitions of electrical equipment and sub-contracts</li><li>Review and approve relay protection and coordination studies. Perform / witness test at factory / site for all major electrical equipment</li><li>Perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for electrical systems</li><li>Daily on the job training and mentoring of team members</li><li>Participate in conducting the in-house technical seminars</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering required</li><li>Minimum of 14-16 years of practical experience with specifications, engineering, design, construction and start-up for low and medium voltage plant distribution systems with EPC consulting firms for small to large oil & gas related projects or power plant projects is required</li><li>Previous experience in a Lead Engineer role is required</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills required</li><li>Experience in motors and VFD design is required</li><li>Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required</li><li>Eligibility for a Professional Engineering certification is required</li><li>Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Job_Description: Electrical, Instrumentation & Piping Specialists <br/><br/> Keystone Technical Resources (KTR) is a Specialized StaffingCompany that focuses on sourcing exceptional talent for our Clients in the Engineering/Oil & Gas Sector, on a Contract, Contract to Hire, or Permanent basis. <br/><br/> Due to an influx of upcoming projects with their clients, we are searching for experienced Technical Professionals with 5+ years experience in an EPCM environment, in the following areas: <br/><br/> Senior Electrical Engineers <br/><br/> B.Sc in Electrical Engineering Degree from a recognized University or equivalent qualification.P.Eng registration with APEGGA (or eligible) <br/><br/> Prepare DBM, EDS, cost estimate and detail design of plant power distribution system.Develop single line diagrams for HV/ MV/LV power distribution system.Carry out engineering calculations and analysis for demand load, equipment sizing, voltage drop, motor starting, neutral grounding resistors (NGRs), and system power factor improvement. <br/> Develop protection, relay coordination and relay settings for the power distribution system.Conduct load flow, short circuit and fault level studies.Specify and select electrical equipment, prepare data sheets, prepare RFQs and material requisitions. <br/><br/> Intermediate & Senior Electrical Designers <br/><br/> Diploma in Electrical Engineering Technology or equivalent.CET Registration with ASET or equivalent.Experience in any one or more of drafting software Autocad, Autoplant, Intools, Microstation, Smartplant. <br/> Design single line diagrams for plant MV/LV power distribution system. <br/> Design substation layouts, grounding layouts, electrical equipment layouts, motor control schematics, control panel layouts, cable layouts, cable tray layouts, lighting layouts, area classification drawings, general plant layouts. <br/> Prepare area classification drawings in conjunction with electrical engineer and other discipline engineers. <br/> Calculate voltage drops, size conductors, starters, breakers, dis-connects, fuses, cable trays and lighting requirement. <br/> Develop material list and load list. <br/> Able to read and extract electrical information from P&ID's and mechanical equipment list. <br/> Familiar with different stages of EPCM projects. <br/> Knowledgeable with latest revision of CEC Part 1, C22.1 <br/><br/> Senior Instrumentation Specialists5+ years North American EPCM experience <br/><br/> CET Registration with ASET or equivalent. <br/> Specify instrumentation such as control valves, pressure safety valves, measurement devices and other associated instrumentation. <br/> Generate Instrument Index and Data Sheets <br/><br/> Assist in P&ID development by providing instrumentation details and document checking. <br/> Develop instrumentation material requisitions - quote, evaluate and purchase. <br/><br/> Intermediate & Senior Piping Designers <br/><br/> 5+ years North American EPCM experience. <br/><br/> Autoplant and/or CADworx software experience required. <br/> Supply ASME, API, ANSI B31.3, B31.4, and B31.8 requirements to the final <br/> design effort. <br/> Experience in the selection and placement of pipe supports, and equipment layout. <br/> Demonstrate a working knowledge of piping requirements for pumps, compressors, heat <br/> exchangers, furnaces and boilers, tanks and pressure vessels. <br/> Participate in scope development, estimating, scheduling for projects. <br/><br/> All opportunities listed are contract or contract to hire <br/> positions with our established Calgary based EPCM client. <br/><br/> www.keystoneresources.ca <br/><br/> (KTR thanks all applicants, however only those selected for screening will be contacted Job_Description: Position Profile <br/><br/> The Junior Electrical Engineer/Technologist will be part of a design team working on automation and low to medium voltage electrical engineering design projects. The project types will vary in size and complexity, and may include, but not be limited to DCS, PLC, HMI, SCADA and RTU systems. <br/><br/> Position Accountabilities <br/><br/> Electrical engineering and design work on all aspects of electrical design under supervision of the project lead. <br/><br/> Preparation and execution of electrical design documents and related calculations, such as voltage drop, cable tray loading, conduit fill calculations, overcurrent selection, motor starting calculations and overload selection, etc. <br/><br/> Staging and Testing – assist in the preparation of test plans and inspect/test hardware <br/><br/> Drawing package preparation – prepare various electrical drawings:  <ul> <li>Layout drawings</li>  <li>Control panel drawings</li>  <li>Power distribution schematics</li>  <li>I/O schematics</li>  <li>Loop drawings</li>  <li>Junction box layout & termination drawings</li>  <li>Single line diagrams</li>  <li>Motor control schematics</li>  <li>Grounding diagrams</li>  <li>Lighting/Distribution panel drawings</li>  <li>System architecture drawings</li>  <li>Marshalling termination drawings</li>  <li>Installation detail drawings</li> </ul> Construction work package preparation – produce a construction scope of work document, construction specifications and supporting documentation. <br/><br/> Procurement – assist with the specification and procurement of equipment. Prepare bid specifications, bid comparisons and produce recommendations for purchase. <br/><br/> Narratives and documentation - produce as-build narratives and shutdown keys from existing PLC code. Prepare reports on various aspects of the project. <br/><br/> System Architecture drawings - as-build and additions to architecture drawings and block drawings. <br/><br/> Candidate Profile  <ul> <li>Diploma in Electrical Engineering Technology or B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from an accredited institution.</li>  <li>Registration with professional engineering association.</li>  <li>Canadian Citizen or Canadian Permanent Resident only.</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22424 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the director, drilling engineering you will be part of a team of engineers and technologists responsible for drilling engineering and well design aspects within oil sands mines and thermal areas. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Execute scope of work through high quality planning, detailed technical design, operating practices and cost estimates for vertical, deviated/slant and horizontal wells (core, observation, geotechnical, water source, disposal and SAGD wells)</li><li>Drilling technical focal point for interactions with reservoir, geology, production and rig operations</li><li>Investigate new drilling technologies for project implementation. Execute on new ideas and follow through with documented findings and recommendations</li><li>Provide well control and emergency planning response expertise</li><li>Handles multiple projects in a fast paced environment and be open to constant challenge and change</li><li>Liaise with multiple internal and external stakeholders including asset teams, regulatory, surface land, logistics, completions and operations</li><li>Ensure regulatory requirements and reporting are met</li><li>Provide mentorship and technical support to junior technical staff</li><li>Project management of drilling projects - quality control and track performance of safety, cost, schedule, quality</li><li>Actively review EH&S guidelines and demonstrate a proactive, safety based work ethic</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education <ul> <li>Seven to ten years drilling experience, preferably in oil sands and in situ drilling</li><li>Experience in mentoring junior staff and working in a multi-functional team</li><li>Knowledgeable of regulatory requirements, industry recommended practices, well control procedures and well licensing</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering</li><li>Registered as a P.Eng or eligible for registration immediately with APEGA</li> </ul> <strong>Skills and Knowledge</strong> <ul> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, familiarity with Peloton Wellview, Accumap and SAP is beneficial</li><li>Strong listening skills along with exceptional written and oral communications abilities</li><li>Strong initiative, problem solving and proven project management skills</li><li>Ability to work in multi-functional team environment</li><li>Highly motivated teammate, adapts to change, open to new ideas and responsibilities</li><li>Self-starter with well-developed interpersonal and organizational skills in order to handle numerous projects within a tight timeframe</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position is based in Calgary, Alberta at the Suncor Energy Centre</li><li>On-call duties to support drilling operations</li><li>Regular field visits to provide support and technical assistance</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/>  <div> <strong>Industrial Engineering Analyst</strong><br/><br/><strong>City:</strong> Calgary / <strong>State:</strong> Alberta</div><br/>  <div>At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture engineered steel products for rail, energy and industrial end markets at six production sites located in the USA (Portland, Oregon; Pueblo, Colorado) and Canada (Regina, Saskatchewan; Calgary, Camrose and Red Deer, Alberta). We are the largest North American producer by volume in the rail and large diameter pipe markets, and we hold leading positions in the Western Canada oil country tubular goods, small diameter pipe and West Coast plate markets.<br/><br/><strong>Job Description and Responsibilities</strong><br/><br/>EVRAZ is seeking an Industrial Analyst for our Calgary facility. This new role will analyze production methods and data by studying key inputs and outputs at all stages of EVRAZ’s production model. The successful candidate will be a strong partner to our operations teams and drive strategies that leverage materials and resources to generate the highest productivity and efficiency at the lowest cost of production. This position reports to the Director of Operations.  <ul> <li>Review of material flows, determine potential improvements to reduce pipe handling</li> <li>Determination of optimal plant load balance through analysis of optimal crew levels per line on tons of production</li> <li>Analysis of headcount per line and determines operators availability based on work load</li> <li>Review of cycle times; determine cycle activities subject to improvement and conducts bench marks with similar lines to determine actions to improve cycle times</li> <li>Study of change overs: utilize SMED type methodology to improve change over times</li> <li>Examine material yield losses, determines technological losses vs. scrap losses and completes analysis of potential technological and control improvements to reduce yield losses</li> <li>Conversion cost analysis: break cost down between “price” and “consumption” and help determining actions to reduce “consumption” or alternatives to overall improve cost per ton</li> <li>Determine production capacity of lines (existing and future)</li> <li>Support basic engineering designs of new lines or modifications to existing lines to have optimal performance</li> <li>Assist engineering team to calculate investment benefits (IRR, NPV, etc.)</li> <li>Utilize lean tools to support continues improvement of plant performance</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Industrial or Manufacturing Engineer, Engineering Technologist</li> <li>Self-starter with the ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy and meet deadlines</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Lean tools training</li> <li>Excellent skills in MS Office Excel and Word</li> <li>Proficient with AutoCAD</li> <li>Knowledge of simulation software (i.e. Arena or ProModel) is recommended</li> </ul> <strong>All applicants must be legally able to work in Canada without sponsorship.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>EVRAZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans.</strong> <br/><br/> At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture steel. We also manufacture excellence, drive success and build careers for our employees. Our people come from diverse backgrounds, but share a common set of values and the same goal of creating the best possible solution for our customers. <br/><br/> With more than 4,500 team members in the U.S. and Canada, EVRAZ offers well-paying jobs and a comprehensive range of employee benefits. Our total compensation package includes benefits such as:  <ul> <li>Competitive wages and bonus opportunities</li> <li>Family medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost</li> <li>Short and long term disability programs</li> <li>Competitive retirement plans</li> <li>Paid vacations</li> <li>Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company</li> <li>Tuition reimbursement</li> <li>Wellness program</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Industrial Engineering Analyst

Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Building Electrical Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> <em>CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced<strong> Building Electrical Engineer</strong> from qualified individuals who are interested in becoming a member of our Buildings Engineering group in Edmonton and Calgary, Alberta.</em> <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, employee-owned, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has expanded operations into Western Canada. <br/><br/> CIMA+ is proud to have reached the prestigious Best Employers in Canada’s Platinum Level, which is exclusively reserved for organizations that have achieved the best results in the Aon Hewitt survey for six consecutive years. We offer a highly competitive compensation package with excellent benefits, merit-based bonuses as well as a flexible and friendly working environment where committed individuals can thrive. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong>   <ul>  <li> Lead building electrical engineering services for commercial, institutional, educational, healthcare, government, recreational and light industrial facility projects.</li> <li> Lead a team of electrical engineers and technologists on assigned projects.</li> <li> Assist the Buildings Practice Leader with the growth and development of the electrical team.</li> <li> Be a technical resource in building electrical design, and leverage that knowledge to mentor and develop junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li> Prepare technical specifications and contract documents for bidding and construction.</li> <li> Conduct quality assurance reviews on building electrical design work completed by others.</li> <li> Keep current on new products, technologies and design processes.</li> <li> Coordinate work with architects, other engineering disciplines, and Owner representatives.</li> <li> Contribute to business development, marketing and liaising with Clients and Architects.</li> <li> Assist in determining the scope and fee for proposed engineering services.</li> <li> Lead proposal efforts for building electrical and multi-discipline project pursuits. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></li> <li> Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited post-secondary institution.</li> <li> Professional Engineer registered in Canada, and eligible for professional registration in Alberta.</li> <li> 10+ years of progressive experience in building electrical design.</li> <li> Experience working in a consulting engineering environment.</li> <li> Experience as electrical design lead and able to direct and oversee a team of engineers and technologists on projects.</li> <li> Experience in sizing and specifying of power distribution components and primary/secondary switchgear for medium (under 35 kV) and low (600 V and under) voltage systems.</li> <li> Experience in sizing and specifying grounding systems and lightening protection systems.</li> <li> Experience in critical power systems including generators and UPS, substations, transformers, metering, motor control and motor control centers.</li> <li> Experience in carrying out power system studies including: short circuit, arc flash, load flow, harmonics, and grounding.</li> <li> Experience in hazard classification studies and the design of intrinsically safe electrical systems.</li> <li> Experience in lighting and lighting controls design including a strong understanding of lighting concepts and terms.</li> <li> Experience in low tension system design such as fire alarm, intrusion alarm, telephone, public address, nurse-call systems, data, access control and CCTV.</li> <li> Able to articulate the electrical design requirements and oversee the progression of electrical system layouts in Autodesk® Revit and AutoCAD MEP.</li> <li> Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring staff.</li> <li> In-depth understanding of regulations, codes and standards associated with building electrical design.</li> <li> General understanding of building mechanical and building structural systems.</li> <li> Team player and independent worker.</li> <li> Professional, energetic, organized and action-oriented.</li> <li> Experience in using Microsoft office products including MS Excel and MS Word.</li> <li> Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written.</li> <li> Experience in estimating engineering fees and schedules.</li> <li> Experience in writing engineering reports, proposals, letters and technical specifications.</li> <li> Proven success in developing business with new and existing clients, and maintaining positive relationships.</li> <li> Experience in project management and controls, with a proven record of client satisfaction and financial success.</li> <li> Experience in monitoring and adapting to industry trends and changing market conditions.</li> <li> Able to travel without restrictions.</li> <li> Willingness to engage in lifelong learning. <br/><br/> <strong>The following are considered assets:</strong>   <ul>    <li> LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP), Fellow or Green Associate.</li> <li> Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM).</li> <li> Experience in conducting field reviews and/or building condition assessments.</li> <li> Experience in Life Cycle Costing (LCC).</li> <li> Experience with electrical engineering software packages such as ETAP, AGI 32 or ElumTools.</li> <li> Experience on projects certified to LEED, Living Building Challenge (LBC), Passive House, and/or Green Globes.</li> </ul>  </li>   </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!
Title: Building Electrical Engineer
