Job_Description: <div>Electrical Design / Drafter – All Levels</div>  <p>True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems.</p>  <p>Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone.</p>  <p>Position</p>  <p>We are currently recruiting for an <strong>Electrical Design / Drafter</strong>. This challenging opportunity is to be an integral part of our electrical engineering team. The successful candidate will be responsible for engineering, design, specification and drafting of various electrical projects.</p>  <p>Main Responsibilities</p>  <ul>  <li>Design and checking of single lines, panel / cable schedules, cable tray layout, schematics and wiring diagrams, area classification, grounding, lighting, electrical heat tracing and installation details.</li>  <li>Perform power system studies (short circuit, coordination, motor starting, arc flash and harmonics).</li>  <li>Perform calculations for lighting, voltage drop, grounding and heat tracing.</li>  <li>Produce material take-off and material requisition.</li>  <li>Review vendor drawings and implement the P&ID requirements into electrical design Implement the P&ID requirements into electrical design.</li>  <li>Visit construction / plant sites and fabrication shops during design phase.</li>  <li>Provide construction support and perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for. Electrical systems when required</li>  </ul>  <p>Qualifications</p>  <ul>  <li>Degree or Diploma in Electrical design / drafting.</li>  <li>Strong background in one or more of the following industries: Oil/Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Forestry, Waste Water, Water, Food and Beverage</li>  <li>Strong experience in electrical design drafting with AutoCAD.</li>  <li>Excellent oral, written and interpersonal skills.</li>  <li>Must be self-motivated, results oriented and be flexible to work well under tight schedules in a fast paced multi-disciplinary team environment.</li>  <li>Valid driver's license, passport and ability to travel.</li>  </ul>  <p>Please submit your cover letter and resume with "Electrical Design / Drafter" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com</p>  <p>We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.</p>
Title: Electrical Design / Drafter – All Levels

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/>  <div> <strong>Senior Process Engineer, Metallurgist</strong><br/><br/><strong>City:</strong> Calgary / <strong>State:</strong> Alberta</div><br/>  <div>At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture engineered steel products for rail, energy and industrial end markets at six production sites located in the USA (Portland, Oregon; Pueblo, Colorado) and Canada (Regina, Saskatchewan; Calgary, Camrose and Red Deer, Alberta). We are the largest North American producer by volume in the rail and large diameter pipe markets, and we hold leading positions in the Western Canada oil country tubular goods, small diameter pipe and West Coast plate markets.<br/><br/><strong>Job Description and Responsibilities</strong><br/><br/>EVRAZ is seeking a Senior Process Engineer, Metallurgist for our Calgary facility. The incumbent will provide technical support to the mill operations in areas involving process metallurgy (heat treating, welding, upsetting, steel chemistry development). This person is responsible for identifying opportunities for current process improvement and interfaces with Engineering, QA and operations personnel to define any new metallurgical process that is incorporated into plant operations. During process improvement activities, the Senior Process Engineer is responsible for leading root cause assessment, process mapping, fishboning, trial planning and the development of real-time process control solutions. Written summaries of the key findings and recommendations is also an important aspect of the work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop product capability studies of key metallurgical attributes (pipe mechanical properties, tempering time, ERW welding, etc.) to identify how the metallurgical processes are performing</li> <li>Analyze trending for quality KPI’s such as rejects, rework, downgrades by mill/product, and key process factors, correlate this data to process conditions, publish update reports and provides analysis of the data with necessary action items and works with operations/quality team to improve trends</li> <li>Supports Tubular Products Group product development activities concerning new or upgraded pipe products when required</li> <li>Promote the continual education of our Quality Assurance personnel by providing annual training programs in the areas of heat treating, ERW welding, root cause analysis, statistical analysis of data, etc.</li> <li>Lead brainstorming sessions (A3, and FMEA types) with operations and quality personnel during the initial stages of the process control effort or efforts to improve the process</li> <li>Conduct process optimization trials at EVRAZ tubular mills using statistical methods (Design of Experiments) as necessary</li> <li>If financial investment is required, provide support to the QA/Operations teams to define the potential savings of process improvements</li> <li>Work with the Quality Assurance and Operations teams to ensure that shop floor documents and training identify the features of process control of the primary process parameters</li> <li>At least quarterly, perform process capability studies of the key process parameters communicate the results to mill management and identify areas of improvement</li> <li>Attend six sigma, lean manufacturing and process control equipment conferences to stay abreast of process control techniques/advancements/ in the broader steel manufacturing industry</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Degree in Metallurgical Engineering or Materials Science Engineering</li> <li>5 years’ experience working in a Quality Assurance or Engineering team</li> <li>Familiar with ISO Quality standards and Quality Management Systems including quality control planning for new products</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in applying root cause problem solving methods (Ford 8D, Ishikawa diagrams, Failure Mode Effects Analysis etc.) to manufacturing problems</li> <li>Demonstrated ability with MS Excel or Minitab to analyze numerical data and draw conclusions</li> <li>Excellent presentation skills, experience giving presentations to management regarding project results</li> <li>Experience writing technical reports summarizing key findings and identifying next steps</li> <li>Strong ability to establish effective working relationships at all levels, experience working with interdepartmental teams at all levels of management to accomplish tasks</li> <li>Knowledge of pipe and /or steel mill processes and operations a plus</li> <li>Knowledge of tubular industry standards including API, CSA, and ASTM a plus</li> <li>Six Sigma green belt qualification a plus</li> <li>Proficient in MS Office tools such as MS Word, and PowerPoint</li> </ul> <strong>All applicants must be legally able to work in Canada without sponsorship.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>EVRAZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans.</strong> <br/><br/> At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture steel. We also manufacture excellence, drive success and build careers for our employees. Our people come from diverse backgrounds, but share a common set of values and the same goal of creating the best possible solution for our customers. <br/><br/> With more than 4,500 team members in the U.S. and Canada, EVRAZ offers well-paying jobs and a comprehensive range of employee benefits. Our total compensation package includes benefits such as:  <ul> <li>Competitive wages and bonus opportunities</li> <li>Family medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost</li> <li>Short and long term disability programs</li> <li>Competitive retirement plans</li> <li>Paid vacations</li> <li>Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company</li> <li>Tuition reimbursement</li> <li>Wellness program</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Process Engineer, Metallurgist

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 19401 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, geotechnical engineering, this person is responsible for the geotechnical aspects of waste dumps, reclamation stockpiles, tailing facilities (dykes), and pitwall structures that are associated with both mining and closure landform applications. risk reduction and continuous improvement in tailings facility management and dam safety. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Deliver and manage complex engineering designs for dykes, pitwalls and dumps/stockpiles suitable for submission to government for approval</li><li>Work at various levels of projects from conceptual to detailed design as required for the stage of the project: design, construction, operations, closure and de-licensing</li><li>Liase with stakeholders including planners, regulatory, projects, operations (mining and tailings), and construction groups to deliver safe, robust and reliable engineering designs. </li><li>Be part of a team to deliver the project for Suncor’s best interests and problem solve issues that arise in the field</li><li>Complete projects as a delivery of IFC to stakeholders</li><li>Manage technical issues and ensure geotechnical integrity through all of the life cycle stages of structures, design, construction, operations, closure, de-licensing</li><li>Work on technical projects such as weak pre-sheared soils, liquefiable material, fine tailings all within an operating environment.</li><li>Present projects to external review boards for risk identification</li><li>Work within the geotechnical group to continually improve our standards, procedures and dam safety programs</li><li>Mentor junior and intermediate staff in all aspects of geotechnical engineering, communication and project management as it applies</li><li>Contribute to technical advancement of staff in other groups</li><li>Work with external technical groups for the advancement of geotechnical and tailings engineering</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years relevant engineering experience in large civil earthworks projects, which include, design, construction and operations</li><li>Experience in the oil and gas or mining environment is strongly preferred</li><li>Engineering degree in Civil/Geological/Mining engineering, Master’s degree in Geotechnical Engineering considered an asset</li><li>Presently registered driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge<ul> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, AutoCAD and geotechnical modelling software (Geostudio, FLAC, etc.)</li><li>Effective communicator that is capable of understanding, anticipating and responding to the ongoing needs of mining, tailings and reclamation engineering and operations groups. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Job_Description: Join Schneider Electric and power your career! <br/><br/> Discover the opportunity to join an international, dynamic, and responsible company that fosters the development of all its people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice. <br/><br/> Schneider Electric is looking for a Senior Quotation Specialist/Engineer to work on large commercial bids. This role can be done from Calgary or Mississauga. <br/><br/> Job Description: <br/><br/> - Review RFQ’s for clarity of request, suitability for Schneider Electric product offering, risk assessment, profitability, and time given to complete. <br/><br/> -Based on the above criteria, along with Quotation team’s loading, and with input from the sales team, to decide to bid (or not). <br/><br/> - Reviews customer specifications/drawings to ensure quote is technically compatible and competitive. <br/><br/> - Understands, analyzes, documents, and communicates contractual and technical terms and conditions relative to the company standard. <br/><br/> - Serves as peer expert for proposal questions including complex technical issues and quote strategies. <br/><br/> - Structure and assemble the proposal/bid documents in collaboration with the concerned stakeholders and subject matter experts. <br/><br/> - Plan and monitor the deadlines to ensure timely and accurate approvals, proposal development and submission <br/><br/> - Review bid and incorporate appropriate ‘clarifications and expectations’ in the proposal <br/><br/> - To work with the sales team members to determine specific closing strategies for each bid. <br/><br/> - To work with the Quotation/Bids Specialists or Supervisors, to determine weekly capacity and capabilities. <br/><br/> - To liaise with the Consultant Sales Representative(s) for; 1) Specification clarification requests generated by Quotations/Bids Specialists; 2) To identify specifications that are not favorable for Schneider Electric. <br/><br/> - Work with our Partners to coordinate our strategies, and leverage our strengths. <br/><br/> - Ensure all bids, are entered into BFO, by the Quotation specialists <br/><br/> - Ensure all information that assists tracking is entered into BFO, (Value Chain Players & CRM). <br/><br/> - Set and manage the agenda for quotes meetings, focusing on upcoming bid closings, following up closed bids, and any issues which are relevant to the sales cycle. <br/><br/> - Other duties as required <br/><br/> Job Requirements: <br/><br/> - Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering (Preferred) or relevant experience. <br/><br/> - Proven bid management experience (6-10 years) in the Electrical Industry. <br/><br/> - A track record in planning and delivering large project bids involving electrical distribution equipment and/or industrial automation systems will be given preference. <br/><br/> - Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to meet tight deadlines <br/><br/> - Detailed oriented and strong proof reading and communication skills both written and verbal <br/><br/> - Computer skills: MS Office (Excel, Word, Power Point) / MS Projects. <br/><br/> - Ability to travel (10"). <br/><br/> Care. Connect. Challenge. Commit. <br/><br/> Our values define our company. Who we are, our customer approach, how we do business, what it’s like to work here, and the kind of people we want to attract and retain. We care for our planet, our customers, our company, our team, and ourselves. We connect to customers and colleagues; we are open and respectful. We challenge others and embrace challenges ourselves. We commit to change by leading the change.
Title: Quotation Engineer - Senior

Job_Description: <p><b> </b></p><p> </p><p>Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year , we who provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients.</p><p> </p><p><b>Position Summary </b></p><p>Senior level position that works independently performing routine aspects of design and checking. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work performed with minimal supervision and has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.</p><p><b> </b></p><ul><li>Perform layout studies and assist Lead Electrical Designer in developing scope of work for design/drafting activities</li><li>Coordinate design interface activities with other disciplines for assigned area</li><li>Supervise electrical designers and drafters assigned for their area</li><li>Ensure consistency and integrity of electrical design throughout Area/Project and review design for logic, functionality and completeness</li><li>Design and checking of all power, grounding, lighting and electric heat tracing layouts and associated single lines, schedules, schematics and wiring diagrams without supervision</li><li>Check electrical 3D model on the PDS, Smart Plant and /or Auto-plant platform</li><li>Review vendor drawings for electrical details and interface data for complex equipment. Perform workshare activities as assigned by the Electrical Squad Leader</li><li>Perform material take-off for electrical commodity material. Inquire, evaluate, and prepare purchase requisition of electrical commodity material. Prepare cost estimate</li><li>Check electrical engineering work package</li><li>Provide construction support at job site and perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for electrical systems</li></ul> <ul><li>Diploma in Electrical Engineering Technology from a recognized technical institute required</li><li>Minimum of 12 years' experience is required in the and design of plant systems with EPC consulting firms required</li><li>Understanding of CEC/NEC codes and experience with ETAP or SKM software is required</li><li>Detailed knowledge and experience with the Canadian Electrical Code is required</li><li>Membership with ASET or eligible to get membership in ASET required</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills required</li><li>Field experience in construction and pre-commissioning support preferred</li><li>Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred</li></ul><p> </p><p>At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.</p>
Title: Sr. Electrical Design Squad Lead

Job_Description: <P>NOV is hiring for an Electrical Designer Drafter job in Calgary, AB who will be responsible for the production and maintenance of electrical drawing packages for mobile oil & gas equipment. Requires strong fundamental knowledge of electrical drafting tools and techniques, instrumentation, and circuit design.</P> <P></P> <P><STRONG>Essential Functions</STRONG></P> <P>• Generation and review of schematic drawing, layout drawings, input/output lists, cable lists, power budget and bills of material.</P> <P>• Designing equipment and specifications for major components and equipment.</P> <P>• Maintain electrical drawing inventory with appropriate revision control for all applicable projects.</P> <P>• Follow schematic document control procedures.</P> <P>• Provide strong internal communication among departments to ensure equipment standardization, project coordination and product information.</P> <P>• Monitor production of equipment to ensure design intent is met and offer feedback on improving designs.</P> <P>• Development of systems, procedures, and tools to assist in the development of electrical drawing and documentation packages.</P> <P>• Work efficiently, safely, and follow all National Oil Varco Safety Policies and Procedures.</P> <P>• Maintain all company information as confidential.</P> <P><STRONG>Education and Experience</STRONG><BR>• Completion of an Electrical Engineering Technology program such as: Automated Systems Engineering Technology or Instrumentation Engineering Technology.<BR>• Knowledge and experience in AutoCAD Electrical and MS Office would be an asset.<BR>• Knowledge and experience in TeamCenter PLM would be an asset.<BR>• Comfortable working with and around heavy industrial equipment. </P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Personal Attributes</STRONG><BR>• Efficiently organize and plan work tasks to meet company goals.<BR>• Able to work on multiple projects in a dynamic manufacturing environment.<BR>• Able to work independently and in team environments.</P> <P> </P> <P><EM>With over 40 different locations in Canada, and 30,000 people worldwide, NOV is proud to offer their employees competitive pay and excellent benefits, including a company matching contribution RRSP, Health Spending account, and employer paid premiums. We are also proud to provide on the job training, with potential for advancement within our organization, and an Educational Assistance Program.</EM></P> <P> </P> <P>To view all open positions please visit: http://www.nov.com/careers/</P>
Title: Electrical Designer / Drafter

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22423 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Are you knowledgeable in the area of steam assisted gravity drainage (SAGD) and are you interested in working with our completions team to lead projects at our Firebag operating area in the Fort McMurray region? In this role, you will be responsible for stewarding the completions engineering activities, including: budget and program preparation, contractor and project team interfaces, office oversight of field execution, cost performance tracking, key performance indicator tracking and technology development. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Lead completions, workovers, and regulatory work (testing, suspension and abandonment) on SAGD horizontal wells and utility wells (observation, water disposal, water source and test wells)</li><li>Lead the Firebag operating expense budget which involves development, stewardship, tracking and reporting</li><li>Provide technical and advisory support for internal client groups and work with them to understand and define the scope of work</li><li>Select vendors for materials and services</li><li>Participate in industry gatherings, mentor other specialists, and participate in completions-related initiatives within in situ</li><li>Understand the financial processes and support the supply chain and project controls requirements to best manage the financial aspect of completions related projects</li><li>Take pride in supporting our environment, health, and safety (EH&S) program and operational excellence management system (OEMS) development</li><li>Responsible for proper engineering procedures relating to service rig operations, electric wireline logging, downhole instrumentation deployment, wellhead valve replacement, and well stimulation applications</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education <ul> <li>At least four years of downhole petroleum engineering experience, including three years of completions engineering expertise (including pump replacements, existing well workovers, well stimulations, and downhole instrumentation installations)</li><li>Horizontal and slant well experience is an asset</li><li>Bachelor's degree in engineering</li><li>APEGA /P. Eng. in good standing</li> </ul> <strong>Skills and Knowledge</strong> <ul> <li>Well versed in SAGD well design and operations with experience managing operating expense budgets</li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; familiarity with Peleton WellView, IHS Accumap and SAP are beneficial</li><li>You want to learn new things and seek greater knowledge about the design and procedures in order to understand not just what you do but why you do it</li><li>Clear and concise oral and written communication skills; good presentation skills; well organized; positive influence; collaborative; accountable</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>The position is based in Calgary, Alberta at the Suncor Energy Centre</li><li>Regular field visits to become familiar with Suncor in situ operations</li><li>On-call duties to support completions operations during the execution of projects</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering
Title: Completions Engineer

Job_Description: Here’s what you need to know about our <strong>Product</strong> team: The BlueCat Product team prides ourselves on our diversity and innovation at our core. Delivery of a quality and cutting edge product is our priority. Most importantly, we always have fun while doing it. We run an Agile shop across all three of our products and rely on product demos and daily standups to keep each other in the loop on all of the amazing things that are happening at BlueCat while keeping each other transparent and challenged. <br/><br/> BlueCat is looking for a Director, Software Development to work in our Toronto Head Quarters. <br/><br/> The Director role will be responsible for multiple agile teams that are building massively scalable SaaS products in the networking and network security space. You’ll be directly responsible for managers and team leads who will benefit from your experience with AWS based SaaS application development. We have a large and growing group of talented engineers leveraging AWS, Docker and microservices architectures. You’ll work closely with a variety of dynamic teams, including Product Management, Architecture, Operations and Customer Care, understanding what it takes lead great teams that build great software. You are expected to guide, mentor and get the best out of everyone while having fun. <br/><br/> The most important aspect of this team is that we’re never satisfied with status quo. We continually learn, adapt and extend. BlueCat is an agile shop, so we expect you to Get Sh!t Done by experimenting, failing, learning and most importantly, pushing forward. <br/><br/> BlueCat is a highly collaborative place to work. We prefer walking up to someone’s desk over sending an email. We support, thank and congratulate each other. <br/><br/> <strong>This job might be for you if you:</strong> <ul> <li>Have spent the last decade successfully building, deploying and managing massively large scale distributed internet systems and products</li><li>Have spent the past 5 years managing multiple agile teams</li><li>Have actually used AWS as part of a solution in production and are cozy with continuous delivery and continuous deployment topics</li><li>Are extremely comfortable when navigating the world of open source tools and frameworks</li><li>Are comfortable communicating with people at all levels, both written and verbal</li> </ul> <strong>You’re practically a shoe in if you:</strong> <ul> <li>Are motivated by helping your teams grow as much as by working on cool technology</li><li>Have experimented with data analytics and machine learning</li> </ul> <strong>BlueCat’s core values are:</strong> <ul> <li>Curiosity - We care and inquire about the challenges and needs of our customers.</li><li>Clarity - We keep communication crisp, clear, and responsive.</li><li>Collaboration - We win with each other, never alone.</li><li>Transparency - We ensure all relevant information is available – no questions are off limits.</li><li>Ownership - We are responsible and accountable for getting things done.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ll get from us:</strong> <br/><br/> Fast growth for BlueCat means fast growth for you! With the world’s biggest and hottest logos as our clients, we are a well-established business that still operates with the fun culture of a start-up. We get to work hard and still have all the fun without all of the risk! Experienced leaders make sure we keep going to the moon and beyond. <br/><br/> While we’re growing together, we’ll have your back with solid compensation/bonuses, education budgets, record breaking sales quarters, and a company culture that values curiosity, clarity, collaboration, transparency and ownership. <br/><br/> If you’re as excited about the future of our company as we are, we would love to hear from you! <br/><br/> Accommodations will be provided throughout the recruitment, hiring and employment process in accordance with the AODA and the Ontario Human Rights Code.
Title: Director, Software Engineering

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/>   <div> <div><strong>04/10/2018</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>001624</strong> </div> <br/><strong>Pomerleau</strong> is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder. <br/><br/> Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :</strong> <br/><br/> Under the supervision of the Project Director, the Mechanical and Electrical Coordinator works in collaboration with the Project Manager and the Superintendent. They will be in charge of managing and coordinating all the work involving the various mechanical and electrical specialties (ME).   <ul> <li>Verify correspondence between engineering and execution plans;</li> <li>Coordinate subcontractor work and that of the various mechanical and electrical (ME) trades.</li> <li>Solve on-site technical problems;</li> <li>Make sure work is in line with plans and specs as well as with quality plan;</li> <li>Establish start-up schedules for the mechanical and electrical (ME) teams and update it according to project completion;</li> <li>Supervise and coordinate tests and start-ups of mechanical and electrical systems;</li> <li>Prepare training calendar for users/owners;</li> <li>Provide support to the estimation department and supply technical expertise for the mechanical and electrical fields. <br/><br/> <strong>DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :</strong> <br/><br/> • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or in Electrical Engineering and/or equivalent experience combined with relevant technical educational background;</li> <li>5 to 8 years’ experience in coordinating mechanical and electrical work in the construction industry;</li> <li>Excellent analytical and communication skills, and ability to exercise leadership;</li> <li>Experience working on large commercial projects is an asset.</li> <li>This position will be based on a Fort McMurray site on a rotation basis from the Calgary office. <br/><br/> <strong>WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :</strong></li>  </ul>    <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>4 weeks’ vacation</li> <li>Group insurance (health spending account)</li> <li>Group RRSP</li> <li>Monthly public transit pass paid by employer</li> <li>Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Ongoing training offered throughout the year</li> <li>Young, dynamic environment</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities</li> <li>Summer hours</li> </ul> <strong>PARTICULARITY:</strong>  <ul> <li>The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check</li> </ul> At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for? Apply now to be part of our team. <br/><br/> Only retained candidates will be contacted. We may consider your CV for other positions. <br/><br/> Pomerleau is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive working environment where all employees are treated fairly.</div>  <br/>
Title: Mechanical & Electrical Coordinator

Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon's Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team has a focus on automating the smooth operation of Replicon's Cloud Platform. We strive to accomplish projects such as fully automating a continuous delivery process, building highly resilient infrastructure components, and introducing & practicing Chaos Engineering.</div><br/>  <div>Junior SRE team members are software developers who love automating work, rather than doing tedious work themselves. They're deeply interested in the infrastructure upon which a complex system runs, rather than just building software features. They are expected to learn quickly, bring new ideas and concepts into the team, and always look for a solution rather than focusing on a problem. They are heavily supported by our amazing senior team members.</div><br/>  <div><strong>What responsibilities does the SRE team have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>Implement new infrastructure systems to provide new operational and business capabilities supporting our platform and product</li> <li>Remove impediments in the engineering processes to support high frequency, low risk software deployments</li> <li>Promotes an environment of continuous improvement throughout the engineering organization</li> <li>Ensures that production and pre-production systems are strongly secured</li> <li>Optimizes the costs of running our cloud platform on AWS</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What does your day-to-day work in this role look like?</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>Work in a small scrum team of about six colleagues to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Understand high-level requirements for new systems and capabilities</li> <li>Break down work into manageable tasks, using a combination of technical design documentation and Jira for task tracking</li> <li>Implement new systems, which is primarily a mix of node.js coding, Terraform infrastructure-as-code, bash or PowerShell scripting, and occasionally some C#</li> <li>Give and receive code reviews, working with colleagues to ensure the highest quality work is accomplished</li> </ul>  <div><strong>In addition to this routine work, you'll often have to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Participate in retrospectives and post-incident reviews to figure out how the team, department, and organization can improve</li> <li>Provide support, incident resolution, and code reviews for other teams</li> <li>Perform on-call drills and training exercises to sharpen skills in incident management and resolution</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What qualifications should you have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>You are eager to learn new technologies and systems, and can grasp new concepts very quickly</li> <li>You are able to mentally leap between different technology platforms and environments smoothly</li> <li>You have worked hands-on performing software development on a web application; preference to experience with node.js or C# platforms</li> <li>You are familiar with systems design and architecture in a large-scale web application (multi-tier, microservices, load balancing)</li> <li>You have knowledge or experience working with cloud platforms (preference: AWS)</li> <li>You're always uncomfortable when working in a project without a version control system in-place (preference: git)</li> <li>You've worked with database systems (preference: PostgreSQL)</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Site Reliability Engineering - Junior

Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon's Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team has a focus on automating the smooth operation of Replicon's Cloud Platform. We strive to accomplish projects such as fully automating a continuous delivery process, building highly resilient infrastructure components, and introducing & practicing Chaos Engineering.</div><br/>  <div>Senior Security Engineers are dedicated every day to making the Replicon Cloud Platform a digital "Fort Knox", in an automated, agile, fast-paced, continuous delivery world. They are able to identify areas where system security can be improved, prioritize those improvements, identify and remove bottlenecks to better security, and drive our security implementation forward. Senior Security Engineers evangelize the DevSecOps mindset in Replicon; the entire engineering organization is responsible for making a secure system, and Senior Security Engineers are responsible for enabling and empowering those teams. They are expected to constantly be learning and applying industry best-practices in system and product security.</div>  <br/><strong><div>Responsibilities include:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Proactively find and remediate security risks in the entire organization, from the internal IT systems to the customer-facing web applications</li> <li>Take a leadership role to enact change; don't accept the way things are done today, we can always do better</li> <li>Design, deploy, monitor and action the findings of automated systems for security enhancement in a globally distributed enterprise web application</li> <li>Collaborate with the operations compliance team to meet and exceed the strictest compliance requirements for cloud system security</li> <li>Enable the product and infrastructure engineering teams to build our world-class cloud platform, while protecting internal and customer data</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Understands the principles of network, IT system, and web application security</li> <li>Deep understanding of networking & web technologies (TCP/IP, firewalls, HTTP, DNS, TLS/SSL, web services)</li> <li>Extensive experience with a Cloud-based infrastructure; strong preference for AWS</li> <li>Experience working with DevOps automation tools (eg. Docker, Terraform)</li> <li>Polyglot software development capabilities, for building and integrating new security systems, and for understanding working systems in a microservice architecture</li> <li>Working knowledge of applied cryptographic systems; TLS, encryption-at-rest, key management</li> <li>Familiar with Enterprise-level security protocols and methods such as web application firewalls, SSO & SAML, multi-factor authentication, federated identity</li> <li>Working experience with automated security tooling, such as vulnerability scanning, intrusion detection and prevention</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Security Engineer

Job_Description: Category : Engineering <br/> Location/City : AB - <br/>  <br/> Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canada's top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client, is a leading Engineering, Procurement, Construction Company with expertise in oil sands, refining, petrochemicals and pipeline segments and covers both operational and engineering aspectsCurrently we are recruiting for Regina Based;INTERMEDIATE ELECTRICAL DESIGNERYou are a motivated self-starter and team contributor with at least five years progressive Electrical Design experience, within an EPC environment [Industrial / Oilsands]. You also bring the following skills and experience to the team:COMPETENCIES	This position will be based in Regina, Saskatchewan. This position reports to the Electrical Department Head located in Edmonton while also reporting to site team leader for day-to-day assignments.	Electrical Designer (Site based)	5 to 10 years relevant industry experience (refinery, oil and gas). Brown field design experience is an asset.	Experience with Electric Heat Tracing (able to use both Thermon and Pentair software)	Design new and revise of existing drawings, i.e. EHT isometrics, EHT control set point sheets, cable schedules, panel schedules, power layouts, bill of materials, and relevant drawings as applicable.	Able to work independently from design conception to start-up as most work are small maintenance projects.	Knowledge and proficiency reading and preparing electrical deliverables (single line diagrams, electrical layouts, schematics and wiring diagrams, electrical heat tracing isometrics, panel schedules, cable schedules, etc.) for new and upgraded installations.	Prepare, verify and implement electrical design calculations such as voltage drop, cable sizing, cable tray loading, conduit fill, electrical heat tracing, etc.	Codes and Standards: Knowledge and proficiency with the Canadian Electrical Code and proficiency in using its rules and tables is a must. C. Tech, C.E.T. in Electrical Engineering Technology;	Foreign trained engineers pursuing their Canadian P.Eng.;	Previous EPC experience required;	Motivated, self-starter with ability to work under minimal supervision. Title: Field Electrical Designers

Job_Description: JOB DESCRIPTION<br/><br/><strong>Field Engineer</strong> <br/> Due to continued growth, our client is in the process of expanding their operations into the Calgary area and are in need of a Field Engineer to operate as a Field Test Coordinator in order to expand into the Alberta Market. <br/><br/> <strong>The Company:</strong> <br/> Our client is has spent years developing new imaging technology that is capable of detecting and identifying a wide variety of downhole problems. Which in turn reduces cost, increases efficiency and fixes problems. <br/><br/> <strong>The Position</strong> <br/> We're looking for an established Wireline Field Engineer <br/> The role offers:  <ul> <li>Attractive Compensation</li> <li>Additional Day Rate</li> </ul> Requirements:  <ul> <li>5-10 yrs experience.</li> <li>Extensive Wireline knowledge and experience</li> <li>Mechanical or Electrical Degree</li> <li>QHSE Knowledge</li> <li>IT/IS skills</li> </ul> Nice to Have:  <ul> <li>Background in New Technology</li> </ul> <strong>Location</strong> <br/> <strong>Calgary, AB <br/><br/> About Petroplan:</strong> <br/><br/> Petroplan is a global organisation which specialises in connecting skilled professionals with exceptional contract and permanent career opportunities throughout the oil, gas and energy industry. This has been our focus since Petroplan was formed in 1976. <br/><br/> Our company aim isn't to be the largest industry recruitment specialist but rather the best. As such, our recruitment services, contractor management and specialised support is tailored to meet the individual needs of candidates, contractors and clients. Petroplan's local offices across Europe, the Middle East, North America, Asia-Pacific, Africa and Australasia support projects throughout forty countries. Our client portfolio includes multi-national companies, together with niche organisations focusing on a specialist discipline or location. <br/><br/> For more information please feel free to visit our website http://petroplan.com <br/><br/> Ref No: BBBH30680<br/> <div> APPLY</div>  <br/>
Title: Field Engineer

Job_Description: <P><STRONG>About Us</STRONG></P>At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That’s why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. <BR><BR>Watch our <STRONG>'About Us'</STRONG> video<BR><BR>We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. <BR><BR> <P><STRONG>Primary Responsibilities</STRONG></P> <P><STRONG></STRONG> </P> <DIV>HDR is currently seeking a highly motivated <B>Civil Rail Track Designer</B> to join our dynamic Rail Infrastructure Team located in our Calgary, AB office.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Key Responsibilities</B></DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <UL> <LI>Reporting to the Canada Rail Lead, provide engineering, technical, and design support to the Rail Group</LI> <LI>Designing track and railway infrastructures in accordance with the quality objectives and regulations, laws and standards (ex. Metrolinx, CN, CP and AREMA);</LI> <LI>Provide technical support during the construction of structures and coordinate the work supervision</LI> <LI>Design of track alignments and special track work</LI> <LI>Design of grading and drainage</LI> <LI>Design of utility protection and relocation</LI> <LI>Design of roads and parking lots</LI> <LI>Construction staging design</LI> <LI>Undertake concept, preliminary, and detailed designs</LI> <LI>Support studies and environmental assessments</LI> <LI>Prepare drawings</LI> <LI>Prepare quantity take-offs</LI> <LI>Prepare designs and drawings using CADD</LI> <LI>Evaluate technical alternatives, resolve technical issues and interface with other disciplines</LI> <LI>Participate in the planning stages, design and construction of the project</LI> <LI>Prepare reports on the execution of the work and follow the schedule</LI> <LI>Participate in the activities of cost estimates and recommend payments</LI> <LI>Ensuring compliance with laws and regulations in health and safety on construction sites</LI> <LI>Perform detailed technical analysis, interpret data, make summaries and draft reports</LI> <LI>Visit construction sites to ensure the quality of the work and to carry out inspections</LI></UL> <P>#LI-MP2</P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must</DIV></LI> <LI>A diploma in Civil Engineering Technology or Degree in Civil Engineering</LI> <LI>Eligibility to obtain P.ENG license an asset</LI> <LI>Must have a minimum of five (5) to ten (10) years of professional experience in design or construction of railway infrastructure is a must</LI> <LI>Solid experience utilizing CADD is a must;</LI> <LI>Proficient with AutoCAD, Civil 3D and/or Microstation and Bentley InRoads</LI> <LI>Experience in Transit or Rail design (freight, LRT, subway, passenger rail, or streetcar)</LI> <LI>Experience designing track or civil infrastructure</LI> <LI>Technical experience in the planning and design of urban infrastructure</LI> <LI>Experience with CN, CP, VIA, TTC, Metrolinx or similar</LI> <LI>Working knowledge of Transport Canada Guidelines and Canadian Railway Operating Rules</LI> <LI>Professional and experienced in relations with customers</LI> <LI>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal are essential</LI> <LI>Ability to work with minimal supervision</LI> <LI>Ability to maintain good working relationships with the various parties involved in the process</LI> <LI>Time management skills and ability to adapt to change</LI> <LI>Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills</LI> <LI>Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills in complex and changing environments</LI></UL> <P>  <P>  <P><STRONG>Why HDR</STRONG></P>At HDR, we know work isn’t only about who you work for; it’s also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other’s contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.
Title: Rail Engineer

Job_Description: Description<br/><br/>The Alberta Electric System Operator is responsible for the safe, reliable, and economic planning and operation of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System. We provide open and non-discriminatory access to Alberta’s interconnected power grid and also facilitate Alberta’s competitive wholesale electricity market which, in 2017, had 291 participants and approximately $3 Billion in annual energy transactions. <br/><br/> • Work collaboratively across disciplines of the AESO in creating high quality load and generation study conditions for power system studies; <br/><br/> • Core member of the AESO modelling team responsible in developing on-going workflow in power system modelling process using cloud collaborative tools; <br/><br/> • Collaborate with interjurisdictional entities in the development of common base cases and study conditions; <br/><br/> • Provide training for EITs on power system modelling; <br/><br/> • Develop novel tools to support internal and external study teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Accountabilities:</strong> <br/><br/> • Interfacing with study engineers and forecasting teams in preparing and reviewing load and generation study conditions <br/><br/> • Provide support for study engineers to resolve data questions and issues; <br/><br/> • Prepare WECC data submission in compliance to applicable Alberta Reliability Standards in coordination to AESO’s internal compliance program; <br/><br/> • Development of collaborative tools for maintenance of power system modelling; <br/><br/> • Active participate in interjurisdictional entities (e.g. WECC) in both provision of data and exchange of latest industry learning and practice; <br/><br/> • Provide training for EITS and other AESO staff on power system modelling and the use of modelling and operational data. <br/><br/> <strong>Education / Degree / Certification:</strong> <br/><br/> BSc Electrical Engineering at minimum, graduate degree an asset <br/><br/> Registered with APEGA as a Professional Engineer or eligibility to register <br/><br/> <strong>Job Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> • Minimum 4 years of experience in transmission modelling, planning or operations; <br/><br/> • Knowledge of power system planning and operation; <br/><br/> • Knowledge of dynamic models for system components; <br/><br/> • Proven capability to perform power system analysis including, but not limited to power flow, voltage stability and dynamics; <br/><br/> • An experienced collaborator, problem solver and decision maker; <br/><br/> • Strong automation tools and programming skills; <br/><br/> • Strong computer skills and knowledge cloud collaborative tools. <br/><br/> Applications accepted via our careers site until May 27, 2018 <br/><br/> The Alberta Electric System Operator, and its members, officers, employees and agents (collectively, the "AESO") is committed to protecting personal information provided to it. By submitting your personal information to the AESO for the purpose of pursuing employment with the AESO, you hereby consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information by the AESO, in accordance with the provisions of the <em>Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act of Alberta</em>, as amended from time to time.
Title: Modelling Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Area</strong>: Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments <br/> <strong>Duration</strong>: 2 years <br/> <strong>Start</strong> <strong>Date</strong>: As soon as possible, until the position is filled <br/> <strong>Annual</strong> <strong>Stipend</strong>: $45,000 CAD/year <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering</strong> in the <strong>Schulich School of Engineering</strong> at the University of Calgary is accepting applications for a Postdoctoral Fellow in “Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments”<strong>.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Focusing on Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, the R&D project is to address the challenges of accurately communicating/displaying multi-dimensional information to human users in the most efficient and effective manner. Based on a Virtual-Reality (VR) platform of interactive and visual analytics, a key aspect of the project is accommodating human cognitive constraints to achieve new insights about highly complex multisensory data and to handle ill-defined and unstructured phenomena. <br/><br/> The project is funded by the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC) of Canada. The working environment includes the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary. The Postdoctoral Fellow will have opportunities to engage in research collaborating closely with researchers/engineers/scientists from national and international research institutes and industry. The position offers a unique multidisciplinary opportunity to be part of cutting edge R&D on VR applications. <br/><br/> R&D Objectives: The research of the Postdoctoral Fellow will focus on the following objectives: <ul> 	<li>Neural mechanisms of multi-sensory integration for facilitating interactive and visual analytics of complex data;</li>	<li>Algorithms of the multi-sensory integration based upon the neural mechanisms;</li> 	<li>Evaluation of the prototype of VR systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> 	<li>PhD in the computer science, engineering, or other related fields: The applicant must have completed (or be within three months of completing) their degree. Applicants who hold the degree must have obtained it within the last five years or have been actively working in a related field.</li>	<li>Brain-Machine Interfaces (BMI) and neurosciences: Sound experience in BMI and good knowledge of neurosciences are essential. Familiarization with EEG devices, eye trackers and associated data processing are very desirable. Preference will be given to applicants with demonstrated BMI research activities.</li> 	<li>Software development: Solid and demonstrated software development experience is essential. Working knowledge of Machine Learning would be desirable.</li> 	<li>Usability Engineering: Knowledge of testing and evaluating the usability of software/hardware systems is desirable. Knowledge and experience of VR technologies would be an asset.</li> 	<li>Communication: The applicant must possess excellent English written and verbal communication. The role will involve a significant amount of communication between varying levels of personnel in academia and industries. The applicant must be capable of communicating potential complex concepts in terms understandable by the various groups involved.</li>	<li>Working Style: The applicant must be capable of working in a self-directed/motivated manner and within a team environment.</li> </ul> <strong>Application details:</strong> <br/><br/> Send (via email) a letter of interest, a CV, and samples of publications to: <br/><br/> Prof. Yaoping Hu <br/> Email: huy@ucalgary.ca <br/> Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering <br/> Schulich School of Engineering <br/> University of Calgary <br/> 2500 University Drive, NW <br/> Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2N 1N4 <br/><br/> <strong>Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about postdoctoral scholar opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Postdoc Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Schulich School of Engineering visit <strong>Careers in the Schulich School of Engineering</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> To succeed as one of Canada’s top universities, where new ideas are created, tested and applied through first-class teaching and research, the University of Calgary needs more of the best minds in our classrooms and labs. We’re increasing our scholarly capacity by investing in people who want to change the world, bringing the best and brightest to Calgary to form a global intellectual hub and achieve advances that matter to everyone. <br/><br/> <strong>About Calgary, Alberta</strong> <br/><br/> Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders – in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from the strongest economy in the nation and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour’s drive from the Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>
Title: Post Doctoral Fellowship, Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering

Title: Engineer, SMES

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> The EvO program is developing the next generation of military communications networking solutions for the United Kingdom Ministry of Defense. The program spans five international sites in Canada and the UK where four major teams execute System Design, Application Development, Software Frameworks, and Hardware/Firmware product design. The Beech Agile Release Train executes on the latter, including six major hardware product designs that are designed in Calgary, manufactured in Hastings, with automated test development in Ottawa. The positions offered in Calgary will touch on all aspects of integration from board support drivers, hardware test and debug, environmental test and root cause analysis, firmware development, and product integration/test/qualification. <br/><br/> The System Integration Co-op reports on a day-to-day basis to the assigned Manager(s) to support related Engineering and System Integration/Test teams. These teams are responsible for delivery of robust and reliable Engineering Solutions that meet the high quality standards demanded by Tactical Environments. <ul> <li>Working under the guidance of senior engineering designers and integrators, setup of physical lab environments to facilitate integration, test, automation, trouble shooting and debug activities.</li><li>Following detailed test plans to verify system behaviour and recording results in the form of written Test Reports and Release Documentation.</li><li>Characterization of unexpected system behavior to assist in debug activities and recording of results in Bug Reports.</li><li>Understanding the behavior and execution of complex systems to assist in troubleshooting, problem solving and bug fixing.</li><li>Extensive interaction with senior System Engineers, System Integrators and Developers.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills are essential.</li><li>Fundamental knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systems is essential. Advanced knowledge of either would be an asset.</li><li>Familiarity with firmware/software programming and scripting is an asset.</li><li>Advanced IP Networking skills related to routing protocols, name distribution, device discovery, system synchronization, wireless networks, mobile ad-hoc networks or tactical environments would be an asset.</li><li>This position requires communication between System, System Integration, Hardware and Software Engineering staff members and it is essential that the successful candidate demonstrate the following aptitudes:</li>  <ul> <li>Organized: Ability to multi-task by planning and prioritizing tasks. Flexible to changing priorities.</li><li>Communications: Deliver clear, concise and professional communications in both spoken and written forms.</li><li>Teamwork: Work cooperatively with various disciplines to accomplish work objectives.</li><li>Initiative: Work independently and proactively to complete tasks appropriately and on time, and seek guidance in situations of uncertainty or urgency.</li><li>Problem solving: Effectively assess problems and determine workable solutions.</li></ul> </ul> <strong>Education</strong> <br/><br/> Currently pursuing a Bachelor degree or Technical Diploma related to Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, System Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Systems Testing or Quality Engineering. <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Engineering Coop - Fall Term -12 Month

Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company in Calgary, AB is currently recruiting 5 Project Engineers for a 5 month contract. The shift will be Monday-Friday, 8 hrs/day. The embedded contractors will support upcoming expense/capital jobs as part of PES Staffing plan (e.g.hydrogen, Plant pressure relief, and other OpEx work.) An embedded contractor would be expected to act on the company’s behalf Engineering overseeing engineering deliverables created at engineering contractor offices. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Management of quality of engineering deliverable</li> <li>Management of change (MOC) for scope, cost, schedule and quality</li> <li>Support design basis development</li> <li>Stakeholder alignment and interface management</li> <li>Cost and schedule estimate support</li> <li>Develop engineering surveillance plan and liaison with SCL technical resources to ensure quality engineering deliverables from engineering contractor</li> <li>Support “cradle to grave” project engineering philosophy (PE may be required to travel to Ft Mac 3-5 days a week to provide field engineering support during construction)</li> </ul> <strong> Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>P.Eng registration in Alberta</li> <li>Minimum 5 years project engineering / operations technical support experience in the oil & gas industry (owner/operating experience preferred)</li> <li>Excellent communication skills</li> <li>Successfully pass a criminal background check</li> <li>This position is classified as safety sensitive, therefore you must also be able to pass a drug & alcohol test</li> <li>Possession of or eligible to obtain a passport</li> <li>Valid OSSA BSO or OSSA Orientation and CSTS</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>

We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Development Services Software Developer in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. <br/><br/> The Development Services System Team, working in a scaled agile framework, is responsible for developing and implementing the strategy for a continuous integration and delivery pipeline. The environment is using industry standard best practices to allow the software being developed to be tested, integrated, packaged, and deployed using automated tools and virtualized environments. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> As a member of the Development Services System Team, the successful candidate will: <ul> <li>Create and maintain infrastructure, including continuous integration, automated builds, and automated build verification testing</li><li>Create platforms and environments for solution demos, development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing and staging</li><li>Create products, utilities, and scripts to automate deployment</li><li>Coordinate with other Agile Teams in order to efficiently share responsibilities, therefore increasing overall performance</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Interest and/or experience in continuous integration, continuous deployment, release management, and automation</li><li>Strong scripting abilities</li><li>Strong knowledge of Linux and the Microsoft Windows OS family</li><li>Some familiarity with the following tools: Nexus OSS, Jenkins, Docker, Parasoft Development Test Plaftorm and GitLab</li><li>Knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of Scrum or the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.
