Job_Description: <div><div><em>Cima+ is looking for a <strong>Telecommunication Wireless Engineer</strong> for our Calgary, Edmonton or Vancouver office</em> <br/><br/> We are interested in qualified individuals, with 7 or more years of experience in multiple aspects of wireless communication. CIMA+ is involved with a various set of clients with a wide variety of requirements. Main clients include large Oil and Gas industries, transit operators, health care institutions, first responders, municipalities and colleges/Universities. If you like diversity, this position is for you. The successful candidate should have broad technical expertise in telecommunication with a special focus on wireless communication. The candidate demonstrates strong organization skills and excellent interpersonal abilities. <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic growing team. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has been rapidly expanding operations into Western Canada. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong>  <ul>  <li>Be involved in all phases and types of telecommunication projects with emphasis on wireless projects including:  <ul>   <li>Needs assessment;</li>  <li>Specifications;</li>  <li>Conceptual design;</li>  <li>Cost Estimations;</li>  <li>Detailed design;</li>  <li>Procurement;</li>  <li>Installation supervision;</li>  <li>Test plans and validation</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Responsible for major account and project management</li>    <li>Develop and maintain relationship with existing and new clients</li>    <li>Participate actively in the proposal process</li>    <li>Oversee the on-site system installation. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications / Experience</u></strong></li>    <li>Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent</li>    <li>Minimum 7 years of relevant experience and P.Eng. Licence;</li>    <li>Experience designing, installing and validating systems in heavy industrial environment is highly desirable.</li>    <li>Experience in a Transit environment is considered an asset.</li>    <li>Experience with many of the following technologies is required:  <ul>   <li>Microwave point-to-point (licence and unlicensed) links.</li>  <li>Point to Multipoint wireless technologies.</li>  <li>Wifi / WiMax</li>  <li>Land Mobile radio systems (P25, DMR, NXDN, TETRA)</li>  <li>Cellular technologies including LTE and DAS.</li>  <li>Working knowledge of Ethernet/IP Switching and routing (VLANs, OSPF, MPLS)</li>  <li>RF Propagation analysis using modern software suites like (E.g. iBwave suite, pathloss 4.0/5.0).</li> </ul>  </li> <li>The candidate should demonstrate experience in  <ul>   <li>building and maintaining a relationship with a client;</li>  <li>creating network architectures;</li>  <li>creating high level and detailed design solutions;</li>  <li>participating in feasibility studies;</li>  <li>creating test plans;</li>  <li>supervising installation;</li>  <li>validating the installed systems;</li>  <li>project management skills.</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Experience in greenfield and brownfield installations.</li>    </ul> Experience working for an engineering firm would be considered an asset</div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!
Title: Wireless Telecommunication Engineer

Job_Description: Electrician/PLC Technician<br/><br/>Calgary, AB, Canada <br/><br/> <strong>Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Canam currently has an opportunity for a permanent full-time, <strong>Electrician</strong> at our steel joist and deck manufacturing plant in Calgary. <br/><br/> This role requires an individual with: <ul> <li>Journeyman Electrician certificate and PLC knowledge; College diploma in industrial electronics, instrumentation and automation or equivalent experience;</li><li>Overhead crane maintenance experience preferred;</li><li>A keen aptitude for diagnosing and correcting electrical problems;</li><li>A minimum of three (3) years’ experience, preferably in the manufacturing industry;</li><li>Sound communication and English language skills (reading and writing);</li><li>Physical fitness to lift up to 40 lbs. on a continual basis;</li><li>The ability to multi-task efficiently, with marginal supervision, while remaining highly self-motivated with a service oriented approach;</li><li>A friendly, patient, team-oriented work ethic and a strong commitment to organizational values;</li><li>Aptitude to ensure safe work practices and compliance with health and safety policies and procedures;</li><li>LEAN or continuous improvement experience an asset;</li><li>Accurate record keeping, and generating log books</li><li>Good comprehension of the Canadian Electrical Code;</li><li>Ability to create and read electrical/electronic plans and symbols,</li><li>Troubleshoot / repair computer-assisted electrical/electronic systems</li><li>Install electrical and electronic controls on machines</li><li>Troubleshoot / repair programmable logic controllers</li><li>Start up complex electronic and electrical systems</li><li>Demonstrated knowledge of,  <ul> <li>Distributed I/O and control networks (devicenet, controlnet, ethernet, etc.)</li><li>Electro-hydraulic and Electro-pneumatic components</li><li>Electronic components (such as Control and Instrumentation principles and function)</li><li>Closed-loop servo-systems (encoders, AC Drive, PLC, Servomotors, etc.)</li><li>Mathematics (trigonometry and algebra) and electricity</li><li>Allen-Bradley (Logix Family) and Omron PLC hardware and programming software (Rockwell RS Logix 500 & 5000, Omron CX, Syswin)</li></ul></li> </ul> As a member of our Maintenance Team, you will: <ul> <li>Be responsible for repair and maintenance of production equipment and facilities, including bridge cranes up to 25 ton capacity;</li><li>Be involved in a variety of activities, including but not limited to: equipment calibration, troubleshooting, and preventive maintenance;</li><li>Perform repairs and installations of hydraulic, pneumatic and mechanical systems;</li><li>Demonstrate punctuality, maturity, reliability, and work well under pressure;</li><li>Install and maintain programmable hardware and software within the electrical department;</li><li>Maintain existing systems and PLC based automated equipment;</li><li>Diagnose and repair malfunctioning PLC based automated equipment;</li><li>Possess the ability to work shift work; previous experience working shifts and weekends would be an asset;</li><li>Perform all other duties as assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>Physical Demands:</strong> <br/><br/> The ability to stand continuously is essential with frequent walking and occasional sitting. The nature of the position will require the employee to perform a wide range of physical activities ranging from pushing and pulling, lifting and carrying heavy objects (60 – 100 lb) to climbing, crouching, kneeling, bending and handling. Vision requirements include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to focus. <br/><br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong> <br/><br/> The Site safety of employees comes first. Constant exposure to a steel fabrication environment and regular exposure to weather conditions, excessive noise levels and vibrations. Often works near moving mechanical parts and is frequently exposed to fumes and airborne particles. Occasionally works in high, precarious positions. <br/><br/> <strong>Remuneration:</strong> <br/> In this permanent, unionized full-time position, you will receive competitive remuneration, benefits, profit sharing, as well as opportunities for training. <br/><br/> <em>Canam Group Inc. appreciates your interest in this position. Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We reserve the right, upon receiving written consent and at the Company’s expense, to perform criminal, credit and job-related medical background checks as part of the hiring process.</em>
Title: Electrician/PLC Technician

Job_Description: <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is a provider of energy efficiency, facility management services and outsourcing solutions for companies and communities. Our experts design, develop and manage tailored, smart and sustainable solutions for our customers’ benefit from airports to office parks and industrial sites. <BR><BR><STRONG>ENGIE Services</STRONG> is part of ENGIE in North America, which manages a range of energy businesses in the U.S. and Canada, including electricity generation and cogeneration, natural gas and liquefied natural gas (LNG) distribution and sales, retail energy sales and energy optimization services. ENGIE (formerly GDF SUEZ) employs 154,950 people worldwide.</DIV> <DIV><BR> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Job Office:</STRONG> Educational Institution in Calgary<BR><STRONG>Position Status:</STRONG> Permanent, Full Time</DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Schedule:</STRONG> Days</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Summary:</STRONG></DIV> <DIV>Reporting to the Facility Manager, The Engineer will be responsible of the development, implementation and management of the facility’s energy and environmental compliance programs, certifications and systems. The engineer assists our client in the implementation of the strategy. This position will assist in ensuring facility compliance with our deliverables and pertinent governmental regulations and procedures. </DIV> <DIV><BR>The incumbent ensures the operations are in accordance with the principles set out in the LEED and BOMA certifications for an Educational Institution Facility in Calgary. <BR></DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <P><STRONG>Responsabilities:</STRONG><BR></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Be responsible for environmental certification and sustainability records such as BOMA BEST and LEED for maintenance and operations of the Educational Institution Facility buildings. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Assist Facility Manager in the development and the implementation of the corporate environmental management system, as well as integration of the environmental system into the facility overall.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Promotes and coaches to mobilize actions in sustainable building. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Write procedures and policies necessary to obtain the required accreditations in accordance with the Head Office standards. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participates in actions related to water management. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Manages actions for ozone depleting substances. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Set up the information system and disseminate the required operating standards (energy, lighting, residual materials, air quality, water).</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Analyze incident and compliance trends data and work with operating departments.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Coordinate activities and prepare/submit reporting to outside agencies.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Stay current with new ideas, engineering and techniques in the environmental field.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Identify cost effective solutions for technical and regulatory environmental issues.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Participate in the facility’s strategic planning and project review process, tract metrics, and support continuous improvement of the environmental management system. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Provide formal recommendations for projects to implement the savings opportunities and execute activities to ensure savings are realized including ongoing energy performance monitoring.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Gather and analyze facilities information including, utility metering data, energy data including load profiles, and existing building and system information.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Conduct site audits to assess energy performance and provide written reports of findings and recommendations.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Identify, develop and implement energy saving measures in the areas of HVAC, Building Automation, central plant and lighting through the application of industry leading technology.</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Identify and provide project justification for energy saving measures, operational changes, maintenance and upgrades that result in reduced energy consumption with return on investment calculations. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Carries out greenhouse gas reduction plans (carbon budget) and is involved in reduction plans and the use of renewable energies. </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Other duties as required.</DIV></LI></UL> <STRONG>Requirements:</STRONG>  <DIV> <UL> <LI>Bachelor’s degree in Environmental science, Building Engineering or equivalent;</LI> <LI>Minimum of 5 years of experience focusing on environmental assessment and energy management;</LI> <LI>Experience in the building sector;</LI> <LI>Good knowledge of principles and achievements related to sustainable development and energy consumption reduction;</LI> <LI>Active participation in building certification files;</LI> <LI>Good knowledge of HVAC and building Equipment;</LI> <LI>LEED and BOMA Best certification (or in process to obtain them);</LI> <LI>Working knowledge of environmental regulations/requirements;</LI> <LI>Environmental compliance and management systems experience;</LI> <LI>Ability to prepare and implement key management systems/controls, such as Permits, Plans, License & Registration; Written Representation Tables; Statement of Basis; Declaration of Negative Applicability; and Compliance Calendars;</LI> <LI>Able to travel occasionally between the sites;</LI> <LI>Knowledge of Microsoft programs.</LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><STRONG>Skills:</STRONG></DIV> <UL> <LI>Possess the ability to interface with different group;</LI> <LI>Customer services oriented;</LI> <LI>Diplomatic;</LI> <LI>Work effectively with others, excellence in written/verbal communications, and in planning, documenting, organizing and executing multiple tasks simultaneously;</LI> <LI>Team work oriented;</LI> <LI>Be proactive and assertive with sense of urgency to problem solving.</LI></UL> <DIV> </DIV> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Equal Employment Opportunity:</STRONG></P> <P>ENGIE Services Inc. is committed to the principles of equality in employment and invites women, aboriginals, members of visible minorities, ethnic minorities and persons with disabilities to apply.</P> <P> </P> <P>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation or preference, religion, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or physical or mental disability.</P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Comment:</STRONG></P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted</STRONG></P> <P> </P></DIV>

Job_Description: <div><strong>What You'll Do</strong> <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to work within a group of exceptional software engineers on one of the fastest growing products. <br/><br/> The AMP (Advanced Malware Protection) team has shipped endpoint software for a number of platforms including Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android. The endpoint clients communicate with a Linux backend running Mongo, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Hive, RabbitMQ, Ruby, and custom C code, all managed by Chef. We're deployed across a cloud infrastructure including Amazon's EC2 and our own hardware running Joyent's SDC, and have condensed these services down into a single instance deployable on VMWare. <br/><br/> We know how to ship software, and shipping software feels good. <br/><br/> <strong> Who You'll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> We have a dynamic environment that inspires employees to create, honing their talents and skills every day. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company's purposes and principles. <br/><br/> We are looking for an experienced windows software developer to join us. We are willing to train those excited to learn. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> Required Skills: <ul> <li>6-10 years of relevant professional experience</li><li>Strong debugging skills</li><li>3 + years of C/C++ development under Windows</li><li>Experience with writing test tools/frameworks</li><li>Strong understanding of secure computing practices</li> </ul> Nice to have: <ul> <li>Kernel driver/embedded development experience</li><li>Security experience</li>  </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/><br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. <br/><br/> We Are Cisco.</div>

We are the largest refiner and marketer of petroleum products - sold primarily under the Esso and Mobil brands - across the country. A proven leader in hydrocarbon research, development, production, manufacturing, distribution, supply and logistics and marketing, we offer tremendously challenging and diverse employment opportunities. <br/><br/> Imperial is recruiting for engineering students to assign to a variety of positions located across multiple departments and locations in Canada. You will be assigned to a specific position and department based on your interests, skills, knowledge, experience and work location preferences as well as Imperial’s business needs. Assignments can include, but are not limited to positions in the upstream production and mining business, refining and supply business, chemicals business, project engineering development and design, sales and marketing, environmental services, safety health and environment and facilities management. <br/><br/> You may be required to give a presentation on the assigned project(s) at the end of your work term depending on the department you are working for. <br/><br/> Click here to hear from one of our past <u>students</u>. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Academic:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Studying to achieve a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering</li> <li>University Engineering student available for a work term beginning in September 2018</li> <li>Currently enrolled in a University Engineering program and returning to full-time studies after the work term</li> <li>Your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> <li>Demonstrated leadership and strong academic skills</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Previous industry experience is considered beneficial, but not essential</li> <li>Commitment to safety on and off the job</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills in English are required for all roles</li> <li>Ability to work with minimal supervision and in a team-based environment</li> <li>A valid driver’s license and a safe driving record are requirements for certain positions</li> <li>Fluency in French is an asset for certain positions; please note in your cover letter if you are fluent in French</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 4, 8, 12 or 16 months <br/> Please indicate in your cover letter the work term / duration that you are interested in working based on your availability and school program. <br/><br/> <strong>Various locations:</strong> British Columbia (Port Moody), Alberta (Calgary, Edmonton, Cold Lake, Kearl site), Manitoba (Winnipeg), Ontario (Sarnia, Nanticoke, Toronto), Nova Scotia (Dartmouth), North West Territories (Hay River) <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong>  <ul>  	<li>You will have the opportunity to work with teams of experienced employees and interact with other engineers during your work term</li> <li>Imperial supports and promotes a learning environment for all of our students, to utilize your current skills and develop new ones</li> <li>You will have the opportunity to work in a fast paced, highly technical and professional engineering work environment</li> <li>Term relocation assistance is available for those who qualify</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/> A leading member of Canada’s energy industry, Imperial offers exciting opportunities across our upstream, downstream and chemical, and corporate divisions. We are committed to high standards, applying technology and innovation to meet energy demands in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit (for additional information, see www.imperialoil.ca/en-ca/careers/working-with-us/term-employment-eligibility). Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> May 13, 2018</div> <br/>Alternate Locations: Canada : Calgary, AB || Canada : Cold Lake, AB || Canada : Dartmouth, NS || Canada : Edmonton, AB || Canada : Hay River, NT || Canada : Kearl Site, AB || Canada : Nanticoke, ON || Canada : Port Moody, BC || Canada : Sarnia, ON || Canada : Toronto, ON || Canada : Winnipeg, MB <br/><br/> Imperial is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, Imperial may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions in the company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  R&D Engineer, Engineer, Project Engineer, R&D, Engineering, Research</div>  <br/>Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Seek</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> Reporting to the Lead Engineer, the Process Engineer will play an active role in the design basis memorandum, engineering design specification, detailed engineering and commissioning of OPP, Hydrotransport and Bulk Material Handling projects currently being undertaken in the Major Projects group. <br>  <br> <strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES - BENEFITS</strong></p>  <p><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br> • Define and develop deliverables such as, process design requirements, process design criteria, process flow diagrams, Instrumentation and Control Diagrams, heat and material balances, definition of battery limits and battery limit conditions.<br> • Resolve process related problems as they arise during the design, construction, and commissioning phases of the project.<br> • Provide technical support to the Major Projects group.<br> • Effectively work in a multidisciplinary team to efficiently contribute to the delivery of fit for purpose projects at Canadian Natural Resources Limited’s (CNRL) Horizon Oil Sands facility. <br> • Determine project process requirements and work to develop design criteria and process flow diagrams that facilitate operations and maintenance requirements.<br> • Participate and take a leadership role in formal design, model and risk reviews including HazOps.<br> • Work with the team to resolve any process related technical problems that arise during any phase of the project.<br> • Interface with Horizon Site Process Engineering, Operations, and Maintenance personnel to ensure that plant needs are taken into consideration within the design.<br> • Participate in systems definitions and development for purposes of pre-commissioning and commissioning, inclusive of onsite support as needed for construction activities<br> • Write the process component of the scope of work that consultants and contractors must meet to deliver fit for purpose assets and ensure they meet the business objectives of the project and industry standards<br> • Identify new technologies that will improve asset performance.</p>  <p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><br> • Engineering Degree is required; preference in Chemical/Process Engineering. <br> • Registration with APEGA is required. <br> • Minimum of seven years’ experience in a petrochemical plant, with 3 to 5 of these years working on Oil Sands facilities projects<br> • Plant operations and/or commissioning and start-up experience in an oil sands processing plant would be considered an asset <br> • Experience working for an EPC would be an asset <br> • A proven track record in optimizing process plants, managing projects and budgets in a team oriented environment <br> • Experience with Oil Sands Ore Preparation Plants and Hydrotransport Pipelines is an asset</p>  <p>To see related Chemical and Process Engineering roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Engineering-Chemical-and-Process </p>  <p><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Process Engineer

Job_Description: <div> <div>SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. Help us define the next generation of investing! <br/><br/> As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. Youll help us Platformize (yes thats a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs.. Its not easy, but its an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.<br/><br/><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:</strong>   <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain highly performant web applications on our stack (AngularJS, Typescript, Sass, Bootstrap).</li> <li>Work with our amazing product design team to develop and iterate on user interfaces that bring simplicity to complicated financial data.</li> <li>Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill.</li> <li>Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code.</li> <li>Participating in SigFigs agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).</li> </ul>  <strong>WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEBODY WITH:</strong>   <ul> <li>Degree or diploma from an accredited college or university, or equivalent work experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices.</li> <li>Good expertise with front end technologies (Javascript, AngularJS, Typescript, Sass, Bootstrap) and experience building large scale responsive web applications.</li> <li>Great Communication Skills You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well.</li> <li>Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.</li> <li>Knowledge of server side technologies like Scala, Java, PHP is a plus.</li> <li>Domain Experience is a plus You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry.</li> <li>Passion for finance and investing is a plus.</li> </ul> <strong>ABOUT SIGFIG</strong> <br/><br/> SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the worlds largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients. <br/><br/> Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com.</div> </div> <br/>
Title: Front End Software Engineer

Consulting  <ul>  	<li>Apply computing technology to solve engineering problems or improve business performance</li> <li>Provide guidance to engineers on effective technology usage</li> <li>Advise learn and apply new engineering technologies</li> <li>Ability to teach and train others</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work You will be provided an opportunity to:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment</li> <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training</li> <li>Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs</li> <li>Work with a geographically distributed team across Canada</li> <li>Work directly with the client business unit to deliver desktop infrastructure to achieve critical business goals</li> <li>Deliver optimum technical solutions within data and technology architecture</li> <li>Utilize desktop, client/server, network, and mainframe technologies</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div>Corporate Analytics & Innovation manages the Engineering Governance for the Corporation including Professional Practice and the Engineer-In-Training (EIT) Rotation Program. <br/> As an EIT, you will be assigned to one of the participating business units for up to one year and then re-assigned on a yearly basis. Participating business units include Water Resources, Water Services, Waste & Recycling Services, Transportation Planning, Transportation Infrastructure, and Calgary Transit. Successful candidates will perform a wide variety of engineering work from design through to project management. At the end of the four-year rotation program, or once the Professional Engineer designation has been obtained, trainees are expected to seek placement in a regular permanent position at The City.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div>  <ul> 	<li>Engineering degree in Civil Engineering, and registration as an Engineer-In-Training (EIT) by the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) by the first day of work.</li> 	<li>A new or recent graduate with a maximum of 1 year of previous engineering experience.</li> 	<li>Experience related to engineering design or reviews related to transportation capital projects would be considered an asset.</li> 	<li>Well-developed communication skills with a focus on problem solving complex issues in a professional manner.</li> 	<li>Strategic and analytical thinker with strong project management and planning skills.</li> 	<li>Ability to work independently and in a team environment while engaging internal and external stakeholders.</li> 	<li>Success in this position requires the ability to build strategic working relationship, continuous learning, innovation and strong planning and organizing skills.</li>  </ul> <strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> <ul> 	<li>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</li> </ul></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div>An offer of employment for this position will be conditional on an applicant passing a pre-employment drug test. Failure to pass a pre-employment drug test may prevent an applicant from being hired into any safety sensitive position for a period of up to twelve months.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div> <div>Union: CUPE Local 38</div> <div>Business Unit: Corporate Analytics & Innovation</div></div> <div> <div>Position Type: 2 Permanent</div>  <div>Location: 800 Macleod Trail S.E.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Pay Grade 10 $37.58 - 50.23 per hour (2017 Rates)</div> <div>Days of Work: This position works a 5 day</div> <div>work week with one day off in a 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 23, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Job ID #: 300766</div></div> </div> </div><div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>
Title: Engineer in Training

Job_Description: <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company is currently recruiting an Instrumentation & Controls Engineering Lead for a 1 year contract. <br/><br/> This position is located in Calgary, AB. Local candidates are preferred, however, non-local candidates will be considered, but must be willing to secure their own accommodations/relocation, as there is no relocation/living allowance provided. <br/><br/> <strong>MAIN FUNCTIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Evaluate and comment on discipline engineering work performed both internally and by Contractors and sub-contractors to ensure that work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, company standards, and regulatory requirements. Facilitates effective execution of discipline engineering and design routines that align with the project's goals, objectives, and procedures. Assures accurate and timely communication among the Project Team and other Company functions on discipline engineering activities, progress, and issues. In addition to technical ability, they should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. <br/><br/> <strong>TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Facilitate and coordinate discipline engineering technical work products</li> <li>Coordination and communication of various issues among the company's and contractor's engineering team that affect the discipline engineering design, safety, and regulatory compliance of the work</li> <li>Evaluate / comment work performed by the Contractor and sub-contractors to insure that the work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, company standards, and regulatory requirements. Includes review of discipline design drawings and documents</li> <li>Identify and assess deviations to Contract Technical Specifications and regulatory requirements; ensure that such deviations will be processed according to project procedures; maintains Deviation Control Log.</li> <li>Steward discipline engineering queries from the Contractor and sub-contractors as well as technical information requests</li> <li>Keep Lead Engineer or Engineering Manager informed of discipline engineering progress, deviations, and execution concerns</li> <li>Participate in discipline engineering reviews at Contractor's and subcontractor's locations</li> <li>Drives and promotes capital efficiency in engineering design</li> <li>Support internal engineering general interest or Global Practice initiatives as requested by Supervisor</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul> <li>Closely related professional experience</li> <li>Bachelors degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience</li> <li>Broad and extensive knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria</li> <li>Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities</li> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of software programs</li> <li>Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>
Title: Instrumentation & Controls Engineering Lead

Job_Description: <div>AvWorks is seeking M1 AMEs to help us deliver high quality maintenance services in several regions across Canada.</div><br/>  <div>To meet our goals, we require professional, experienced AMEs. We provide maintenance on a wide variety of private and commercial aircraft with single/twin pistons, turbo props and light jets. Periodically, you may have the opportunity to travel within Canada and overseas on short term work contracts.</div><br/>  <div><strong>The ideal candidate will:</strong></div><ul><li>Have experience on a variety of aircraft types.</li><li>Be comfortable working alone or in a small team.</li><li>Have excellent communication skills.</li><li>Be diligent with their paperwork.</li><li>Have a thorough understanding of the CARs.</li><li>Take pride in performing maintenance to a high standard.</li><li>Have effective time management skills.</li> </ul><br/>  <div><strong>This position requires that you have:</strong></div><ul><li>A valid M1 Canadian AME license.</li><li>A valid drivers license.</li><li>Human Factors training (in house training can be provided).</li><li>Microsoft Office and general Computer skills.</li><li>A positive attitude and a desire to succeed.</li> </ul>  <br/> <div>Drop us a line if you want to have flexible work hours and the support of a strong team.</div>  <br/><strong>About AvWorks Aerospace</strong><br/><br/>AvWorks Aerospace is an Aircraft Maintenance and Management company that was founded in 2012 by Mark Bushrod at the Calgary/Springbank Airport. Since then we have grown to be recognized as a trusted source for quality aircraft maintenance. Our services have been requested in many different countries including the United States, Ecuador, Guadalupe, Fiji and the United Kingdom.
Title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (FT)

Job_Description: Your Opportunity<br/><br/>Every power project is a community project—whether it’s a gas plant conversion, a transmission line corridor, or a wind development. Our goal is to improve industrial, business, and local communities through our project work. We see beyond the project at hand to where our work fits in the big picture. Join a team that does more than generate and deliver electricity through its work; join a team that powers growth and advances communities.<br/><br/>Your Duties<br/><br/>As a result of new and expanding business opportunities, Stantec's Power group is currently seeking a Civil Engineer in our Lethbridge or Calgary Office. As a member of our dynamic team you will be engaged in the execution of Wind and Solar projects, HV substation projects, transmission lines, and other renewable developments providing our clients with superior engineering design solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Develop project designs aligned with our client requirements and Stantec’s best practice standards</li> <li>Conduct calculations and studies to develop preliminary and detailed design for various engineering stages; IFR, IFT, IFF, IFC and Record Drawings</li> <li>Provide detailed design in the following areas:    <ul>   <li>Site preparation including access road, fence, grading, clearing boundaries, and roadway and intersection designs, etc.</li> <li>Manage and coordinate geotechnical investigations to meet project requirements</li> <li>Supervise and provide input in to Storm Water Management Designs and Studies</li> <li>Develop Component Transportation plans</li> <li>Foundation Drainage systems</li> <li>Coordinate and design foundation earthworks details</li> <li>Cable trench and duct bank designs</li> </ul>   </li> <li>Develop and evaluate the technical requirements for fabrication and construction tender packages</li> <li>Review and approve equipment vendor drawings and structure shop drawings</li> <li>Provide engineering support for proposals, estimating, procurement and construction</li> <li>Coordinate with other engineering disciplines and project managers to successfully deliver projects</li> <li>Mentor, coach and develop junior team members</li> </ul>  Your Capabilities and Credentials<br/><br/><strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering coupled with a minimum of five years detailed design experience in site designs in North America</li> <li>Eligibility and/or currently registered with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of AB, BC, and SK</li>   <li>Proficient with MS Office applications & AutoCAD</li> <li>Effective communication skills with the ability to successfully work in a team environment</li>   <li>Valid Class 5 BC driver’s license or equivalent</li> </ul>
Title: Civil Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>As the Senior Systems Engineer, you will report to the Rail Systems Coordinator who has the overall responsibility for engineering, operation and maintenance of the electrical aspect of the Rail Systems, including traction power, signals & communications, and control systems. As a Department ID (DeptID) Owner, you will also be responsible and accountable for the operating budget for all maintenance service contracts (approximate annual contract values are over $5 million). Major duties include:</strong></div><ul>	<li>	<div>Prepare and control engineering safety standards, specifications, design guidelines, procedures and practices to be used in the construction and maintenance of traction power systems for the Light Rail Transit (LRT) system. The process involves liaising with regulatory agencies, contractors, industrial associations and City business units.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Build and lead a team of technical professionals to deliver traction power design, maintenance, and construction engineering support for transit projects.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Provide technical support and advice to project engineers in Transit Capital Construction, Rail Systems and Engineering Support groups. Present Transit’s interests and concerns on maintenance and operational issues.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Assist in the selection process of consultants and contractors carrying out traction power design and construction.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>An Electrical Engineering degree, and current licensure as Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA), or licensure by the first day of work.</div></li>		<li>	<div>A minimum of 8 years of directly related experience, including working knowledge in traction power systems design standards, is required.</div></li>		<li>	<div>You demonstrate sound knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of system engineering. This must include the application of principles related to conceptual design, requirements definition, design, testing, and project management.</div> </li>		 <li> <div><strong>Success in this role requires:</strong></div><ul> <li> <div>Expert analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to breakdown complex system problems and develop recommendations.</div></li>  <li> <div>Solid interpersonal and communication skills to build trust by consulting and liaising with others.</div></li>  <li> <div>The ability to apply a team approach as needed to achieve solutions on moderately complex technical issues.</div></li> </ul>	</li> </ul>  <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div><div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div>Union: Exempt</div>  <div>Business Unit: Calgary Transit</div> </div> <div> <div>Position Type: Permanent</div> <div>Location: 1417C 33 Street S.W.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Engineer Level F $88,307 - 148,777 per annum</div> <div>Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day</div> <div>work week, earning 1 day off in each 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 24, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Amendment: Closing Date</div>  <div>Job ID #: 300727</div></div> </div> <div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>
Title: Senior Systems Engineer - Traction Power - AMENDMENT

Job_Description: <div><div> Intermediate Project Engineer – Process – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 03, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3209</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex Ltd. is a single source supplier of natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems, and electric power generation equipment – plus related engineering and mechanical service expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission, and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, refrigeration systems, and electric power equipment servicing the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for an Intermediate <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities, while working with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility. This position is responsible for all aspects of the project from design through to commissioning. Work with a strong leadership team who will mentor you through every aspect of the job and share valuable industry knowledge. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to ensure project deliverables are accurate, complete and timely while remaining customer focused, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings.</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size tanks, PVRV’s and EPRV’s</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Select and order all hand valves and instrumentation on a portion of a gas plant project</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>5-10 Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma.</li> <li>Preference for P. Eng designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required.</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping will be considered an asset</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong><ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Software</div><br/>   <div> Technical Support for Applying Online</div> </div> 	</div>  <br/>
Title: Intermediate Project Engineer – Process –

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Fort Hills, Wood Buffalo, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 20786 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the shift supervisor, you will be responsible for supporting the Fort Hills mine maintenance team by safely maintaining the heavy equipment fleet to ensure optimum reliability and availability of the assets. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Execute maintenance activities including installation, troubleshooting, and repairs to all systems and equipment to ensure optimum reliability and availability (electrical safety systems, motor starters, large medium voltage frequency drive systems and PLCs, 13.8KV/ 7.2KV / 600 V / 480 V and 220 V power distribution and computerized control systems)</li><li>Conduct preventative maintenance inspections and repairs on all types of heavy and auxiliary equipment and ensure that preventative maintenance guidelines are adhered to and maintain complete and accurate records</li><li>Support in the removal and replacement of major components (engines, transmissions, wheel motors, etc.)</li><li>Safely operate company-provided equipment and vehicles</li><li>Actively participate in post-event failure analysis and root cause discussions to craft creative solutions</li><li>Troubleshoot, repair and test high voltage trailing cables</li><li>Build an atmosphere of continuous improvement centered on safe work practices, procedures and standards</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>One year of post-apprenticeship experience maintaining mining heavy equipment</li><li>One or more years of experience on P&H 4100BOSS A/C electric cable shovels, Komatsu A/C ultra class electric haul trucks</li><li>Valid Alberta Journeyman Electrician Certificate or an Interprovincial Red Seal; attach your journeyman / red seal ticket with your application</li><li>High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>In-depth knowledge and application of technical requirements and quality standards</li><li>Deep understanding of maintenance and operations with the ability to read and interpret equipment specifications, engineering drawings, blueprints, charts, and tables, or study sample parts as required</li><li>Familiar with computerized maintenance management systems; working knowledge of SAP would be considered an asset</li><li>Safety and environmental mindset</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position has been identified as safety sensitive</li><li>This is a camp-based position at the Fort Hills site</li><li>Shift schedule is a seven days on/seven days off rotation (seven days on, seven days off, seven nights on, seven nights off; 12-hour shifts)</li><li>Requires some heavy lifting, use of ladders and working on elevated work sites such as scaffolds and towers both indoor and outdoor as well as within confined spaces</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>About Fort Hills</strong> <br/> Fort Hills, a joint venture between Suncor, Total, and Teck Resources, is the largest undeveloped oil sands mining asset in the region. Located 90 kilometres north of Fort McMurray, you’ll travel in comfort from one of our Western Canadian hubs, or Fort McMurray. There, you will stay in a world class, modern yet comfortable, lodge-style accommodation. More information about life at Fort Hills is available here. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals.
