Job_Description: The NPI (New Product Introduction) Component Engineer is a challenging opportunity that involves working directly with Engineering, Project Management and Operations to bring new products to market. The job will provide you with diverse experiences in both new product introduction, component evaluation and selection while providing an opportunity to learn about GNSS products. The role is an integral part of the NPI team and is focused on Component AVL (Approved Vendor List) Management and Component Quality/Reliability. <br/><br/> As our NPI <strong>Component Engineer</strong>, responsibilities include: <ul> <li>Supporting Supply Chain and Engineering by identifying suitable alternatives, second sources and managing qualification in affected products</li><li>Assessing current market state and pro-actively making recommendations to prevent risk</li><li>Ensuring selected components meet or exceed quality and reliability standards</li><li>Reviewing technical data sheets to assess Digital and RF hardware design fit</li><li>Reviewing components for compliance to relevant standards (RoHS, WEEE, REACH, Conflict Minerals, etc.) and maintaining supporting documentation</li><li>Supporting project teams in the sourcing and selection of electronic components (semiconductors, discrete, passives, interconnects, fasteners etc.)</li><li>Managing component obsolescence including sourcing and recommending alternatives</li><li>Working directly with component manufacturers on failure analysis to determine root cause and corrective actions</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum of a 2 Year Electronics Engineering Technical diploma with 5 + years’ experience</li><li>Excellent communication skills – both written and oral</li><li>Ability to work within a team environment, creating effective relationships with various internal functional teams and external suppliers</li><li>Effective organization skills and the ability to deliver tasks with minimal supervision</li><li>Self-motivated team player with proven problem solving capabilities</li><li>Experience in electronic manufacturing environment</li><li>Knowledge of Digital and RF design and GNSS receivers</li>  </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to communicate in a technical environment with confidence</li>  </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience working in a Continuous Improvement environment</li><li>Lean training/knowledge</li> </ul>
Title: Component Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is an ad optimization company that dramatically increases ad revenues of websites and creates innovative ad optimization technology. <br/><br/> MonetizeMore manages all aspects of publishers ad inventories as a trusted partner. This includes, but is not limited to: <br/><br/> DFP implementation and optimization <br/> Optimization amongst hundreds of ad networks including Facebook, Google Adsense and AdX <br/> Header Bidding implementation and optimization <br/> Building ad optimization technology to further increase ad revenues, automate ad operations and ensure quality user experience. <br/><br/> We are a group of 60+ team members that are ambitious, innovative and passionate about making a positive difference in the ad tech industry. Each team member values and gets the full benefit of location and schedule freedom. This allows each team member to engineer the perfect lifestyle for themselves while still being involved in a challenging and progressive career. We truly believe that if someone can live their ideal lifestyle, they will be enabled to perform to the best of their abilities. <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is seven years old, a Google Adsense Certified Partner, and a leader in ad optimization technology and strategy. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is looking for an Ad Tech Engineer comfortable in an Agile Development environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Use Javascript, Python/Flask, PostgreSQL, Linux, Docker, Git, Cloud Services and any other new tech that accomplishes the tasks.</li> <li>Develop APIs and hook up to third parties APIs to automate manual work.</li> <li>Develop user interfaces for third-party reporting or internal business processes.</li> <li>Integrate multiple services to maximize Ad monetization.</li> <li>Write Javascript code that tracks and acts upon billions of actions.</li> <li>Work in an Agile environment where requirements are clear and tasks are small and modular.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience</li> <li>3+ years of programming experience</li> <li>2+ years of experience in web development - Flask, Django, Ruby on Rails or similar</li> <li>2+ years Experience with software development for an Ad tech Industry</li> <li>SQL database experience, schema design, optimization, query analysis, database administration</li> <li>Knowledge of DHTML, experience with ReactJS, AngularJS or similar</li> <li>Experience on Linux platforms basic administration, builds, software deployment, writing Shell scripts</li> <li>GIT experience</li> <li>English language fluency</li> <li>Good communication skills, self motivated</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits and Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>Location freedom (100% remote working set-up)</li> <li>You get to create your own schedule</li> <li>Competitive compensation package</li> </ul>
Title: Ad Tech Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Co-op Work Term Duration:</strong> 4 or 8 month term starting in April 30th, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Location:</strong> The facility located in <strong><em>Calgary.</em></strong> Positions also available in Vancouver and Winnipeg. <br/><br/> <strong>Who are we?</strong> <br/> PepsiCo is making a difference on a global scale, and so can you! Competing in a dynamic, fast-paced industry, our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive at PepsiCo. <br/><br/> Follow the link below to find out more about our culture and commitment to Performance with Purpose. We believe that delivering value for our consumers and customers, protecting our environment, sourcing with integrity and investing in our employees are not simply good things to do, but that these actions fuel our returns and position PepsiCo for long-term, sustainable growth. <br/><br/> http://tinyurl.com/PepsiCoCampus <br/><br/> <strong>Operations Co-op Program</strong> <br/> At PepsiCo Canada we're always on the lookout for great talent - and that search often brings us to campuses like yours! So, why choose the PepsiCo Operations Co-op Program? <ul> <li><strong>Early Responsibility:</strong> Accelerate your career progression with early responsibility and leadership</li><li><strong>Make an Impact:</strong> Lead change in a fast paced, dynamic, and evolving industry where you can sink your teeth into challenging opportunities and drive for growth</li><li><strong>Development and Coaching:</strong> Develop yourself and learn to develop others at a company where our People are a strategic priority</li><li><strong>Mega Brands:</strong> Make tangible impact on Globally Recognized Billion Dollar brands! Your friends and family can touch and taste the impact you make!</li> </ul> At PepsiCo you will have total ownership over your success; by Delivering Results and Doing Things the Right Way your future possibilities are endless. From our great brands, to our great culture; come for one experience, you'll stay for 10! <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do in your first experience?</strong> <br/> You'll be based out of one of our world class manufacturing facilities in Western Canada. Your role will be to lead a team of 15-30 frontline employees and manage through the challenges of doing so in a Supply Chain organization, including motivating the team, problem solving issues, and removing barriers in order to help "win the shift". You will hold responsibility for the operations of the department on your shift and will set the agenda for your team in order to enable them to achieve the Business Unit expectations in the Key Performance Metrics for the area. Ultimately your initial assignment will help to familiarize you with our day to day business and work independently in a fast-paced and challenging work environment on a non-traditional shift schedule. <br/> To learn more about the possibilities in Supply Chain at PepsiCo Canada, please follow the link below. <br/><br/> http://tinyurl.com/PepsiCoSupplyChainCampus <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>Currently pursuing a degree in Commerce, Engineering, Supply Chain, or similar program</li><li>Second year plus students preferred</li><li>Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Demonstrated commitment to working with and leading people</li><li>Proven problem solver and ability to manage competing priorities</li><li>Collaborative team-player with a "roll-up your sleeves" approach</li><li>A passion for and a demonstrated commitment to extra-curricular activities and/or community involvement</li> </ul>
Title: Calgary Engineering/Operations Coop

Job_Description: <div><p></p><div>Tachyus delivers the leading prescriptive analytics platform to oil and gas producers. Our customers include many of the largest companies and state-owned entities on the planet with whom we have complex high-value relationships. We need a Customer Success Engineer to ensure that our Canada customers are delighted working with Tachyus so that they renew deals worth tens of millions or more to Tachyus.</div><div><br></div><div>The right candidate will bring experience managing relationships with petroleum engineers and geologists and a deep network of existing contacts across Canada. Tachyus Customer Success Engineers work with our Customer Success Managers and IT experts to maximize the happiness of existing customers, ensure renewals, and achieve successful upsells. The right hire will present crucial petrotechnical information, train customer petroleum engineers how to use Tachyus software, and manage key customer relationships to delight our Canada customers.</div><div><br></div><div>We are looking for someone who will represent Tachyus with customers in Canada but is also open to traveling to multiple neighboring regions.</div><p></p></div><div><div>Responsibilities<ul><ul><li>Identify and grow opportunities within assigned oil and gas producers and collaborate with Tachyus business development to extend our solutions footprint (more solutions to more assets)</li><li>Train customers' petroleum engineers on how to use Tachyus' breakthrough technology</li><li>Present valuable petrotechnical findings to Tachyus customers</li><li>Ensure continued rapid revenue growth for Tachyus in Canada</li><li>Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all petrotechnical matters specific to Tachyus customers once the solutions are deployed</li><li>Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships</li><li>Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key customer stakeholders and engineering champions</li><li>Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders</li><li>Obtain referrals from customers to increase the portfolio of Tachyus success stories</li><li>Forecast and track key account metrics</li><li>Assist with high severity requests or issue escalations as needed</li></ul></ul></div></div><div><div>Requirements<ul><ul><li>Extensive existing oil and gas domain experience as a service provider</li><li>Proven track record implementing software solutions for major enterprise accounts</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively about crucial petrotechnical information</li><li>Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communications skills</li><li>Curiosity to build and define new ways of doing business as an early member of a startup customer success engineering team</li><li>At least a bachelors in petroleum engineering</li><li>Experience operating SAGD, thermal and/or waterflood assets</li></ul></ul></div></div><div><div>Extras<ul><ul><li>Experience with software production management systems</li><li>Experience writing software or analyzing data</li><li>Business development experience</li><li>At least a masters in petroleum engineering and/or computer science</li></ul></ul></div></div><div></div>
Title: Customer Success Engineer: Canada

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div>Zedi is seeking a Customer Solutions Engineer to join our innovative team. This role is based out of Calgary, AB The ideal candidate will have a BSc. and a minimum of four years’ in this field along with a work ethic that aligns with Zedi’s Core Values –  <ul> <li>Deliver on our promises,</li> <li>Reward creative teamwork,</li> <li>Communicate with clarity,</li> <li>Growth through innovation,</li>   <li>Prioritize workplace health and safety.</li> </ul> Key Responsibilities:  <ul> <li>End-to-end design of SCADA automation systems for Oil & Gas well sites, batteries and plant facilities in the Canadian and International markets.</li> <li>Generation, Review and Approval of Technical Drawings (P&ID, electrical panel IFC drawings, network architectures, system block diagrams, etc).</li> <li>Creating Bills of Materials (BOMs), Rough Orders of Magnitude (ROMs) and formal proposals</li> <li>Creating, reviewing and approving engineering documentation such as FEED (Front-End Engineer and Design) Studies, Standard Operating Procedures, Acceptance Tests and Scopes of Work.</li> <li>Commissioning and Acceptance Testing various RTUs, PLCs and automation solutions back to Zedi’s web-based HMI interface, Zedi Access.</li> <li>Interfacing with customer management, operations, engineering and field teams during design review and project status meetings.</li> <li>Providing Tier 3 technical support to internal and external customers.</li> <li>Performing Technical Sales Support for existing and new clients with the Zedi Business Development Team.</li> <li>Delivering corporate and technical presentations to clients and potential partners</li> </ul> The ideal candidate will possess the following:  <ul> <li>BSc. in Engineering, Engineering Technologist or equivalent (Electrical, Computer, Mechanical or Petroleum preferred</li> <li>Minimum 4 years’ experience in the Oil & Gas Industry</li> <li>Experience with SCADA/Automation systems and Field Instrumentation</li> <li>Experience with Ethernet, Radio, Cellular, and Satellite communication</li> <li>Knowledge of communication protocols and complex networking</li> <li>Proficient with Microsoft operating systems and program suites</li>  </ul> Key Competencies:  <ul> <li>Ability to work in a team environment</li> <li>Ability to coordinate with multiple departments</li> <li>Ability to take initiative and work independently</li> <li>Able to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Responsibility and capability of seeing tasks through to completion</li> <li>Analytical and Troubleshooting skills</li> <li>Ability to learn new skills quickly</li> <li>Project Coordination</li> <li>Experience with programming languages such as Assembly, C, C++, Visual Basic, Ladder Logic</li> <li>Knowledge of safety regulations, the electrical codes and regulatory production guidelines</li> <li>Experience with SCADA software such ROCLink 800, Telepace, WinCCU, AutoSol</li> <li>Oil and Gas + SCADA/Automation field experience</li> </ul>  To apply please to go to www.zedisolutions.com. We thank all applicants for their interest in Zedi; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div> </div> </div>  <br/>
Title: Customer Solutions Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 17961 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, Autonomous Haul System (AHS) Engineering, you will be accountable to collect and analyze performance data from both field and office environments. This is a dynamic role, where you will interact within a multi-functional team to continually assess and optimize our AHS fleet output. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Demonstrate safety leadership for yourself and others consistently</li><li>Provide in-depth understanding of AHS operations data with an emphasis on data integrity and standardization across all work teams</li><li>Perform frequent and varied data analysis and create unique reports for distribution to mining teams</li><li>Lead the change management process through version upgrades for Front Runner and any other major upgrades impacting the our AHS operations teams</li><li>Build and execute scopes for production studies on all aspects of the autonomous load-haul-place cycle</li><li>Collaborate with the operations team regularly to examine and investigate performance focus areas</li><li>Conduct field investigations such as time motion studies, payload performance and specific equipment performance areas</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>Minimum five years of large scale open pit mine operations experience, including both field and technical roles; oil sands experience is critical</li><li>Experience in autonomous mining operation is highly desirable</li><li>University degree in mining engineering or related field</li><li>Professional Engineering designation with APEGA or eligibility to register with APEGA</li><li>High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Strong understanding of oil sands mine operating practices, including technical knowledge and process skills</li><li>Excellent change management skills with the ability to think tactically and strategically</li><li>Familiarity with Modular Mining Systems dispatch software is an asset</li><li>Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel with a proven foundation in SQL and VBA</li><li>Focus on teamwork with a track record of effective interaction within a multi-disciplinary team environment</li><li>You constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position will initially be based in Fort McMurray, Alberta and will then transition to a position in Calgary, Alberta with frequent site travel</li><li>The schedule is seven days on, seven days off while in Fort McMurray</li><li>While in Fort McMurray, transportation and housing will be provided</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering
Title: Engineer, Operations

Job_Description: <p> <strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW</strong> </p> <p>For over 17 years, DoxTek has delivered dependable document management and process automation solutions. Our award-winning solutions from Hyland OnBase, Kofax, ABBYY, and much more, are utilized by organizations across various industries and departments. DoxTek’s focus on doing the right thing, at a fair price, and with the best people, results in over 500 organizations in the US and Canada, placing their trust and confidence in DoxTek. Our customers derive value from a unique blend of technical expertise, product strategy, and exceptional customer care - a rare combination in today’s marketplace. </p> <p><br></p> <p> <strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong> </p> <p>If you enjoy solving problems, working with customers, and have the ability to produce clean, stable and functioning solutions, than DoxTek is excited to welcome you! </p> <p><em>Experience with Kofax Capture, KTA, and KTM products or any additional Imaging or Enterprise Content Management product knowledge is highly desired.</em> </p> <p><br></p> <p> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS</strong> </p> <p> Included, but not limited to: </p> <ul>  <li>Possess advanced knowledge of the Kofax and KTM product line and support (minimum of 3 years of experience with at least one of these platforms is required) </li>  <li>Possess strong analytical, integrative and problem solving-skills </li>  <li>Be organized enough and flexible enough to succeed in a performance-driven environment working on multiple projects simultaneously </li>  <li>Be comfortable in client-facing situations, connecting well with customers through great interpersonal skills, strong verbal skills and a customer-service orientation </li>  <li>Take full ownership of the work, accept feedback as an opportunity for improvement, and a passion for quality work delivered every time </li>  <li>Be able to travel and work extended hours as needed </li>  <li>Respond in a professional and timely manner to customer technical support issues via phone, web tools, or on-site </li>  <li>As needed diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve escalated customer support issues </li>  <li>Adhere to company procedures regarding the process of support ticket handling and reporting </li>  <li>Provide speedy and accurate feedback to customers </li>  <li>Have a working knowledge of VMWare, Microsoft Server, Microsoft SQL Server, and other platforms </li>  <li>Experience with ABBYY or other document capture products is a plus </li>  <li>Thrive in a team environment (both face to face and virtual) as a top notch contributor </li>  <li>Have the integrity to tell the truth no matter how bad it makes you or the company look </li>  <li> Be driven to deliver the highest quality solution in order to delight our customers </li>  <li>Relentlessly strive for improvement for DoxTek, our customers, and in your professional development… while having fun on the journey </li> </ul>
Title: Kofax Solutions Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> As Project Engineer, your primary role will be to work with the Manager of Engineering and the rest of the team to successfully deliver projects to clients in the municipal and land development industries. In addition, you will work with and support the business development and marketing aspects of the team. <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Successful completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited University.</li> <li>5 plus years’ experience in engineering discipline, specifically in municipal and land development.</li> <li>Must be a registered member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA).</li> <li>Experience with Civil 3D software.</li> <li>Experience in Stormwater Management design is an asset.</li> <li>Strong presentation, verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Business development drive and entrepreneurial acumen.</li> <li>Strong technical skills and attention to detail.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with engineering manager, project managers, engineers and drafting technicians to successfully deliver quality projects on-time and on-budget for a variety of land development and municipal projects.</li> <li>Design of various municipal and land development projects.</li> <li>Review technical drawings, details, and specifications to ensure quality and oversight.</li> <li>Supervise junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li>Prepare proposals.</li> <li>Develop relationships for partnering with other firms.</li> <li>Develop business opportunities with existing and potential clients.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY INFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> Since 1983, Watt Consulting Group has been a multi-disciplinary civil engineering, transportation planning and land survey practice, operating out of offices in Calgary, Victoria, Vancouver, Kelowna, Edmonton and Lloydminster. We provide transportation planning, engineering and geomatics services to a wide variety of public and private sector clients throughout Western Canada. We strive to achieve our Vision of being a recognized leader in the creation of vibrant and livable communities. You will be joining a team that is passionate about what they do and who hold themselves to a high standard of excellence. We take our work to “<strong>HEART</strong>”. These are the values we hold high and strive to live by every day: Honesty, Excellence, Accountability, Respect and Teamwork. <br/><br/> <em>If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and to grow your career in a dynamic organization, owned and led by employees, submit your resume to careers@wattconsultinggroup.com.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Ownership opportunities will also be available to the successful candidate.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. WATT Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer</em>.

Job_Description: <div>Job Summary</div> <br/>  <div>An Engineer/Technician will support the Engineering Team to efficiently maintain all hotel operations such that safety, security, conversation, and compliance are ensured at the highest levels.<br/><br/><strong>What will I be doing?</strong><br/><br/>As Engineer/Technician, you will support the Engineering Team to ensure that engineering and maintenance operations within the hotel, including general property maintenance energy conservation, are working properly and to standard. You are also responsible for the development of the Engineering Team and staying abreast of compliance regulations and procedures in the field of Engineering, as required for hotel standards. Specifically, an Engineer will perform the following tasks to the highest standards: <ul> <li>Perform day-to-day routine and preventative maintenance within the hotel rooms</li><li>Respond promptly and efficiently to any maintenance calls that arise</li><li>Execute the preventative maintenance schedule and ensure all equipment and designated areas are maintained to the required standard</li><li>Assist in the implementation of energy conservation program</li><li>Recommend maintenance system improvements and energy savings</li><li>Maintain all tools, equipment, and working areas in good condition</li><li>Keep your technical training knowledge and skills up to date</li></ul></div><br/>  <div> <strong>What are we looking for?</strong><br/><br/>An Engineer/Technician serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: <ul> <li>Current working knowledge of general maintenance and engineering work</li><li>Experience in the Maintenance Department of a hotel, hospital, ship, and/or restaurant complex or similar</li><li>Strong work ethic</li><li>A passion for delivering great customer service</li><li>Ability to work without close supervision and within established timeframes</li> </ul>  <strong>What will it be like to work for Hilton?</strong><br/><br/>Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. Job_Description: <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> As Project Engineer, your primary role will be to work with the Manager of Engineering and the rest of the team to successfully deliver projects to clients in the municipal and land development industries. In addition, you will work with and support the business development and marketing aspects of the team. <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Successful completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited University.</li> <li>5 plus years’ experience in engineering discipline, specifically in municipal and land development.</li> <li>Must be a registered member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA).</li> <li>Experience with Civil 3D software.</li> <li>Experience in Stormwater Management design is an asset.</li> <li>Strong presentation, verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Business development drive and entrepreneurial acumen.</li> <li>Strong technical skills and attention to detail.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with engineering manager, project managers, engineers and drafting technicians to successfully deliver quality projects on-time and on-budget for a variety of land development and municipal projects.</li> <li>Design of various municipal and land development projects.</li> <li>Review technical drawings, details, and specifications to ensure quality and oversight.</li> <li>Supervise junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li>Prepare proposals.</li> <li>Develop relationships for partnering with other firms.</li> <li>Develop business opportunities with existing and potential clients.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY INFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> Since 1983, Watt Consulting Group has been a multi-disciplinary civil engineering, transportation planning and land survey practice, operating out of offices in Calgary, Victoria, Vancouver, Kelowna, Edmonton and Lloydminster. We provide transportation planning, engineering and geomatics services to a wide variety of public and private sector clients throughout Western Canada. We strive to achieve our Vision of being a recognized leader in the creation of vibrant and livable communities. You will be joining a team that is passionate about what they do and who hold themselves to a high standard of excellence. We take our work to “<strong>HEART</strong>”. These are the values we hold high and strive to live by every day: Honesty, Excellence, Accountability, Respect and Teamwork. <br/><br/> <em>If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and to grow your career in a dynamic organization, owned and led by employees, submit your resume to careers@wattconsultinggroup.com.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Ownership opportunities will also be available to the successful candidate.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. WATT Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer</em>.
Title: Project Engineer

Job_Description: <p> <strong>COMPANY OVERVIEW</strong> </p> <p>For over 17 years, DoxTek has delivered dependable document management and process automation solutions. Our award-winning solutions from Hyland OnBase, Kofax, ABBYY, and much more, are utilized by organizations across various industries and departments. DoxTek’s focus on doing the right thing, at a fair price, and with the best people, results in over 500 organizations in the US and Canada, placing their trust and confidence in DoxTek. Our customers derive value from a unique blend of technical expertise, product strategy, and exceptional customer care - a rare combination in today’s marketplace. </p> <p><br></p> <p> <strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong> </p> <p>If you enjoy solving problems, working with customers, and have the ability to produce clean, stable and functioning solutions, than DoxTek is excited to welcome you! </p> <p><em>Experience with Kofax Capture, KTA, and KTM products or any additional Imaging or Enterprise Content Management product knowledge is highly desired.</em> </p> <p><br></p> <p> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS</strong> </p> <p> Included, but not limited to: </p> <ul>  <li>Possess advanced knowledge of the Kofax and KTM product line and support (minimum of 3 years of experience with at least one of these platforms is required) </li>  <li>Possess strong analytical, integrative and problem solving-skills </li>  <li>Be organized enough and flexible enough to succeed in a performance-driven environment working on multiple projects simultaneously </li>  <li>Be comfortable in client-facing situations, connecting well with customers through great interpersonal skills, strong verbal skills and a customer-service orientation </li>  <li>Take full ownership of the work, accept feedback as an opportunity for improvement, and a passion for quality work delivered every time </li>  <li>Be able to travel and work extended hours as needed </li>  <li>Respond in a professional and timely manner to customer technical support issues via phone, web tools, or on-site </li>  <li>As needed diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve escalated customer support issues </li>  <li>Adhere to company procedures regarding the process of support ticket handling and reporting </li>  <li>Provide speedy and accurate feedback to customers </li>  <li>Have a working knowledge of VMWare, Microsoft Server, Microsoft SQL Server, and other platforms </li>  <li>Experience with ABBYY or other document capture products is a plus </li>  <li>Thrive in a team environment (both face to face and virtual) as a top notch contributor </li>  <li>Have the integrity to tell the truth no matter how bad it makes you or the company look </li>  <li> Be driven to deliver the highest quality solution in order to delight our customers </li>  <li>Relentlessly strive for improvement for DoxTek, our customers, and in your professional development… while having fun on the journey </li> </ul>
Title: Kofax Solutions Engineer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div>  <br/><div>Replicon is looking for software developers who are passionate about coding and technology to work on our Time Intelligence platform. Our SaaS application is used globally by thousands of customers and millions of users. We want to build out our team with more engineers who are also passionate about building great applications and care about giving our customers a great user experience.</div>   <br/><strong><div>What you need to bring:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Coding skills across the entire stack UI, Services and Data</li> <li>Familiarity with IaaS (AWS, Azure, GCP)</li> <li>A technology toolbelt that includes leading edge languages and tools with knowledge on when and why to use them</li> <li>You adopt industry best practices in all of your projects - TDD, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, linting</li> <li>You are pragmatic enough to deliver an MVP, but aspirational enough to think about how it will work with millions of users</li> <li>You take ownership and pride in everything you do and you will stand by what you deliver</li> <li>Readiness to hit the ground running you may not know how to solve everything right off the bat, but you will put in the time and effort to understand so that you can</li> </ul>  <strong><div>How we work:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>An agile development environment delivering functionality to production every day</li> <li>Team lunches, team events, flexible work environment</li> <li>A relentless desire to continuously improve</li></ul>
Title: Full Stack Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Title:</strong> Sales Engineer <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary <br/><br/> Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. <br/><br/> <strong>Role:</strong> <br/><br/> Splunk is seeking a highly motivated, results oriented individual to join our dynamic presales team. You will work together with Splunk’s direct sales team on the solution and technical aspects of selling Splunk’s solutions to our largest commercial Enterprise clients. Our clients span all business sectors and sizes. You'll be the subject matter expert for our team serving our customers and prospects in the Calgary region. <br/><br/> Would you like the opportunity to work at a fast-growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? You will have the responsibility for actively driving and leading the technology evaluation stage of the sales cycle. Working in conjunction with the sales team as the key technical advisor, you will be an advocate for Splunk’s products and services. Additionally, you will position Splunk's technology and solutions to both business and technical users. You will identify all technical issues of your assigned accounts to assure complete client satisfaction throughout the sales process, and establish and maintain positive relationships with your client's technical staff. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to demonstrate Splunk products and services to customers on site, remotely via webinar sessions, and at field events such as conferences and trade shows.</li><li>Experience responding to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs is also important.</li><li>Self-motivated with a proven track record in technical software sales and knowledge of technology.</li><li>Strong presentation skills and ability to communicate clearly to emails and RFPs when submitting reports.</li><li>Ability to be organized and analytical, and will be able to eliminate sales obstacles using creative and adaptive approaches.</li><li>Comfortable working for a dynamic technical organization with a fast growing customer base.</li><li><strong>IMPORTANT:</strong> We can teach you the technology, coach you on soft skills and educate you on processes. You should have a strong sense of <strong>self-motivation</strong>, an <strong>insatiable</strong> <strong>curiosity</strong> about what “is possible” with technology, the desire to work with an <strong>awesome</strong> <strong>team</strong> and a <strong>positive,</strong> <strong>fun-loving</strong> attitude.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years related experience in selling and supporting software products to IT organizations.</li><li>Knowledge of virtualization (VMware/Citrix/Hyper-V).</li><li>Network Administration/Architecture/Management Knowledge.</li><li>Unix/Windows – Administration Experience.</li><li>Domain expertise with IT operations, security or compliance.</li><li>Familiar with Computer Programming - C/C++, Shell, Perl, Python Programming.</li><li>Knowledge of “Big data” technologies (Map-Reduce, Hadoop, HBase, Cloudera, Cassandra).</li><li>Comfortable approaching total strangers and quickly extracting technical know-how from them.</li><li>Should be available to travel to visit prospects and customers.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Located in Calagary</li>  </ul> <strong>Education:</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor of Science degree in EE, CE, Computer Science, MIS, or Business. We’ll break the rules if you’re awesome. Liberal Arts majors/minors are great to see. We love individuals with a broad range of interests; art, science, research, writing, music, whatever you’re into. <br/><br/> Are you looking for an incredible place to work that celebrates innovation, leadership and creativity? Please contact us. Splunk offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits. When you join Splunk you'll be working with a team of smart people who are as passionate about our products as our customers' success. <br/><br/> We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.
Title: Sales Engineer

Job_Description: An Engineer/Technician will support the Engineering Team to efficiently maintain all hotel operations such that safety, security, conversation, and compliance are ensured at the highest levels.<br/><br/><strong>What will I be doing?</strong><br/><br/>As Engineer/Technician, you will support the Engineering Team to ensure that engineering and maintenance operations within the hotel, including general property maintenance energy conservation, are working properly and to standard. You are also responsible for the development of the Engineering Team and staying abreast of compliance regulations and procedures in the field of Engineering, as required for hotel standards. Specifically, an Engineer will perform the following tasks to the highest standards:  <ul> <li>Perform day-to-day routine and preventative maintenance within the hotel rooms</li> <li>Respond promptly and efficiently to any maintenance calls that arise</li> <li>Execute the preventative maintenance schedule and ensure all equipment and designated areas are maintained to the required standard</li> <li>Assist in the implementation of energy conservation program</li> <li>Recommend maintenance system improvements and energy savings</li> <li>Maintain all tools, equipment, and working areas in good condition</li> <li>Keep your technical training knowledge and skills up to date</LI> </ul>  <strong>What are we looking for?</strong><br/><br/>An Engineer/Technician serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow:  <ul> <li>Current working knowledge of general maintenance and engineering work</li> <li>Experience in the Maintenance Department of a hotel, hospital, ship, and/or restaurant complex or similar</li> <li>Strong work ethic</li> <li>A passion for delivering great customer service</li> <li>Ability to work without close supervision and within established timeframes</LI> </ul>  <strong>What will it be like to work for Hilton?</strong><br/><br/>Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Your future is just a click away. <br/> Ready - Set - LAUNCH!<br/>  <div> Title Industry Term Compensation</div> <div> Manufacturing Engineering Technologist HVAC, Plumbing and Heating Calgary $40,000 to $55,000</div> <br/><strong>Overview:</strong> <br/> Reports directly to the Technical Services Manager <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/> Make a personal commitment to consistently provide superior customer service to our Manufacturing customers so they will want to do repeat business with our company. <br/><br/> Review requests from Sales and Marketing for new products and improvements to existing products as approved by the Manager R&D. Identify specific product requirements, questions, and concerns. <br/><br/> Communicate with the Sales and Marketing staff to answer all questions or concerns and ultimately confirm all required specifications. <br/><br/> Develop concepts for the design and manufacture of new and improved products. <br/><br/> Meet with internal customers (Marketing, Production, Engineering, and Distribution) as required to discuss product concepts and manufacturing methods. Gather input to ensure the product is designed incorporating the best ideas that will meet specific external and internal customer requirements. <br/><br/> Review product design to ensure the product is functional, can be produced with high quality, and at the lowest cost possible. <br/><br/> Develop accurate cost estimates for new and improved products including special equipment and tooling and provide information on new product response forms to Sales and Marketing. <br/><br/> Complete product design using Solid Works, AutoCAD, and CNC Programming. <br/><br/> Design simple jigs and fixtures under the supervision of the Engineering and Machine Shop Manager. <br/><br/> Assist in developing technical catalogs, specification sheets and marketing tools for all manufactured products. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong><br/><br/>Apply  <br/>  <div> <div>© Launch Recruiting INC. | 403-615-3255 | info@launchrecruit.com</div></div> <br/>
