Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15286 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking a Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Manager, Operations Engineering, the successful candidate will coordinate and manage the Project Engineering team within the Operations Engineering group. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: <ul> <li>Working with the Manager, Operations Engineering to clearly establish project management processes, templates, and execution strategies for the project management team;</li><li>Accountable to manage projects from inception to completion of commissioning and turnover which will include coordination with Operations personnel, management of engineering resources (either internal or external), development and management of procurement and contract activities, management of construction execution teams and management of commissioning activities;</li><li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li><li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li><li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li><li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li><li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li><li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li><li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li><li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li><li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li><li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory and Environmental) group; and</li><li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation.;</li><li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li><li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design; engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li><li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li><li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America&apos;s energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers&apos; products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina&apos;s growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta&apos;s Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>
Title: Supervisor, Project Engineering

Job_Description: Reporting to the engineering manager through the Group Team Lead, The Senior Mechanical Engineer serves a key role in the central engineering team, providing expertise into the design, execution, commissioning and start-up for key capex projects, plus providing subject matter expert support to operations in a defined area of the manufacturing process. <br/><br/> As part of a capex implementation team, the Senior Mechanical engineer uses World Class Manufacturing (WCM) early equipment manufacturing (EEM) toolsets to implement and commission the processes, products and/or equipment in liaison with the manufacturing sites. <br/><br/> As a member of a subject matter expert group for an area of the manufacturing, the Senior Mechanical Engineer will provide guidance, support and training to the local manufacturing equivalent teams to ensure maximum, sustainable performance of the equipment and processes. <br/><br/> Role will function consistent with CertainTeed Gypsum Principle of Conduct and Action and the 5 Key Attitudes of Saint-Gobain. <br/><br/> <strong><u>ESSENTIAL DUTIES</u></strong> <br/><br/> <u>Capital Implementation team</u> <ul> 	 <li>Key member of capex implementation team; from design to installation, commissioning and start-up.</li> 	 <li>Fluent use of TPM methodologies (EEM, PM, AM, PD) to delivery Capex on time, on budget, at right customer expectation</li> 	 <li>Handle multiple projects concurrently.</li> 	 <li>Provide mechanical engineering input into equipment design and layout.</li> 	 <li>Hands-on installation and commissioning of new equipment, products and/or processes.</li> 	 <li>Detailed Design reviews, working with 3D models</li> 	 <li>Develop detailed design mechanical scope and detailed equipment specifications of process equipment, either individually or in collaboration with the capex team.</li> 	 <li>Develop and refine Automation Control Strategies and Narratives;</li> 	 <li>Translate technical information into operator training documents.</li> 	 <li>Work collaboratively with other engineering departments within CertainTeed and Saint-Gobain.</li> 	 <li>Train engineers, operators and tradespeople on new equipment/processes.</li> 	 <li>Work with plant teams to ensure capex project information is integrated into local plant management systems</li> 	 <li>Evaluation and selection of process equipment from competitive tenders to suit manufacturing best practices</li> 	 <li>Witness and approval of Factory Acceptance Testing of equipment and systems against clear criteria.</li> 	 <li>This role may require a person to rotate into a given plant for a defined period of time. Required agility to do this.</li>  </ul> <u>Subject Matter Expert Support</u> <ul> 	 <li>Provide mechanical engineering expertise as a member of a Subject Matter Expert (SME) group for a specified area of the plants.</li> 	 <li>Work interactively with Automation Engineer and Process Engineer as part of SME group.</li> 	 <li>Provide coaching, training and support to local plant teams in SME area.</li> 	 <li>Available to travel to plants at short notice to provide troubleshooting support</li> 	 <li>Provide guidance to optimize performance in SME area of plant.</li> 	 <li>Keep up to date with company best practices in SME area and disseminate.</li> 	 <li>Provide guidance on energy optimization within SME area.</li> 	 <li>Use of Focused Improvement (FI) tools within WCM framework</li> 	 <li>Provide input into Long Range Plans for improvements.</li>  </ul> <strong><u>OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</u></strong> <ul> 	 <li>Ensure CertainTeed Gypsum’s standards of safety, quality and reliability are built into process and equipment solutions utilizing WCM principles.</li> 	 <li>Technical support to our company Innovation platforms, implementation and refinement of necessary best practices, all while liaising with global company and industry experts.</li> 	 <li>Develop and encourage innovative processes and equipment concepts along with follow through to Return on Investments (ROI) patents and / or proprietary intellectual property when appropriate.</li> 	<li>In conjunction with Purchasing and Project staff, identify applicable bidders, evaluates competitive bids and assess Low Country Cost (LCC) potential.</li> </ul> <strong><u>WORKING CONDITIONS</u></strong> <br/><br/> Works in a manufacturing plant environment. Extensive travel up to 75% required. Exposure to industrial noise, dust, chemicals and temperature changes. Normal plant operation is 24 hours, 7 days a week and work hours may vary depending on business needs. May require long hours, and weekend and holiday work. Requires travel by air and rental cars globally, primarily within NA. <br/><br/> <strong><u>PHYSICAL DEMANDS</u></strong> <br/><br/> Must be able to spend a significant amount of time on plant floor. Job includes tasks that require walking, bending, twisting, gripping, stair and ladder climbing, entering confined spaces, navigating rough terrain and occasional lifting of up to 35 lbs. Job may require long periods of sitting, walking, standing, working on a computer or engaging in telephone conversation. Must be capable of wearing personal protective equipment necessary to comply with government and company safety standards whenever engineered methods of reducing hazards or physical requirements cannot be reasonably accommodated.
Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer -Western Canada

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>As a Journeyman Signals Electrician/Technician, you are responsible for the construction and maintenance of Traffic Signals, Communications and Light Rail Transit (LRT) Signal systems. Primary duties include:</strong></div><ul>	<li>	<div>Install, repair, clean and maintain LRT signals, communications and equipment.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Inspect and test the operation of gate crossings and switch machines.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Assemble, wire and test various LRT signal equipment.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Configure, test and wire traffic signal cabinets.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Troubleshoot, repair and maintain traffic signal equipment.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Make and implement timing changes, program controllers and conflict monitors.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Complete reports, update records, and assist in resolving issues arising from service requests.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Working Conditions:</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong> This position will perform work in an outdoor environment, with exposure to: various weather conditions, confined space, noise, LRT right of ways and roadways, and electrical hazards.</div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>A completed 2 year diploma in Electronics Technology; OR</div> </li>		<li>	<div>A valid Journeyman Electrician certificate, or equivalent as recognized by the Alberta Apprenticeship and Industry Training Board.</div></li>		<li>	<div>A minimum of 3 years’ experience as a Journey Electrician or as an Electronic Technician is preferred.</div></li>		<li>	<div>An International Municipal Signal Association (IMSA) Signal certification would be considered an asset.</div></li>		<li>	<div>A valid Full Class 5 Driver's Licence (or provincial equivalent), with no more than 6 demerits and no current suspensions or charges pending is required.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Knowledge of digital computers, microprocessors and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs).</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Familiarity with programming languages, and the ability to read and interpret civil and electrical plans.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Ability to read and interpret electronic and electrical schematic drawings is also required.</div></li>		<li>	<div>A valid Class 3 Driver's Licence with ‘Q’ endorsement will be considered an asset.</div></li>		<li>	<div>You demonstrate success in customer relations and are able to work well in a team environment.</div></li>	 </ul>  <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div><div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>Ability to obtain a City of Calgary operator's permit.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div>An offer of employment for this position will be conditional on an applicant passing a pre-employment drug test. Failure to pass a pre-employment drug test may prevent an applicant from being hired into any safety sensitive position for a period of up to 12 months.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div>Union: IBEW Local 254</div> <div>Business Unit: Roads</div></div> <div> <div>Position Type: 5 Temporary Positions (up to 2 years)</div> <div>Location: 840 32 Avenue N.E.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: $47.83 per hour (2017 rates)</div> <div>Days of Work: This position works a 5 day</div> <div>work week with 1 day off in a 2 week cycle.</div>  <div>Applicants must be available to work evenings, weekends,</div> <div>shift work, and overtime.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Non-standard 40 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 22, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Amendment: Position Type</div> <div>Job ID #: 300801</div></div> </div> </div><div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>
Title: Journeyman Signals Electrician/Technician - AMENDMENT

Job_Description: <div>Requisition Id: 15286 <br/><br/> Department: Operations Engineering Department <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is seeking a Supervisor, Project Engineering (Operations), to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Manager, Operations Engineering, the successful candidate will coordinate and manage the Project Engineering team within the Operations Engineering group. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  	<li>Working with the Manager, Operations Engineering to clearly establish project management processes, templates, and execution strategies for the project management team;</li> <li>Accountable to manage projects from inception to completion of commissioning and turnover which will include coordination with Operations personnel, management of engineering resources (either internal or external), development and management of procurement and contract activities, management of construction execution teams and management of commissioning activities;</li> <li>Development of PMO (Project Management Office) documents as required;</li> <li>Liaising with and coordinating project stakeholders to manage project scope, timing, resourcing, and execution;</li> <li>Working with the engineering team to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables;</li> <li>Working with the SCM (Supply Chain Management) team to coordinate procurement and contracts as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over;</li> <li>Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project;</li> <li>Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place;</li> <li>Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project;</li> <li>Coordinate as necessary with SPCC (Sherwood Park Control Center) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution;</li> <li>Consult and coordinate as necessary with the Pembina LARE (Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory and Environmental) group; and</li> <li>Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation.;</li> <li>A background in the mechanical trades is a definite asset;</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in project coordination between design; engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors;</li> <li>Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset; and</li> <li>Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning and project closeout.</li> </ul> <strong>No agency calls please.</strong> <br/><br/> Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. <br/><br/> Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. <br/><br/> Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. <br/><br/> Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. <br/><br/> Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. <br/><br/> ></div>  <br/>
Title: Supervisor, Project Engineering

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><br> At<strong> exp</strong>, we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life.</p>  <p><br> <strong> <br> Your Challenge</strong></p>  <p><strong> <br> Exp</strong> is currently seeking an Intermediate Environmental Engineer or Scientist in its Calgary office. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing Environmental investigation and Remediation support for exp in Calgary and the surrounding areas.</p>  <p><br> <strong> <br> Your Responsibilities</strong></p>  <p>The successful candidate will be responsible for:<br> •Conducting and managing a variety of environmental investigation projects (Phase I, II ESAs, Remediation);<br> •Project planning, implementation, fieldwork and reporting including preparing reports and documentation for Alberta Environment and Parks submissions;<br> •Participating and facilitating investigations pertaining to environmental incidents;<br> •Contributing to proposal writing and scoping;<br> •Involvement in provincial and/or federal contaminated sites assessments, site remediation, some risk assessments (human or ecological) or exposure control plans;<br> •Participating in projects for other technical disciplines (e.g. land development); and,<br> •Assisting project managers with scoping and budgeting for environmental work and being responsible for quality assurance of deliverables.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong> <br> The Skills, Knowledge, and Ability We Seek</strong></p>  <p><br>  <br> •Minimum of 6 years of environmental experience<br> •University degree in Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science, Hydrogeology or Geology<br> •Professional status or eligibility for professional status with a professional organization (i.e., APEGA, Alberta Institute of Agrologists, Alberta Society of Professional Biologists)<br> •Must have demonstrated project management experience<br> •Ability to deal tactfully and effectively with clients and co-workers<br> •Ability to work effectively in a high demand, fast paced environment<br> •Must have a valid driver’s license<br> •Strong written and communication skills</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What exp Can Offer</strong></p>  <p> <br> With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, <strong>exp</strong> provides professional, technical and strategic advisory services related to the world's built and natural environments in six key practice areas: Buildings, Earth & Environment, Energy, Industrial, Infrastructure, and Sustainability. Our heritage dates back to 1906, and today more than 3,300 creative professionals across North America and the globe provide the expertise and experience needed to deliver successful projects for clients.</p>  <p> <br> Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it's a promise we take seriously.<br>  <br> Join a dynamic team at <strong>exp </strong>that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what <strong>exp</strong> has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>#LI-AO1</p>  <p> </p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Intermediate Environmental Engineer or Scientist

Job_Description: <STRONG><U>Job Opportunity</U></STRONG> <br/><br/> <STRONG>POSITION:</STRONG> <STRONG>Field Sales Engineer</STRONG> <br/> <STRONG>REPORTS TO: Field Engineering Manager</STRONG> <br/> <STRONG>DIVISION: Global Tools & Storage</STRONG><DIV><STRONG>LOCATION: Home Office, BC</STRONG> </DIV>  <br/><strong><U>SUMMARY:</U></STRONG></strong> <br/> The Field Sales Engineer is responsible for generating new business and ensuring growth of existing accounts through the attainment of specification of company products and technical support for "DEWALT Engineered by Powers" products in the territory. <br/><br/> <strong><U>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</U></STRONG></strong>  <ul> <LI>Develop a strong technical understanding of Powers products and how they are used in construction and how they are designed in accordance with current building codes</LI> <LI>Establish relationship with key specifying firms in the territory.</LI> <LI>Influence designers, architects and engineers to specify "DEWALT Engineered by Powers" products through regular scheduled visits and communication</LI> <LI>Assess potential application of company products and offer solutions to meet customer needs</LI> <LI>Hold regular technical presentations and training seminars for design professionals related to the design of Powers products with a focus on testing details, product performance, characteristics, applications and limitations in order to achieve specification</LI> <LI>Use technical knowledge of products to support and build sales on specification and conversion in conjunction with local sales team and provide technical job-site support as needed</LI> <LI>Provide assistance on proprietary technical software to clients and communicate customer feedback for future product developments</LI> <LI>Support local sales efforts from a technical level – including jobsite visits</LI> <LI>Research and present reports showing potential customers the cost benefit of purchasing company products</LI> <LI>Develop and maintain client records.</LI> </ul>  <strong><U>SELECTION STANDARDS REQUIRED:</U></STRONG></strong>  <ul> <LI>Bachelor of Science in Engineering (Civil, Structural or Mechanical) or equivalent qualifications</LI><LI>Professional Engineering (P. ENG) license preferred</LI> <LI>Minimum 2 years’ experience in engineering or technical position or technical sales role</LI> <LI>Previous experience in the fastening or building construction industry preferred.</LI><LI>Impeccable communication skills – both spoken and written – mandatory</LI> <LI>Able to handle multiple priorities, organize, plan, and meet difficult deadlines, and multi-task in a fast-paced environment</LI> <LI>Strong Interpersonal, negotiation, follow-up, and documentation skills</LI> <LI>Working knowledge of computer applications including MS Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)</LI> <LI>Able to make group presentations</LI> <LI>High energy, self-starter, and goal-oriented eager to meet and exceed goals and targets</LI> <LI>Outgoing, self-starter, ability to manage own schedule and work as “home-based”</LI> <LI>Technical sales experience a plus</LI> <LI>Construction jobsite experience a plus.</LI> </ul>  <STRONG><EM>***Stanley Black & Decker Canada Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equity in employment. ***</EM></STRONG>
Title: Field Sales Engineer

Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year , we who provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Responsible for design and coordination work and leading civil task forces as assigned. Independently applies advances engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work is performed with minimal supervision and this position has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Directing Engineers and Designers</li><li>Supervising engineering design and drafting activities</li><li>Interfacing with client, project personnel and attending project meetings</li><li>Evaluating civil/structural deliverables and manpower requirements</li><li>Mentoring less experienced employees</li><li>Providing technical direction and decision making on designs for foundations, structural steel, reinforced concrete, earthwork and site drainage</li><li>Developing, monitoring and controlling project schedules</li><li>Preparing and monitoring progress reports</li><li>Preparing cost estimates for bids and proposals</li><li>Evaluating developmental performance of staff</li><li>Organizing and maintaining departmental design guidelines</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Recognized Bachelor's degree in Civil/Structural Engineering required</li><li>12-15 years' of relevant experience required</li><li>Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills required</li><li>Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills required</li><li>Experience with structural engineering software such as STAAD, and S-Frame preferred</li><li>Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.
Title: Principal Civil Engineer

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment under the supervision of more senior engineers and leads.</li><li>Perform system requirements analysis</li><li>Perform system design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Define SAFe Capabilities and Features</li><li>Prepare and review system specifications, system design documents, and interface design documents</li><li>Provide design information to hardware and software engineers implementing the system</li><li>Prepare and review test plans, procedures and results</li><li>Identifying defects, resolving issues and verification</li><li>Support the change management process as the system design evolves</li><li>Documenting the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Planning of activities/tasks for each design iteration</li><li>Reporting progress against plans</li> </ul> Required Experience: <br/><br/> Experience is required in a number of the following areas: <ul> <li>Disciplined approach to system engineering with knowledge of the full system life cycle.</li><li>Experience with model based design tools (PTC Integrity Modeler in particular) and SysML.</li><li>DOORS Requirements Management</li><li>Rational Team Concert</li><li>Tactical Communications and Networking Systems</li><li>Information Management Systems</li><li>Voice and Multimedia</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills.</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work.</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision.</li><li>Experience with Agile product development methods</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: System Engineer (Contract)

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> As an Exploitation Engineer with the Thermal In Situ Oil Sands division, you have an opportunity to influence the overall success of Thermal operations at Canadian Natural as you use your demonstrated skills and experience to contribute to the development of strategic project plans to assist the team in reaching thermal production targets through the use of CSS, SAGD, steam flooding and other thermal technologies as required. In this role, your value focused work style and ability to integrate efficiently and effectively with a multi-discipline team will present many opportunities to advance your career in an exciting new industry and in a company dedicated to developing leaders. </p>  <p><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES - BENEFITS!</strong></p>  <p><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br>  • Work in a team environment to create development plans and strategies for specific in-situ projects<br>  • Create depletion and development scenarios then review the economic impacts to maximize the net present value (NPV) of the projects<br>  • Monitor production analogs to assess the impact of past operating experience on future development plans<br>  • Develop and optimize short term, annual and long-term forecasts for reservoir performance <br>  • Develop a project justification for senior management approval<br>  • Evaluate potential acquisitions and/or joint venture deals<br>  • Assist in developing regulatory applications for projects<br>  • Provide reservoir engineering support to the project execution team during the construction phase of the project<br>  • Calculate, maintain and ensure the accuracy and integrity of the corporate reserves<br>  • Participate in the development and execution of a long term growth strategy for the company’s assets that maximizes value for our shareholders</p>  <p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS: </strong><br>  • Typically 5+ years of related industry experience with B.Sc. in Engineering<br>  • Registration or eligibility for registration with APEGA<br>  • Familiarity with and understanding of the following:<br>  o CSS: steam strategies, pressure management, depletion optimization, and drive-mechanism fundamentals<br>  o SAGD: start-up procedures, conformance management, flow control devices, modelling, and depletion <br>  o Thermal EOR: NCG/solvent co-injection processes<br>  o Economic evaluations and exposure to field operations<br>  o Microsoft Office Suite</p>  <p>To see related Exploitation/Reservoir Engineering roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Engineering-Exploitation-Reservoir</p>  <p><strong>Our Thermal In Situ Oil Sands Operations</strong><br> Canadian Natural’s oil sands assets offer professionals with proven expertise an unparalleled opportunity to enhance those skills in a wide variety of projects throughout the Athabasca and Cold Lake Oil Sands areas. Your initiative as a self-starter will be maximized inside our defined growth plan strategy by utilizing leading edge CSS and SAGD technologies on long term projects to capture the value in our vast portfolio of assets. Your innovation is welcomed at Canadian Natural. </p>  <p><strong>About Canadian Natural </strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.<br> Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Exploitation Engineer - Thermal

Job_Description: <div><div>  <div>  <div><strong>POSITION OPEN:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Samsung Sales Engineering Manager</strong></div> <div><strong>EMPLOYEE TYPE:</strong> <br/><br/> Full-time</div> <div><strong>OVERVIEW:</strong> <br/><br/> The Sales Engineer is responsible for pre & post-sales support for B2B customers. The primary responsibility is to ensure a best-in-class deployment experience for customers migrating to Samsung optimized enterprise solutions. This role will also function as an overall technical SME on Samsung mobile devices, MDM partners and provide deep dive technical training and competitive analysis.</div> <div><strong>POSITION DESCRIPTION:</strong> <br/><br/> ​  <ul>   <li>Responsible for pre-sales technical support in full sales cycle including discovery, opportunity evaluation, pilot support, and opportunity closure in both Enterprise and SMB accounts.</li>   <li>Coordinates solutions design with Sales team, Product team, and Solution providers to ensure accuracy and feasibility</li>  <li>Conduct Proof of Concept evaluations to implement solutions to demonstrate the ability to meet client objectives including, full management of the PoC process and reporting.</li>   <li>Responsible for staying up to date on all the technical aspects of Samsung Enterprise solutions, with a sharp focus on Samsung Knox.</li>  <li>Responsible for building a tight relationship with Samsung’s Key Knox MDM partners with a focus on migration from competing platforms.</li>  <li>Close collaboration with various internal Samsung B2B sales teams, (Direct, Carrier, and Channel) will be necessary to ensure alignment with stated sales goals and strategies.</li>  <li>Establish relationships with the various internal and external resources needed to deliver best in class experiences when deploying Samsung optimized solutions.</li>  <li>Deliver technical presentations, training, demos and product overviews and deep-dives on product features. Can include participation in events (i.e. Tradeshow/Channel recruitment and training).</li>   <li>Manage a large volume of pre/post sales technical issues with a focus on challenges arising from customers migrating onto Samsung Optimized solutions.</li>  <li>Document technical issue resolutions, known issues, root cause analysis, troubleshooting details in a comprehensive Knowledge Base.</li>  <li>Logging activities and maintaining prospect’s technical profile in CRM.</li>   <li>Providing regular reports on account activities (account visits, calls, etc.).</li>   <li>Develop and maintain expert-level knowledge of Samsung’s B2B product and service offerings.</li>  <li>Attends company trainings to stay abreast of the latest internal technologies and product line developments.</li>   <li>Keeps informed of latest industry news, trends, products, services, competitors and relevant existing and emerging technologies.</li>  <li>Frequent travel to partner/customer facilities, remote facilities, industry events, and trade shows more than 30 to 50% of time.</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div><strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Have 5 - 7+ years of experience in mobile solution sales and support with a technical/engineering background preferred.</li>   <li>Have 5 - 7+ years of experience working in the enterprise sales space with exposure to multiple industry verticals preferred.</li>  <li>Minimum 3 years previous technical sales support experience or equivalent, preferably for both SAAS and enterprise, on-premise technology solutions preferred.</li>  <li>Must have experience working with external vendors in multiple industry verticals.</li>  <li>Demonstrated experience with deployment of complex technical solutions in a large enterprise environment.</li>  <li>Detailed technical knowledge of the wireless industry to include mobile hardware (Smartphones and Tablets), applications (OS and End-user Apps) and services.</li>   <li>Deep understanding of the integration of mobile solutions into corporate network environments and email platforms, mainly Microsoft Exchange and Lotus Notes.</li>   <li>Efficient in troubleshooting application, device, and network communications</li>   <li>Must be able to write, read, analyze, interpret, present, and explain mobile technical products and development materials.</li>   <li>A Knowledge of BES, MobileIron, Airwatch, SAP, Citrix, SOTI, MaaS360e and other MDM solutions a must.</li>  <li>Understanding of web applications and their architecture and design</li>   <li>Knowledge of Application stores and the associated enterprise customer requirements a plus.</li>   <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business or Engineering from accredited college or university.</li>   <li>Experience with wireless network configuration and troubleshooting preferred</li>   <li>Must have experience with Microsoft Standard Office Suite and extensive use of presentation software within a Windows/NT LAN/WAN network environment.</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div><strong>BENEFITS:</strong> <br/><br/> Premium offers a competitive salary along with a full benefits package including health, dental, vision, life insurance, long-term disability, and paid time off. All supplementary benefits and employment practices are in compliance with all Canadian employment laws.</div> <div><strong>COMPANY:</strong> <br/><br/> Premium has been pioneering bold strategies, tools and technologies since 1985 with a single goal: to help our partners advance their industries and the lives of their consumers. <br/><br/> Experts in strategy, merchandising, brand advocacy and support, we employ a tailored approach to answering each client's unique business needs. Together with our clients, we're inventing and leading a new era in retail, moving forward by moving beyond what's expected.</div><br/>   <div><strong>PREMIUM CAREERS:</strong> <br/><br/> Retail experience? Check. An unbeatable work ethic? Check. A burning desire to be part of a team delivering results for a cutting-edge roster of clients? Check. You just might be Premium. <br/><br/> Propel brands to new heights with integrity and imagination. Join our team and be the next big thing.</div><br/>   <div>Premium is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we will accommodate your needs under the Human Rights Code. Upon individual request, hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact the Human Resources Department for assistance. Due to the high volume of applicants, only those moving forward in the next step of the selection process will be contacted.</div> </div>  </div>  </div><div></div>
Title: Samsung Sales Engineering Manager

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/><strong>SNC-Lavalin, a Tier1 Canadian Engineering & Construction company with presence in all corners of the globe, are currently seeking to identify the availability of highly qualified candidates for a potential Oil & Gas EPC mega-project that may be constructed in a remote region of the Middle East. Still in the early stages of development and qualification, this project will require a large and highly skilled team of people who will be hand-selected based on their professional experience and past working history on similar projects. We require candidates in all Disciplines to support the Detailed Engineering and Procurement stage of the project that may be executed out of our Western Operations centre in downtown Calgary. SNC-Lavalin invites candidates with specific experience in engineering, procurement, and construction of Gas Processing facilities (Separation, Storage, Compression, Treatment, Sulphur Recovery, U&O) in the Middle East, and for Clients specific to that region, to submit their Resume for our review. Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada, and only candidates with experience specific to this region and its associated Clients will be considered.</strong><br/><br/><strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
Title: Project Engineer

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems-Canada is staffing for an exciting opportunity to deliver a world class secure next-generation communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom (UK). General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with GDMS-UK to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> The project includes all phases including System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. The project will be a multi-site development project with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the greater GDMS- International business area. Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 7/10 laptops and for key hardware products running Linux, also developed by General Dynamics Mission Systems-Canada. <br/><br/> Within an Agile team, the successful candidate will hold a test verification & integration role, assisting in the design, execution and reporting of combined software and hardware level test and integration related activities. The successful candidate will act as the test and integration specialist within the agile team and assist in the development of cross-functional team capabilities. The candidate will be exposed to test activities ranging from validation of custom kernel modules, deployment and verification of services such as DNS, and complex routing protocols, and the design and implementation of complete automated test environments. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>Work with the Agile product owner to develop test scenarios which meet feature level acceptance criteria</li><li>Contribute to the cross functional skillset within the Agile team, acting as a product integration and test professional. Assist the development of the team by cross-training developers with test case design and execution.</li><li>Work to develop automation environments that support a continuous integration environment</li><li>Execute tests – implement configurations to effectively and efficiently perform the procedures; define any special equipment settings; gather data and document as required</li><li>Troubleshoot – analyze and interpret data to identify errors in behavior, identify root cause, and make use of tools and resources available to debug and investigate</li><li>Prepare reports and supporting documentation for all tests and performance measures to demonstrate progress and communicate these with other team members as required</li><li>Assist with engineering peer reviews of technical documentation, test plans and procedures</li><li>Conduct himself/herself professionally in all meetings, activities and when included in customer attended events</li><li>Able to deal with a highly educated multi-disciplinary team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment</li> </ul> Required skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Demonstrated initiative, willingness to learn and continued personal development</li><li>Demostrated excellent communications skills (written and verbal)</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Minimum of 2 years experience with testing software in a Linux operating system (kernel 4.X) and Windows Operating system (e.g, Windows 7-10)</li><li>Minimum 2 years experience with software integration and/or software qualification activiites including own test planning, procedure writing, manual and automated testing</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Previous experience with testing in Agile or Disciplined Agile environments</li><li>Familiarity with the principles of tactical mobile communication systems; familiarity with these in military systems and subsystems development, an asset</li><li>An understanding of the 7 layers of the ISO network model</li><li>Exposure to transport layer protocols like UDP and TCP</li><li>Exposure to network layer protocols like ICMP, IGMP, IPv4, IPv6</li><li>Exposure to routing protocols like IS-IS, RIP, OSPF, BGPv4, multicast and unicast routing</li><li>Experience with network test tools such as IXIA and Wireshark</li><li>Experience with scripting languages such as bash, python and powershell</li><li>Exposure to test automation tools like Robot Framework</li><li>Virtualization/Emulation environments: VirtualBox, Xen Server, CORE, QEMU, KVM</li><li>Source code control through GIT</li><li>Experience with the any of the following tools, or their equivalent, is highly desirable:</li><li>Ubuntu Linux desktop and terminal</li><li>Experience in troubleshooting transport layer network protocols</li><li>Enterprise Architect, Artisan or Rational Rose</li><li>SVN / GIT</li><li>Microsoft Visio and Office Suite products</li> </ul> Education/Training: <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical/scientific degree. Candidates with diplomas will be considered with adequate additional experience.</li><li>APEGA P.Eng or ASET P.Tech(Eng.) accreditation, or eligible to obtain that accreditation.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> Limited international travel may be required for this role. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Systems Integration Test Engineering Specialist - EvO (P2)

Job_Description: <div><div>  <div><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong></div><div>You will be part of a team responsible for ongoing development and implementation of our Pipeline and Pressure Equipment Integrity Management Programs within our Western Canadian Operations.</div><br/>  <div><strong>This position is based in Calgary, Alberta.</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES - BENEFITS - RELOCATION</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>H​OW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong></div>  <li>Identify and mitigate integrity threats by technically supporting field integrity staff via root cause analysis, fitness-for-service evaluations, risk based inspections, material selection and other risk management processes.</li> <li>Develop a solid understanding of static equipment design and operational processes in units / plants / batteries / pipelines installations</li> <li>Develop a comprehensive understanding of all existing and potential degradation mechanisms and hazards (i.e. “Asset Integrity Threats”) and ensure they are effectively and appropriately communicated to other Asset Integrity team members, Operations, Production, Engineering, and Management</li> <li>Proactively analyze inspection results, failure investigation findings, risk assessment results, and process conditions to ensure that key degradation mechanisms are understood and that appropriate mitigation and monitoring techniques are in place</li>  <div><strong>• Work with other Asset Integrity team members, Operations, Production, Engineering, and Management to deliver effective Asset Integrity Management programs that address all Asset Integrity Threats. Such programs include but are not limited to:</strong></div><div> o Corrosion control programs</div><br/>  <div> o Inspection programs</div><br/>  <div> o Monitoring programs</div><br/>  <div> o Metallurgical upgrades</div><br/>  <div> o Design/process changes</div><br/>  <div> o Detection and measurement systems</div>  <li>Become the owner and driver of Asset Integrity Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) for which your supervisor has deemed you to be the accountable person</li> <li>Act as the key technical contact for support requests related to corrosion and materials engineering</li> <li>Apply risk assessment methodologies to ensure Canadian Natural’s assets remain at a tolerable level with respect to safety, environmental impact, compliance, reliability, and economic loss</li>  <strong><div>QUALIFICATIONS:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Materials or Mechanical Engineering Degree with at least 3 years related experience or a Materials or Mechanical Engineering Technology Diploma with at least 6 years related experience</li> <li>Registered or eligible for registration with APEGA or ASET</li>  <div><strong>• Familiarity with and understanding of:</strong></div><div> o Corrosion and degradation prevention strategies</div><br/>  <div> o Metallurgy and materials selection</div><br/>  <div> o Pipeline Integrity management</div><br/>  <div> o Failure analysis</div><br/>  <div> o Fitness for service evaluation</div><br/>  <div> o Pressure Equipment Integrity programs and International standards (ASME)</div><br/>  <div> o Risk-based inspections</div><br/>  <div> o Non-destructive inspection techniques used in the oil & gas industry</div><br/>  <div><strong>• Certification in the following are considered assets:</strong></div><div> o NACE Senior Corrosion Technologist</div><br/>  <div> o NACE Senior Internal Corrosion Technologist</div><br/>  <div> o API 579, API 580, API 571, API 510, API 570</div><br/>  <div> o National Board Commission</div><br/>  <div>To see related Asset Integrity Engineering roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Engineering-Asset-Integrity</div><br/>  <div><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong> </div><br/>  <div>At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</div><br/>  <div><strong>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</strong></div></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Asset Integrity Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22207 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, engineering, strategy and operations services, you will develop, implement, and sustain enterprise-wide sourcing strategies and their corresponding commercial arrangements for engineering procurement (EP) and construction services across Suncor. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Develop and maintain a detailed knowledge of the EP and construction sub-categories</li><li>Consolidate sub-category demand for services at the site and enterprise level</li><li>Lead the development and implementation of supply strategies as well as the optimized tactical solutions for the provision of EP and/or construction services</li><li>Evaluate and develop recommendations for the commercial structures of contracts for EP and construction services with both new and existing contractors</li><li>Develop, negotiate, and draft commercial agreements for the provision of goods and services consistent with articulated supply strategies</li><li>Ensure contractors consistently deliver goods and services that meet business requirements and drive value for Suncor through the contractor performance management process</li><li>Ensure effective roll-out of negotiated terms and conditions to respective peers and business units</li><li>Monitor and collaborate to manage potential contractor cost, availability, product quality and reliability risks to Suncor’s businesses</li><li>Manage strategic supplier relationships</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>10 years or more of related industry experience, preferably in supporting projects and commercial operations in engineering, construction, maintenance, and remediation</li><li>Extensive experience with the execution of strategy development, contract formation and administration duties of complex EP and construction contracts on large/medium sized projects.</li><li>General understanding of power generation, oil sands mining/bitumen production, upgrading and refining processes</li><li>Post-secondary degree in business, economics, law or engineering</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Excellent knowledge of the entire project lifecycle, from strategy development and execution through to completion and close out</li><li>Advanced commercial and negotiation skills with the ability to influence and lead others</li><li>Ability to manage risks and make timely decisions</li><li>You possess exceptional communication skills both verbal and written</li><li>Superior analytical, business and financial acumen; you are able to balance both technical and commercial issues that arise</li><li>You are results oriented and able to drive both execution and accountability</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position is located in Calgary, Alberta</li><li>Minimal travelling could be required within Canada and the U.S.</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals

Job_Description: Reporting to the engineering manager through the Group Team Lead, The Senior Process Engineer serves a key role in the central engineering team, providing expertise into the design, execution, commissioning and start-up for key capex and industrialization projects, plus subject matter expert support to operations in a defined area of the manufacturing process. <br/><br/> As part of a capex implementation team, the Senior Process engineer uses World Class Manufacturing (WCM) early equipment manufacturing (EEM) toolsets to implement and commission the processes, products and/or equipment in liaison with the manufacturing sites. <br/><br/> As a member of a subject matter expert group for an area of the manufacturing, the Senior Process Engineer will provide guidance, support and training to the local manufacturing equivalent teams to ensure maximum, sustainable performance of the equipment and processes. <br/><br/> Role will function consistent with CertainTeed Gypsum Principle of Conduct and Action and the 5 Key Attitudes of Saint-Gobain. <br/><br/> <strong><u>ESSENTIAL DUTIES</u></strong> <br/><br/> <u>Capital Implementation team</u> <ul> 	 <li>Key member of capex implementation team; from design to installation, commissioning and start-up.</li> 	 <li>Fluent use of TPM methodologies (EEM, PM, AM, PD) to delivery CAPEX on time, on budget, at right customer expectation</li> 	 <li>Handle multiple projects concurrently.</li> 	 <li>Provide process engineering input into equipment design and layout.</li> 	 <li>Hands-on installation and commissioning of new equipment, products and/or processes.</li> 	 <li>Works closely with Technical department on the industrialization of new products and processes</li> 	 <li>Works closely with the Technical department to align the needs of the products to the process equipment engineering and specifications.</li> 	 <li>Links with R&D for the industrialization of new products and processes.</li> 	 <li>Detailed Design reviews, working with 3D models</li> 	 <li>Develop detailed design process scope and detailed equipment specifications of process equipment, either individually or in collaboration with the capex team.</li> 	 <li>Work collaboratively with other engineering departments within CertainTeed and Saint-Gobain.</li> 	 <li>Develop and refine Automation Control Strategies and Narratives</li> 	 <li>Translate technical information into operator training documents.</li> 	 <li>Train engineers, operators and tradespeople on new equipment/processes.</li> 	 <li>Work with plant teams to ensure capex project information is integrated into local plant management systems</li> 	 <li>Evaluation and selection of process equipment from competitive tenders to suit manufacturing best practices</li> 	 <li>Witness and approval of Factory Acceptance Testing of equipment and systems against clear criteria.</li> 	 <li>This role may require a person to rotate into a given plant for a fixed period of time. Required agility to do this.</li>  </ul> <u>Subject Matter Expert Support</u> <ul> 	 <li>Provide mechanical engineering expertise as a member of a Subject Matter Expert (SME) group for a specified area of the plants.</li> 	 <li>Develops baseline fundamental knowledge of equipment function and operation in relation to maximizing product performance.</li> 	 <li>Work interactively with Automation Engineer and Process Engineer as part of SME group.</li> 	 <li>Provide coaching, training and support to local plant teams in SME area.</li> 	 <li>Available to travel to plants at short notice to provide troubleshooting support</li> 	 <li>Provide guidance to optimize performance in SME area of plant.</li> 	 <li>Keep up to date with company best practices in SME area and disseminate.</li> 	 <li>Provide guidance on energy optimization within SME area.</li> 	 <li>Use of Focused Improvement (FI) tools within WCM framework</li> 	 <li>Provide input into Long Range Plans for improvements.</li>  </ul> <strong><u>OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</u></strong> <ul> 	 <li>Ensure CertainTeed Gypsum’s standards of safety, quality and reliability are built into process and equipment solutions utilizing WCM principles.</li> 	 <li>Technical support to our company Innovation platforms, implementation and refinement of necessary best practices, all while liaising with global company and industry experts.</li> 	 <li>Develop and encourage innovative processes and equipment concepts along with follow through to Return on Investments (ROI) patents and / or proprietary intellectual property when appropriate.</li> 	 <li>In conjunction with Purchasing and Project staff, identify applicable bidders, evaluates competitive bids and assess Low Country Cost (LCC) potential.</li> 	 <li>Other duties and projects as required.</li>  </ul> <strong><u>WORKING CONDITIONS</u></strong> <br/><br/> Works in a manufacturing plant environment. Extensive travel up to 75% required. Exposure to industrial noise, dust, chemicals and temperature changes. Normal plant operation is 24 hours, 7 days a week and work hours may vary depending on business needs. May require long hours, and weekend and holiday work. Requires travel by air and rental cars globally, primarily within NA. <br/><br/> <strong><u>P<u>HYSICAL DEMANDS</u></u></strong> <br/><br/> Must be able to spend a significant amount of time on plant floor. Job includes tasks that require walking, bending, twisting, gripping, stair and ladder climbing, entering confined spaces, navigating rough terrain and occasional lifting of up to 35 lbs. Job may require long periods of sitting, walking, standing, working on a computer or engaging in telephone conversation. Must be capable of wearing personal protective equipment necessary to comply with government and company safety standards whenever engineered methods of reducing hazards or physical requirements cannot be reasonably accommodated.
Title: Senior Process Engineer Western Canada

Job_Description: Your Opportunity<br/><br/>Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system. <br/><br/> Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential. <br/><br/> Stantec’s Calgary office is seeking an Intermediate<strong> Civil Engineer</strong> to join our Water group.<br/><br/>Your Duties<br/><br/>Key Responsibilities include: <br/><br/> <strong> <ul>   <li>Civil engineering planning and design for:</li>  </strong>   <ul>   <li>Municipal conveyance infrastructure (potable water distribution, sanitary and storm sewer systems, and related components)</li> <li>Site grading designs</li> <li>Site development plans</li></ul>  </ul>    <ul>   <li>Contract document preparation, including detailed design drawings and specifications</li> <li>Construction contract administration and site inspection services</li> <li>Assisting with managing projects, administering contracts and controlling budgets.</li> <li>Assisting with coordination of design teams (Project Engineers and Drafting Personnel) and various discipline professionals.</li> <li> Assisting with proposal writing and business development initiatives</li> </ul>  Your Capabilities and Credentials<br/><br/>The successful candidate will possess the following:  <ul>   <li>Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil Engineering.</li> <li>Minimum of 6 years of consulting experience, primarily in municipal infrastructure (conveyance of water, storm and wastewater.)</li> <li>Registered with APEGA as an Engineer (P.Eng.)</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>Desire to learn and grow in your career.</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate Civil Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div>  <div><strong>YOUR OPPPORTUNITY:</strong></div><div>You will be responsible for the management of thermal well integrity across CNRL’s thermal development projects, including root cause failure analysis, working with internal and external stakeholders and stewarding the execution of thermal well integrity protocols. The goal of the role is to help increase annual production and reduce workover costs by decreasing the number of well failures.</div><br/>  <div>You will be an effective interface between Calgary-based production engineers and field operating staff, as well as the Well Servicing organization; to provide technical guidance in various casing integrity log interpretations and analyses; and integrity data management and analysis expertise. Additionally, the candidate is expected to act as a technical specialist in production technology and engineering aspects of thermal well operations and design.</div><br/>  <div><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong></div>  <li>Owner of the CNRL thermal Well Integrity Protocols. Manage periodic updates of the documents as required</li> <li>Assist with field operations related to well integrity, including guidance in various inspection activities</li> <li>Monitor technologies being used for well integrity, qualify new technologies for internal use and gain stakeholder alignment</li> <li>Provide leadership in well failure / root cause analyses related to well / completion integrity</li> <li>Fulfill the role of CNRL's AER contact on thermal well integrity issues / clarifications</li> <li>Prepare & present annual D54 well integrity presentation to the AER</li> <li>Prepare & present periodic internal well integrity updates</li> <li>Thermal well design and construction support</li> <li>Development of a well integrity data storage protocol / system</li> <li>Mentor junior engineers on aspects of well integrity and production-related challenges</li> <li>Improve well operating life through innovative approaches to existing operating practices</li>  <strong><div>QUALIFICATIONS:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>10+ years related oilfield experience, preferably with an asset integrity and/or well completions background</li> <li>Thermal production engineering experience (ideally 8+ years)</li> <li>Engineering degree and registration with APEGA is an asset</li> <li>Familiar with metallurgy, materials, failure analysis techniques, well design and well construction practices as applied in thermal recovery projects</li> <li>Innovative approaches to problem solving or troubleshooting will be beneficial to the candidate, both from technical and organizational points of view.</li>  <div>To see related Mechanical Engineering roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Engineering-Mechanical</div><br/>  <div><strong>Our Thermal In Situ Oil Sands Operations</strong></div><br/>  <div>Canadian Natural’s oil sands assets offer professionals with proven expertise an unparalleled opportunity to enhance those skills in a wide variety of projects throughout the Athabasca and Cold Lake Oil Sands areas. Your initiative as a self-starter will be maximized inside our defined growth plan strategy by utilizing leading edge CSS and SAGD technologies on long term projects to capture the value in our vast portfolio of assets. Your innovation is welcomed at Canadian Natural.</div><br/>  <div><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong> </div><br/>  <div>At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</div><br/>  <div>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</div></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Well Integrity Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Project Manager, Engineering-</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Calgary, AB or Port Coquitlam, BC</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Director, Engineering, the Senior Project Manager, Engineering is accountable for successful completion of various capital projects while providing technical support and guidance in troubleshooting plant equipment and service issues. This position provides diligence, rigour, cost control and effective project management skills to deliver successful execution of major capital projects ranging in value from $5K-$2M. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Accountable for leading efforts to drive continuous improvement with regards to engineering and capital projects within multiple facilities.</li> <li>Manage various capital projects at our Port Coquitlam plant, Abbotsford plant and Hatchery from concept through to commissioning including budget preparation, cost tracking and negotiating with vendors.</li><li>Participate in the development of long term capital plan to support plant reliability and future growth.</li><li>Working with the plant managers and their teams, assess and prioritize process/project opportunities and manage it from beginning through to completion.</li><li>Provide technical support and guidance in troubleshooting plant equipment and services.</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Post-Secondary Degree in Engineering, Mechanical Engineering preferred;</li><li>A minimum of 10 years of progressive engineering/technical experience in a manufacturing environment Minimum of 5 years’ experience in managing capital projects;</li><li>Experience in food manufacturing is required, meat manufacturing preferred;</li><li>Excellent organization and project management skills including planning, scheduling, assigning, budgeting and managing;</li><li>Travel is required</li>  </ul> <strong>Build your career, apply today!</strong>
Title: Senior Project Manager, Engineering- Port Coquitlam
