Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing Firmware Engineers from junior to senior level for award of a new contract to deliver a world class Tactical Communication and Information System (TacCIS) to a new customer. Our Canadian team will be partnered to deploy a vehicle installed with field-proven TacCIS architecture and system components which is cost effective, modular and scalable to support different vehicle variant roles.The vehicle TacCIS provides the vehicle crew with intercom and radio voice services and is capable of transmitting high-speed Position Awareness (PA), Command & Control (C2) and sensor data on the move as a component of a larger Battalion-level TacCIS. <br/><br/> The project will involve participation from System Design, Software and Platform Design, System Integration, and System Validation domain stakeholders. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning groups across General Dynamics Mission Systems-International.The firmware development team will be primarily focused on evolving and customizing existing Ethernet Local Area Network domain firmware to be applied to the customer requirements. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <ul> <li>Assisting and supporting lead engineers and team members</li> <li>Performing some basic design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Documenting the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Participate in integrated team activities with System Engineering, Development and System Integration</li><li>Developing and performing tests and debug of code</li><li>Identifying defects, resolving issues and verification</li><li>Supporting and performing system level test and integration efforts</li><li>Participating in code reviews</li><li>All other duties as required</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Able to apply problem solving skills to daily activities</li><li>Experience developing system software</li><li>Experience in programming in C/C++</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Excellent communication and time management skills</li><li>Strong problem solving and root cause analysis skills</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willingness to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li> </ul> Skills & Experience Nice to Have <ul> <li>Experience with DevOps tools such as IBM Jazz Rational Team Concert for Requirements Management, Quality Management, and Configuration/Change Management</li><li>Experience with scripting languages such as bash, powershell</li><li>Experience with data model generation, database schemas, relational models, object models, data access layers, and CRUD operations</li><li>Experience with policy-based/highly configurable software</li><li>Experience with distributed database models</li><li>Experience with pub/sub and request/response messaging patterns</li><li>Experience with multimedia technologies such as SIP, RTP, and RTCP</li><li>Experience with transport layer technologies such as TCP/IP and UDP</li><li>Experience with networking technologies such as IPv4, IPv6, VLANs, 802.3, Routing Protocols (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP4), 802.1x, DSCP, and DHCP</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF.</li><li>Experience with cross-platform development</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Firmware Engineers , Junior - Senior Level

Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div> <div>DevOps Engineers are responsible for creating and improving the tools and processes that power the building, validation, deployment, and monitoring of Replicon's globally distributed multi-tenant SaaS systems. DevOps are spreading and evangelizing the DevOps culture throughout Replicon.</div><br/>  <div>Working at Replicon is an opportunity to take on the unique challenges of a successful, large scale SaaS business application that existed before "web applications" as we know them today even existed. We have unusual challenges in such as extreme data consistency & reliability (nobody puts up with being paid incorrectly), large scale, complex legacy systems, enterprise-scale customizability, all combined with a friendly non-technical user experience. It's a "never-stop-learning" environment, where you'll be working with a strong technical team.</div>  <br/><strong><div>Responsibilities include:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Remove impediments in the technical development processes to support high-frequency, low lead-time software deployments</li> <li>Isolate risk of deployment or software failures to minimize scope and impact of production incidents</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with multiple product teams with unique internal processes and technologies</li> <li>Identifies where development and operational practices are outside industry norms; doesn't accept "we've always done it this way", works to do it better</li> <li>Effectively implements automation to augment or replace manual processes; prefers adopting rather than building software where appropriate</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to efficiently triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Deep understanding of web technologies (HTTP, DNS, TLS/SSL, web services, load balancing)</li> <li>Experience with AWS (have used S3, EC2, RDS); would accept experience with Azure and/or Google Cloud</li> <li>Experience with automation tools (eg. Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, CodePipeline)</li> <li>Familiar with agile processes/scrum and TDD</li> <li>Built or have supported CI and CD processes</li> <li>Experience with post mortems/failure analysis - identifying the root cause & contributing factors of incidents</li> <li>Experience with a SaaS, globally-distributed multi-tenant system would be a preference</li> <li>Experience with a micro-services architecture, or the transition towards one</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Software Engineer DevOps

Job_Description: ◃Careers<br/><br/>Intermediate/Senior Bridge Engineer <br/> <br/>  Calgary Studio<br/><br/>DIALOG is a fully integrated multi-disciplinary design firm offering engineering, architecture, landscape architecture, sustainability, urban design and planning services. Our special culture and spirit is founded on a unique collaborative approach to clients and communities. <br/><br/> For any project to be successful, the experts involved have to be able to see to the core of the challenge right from the start. From conception to completion our Structural Engineers are experts in structural analysis and performance design. Whether working with concrete, steel, wood or any other construction material, we bring a combination of engineering fundamentals and innovation to every project. From supporting rush hour traffic on the new Walterdale Bridge to designing the lookout for the River Valley Mechanized Access, we work collaboratively with the architects, planners and builders involved to develop structures that are safe, sound, and financially viable to build. And we make them look amazing too! <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> At DIALOG you will have the opportunity to work with architects, landscape architects, planners, and additional engineering disciplines. We are truly an integrated and sustainable design practice. As an Intermediate or Senior Bridge Engineer you will contribute your experience, technical abilities and creativity as part of a team of engineers and technologists. <br/><br/> You will:  <ul> <li>Act as the project manager and/or lead design engineer on a variety of bridge and civil infrastructure projects of various sizes and complexity.</li> <li>Be involved in all phases of the project from concept design through construction.</li> <li>Be responsible for total project and/or technical quality and delivery.</li> <li>Liaison with clients and other outside agencies.</li> <li>Coordinate with other engineering consultants.</li> <li>Prepare and review drawings and specifications.</li> <li>Train and mentor junior project engineers.</li> <li>Assist with preparation of proposals for future bridge projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Professional Requirements</strong><ul> <li>A Masters Degree in Structural Engineering.</li> <li>Professional registration with APEGA, or another provincial engineering association.</li> <li>A minimum of 7 years of bridge design experience.</li> <li>Proficient with bridge specific structural analysis and design programs.</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines.</li> </ul> <strong>Why work for DIALOG?</strong> <br/><br/> We are proud to have been named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and Top Greenest Employer for 2018 . Employing over 650 people in 4 offices across Canada, DIALOG is committed to delivering sustainability and excellence in design along with exceptional client service, in a fun working environment.  <ul> <li>Our team is fun, creative and committed to success;</li> <li>DIALOG offers first-class internal training and development;</li> <li>We offer competitive compensation and benefits; and,</li> <li>DIALOG is an award-winning company that is committed to sustainable, integrated design.</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/><br/> Clicking the “Apply Now” button below will launch your default mail application. <br/><br/> We are delighted that you are considering furthering your career with DIALOG. Your submission will be reviewed carefully however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> <em>DIALOG is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to the principle of diversity and looks forward to receiving applications from a wide range of people.</em> <br/><br/> Please note we will retain your submission for a maximum of 6 months. You are welcome to re-apply anytime.
Title: Intermediate/Senior Bridge Engineer

We provide a wide range of consulting and design services related to the infrastructure, real estate, resource, industrial and government sectors in Canada and abroad. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking candidates for the position of <strong>Water Resources Engineer</strong> in our <strong>Calgary</strong> office.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Strong leadership and project management of stormwater management projects for land development and/or public sector clients.</li> <li>Management and leadership of client relationships, developing new business opportunities, and the geographic expansion of Dillon’s services.</li>  <li>Leadership of technical training and professional guidance to our growing professional and technical staff within the Calgary office.</li> <li>Input to the career development of more junior staff, including technical direction, training recommendations, coaching and mentoring.</li> <li>Contribution to Dillon’s corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees.</li> <li>Business travel upon request.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>A degree in water resources or civil engineering. A post graduate degree in water resources engineering would be considered an asset.</li> <li>Licensed to practice as a professional engineer, or eligible to be licensed within six months in the province of Alberta.</li> <li>Minimum of 10 years' experience in water resources engineering.</li> </ul>  Experience  <ul>  <li>Highly proficient in the preparation of watershed studies, master drainage plans, stormwater management plans, and site servicing plans.</li> <li>Expert knowledge of industry standard hydrologic and hydraulic modeling software packages.</li> <li>Proficient in the analysis, design and contract administration of stormwater management infrastructure for green-field developments and in retrofit situations.</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of local municipality standards, specifications, tendering and approvals process.</li> <li>Demonstrated abilities in multidisciplinary project teamwork and coordination.</li> <li>Proven skills in client relationship and business development.</li> <li>Exceptional communication, report writing, organization and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Proficient in project proposal preparation and presentations.</li> <li>International experience would be an asset.</li> </ul>  Related Services<br/><br/>Water Resources Engineering

Job_Description: <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company is currently recruiting a Process Engineer Specialist for a 1 year contract. <br/><br/> This position is located in Calgary, AB. Local candidates are preferred, however, non-local candidates will be considered, but must be willing to secure their own accommodations/relocation, as there is no relocation/living allowance provided. <br/><br/> <strong>MAIN FUNCTIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Evaluate and comment on discipline engineering work performed both internally and by Contractors and sub-contractors to ensure that work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, Company standards, and regulatory requirements. Facilitates effective execution of discipline engineering and design routines that align with the project's goals, objectives, and procedures. Assures accurate and timely communication among the Project Team and Company Functions on discipline engineering activities, progress, and issues. In addition to technical ability, they should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. <br/><br/> <strong>TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Facilitate and coordinate discipline engineering technical work products</li> <li>Coordination and communication of various issues among the Company and contractor's engineering team that affect the discipline engineering design, safety, and regulatory compliance of the work</li> <li>Evaluate / comment work performed by the Contractor and sub-contractors to insure that the work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, Company standards, and regulatory requirements. Includes review of discipline design drawings and documents</li> <li>Identify and assess deviations to Contract Technical Specifications and regulatory requirements</li> <li>Ensure that such deviations will be processed according to project procedures; maintains Deviation Control Log</li> <li>Steward discipline engineering queries from the Contractor and sub-contractors as well as technical information requests</li> <li>Keep Lead Engineer or Engineering Manager informed of discipline engineering progress, deviations, and execution concerns</li> <li>Participate in discipline engineering reviews at Contractor's and subcontractor's locations</li> <li>Drives and promotes capital efficiency in engineering design</li> <li>Support internal Company engineering general interest or Global Practice initiatives as requested by Supervisor</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul> <li>Closely related professional experience</li> <li>Bachelors degree in Chemical Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience</li> <li>Broad and extensive knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria</li> <li>Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities</li> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of software programs</li> <li>Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications</li> <li>10 to 20 years of related experience is required</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>
Title: Process Engineer Specialist

Job_Description: We currently require an established, motivated, innovative individual to join our dynamic team in the following position: <br/><br/> <strong>Sales Engineer - Vibration</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Sales Manager – Instrumentation, this individual will be based out of our Calgary office and working closely with our Reliability & Controls Product Specialist. The successful applicant will be responsible for representing BHD’s specialized product lines and working inconjunction with our sales department. You will be tasked to establish relationships that are both longstanding and mutually beneficial. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Mechanical Engineer with a specialization vibration</li>  <li>some experience working with a sales department</li>  <li>Previous experience/education in Instrumentation, Electrical or Reliability and Controls Industry</li>  <li>Organized, independent, self-motivated with a strong ability to prioritize</li>  <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team environment</li>  <li>A strong knowledge of target industries and clients</li>  <li>Valid driver’s license, as frequent travel is required</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Achieve growth through the identification and development of new opportunities</li>  <li>Identify and recommend solutions for vibration measurement and controls & reliability systems</li>   <li>Become an expert in key product lines and have a breadth of knowledge in all products available</li>  <li>Service and support BHD Instrumentation's existing customer base</li> </ul> <strong>Why BHD?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Be a part something innovative and growing!</strong> We are proud leaders within our industry and continue to drive success. We have seen revenue growth year after year while also being established for over 25 years in the industry. <br/><br/> <strong>Benefit from our benefits!</strong> We enroll our employees in an extensive medical benefits package. We also offer a competitive vacation day policy, recognition programs, incentive packages and many more perks. <br/><br/> <strong>Succeed as a Team!</strong> Our commission structure promotes an inclusive sales team environment. We all have invested interest in seeing each other succeed and are committed to do so. <br/><br/> <strong>Never Stop Growing!</strong> Our product offerings offer an extensive opportunity to continue to learn. You will have routine product information sessions available and a knowledgeable sales department to support you. We are proud of our history of quick career progression for our top achievers and are committed to see our people grow. <br/><br/> <strong>Enjoy Where You Work!</strong> We built a beautiful state-of-the-art office where you will be proud to work. Enjoy free parking, an open-concept environment, industry resources at your fingertips and visibility into our calibration, promotions and rentals departments. <br/><br/> BHD Instrumentation is a growing company that sells, services and rents Process Instrumentation and Test & Measurement equipment from leading manufacturers. BHD has been in business for over 25 years and is the leading supplier to industrial clients in the resource and municipal market segments.
Title: Sales Engineer - Vibration

Job_Description: EVRAZ is seeking a Senior Process Engineer, Metallurgist for our Calgary facility. The incumbent will provide technical support to the mill operations in areas involving process metallurgy (heat treating, welding, upsetting, steel chemistry development). This person is responsible for identifying opportunities for current process improvement and interfaces with Engineering, QA and operations personnel to define any new metallurgical process that is incorporated into plant operations. During process improvement activities, the Senior Process Engineer is responsible for leading root cause assessment, process mapping, fishboning, trial planning and the development of real-time process control solutions. Written summaries of the key findings and recommendations is also an important aspect of the work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Develop product capability studies of key metallurgical attributes (pipe mechanical properties, tempering time, ERW welding, etc.) to identify how the metallurgical processes are performing</li><li>Analyze trending for quality KPI's such as rejects, rework, downgrades by mill/product, and key process factors, correlate this data to process conditions, publish update reports and provides analysis of the data with necessary action items and works with operations/quality team to improve trends</li><li>Supports Tubular Products Group product development activities concerning new or upgraded pipe products when required</li><li>Promote the continual education of our Quality Assurance personnel by providing annual training programs in the areas of heat treating, ERW welding, root cause analysis, statistical analysis of data, etc.</li><li>Lead brainstorming sessions (A3, and FMEA types) with operations and quality personnel during the initial stages of the process control effort or efforts to improve the process</li><li>Conduct process optimization trials at EVRAZ tubular mills using statistical methods (Design of Experiments) as necessary</li><li>If financial investment is required, provide support to the QA/Operations teams to define the potential savings of process improvements</li><li>Work with the Quality Assurance and Operations teams to ensure that shop floor documents and training identify the features of process control of the primary process parameters</li><li>At least quarterly, perform process capability studies of the key process parameters communicate the results to mill management and identify areas of improvement</li><li>Attend six sigma, lean manufacturing and process control equipment conferences to stay abreast of process control techniques/advancements/ in the broader steel manufacturing industry</li></ul> <ul> <li>Degree in Metallurgical Engineering or Materials Science Engineering</li><li>5 years' experience working in a Quality Assurance or Engineering team</li><li>Familiar with ISO Quality standards and Quality Management Systems including quality control planning for new products</li><li>Demonstrated experience in applying root cause problem solving methods (Ford 8D, Ishikawa diagrams, Failure Mode Effects Analysis etc.) to manufacturing problems</li><li>Demonstrated ability with MS Excel or Minitab to analyze numerical data and draw conclusions</li><li>Excellent presentation skills, experience giving presentations to management regarding project results</li><li>Experience writing technical reports summarizing key findings and identifying next steps</li><li>Strong ability to establish effective working relationships at all levels, experience working with interdepartmental teams at all levels of management to accomplish tasks</li><li>Knowledge of pipe and /or steel mill processes and operations a plus</li><li>Knowledge of tubular industry standards including API, CSA, and ASTM a plus</li><li>Six Sigma green belt qualification a plus</li><li>Proficient in MS Office tools such as MS Word and PowerPoint</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Process Engineer,Metallurgist

Projects involve construction of oil sands processing facilities, including steamassisted gravity drainage facilities, refinery expansions, gas plant expansions, cogeneration facilities, major mine developments and pipe spool fabrication. Kiewit Energy Canada also has a Modular Yard facility in Edmonton, Alberta.<br/> <br/><br/> <br/>**Position Description:**<br/> <br/>This is an entry level position that performs assignment-specific engineering and construction management duties that may include any combination of the following:<br/> <br/>•Safety participation in daily safety tours and tool box meetings<br/> <br/>•Estimating, pricing and bidding work<br/> <br/>•Contract Administration subcontract and material contract management<br/> <br/>•Document control<br/> <br/>•Trend tracking tracking of quantities, costs and progress curves<br/> <br/>•Purchasing, expediting and coordination of materials<br/> <br/>•Equipment and Material Management<br/> <br/>•Material takeoffs and material receipt inspections<br/> <br/>•Surveying and quantity tracking<br/> <br/>•Quality Control & Quality Assurance<br/> <br/>•Scheduling & Work plan development - Coordination between engineering and construction activities<br/> <br/>•Temporary structure design<br/> <br/><br/> <br/>**Requirements / Qualifications:**<br/> <br/>•Degree in Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering and/or Civil, Construction and Mechanical Engineering Technology or equivalent program<br/> <br/>•Construction experience, or classroom instruction in reading and interpreting design drawings, specifications and perform material take-off, applying labor costs and examining in process and completed work<br/> <br/>•Must have valid drivers license<br/> <br/>Skills and Abilities:<br/> <br/>•Flexible with work locations must be able to travel/relocate<br/> <br/>•Strong work ethic willing to put in the time to get the job done right<br/> <br/>•Must be able to meet multiple and sometimes conflicting deadlines<br/> <br/>•Strong organizational, time management<br/> <br/>•Effective oral, written and interpersonal communication skills<br/> <br/>•Ability to speak both french and english an asset<br/> <br/><br/> <br/>**About Kiewit**<br/> <br/>As one of North America's largest, most respected construction and engineering organizations, with 2017 revenues of $8.7 billion, Kiewit exists to make a difference. We improve and connect communities across the United States, Canada, Mexico and Australia through complex projects in transportation, water/wastewater, power, oil, gas and chemical, building, industrial and mining. Our services are as diverse as the skills of our 22,000-strong workforce to whom we provide challenging, honest work in a caring and collaborative culture. A sense of adventure, pride and fulfillment is built in to every career at Kiewit.<br/> <br/><br/> <br/>**How Were Different**<br/> <br/>• Consistently ranked within the top five of the Top 400 Contractors according to Engineering News-Record<br/> <br/>• Named to the Best Workplaces in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute Canada for the sixth year in a row<br/> <br/>• Extended health, dental and vision insurance where employees can get expert support for work, life, and everything in between<br/> <br/>• RRSP plan that includes company dollar-for-dollar match on contributions up to 6 percent of weekly base wages<br/> <br/>• Our employees are entitled to accrue at least 20 days paid time off each year, in addition to statutory holidays per each provinces guidelines<br/> <br/>• We spend an average of $8,500 per employee each year on training and career development, and reimburse up to $5,250 per year in outside tuition costs<br/> <br/><br/> <br/>_Kiewit believes in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination, and complies with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate._<br/> <br/><br/> <br/>**Job Segment:** Construction, Chemical Research, Engineer, Electrical, Engineering, Entry Level
Title: Entry Level Engineer - Kiewit Energy Canada

Job_Description: Due to continued growth, iSolutions Consulting is looking for a System Integration Specialist with experience in the Upstream Oil & Gas and / or Power Industries to join our team. <br/><br/> The System Integration Specialist position is an Engineering position which requires advanced knowledge in a wide range of software systems employed by iSolutions. The ideal candidate would have experience working with OSISoft PI, Aspentech IP.21 or Honeywell PHD Data historians. The System Integration Specialist is responsible for commissioning these systems, implementing process graphics, constructing data integrations to and from underlying control systems such as Emerson DeltaV or Rockwell FactoryTalk. Knowledge of high availability data historian architectures is important to this role. <br/><br/> The System Integration Specialist will be responsible for performing the duties listed below including: <br/><br/> • Plant and Corporate Historian Commissioning   <ul> <li>Plant and Corporate Historian Data Integrations</li> <li>Designing and implementing software solutions that leverage historian data</li> <li>Quality assurance/regression testing of software solutions</li> <li>System architecture design and documentation</li> <li>Conducting customer stakeholder meetings / solution walk-throughs</li> <li>Leading junior-level resources through system commissioning tasks and quality assurance procedures <br/><br/> In addition to utilizing vendor-supplied integration packages, the need will occasionally arise to write custom code for interfacing with these systems. For this reason, working experience with one or more of the following software technologies is required: <br/><br/> • ASP.Net 2.0+,</li> <li>ADO.Net</li> <li>SQL Server 2005+</li> <li>Oracle PL/SQL</li> <li>SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) <br/><br/> The position requires a Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Process Control Engineering, Computer Science Software or Electrical Engineering or a related field and at least 4 years relevant experience. Relevant experience with the upstream Oil and Gas and or power industries is required. <br/><br/> iSolutions services a large number of name-brand customer in the oil & gas and power domains. We offer our consultants access to interesting and challenging work assignments, performance based compensation & fast-tracked career progression for those with the drive to succeed. <br/><br/> iSolutions Inc. is a Data Management consulting company that specializes in designing, implementing and supporting real-time, historian based, reporting and integration solutions for Oil/Gas and Power Generation/Transmission companies. Our implementations allow clients to make educated, site specific production and operational decisions based on the analysis of real time data from integrated field and plant systems.</li>  </ul>
Title: Systems Integration Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong><em>PRINCIPAL/SENIOR IC DESIGN ENGINEER</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u>Our Company</u></strong> <br/><br/> Semtech Corporation (NASDAQ:SMTC; www.Semtech.com) is a leading supplier of high-quality analog and mixed-signal semiconductor products. Semtech is an organization headquartered in Camarillo, California with 31 offices in 14 countries around the world. We pride ourselves of being big enough to have global reach but still a size where our staff can influence and make an impact through great performance and innovation. We are presently looking for multiple <strong>PRINCIPAL/SENIOR IC DESIGNERS</strong> to be located in our Ottawa, Burlington and/or Calgary offices. This role is a great opportunity to work with a world class IC development team, developing advanced CMOS and BiCMOS data and video communications products at rates of 25-400G. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Design Engineering, the Principal/Senior IC Design Engineer will supplement our existing team by taking a leading role in the development and design of high speed IC products, from initial concept through to volume production. This position offers the opportunity to lead programs and make a major difference. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Locations:</u></strong> Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Burlington, Ontario, Canada +/or Calgary, Alberta Canada <br/><br/> <strong><u>The Candidate</u></strong> <br/><br/> The ideal candidate should have recent experience of designing high speed data communications products. We are also interested in hearing from candidates with experience of high speed IC circuit design for other applications. <br/><br/> Not only is this a great opportunity to exploit and further develop your IC design skills in a successful team, we also offer a competitive remuneration package including an attractive salary, a full range of benefits, performance related bonus and equity. <br/><br/> <strong><u>The Role</u></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Duties and Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Design of high speed IC products from concept to manufacture, to schedule</li>  <li>Lead engineer with responsibility for delivering high performance IC product designs</li>  <li>Provide technical leadership to junior design engineers</li>  <li>Interface to marketing and applications to define new products and support existing products</li>  <li>Working effectively with cross functional teams (marketing, sales, applications, product/test engineering) to deliver IC Products</li>  <li>Assessing product feasibility and schedule</li>  <li>Undertaking multiple projects in parallel</li>  <li>Preparing technical reviews and product documentation</li>  <li>Timely production and delivery of IC circuit designs to specification, technical reviews and product documentation</li>  <li>Effective working relationships developed and maintained at all times</li>  <li>Develop leadership skills</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications and Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>BASc degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering with significant IC design content (PhD or Masters degree preferred)</li>  <li>10 years of post-graduate experience in IC product design</li>  <li>Thorough understanding of analogue circuit theory, transmission lines and device fundamentals</li>  <li>Experience of designing analog SiGe BiCMOS circuits is a strong asset as is knowledge of SerDes, PLLs, CDRs, TIAs and laser drivers</li>  <li>Proven track record of taking high performance, high speed IC designs from concept through to volume production, with a successful commercial outcome</li>  <li>Experienced in Cadence IC design flow and tools. Experience with system modelling tools an asset.</li>  <li>Experienced in working with test and product engineering and applications</li>  <li>Good interpersonal and communication skills</li>  <li>Good appreciation of the impact of IC layout on circuit performance and circuit design</li>  <li>Ability to interpret customer and lab verification results to support applications and device characterization</li>  <li>Proven analytical and problem solving skills</li> </ul> Semtech, an equal opportunity employer, values the diversity, knowledge and expertise of our workforce. Success, Ethics, Respect and Alignment are the foundational values of our business and guide our relationships with employees, shareholders, customers and other stakeholders. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, an environment dedicated to teamwork, innovation, work/life balance and opportunities for professional growth. Learn more about Semtech and our products in our <u>Corporate Video</u></div> </div><div></div>
Title: PRINCIPAL/SENIOR IC DESIGN ENGINEER

Job_Description: Position Summary/Responsibilities <br/>  <div><strong>Server / Storage Hardware Repair Field Engineer- Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> Unisys is a global information technology (“IT”) company. We work with many of the world’s largest companies and government organizations to solve their most pressing IT and business challenges. We specialize in providing integrated, leading-edge solutions to clients in the government, financial services and commercial markets. Our offerings include cloud and infrastructure services, application services, security solution and high-end server technology. We have more than 20,000 associates serving clients around the world. For more information, visit www.unisys.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Respond to technical service hardware repair requests on enterprise-level servers, storage sub-systems and drives and networking devices at client locations in the area.</li>   <li>Resolve clients’ questions or problems in the areas of system configurations, product functionality and technical troubleshooting.</li> <li>Serve as primary support liaison between company and customer.</li> <li>Performs installs, moves, adds and changes as required</li> <li>Installs and maintains enterprise servers, mainframe, high-end networking and complex product configurations, servers, storage-subsystems and drives</li> <li>Takes responsibility for additional follow-up, testing and troubleshooting services or problem escalation.</li> <li>Maintains a high degree of professionalism in actions, demeanor and dress.</li> <li>Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction throughout the service delivery transaction.</li>  </ul> <strong>Technical and Behavioral Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>High school diploma or GED required</li> <li>Background investigation and drug screen required</li> <li>2 or more years of experience in a field service support role deploying and supporting server and storage systems such as Dell, HP or IBM servers, Cisco networking, and Hitachi or EMC storage arrays.</li> <li>Must have valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle with appropriate insurance (required)</li> <li>Ability to troubleshoot and repair enterprise-level software and hardware issues. Excellent problem solving skills where problems may be complex or hard to diagnose.</li> <li>Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills to work effectively with internal and external customers</li> <li>A+, HP, Cisco, Dell and EMC certifications are highly desired</li> <li>Must be available for after-hours on-call rotation</li> <li>Must be available for varying shifts on a rotating basis.</li>  </ul> Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). M/F/Disabled/Veterans.</div>  <br/>
Title: Server / Storage Hardware Repair Field Engineer

Job_Description: Our customers have ideas. Lots of them. Turning those ideas into a competitive advantage is what we do. As part of the Hexagon group of companies, NovAtel's integrated global positioning solutions deliver success time and time again on land, sea and in the air. We help many of the world's leading companies stay in the lead by consistently delivering OEM global satellite positioning products that are recognized for their technical innovation, unsurpassed quality and industry-leading customer support. <br/><br/> Applications Engineering provides general product and application support for NovAtel Hardware and Software, and on related GNSS & INS topics, along with field services to NovAtel’s worldwide customer base. <strong>While part of the Applications Engineering team, this position will have a focus on supporting NovAtel’s Precision Agriculture market.</strong> <br/><br/> The team also provides other services internally and externally to Customers, Sales, Product Management, Project Management and Marketing to help ensure the cohesive and comprehensive delivery of products and materials. Working closely with internal engineering teams ensures escalated issues are resolved in a timely manner while continuing to be the customer liaison and maintaining the customer interface. <br/><br/> As our <strong> Applications Engineer, Agriculture</strong> you would be responsible for: <ul> <li>Providing front line product and application support on NovAtel Hardware, Software, and related GNSS & INS topics to internal and external customers</li><li>Providing customer training, demonstrations, technical assistance, and technical sales support</li><li>Liaising with other departments regarding technical matters</li><li>Formulating and implementing procedures and plans for resolving problems</li><li>Performing software testing, verification, bug reports, and field trial coordination</li><li>Reviewing technical documentation materials and manuals</li><li>Generating application notes for frequently asked questions and knowledge base</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Geomatics or Electrical Engineering degree with 2+ years of related industry experience</li><li>Self-motivated team player with proven problem solving skills.</li><li>Outgoing and energetic with exceptional people skills.</li><li>Multi-tasking with excellent verbal and written skills.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel, worldwide.</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>High attention to detail and highly organised</li><li>Strong multitasker with keen ability to prioritize</li><li>Comfortable working individually but know when to ask for help</li><li>Work well in a collaborative environment</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Background includes experience working directly with customers, preferably in the delivery of support or services</li><li>Background includes experience in GNSS and INS systems installation and/or troubleshooting in precision agriculture related applications.</li> </ul>
Title: Applications Engineer, Agriculture

Job_Description: <div><div>Job Summary<br/><br/><strong>Rubrik’s Sales Engineer Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> Ready for an opportunity to make a substantial impact with a disruptive tech company while building your pre-sales career? Rubrik, Inc. has an amazing product, a supercharged team and the financial backing of Lightspeed Ventures, Greylock Partners and Khosla Ventures. Bottom line, if you have limitless drive and like to win, we want to talk to you! <br/><br/> Rubrik is looking for Sales Engineers to provide technical direction and business guidance to the regional sales team. As a Sales Engineer, you will be accountable for regional revenue goals by driving innovative technical programs and overseeing day-to-day account-level activities. You will be responsible for evangelizing, positioning, and architecting the industry's first hyper-converged hybrid cloud data management platform for a mix of enterprise, mid-market, and small business customers throughout your region. <br/><br/> <strong>About the position:</strong> <ul> <li>Provides technical leadership and direction to customers and internal staff in the development of fully integrated technology solutions in support of pre-sales activities in the assigned market.</li><li>Assists in the analysis, design and development of fully integrated technology solutions.</li><li>Demonstrates technical leadership and subject matter expertise on Rubrik’s products, distributed architectures, file systems, and competitive storage offerings in the SAN product space.</li><li>Acts as technical expert and consultant to develop and propose solutions that meet the technology and business requirements of assigned customers.</li><li>Makes technical and sales presentations to customer's technical staff and senior management.</li> <li>Serves as a trusted technology advisor to customers and serves as an internal resource on technical issues or specific business applications within an assigned market segment.</li><li>Successfully builds relationships with the account team, partners and customers in support of sales team objectives and engages and leverages corporate resources, abilities, budgets and personnel as appropriate.</li><li>Leads technical sales calls</li><li>Qualifies sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.</li> </ul> <strong>About you:</strong> <ul> <li>5-7 years of sales engineering experience preferably in a software or data center environment.</li><li>Driven – need for success, highly energetic with a strong hands-on, “can do” approach.</li><li>The successful candidate must have a fundamental breadth of technical knowledge in cloud data management, backup and disaster recovery and data analytics.</li><li>Entrepreneurial - willing to go the extra mile, strong work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude</li><li>Strives in moving in a fast-paced environment; including handling multiple calls/demos per day with immediate follow up.</li><li>A high level of business acumen and experience working with Cx0 level personnel, bringing technology solutions to solve business challenges.</li><li>Smart, adaptable and open-minded</li><li>Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent experience</li></ul></div> </div>
Title: Sales Engineer

Job_Description: <div>The <strong>Department of Civil Engineering</strong>, in the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary, is pleased to invite applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the rank of <strong>Assistant</strong> <strong>Professor</strong> in the area of <strong>Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector</strong>. The preferred start date of the appointment is <strong>July 1, 2018</strong> or as negotiated. <br/><br/> The successful applicant will be expected to teach courses in Engineering Project Management as well as fundamental and advanced courses in Civil Engineering. The main criteria for selection are research and teaching excellence. The successful candidate will provide evidence of high quality scholarly output that demonstrates potential for independent research leading to peer-reviewed academic publications and securing of external research funding, active engagement with industry, and supervision of graduate students. The candidate must also be able to demonstrate a strong academic background and research expertise in Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector, and an ability to work as part of our highly-collaborative research teams. Specialization and expertise are required in one or more of the following areas: <ul>  <li>Major Energy-related Projects</li> <li>Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC)</li> <li>Supply Chain Management</li> <li>Entrepreneurship and Innovation</li> </ul> Assistant Professors will dedicate their time to teaching our undergraduate and graduate programs, continue to engage in high impact research, submit scholarly works to high quality publications, and provide service with the university and within our profession. <br/><br/> Candidates must hold a B.Sc. in Engineering and a Ph.D. in Engineering or a closely related discipline; a strong research track record; a demonstrated ability in teaching excellence or evidence of excellence in teaching at a university level. Relevant industrial experience is an asset. Complementing the current faculty, the incumbent is expected to participate in joint projects, and develop a strong independent research program. Working as a team and providing service to your Department, Faculty and University are required. Candidates should have strong oral and written English communication skills. <br/><br/> Candidates must be a registered professional engineer or eligible for registration as a professional engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA). Information about becoming a professional engineer can be found online. <br/><br/> The Schulich School of Engineering is committed to fostering diversity through cultivating an environment where people with a variety of backgrounds, genders, interests and talents feel welcome and included. In 2016, the Schulich School of Engineering was recognized with the KNOVO Award of Distinction to honour the school’s commitment to diversity and equity. <br/><br/> Interested individuals are encouraged to submit an application online via the 'Apply Now' link and are advised that the application process allows for only four attachments. Your four application attachments should be organized as follows: <ul>  <li>Attachment 1: Curriculum Vitae, Name and contact information of at least three referees (referees will only be contacted if the applicant is short-listed for the position) and samples of 3 scholarly publications.</li> <li>Attachment 2: All Postsecondary Academic Transcripts (B.Sc., M.Sc., and Ph.D.)</li> <li>Attachment 3: Statement of teaching interests with respect to technical subject areas and how you would plan and deliver an undergraduate engineering course (not to exceed two pages)</li> <li>Attachment 4: Statement of proposed research (not to exceed two pages), that includes:  <ul>  <li>Research objectives</li> <li>Recent activity in this area</li> <li>Methodology (how the research will be conducted)</li> <li>Significance and potential impact of the research</li> <li>Link to the University of Calgary’s Strategic Research Themes</li></ul> </li> </ul> <strong>Applications are encouraged as soon as possible and will be accepted until June 30, 2018.</strong> <br/><br/> For more information and to apply, please visit the university’s career page. <br/><br/> Salary is competitive and will be determined according to the successful applicant's accomplishments, experience and qualifications. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.</em> <br/><br/> About the Department <br/><br/> The Department of Civil Engineering offers B.Sc., M. Eng., M.Sc., and Ph.D. degrees in a variety of specializations. The University of Calgary is a comprehensive research university with close to 30,000 full-time students, including over 5,000 graduate students. It is in the Canadian top ten in a broad cross-section of measures including: research funding, endowment, graduation of Ph.D. students, fundraising, and the quality of professoriate. The Schulich School of Engineering supports the University of Calgary vision of Eyes High to become one of Canada’s top five research universities. Related information can be found at the department website.</div><br/>  <div> Internal Number: 14919</div> <br/>
Title: Assistant Professor, Engineering Project Management in Energy Sector, Department of Civil Engineerin

Job_Description: We're looking for an enthusiastic and talented solutions engineer to join our sales team. Do you enjoy solving challenges, working as a team and building strong relationships? If so, than this role may be for you! <br/><br/> The Solution Engineer provides support for technical elements of the sales cycle and is the primary internal resource for the sales team. Responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process, working in conjunction with internal teams to ensure that clients are set up for success, post-sales. <br/><br/> As an expert in Benevity products and services, the Solution Engineer will serve customers by identifying their needs and recommending possible adaptations of products and services that may be implemented and supported by the Client Services team. He or she will maintain a connection with various departments including client services, product and technical services. The Sales Engineer will be responsible for gathering and communicating key client information to the Relationship and Implementation Management teams to ensure timely and successful client implementations. <br/><br/> The person in the role is a solutions-oriented individual with a high technical aptitude and strong interpersonal skills. He or she is a great juggler of priorities, capable of communicating complex information simply, and enjoys working with clients to understand possible solutions for their needs. <br/><br/> Our Sales team members are located across North America, so we welcome exceptional, passionate applicants from all over the United States & Canada. If making an impact matters to you, and working with a company that helps clients to change the world sounds like an exciting adventure, then read on! <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Benevity is the global leader in online workplace giving, matching, volunteering and community investment software. Many of the world’s most iconic brands rely on Spark, Benevity’s award winning cloud solution, to power corporate “Goodness Programs” that attract, retain and engage today’s diverse workforce by connecting people to the social causes that matter to them. <br/><br/> Better Work and a Better World: that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes and prosocial behaviour (we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline!). We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us. <br/><br/> We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love, and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and sustainability standards. <br/><br/> <strong>The Why</strong>  <ul> <li>The Solution Engineer expedites the sales process by assisting Sales Executives with technical discussions, articulating the technology and product positioning to both business and technical users, contributing to client satisfaction and implementation success.</li> <li>Finds solutions to unique client issues by using the tools available, contributing to organizational profitability and revenue growth.</li> </ul> <strong>The What</strong>  <ul> <li>Bridge the gap between sales and client services to reduce implementation timelines and improve visibility into resource allocation and planning</li> <li>Gather and articulate important client information through internal channels (SalesForce, Confluence) to build a strong client profile</li> <li>Maintain and communicate the latest Spark features and capabilities to the sales team so we are continuously able to provide the best solutions for potential buyers</li> <li>Streamline the implementation process by gathering relevant information and preparing clients for next steps during sales cycle</li> <li>Communicating client requests and requirements to product and technical teams to ensure implementation success</li> <li>Work with Marketing and other internal teams to develop sales tools that help present complex information in a way that potential buyers can understand</li> <li>Identify current and future customer service requirements by establishing personal rapport with potential and actual customers and other persons in a position to understand service requirements</li> <li>Gain buyer acceptance by explaining and demonstrating the fi t of the Benevity solution through proof of concept (POC) solutions</li> <li>Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies</li> <li>Contribute to the Marketing and Product team’s effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed; providing information and commentary pertinent to deliberations; recommending options and courses of action</li> <li>Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed</li> </ul> <strong>The How</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years experience in Sales Engineering or related role</li> <li>Learn quickly and adapt even more quickly</li> <li>Ability to manage competing priorities and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a fast-paced, complex, collaborative and team-oriented environment</li> <li>Highly developed interpersonal and written/spoken communication skills</li> <li>Able to maintain strong relationship both internally and with clients</li> <li>Experience with Salesforce is a strong asset</li> <li>Strong understanding of SaaS software solutions</li> <li>In-depth knowledge of Community Investment industry</li> <li>Technical understanding – not afraid to question and investigate so that challenges can be resolved quickly</li> <li>Professional, motivated and flexible – enthusiastic about using process to deliver but understand that there’s a time and a place to go with the fl ow</li> <li>Motivated self-starter that works well both alone and with a team</li> <li>Business analysis and problem solving skills</li> </ul> It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Solutions Engineer

Job_Description: JOB DESCRIPTION<br/><br/><strong>Technical Sales Engineer</strong> <br/> Due to continued growth, our client requires a Technical Sales Engineer to help establish and grow the global market share. With your network and connections, you will be a key player in the company's ongoing success. <br/><br/> <strong>The Company:</strong> <br/> Our client is a Global Oil Field Service provider that develops new solutions to specific challenges. With your role as a Technical Sales Engineer you will be a part of a team of professionals that are excited about thinking of new, innovative and crazy solutions that do things better and not just different. <br/><br/> <strong>The Position</strong> <br/> We're looking for an established oil field service professional with mixed experience in both the field as well as within sales. <br/> The role offers:  <ul> <li>Attractive Base Salary</li> <li>Generous Bonus Program</li> <li>Benefits</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>5 Years Technical Sales Experience</li> <li>Ability to travel from Calgary base to international locations on a regular basis</li> <li>Strong Network abroad</li> <li>Ability to determine target markets</li> <li>Proven ability to sell oil field solutions</li> </ul> <strong>Location</strong> <br/> <strong> <ul> <li>Calgary, will require international travel. <br/><br/> About Petroplan:</li> </ul>  </strong> <br/> Petroplan is a global organisation which specialises in connecting skilled professionals with exceptional contract and permanent career opportunities throughout the oil, gas and energy industry. This has been our focus since Petroplan was formed in 1976. <br/><br/> Our company aim isn't to be the largest industry recruitment specialist but rather the best. As such, our recruitment services, contractor management and specialised support is tailored to meet the individual needs of candidates, contractors and clients. Petroplan's local offices across Europe, the Middle East, North America, Asia-Pacific, Africa and Australasia support projects throughout forty countries. Our client portfolio includes multi-national companies, together with niche organisations focusing on a specialist discipline or location. <br/><br/> For more information please feel free to visit our website http://petroplan.com <br/><br/> Ref No: BBBH30546<br/> <div> APPLY</div>  <br/>
Title: Technical Sales Engineer

Job_Description: <div> <div> Job Description <br/>  <div> <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Envista Forensics addresses the growing demand by insurance claims and legal professionals for a global, multi-disciplinary and highly-skilled forensic engineering partner. Envista Forensics is a global forensic consulting firm that provides a comprehensive array of technical services to the insurance and legal communities. <br/><br/> <strong>Our mission is simple:</strong> <ul> <li>We deliver certainty to our clients when they need it most: When equipment, systems, structures, or data have been threatened by catastrophe or litigation.</li><li>We determine cause and responsibility; we identify the nature and extent of damage or loss and provide a full range of solutions to protect their assets.</li><li>Our technical experts are trusted advisors and industry leaders. Their expertise is broad and deep, capable of withstanding all forms of scrutiny. Our services are available globally so that certainty is assured no matter where in the world it is needed.</li> </ul> As the recovery from disasters has grown more complex, Envista Forensics has developed a comprehensive array of services to help our clients and has associates located around the globe to provide our clients assurance no matter the type of loss or location of the disaster. <br/><br/> Our entire staff is dedicated to providing the best possible service, vast experience, and Certainty in an Uncertain World. <br/><br/> We are an Equal Opportunity Employer offering competitive pay and benefits and an environment where teamwork, ongoing professional development, continuous improvement, and exceptional service are valued and rewarded. <br/><br/> We currently have an outstanding career opportunity for a Mechanical Engineer – Vehicle Accident Reconstruction. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Conduct vehicle accident investigations including vehicle inspections, analysis of event data recorders, surveying, analyzing vehicle speeds and orientations at impact, collision sequences, computer simulations/animations, occupant dynamics, perception/reaction times, visibility issues, and collision avoidance potential.</li><li>Prepares accurate, clear, thorough, and concise reports and letters outlining the cause and origin of the damages to clients. Follows established policies, procedures, and processes in preparing information, exercising sound judgment in applying these to potentially unusual or complicated situations, and submit reports and documents in a timely manner and in accordance with client’s standards and expectations.</li><li>Stays abreast of office and company policies, procedures, and practices; participates in ongoing training and development as assigned or approved to assure knowledge and skills remain current and comprehensive.</li><li>Functions as an effective member of the team, assisting co-workers as needed and learning from colleagues and supervisors; supports the goals of the department, division, and organization; participates in special assignments and activities as required or approved; demonstrates initiative in the interest of the client and the organization.</li><li>Adheres to all applicable federal, state, and local laws as well as applicable regulations and standards.</li><li>Establishes trusted working relationship with clients in regional area and interacts socially at mixed engagements with clients.</li> </ul> </div></div></div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Requirements  <ul> <li>Baccalaureate degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field is required.</li><li>4+ years of automotive or mechanical engineering experience, including field work.</li> <li>Vehicular Knowledge is required.</li><li>Experience in or desire to learn Vehicular Accident Reconstruction and Failure Analysis.</li><li>General knowledge of gas systems and equipment is a plus.</li><li>Active Professional Engineering (P.Eng) license is required.</li></ul></div> </div>  <br/>
Title: Vehicle Accident Reconstruction Mechanical Engineer in Calgary at Envista Forensics

and Channels located in a variety of locations.<br/><br/>Requirements:<br/><br/>•BA/BS or equivalent required <br/><br/> •10+ years of experience in Pre-sales storage technology and virtualization Management and sales methodologies <br/><br/> •Strong presentation skills as well as ability to build and present high quality product demonstrations to both technical and executive audiences reports <br/><br/> •Experience with enterprise applications, security, systems management, business continuity solutions a plus <br/><br/> •Experience troubleshooting system level problems including server failure, OS tuning, networking problems <br/><br/> •Strong IT infrastructure technical skills including x86 server platforms, Windows Server and Linux operating system expertise, SAN/NAS storage technologies and TCP/IP networking <br/><br/> •Comfortable in the dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base <br/><br/> •Must be able to persuade and influence senior enterprise IT Architects and C-level executives <br/><br/> •Organized and analytical, able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive<br/><br/>Education/Experience<br/><br/>•You have a BA/BS degree or higher, or equivalent job-related experience <br/><br/> Travel: +50% <br/><br/> #joinvSAN <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Job_Description: <div><div> Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 02, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3184</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is the single source supplier for natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment – plus in-house engineering and mechanical services expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’ s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, processing plants, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment serving the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for a <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities.This individual will mentor junior engineers and work with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility every day, responsible for all aspects of their team’s projects from design through to commissioning. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to lead by influence, mentor, be organized, establish clear objectives and monitor key measures, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Complete final checks on P&ID’s Models and other project deliverables</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma</li> <li>Professional engineer designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in plant layout and how it relates to equipment design</li> <li>Experience sizing pumps, heat exchangers, Air coolers, and compressors required</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping is required</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22506 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, oil sands sustaining, you will create and develop mine and tailings plans and designs while working in an exciting interdisciplinary environment. You will support Suncor’s Millennium, North Steepbank mining operations and Oil Sands future projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Lead the development and optimization of long range (+ 5 years) mine and tailings plans</li><li>Develop project scopes and designs to support mining and tailing operations</li><li>Conduct strategic economic studies of engineering and business options available to the company and make recommendations to management</li><li>Mentor junior staff and supporting them in their development</li><li>Lead the integration of reclamation and closure landform designs in plans</li><li>Facilitate collaboration with various technical groups to ensure consistency with reclamation plans and stakeholder groups</li><li>Benchmark and analyze operational performance</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>10 or more years of engineering/planning industry experience</li><li>Experience in operations and with regulatory submissions is preferred</li><li>Engineering degree in Mining, Civil, Geological or equivalent</li><li>A multidisciplinary background in mining, reclamation, geotechnical / geological engineering and tailings planning</li><li>P.M.P certification is desirable</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Knowledge of CAD and/or Mine Planning software such as Minescape and XPAC</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work closely with others at various levels within the organization</li><li>Strong trouble-shooting and analytical skills with a continuous improvement mindset</li><li>You are a highly motivated, self starter who is able to provide personal and technical mentorship to junior staff members</li><li>Continually seek greater knowledge about the systems, processes and hazards in the workplace, in order to understand not just what you do but why you do it</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position is a staff role based in the Calgary office with infrequent travel to site on an as-required basis</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering
Title: Senior Engineer, Mining
