Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Building Mechanical Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> <em>CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced<strong> Building Mechanical Engineer</strong> from qualified individuals who are interested in becoming a member of our Buildings Engineering group in Edmonton or Calgary, Alberta.</em> <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, employee-owned, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has expanded operations into Western Canada. <br/><br/> CIMA+ is proud to have reached the prestigious Best Employers in Canada’s Platinum Level, which is exclusively reserved for organizations that have achieved the best results in the Aon Hewitt survey for six consecutive years. We offer a highly competitive compensation package with excellent benefits, merit-based bonuses as well as a flexible and friendly working environment where committed individuals can thrive. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong>   <ul>  <li> Lead building mechanical engineering services for commercial, institutional, educational, healthcare, government, recreational and light industrial facility projects.</li> <li> Lead a team of mechanical engineers and technologists on assigned projects.</li> <li> Assist the Buildings Practice Leader with the growth and development of the mechanical team.</li> <li> Be a technical resource in building mechanical design, and leverage that knowledge to mentor and develop junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li> Prepare technical specifications and contract documents for bidding and construction.</li> <li> Conduct quality assurance reviews on building mechanical design work completed by others.</li> <li> Keep current on new products, technologies and design processes.</li> <li> Coordinate work with architects, other engineering disciplines, and Owner representatives.</li> <li> Contribute to business development, marketing and liaising with Clients and Architects.</li> <li> Assist in determining the scope and fee for proposed engineering services.</li> <li> Lead proposal efforts for building mechanical and multi-discipline project pursuits. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></li> <li> Undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering from an accredited post-secondary institution.</li> <li> Professional Engineer registered in Canada, and eligible for professional registration in Alberta.</li> <li> 10+ years of progressive experience in building mechanical design.</li> <li> Experience working in a consulting engineering environment.</li> <li> Experience as mechanical design lead and able to direct and oversee a team of engineers and technologists on projects.</li> <li> Able to articulate the mechanical design requirements and oversee the progression of mechanical system layouts in Autodesk® Revit and AutoCAD MEP.</li> <li> Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring staff.</li> <li> In-depth understanding of regulations, codes and standards associated with building mechanical design.</li> <li> General understanding of building electrical and building structural systems.</li> <li> Team player and independent worker.</li> <li> Professional, energetic, organized and action-oriented.</li> <li> Experience in using Microsoft office products including MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.</li> <li> Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in the English language.</li> <li> Experience in estimating engineering fees and schedules.</li> <li> Experience in writing engineering reports, proposals, letters and technical specifications.</li> <li> Proven success in developing business with new and existing clients, and maintaining positive relationships.</li> <li> Experience in project management and controls, with a proven record of client satisfaction and financial success.</li> <li> Experience in monitoring and adapting to industry trends and changing market conditions.</li> <li> Able to travel to project sites. <br/><br/> <strong>The following are considered assets:</strong>   <ul>    <li> LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP), Fellow or Green Associate.</li> <li> Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM).</li> <li> Experience in conducting field reviews and/or building condition assessments.</li> <li> Certified Passive House Designer (CPHD).</li> <li> Experience in Life Cycle Costing (LCC).</li> <li> Experience on projects certified to LEED, Living Building Challenge (LBC), Passive House, and/or Green Globes.</li> <li> Experience in building energy modeling using Can-QUEST, eQUEST, EnergyPlus, Trane Trace, Carrier HAP, IES(VE) or comparable platform.</li> </ul>  </li>   </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!
Title: Building Mechanical Engineer

Job_Description: Paladin Technologies has emerged as the largest complex systems integrator in Canada. As a leader in the design, deployment, optimization, management, and maintenance of communication and digital networks, Paladin can meet the needs of clients on a national scale, while providing local support. <br/><br/> We are 100% Canadian-owned, and operate nationally. The experts that make up Paladin's teams stay at the forefront of the changing technology landscape through continued training, complex client projects, and company support. As Paladin continues to grow, we continue to provide our employees with exciting challenges and a rewarding career. <br/><br/> The Systems Engineer/Designer performs discovery and analysis of business needs to define client requirements. This position works in conjunction with Account Executives and the Project Management team to determine technical requirements for project work and to ensure fit and suitability of our product offering within the client environment. <br/><br/> RESPONSIBILITIES:  <ul>  	<li>Prepare high level system designs in a thorough and professional manner during the pre-sales cycle. Design work may include conducting site surveys and device mark-ups, network architecture design, server loading, writing technical narratives and proposals, and preparing bills of materials</li>  <li>Produce detailed post-sale design documents that will guide the technical installation and configuration of systems</li>  <li>Develop financial and logistics estimates, both independently and in collaboration with Paladin Technologies sales, marketing, and project management professionals</li>  <li>Multi-task and manage time effectively to prioritize projects, tasks, and meetings as necessary</li>  <li>Identify, establish, and document processes to support design efficiency and scalability</li>  <li>Develop productive relationships with clients and key stakeholders which will build respect and confidence in the organization's capabilities.</li>  <li>Understand and maintain an awareness of the productivity and profitability of work carried out by the organization</li> </ul> QUALIFICATIONS:  <ul>  	<li>A minimum of three years of design experience in the information technology, instrumentation and controls, and/or security industries</li>  <li>Field experience in a construction environment is an asset</li>  <li>A strong understanding of the physical security and/or IT industries, including an awareness of complimentary products, technologies, trends, and the general application of physical security technology</li>  <li>An understanding of and experience with fundamental concepts pertaining to IP networks, low voltage electronics, power, and communications</li>  <li>A strong command of the English language supported by excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>  <li>The ability to simultaneously handle multiple tasks and projects and be responsive to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment</li>  <li>Post-secondary education from an accredited college, university, or technical institution in Business, Construction Management, Electronics, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field</li>  <li>P.Eng, EIT, CET, or equivalent professional technical designation is preferred</li>  <li>Highly developed analytical and problem solving skills</li>  <li>Motivated self-starter with ambition to independently research new technologies as well as engineering and business methodologies/concepts</li> </ul>
Title: Systems Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong>We are currently seeking a Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Engineer to join our team in Calgary. <br/><br/> Reporting to a Senior Geotechnical Engineer, the Geotechnical/Geohazard Junior holds a role supporting a wide variety of projects across our western Canadian offices. The role will be an opportunity to gain experience and knowledge working with senior experienced professionals, in the office and in the field<br/><br/><strong>Job Duties:</strong> <ul> <li>Acting as a design engineer resource for a variety of projects and clients</li><li>Assist in the development and growth of the Calgary team with a focus on energy and infrastructure developments</li><li>Support the development of the Environment & Geoscience business by developing relationships with existing and future client contacts, attending meetings, and supporting BD initiatives</li><li>Preparation of proposals</li><li>Provision of practical and economic solutions to clients</li><li>Preparation of technical reports associated with the project scope of work</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>University degree or diploma in a related discipline (i.e. geoscience or civil engineering, etc.); a post-graduate degree would be considered an asset</li><li>Minimum of <li>Willing to work extended and irregular hours within western Canada when necessary;</li><li>Currently registered or eligible to register as a member of APEGA;</li><li>Ability to work on multiple projects and meet established deadlines;</li><li>Effective interpersonal skills, a strong client-service focus and the ability to work in a team environment are essential;</li><li>Strong business development skills;</li><li>Experience using specialized equipment and software (e.g. GeoStudio or equivalent) would be considered an asset;</li><li>Strong report writing and verbal communication skills in the English language; and</li><li>Valid driver’s licence with a clean driving abstract.</li> </ul> <strong>Experience in the following areas would be an asset:</strong> <ul> <li>Slope Stability, mitigation design and monitoring</li><li>Terrain Mapping</li><li>Landslide Detection</li><li>Slope Hazard Assessment</li><li>Fluvial Geomorphology</li><li>Flood Hazard Assessment</li><li>Hydrologic Modelling</li><li>River Surveying</li><li>Debris Flows</li><li>Foundation Design</li><li>Retaining wall design</li><li>Mining</li><li>Infrastructure design</li><li>Site Investigation- drilling</li> </ul> Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals. <br/><br/> For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com <br/><br/> While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.<br/><br/><strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
Title: Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Engineer

Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year , we who provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Senior engineer position that independently applies advanced engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work is performed with minimal supervision and has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Carry out the responsibilities of a Lead Engineer on small to medium sized projects or Area Lead on large sized projects or provide technical support / leadership on a project. Promote workshare execution</li><li>Perform studies and develop scope of work and execution of the engineering work</li> <li>Power system studies using PSS/E, CYME, ETAP, SKM.</li><li>Power system modelling experience for the following types of studies:</li>  <ul> <li>Load Flow & Short Circuit.</li><li>Motor Starting (Synchronous and Induction).</li> <li>Grounding.</li><li>Coordination Studies.</li><li>Power Factor Correction.</li><li>Harmonic Analysis.</li><li>Stability.</li> </ul>  <li>Power system modelling using EMTP/ATP or equivalent software for:</li>  <ul> <li>TRV.</li><li>Switching Surge.</li><li>Insulation Coordination.</li><li>Pipeline Induction.</li><li>Philosophy development, settings development and logic development for high voltage transmission line and substation protection.</li><li>Substation Physical Layout/Arrangement.</li> </ul>  <li>Coordinate project electrical activities with a utility and other disciplines for their area of responsibility</li><li>Develop and maintain electrical project schedule, progress reports and cost estimates. Execute change management proces</li><li>Supervise Juniors & Intermediate electrical engineers and designers. Interface with design group to monitor and control project schedule, electrical hours and electrical cost for their area of responsibilites</li><li>Ensure consistency and integrity of electrical design throughout project and review design for logic and functionalites</li><li>Perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for electrical systems</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering required</li><li>Minimum of 7-9 years' experience with specifications, engineering, design, construction and start-up for low and medium voltage plant distribution systems with EPC consulting firms for small to large oil & gas related projects or power plant projects is required</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills required</li><li>Experience in motors and VFD design is required</li><li>Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required</li><li>Eligibility for a Professional Engineering certification is required</li><li>Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.
Title: Sr. HV Substation Engineer

Job_Description: Longview Aviation Asset Management (LAAM) was established in 2016 to provide attractive financing and lease options, as well as trade-in aircraft capabilities, for aircraft supported and manufactured by Viking Air Limited (Viking). <br/><br/> In 2018, LAAM, in partnership with Viking, formally launched the CL-415EAF "Enhanced Aerial Firefighter" conversion program. The CL-415EAF combines the proven performance of the CL-215 airframe with modern upgrades to create the next generation of the worlds only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform. <br/><br/> <strong>MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Follow the policies and procedures laid out in the Company's Transport Canada Approved Maintenance Policy Manual to ensure the Company is in full compliance with the current Canadian Aviation Regulations</li> <li>Be responsible to their assigned Charge Hand</li> <li>Disassemble, inspect, record discrepancies, recommend and record methods of repair</li> <li>Repair, fabricate parts and components;</li> <li>Install, rig and carry out all other mechanical and structural functions as they relate to avionics and electrical systems and test in accordance with manufacturer's specifications</li> <li>Ensure that all applicable airworthiness requirements are met</li> <li>Maintain a clean work area, and alert the Supervisor of any safety concerns</li> <li>Responsible for ensuring both accuracy and traceability of parts removed or installed on Aircraft</li> <li>For those AME's possessing certifying authority, perform and/or certify work performed within the scope of this Aircraft Maintenance Organization</li> <li>Perform any other work assigned</li> </ul> <strong>EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Have experience with the CL 415/215T/215 avionics suite</li> <li>Have experience with CL 415/215T/215 wiring installations</li> <li>Have experience with general aircraft wiring repair, fabrication and installation</li> <li>Possess knowledge expected of an Aircraft Avionics and Electronics Technician on aircraft types handled by the Company</li> <li>Shall hold a valid AME E Transport Canada License; or be eligible to be an apprentice to achieve this license</li> </ul> Interviews start ASAP! Apply today for consideration! (No cover letter required)

CIMA+ is a well-established, employee-owned, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has expanded operations into Western Canada. <br/><br/> CIMA+ is proud to have reached the prestigious Best Employers in Canada’s Platinum Level, which is exclusively reserved for organizations that have achieved the best results in the Aon Hewitt survey for six consecutive years. We offer a highly competitive compensation package with excellent benefits, merit-based bonuses as well as a flexible and friendly working environment where committed individuals can thrive. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong>   <ul>  <li> Lead building structural engineering services for commercial, institutional, educational, healthcare, government, recreational and light industrial facility projects.</li> <li> Lead a team of structural engineers and technologists on assigned projects.</li> <li> Assist the Buildings Practice Leader with the growth and development of the structural team.</li> <li> Be a technical resource in building structural design, and leverage that knowledge to mentor and develop junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li> Prepare technical specifications and contract documents for bidding and construction.</li> <li> Conduct quality assurance reviews on building structural design work completed by others.</li> <li> Keep current on new products, technologies and design processes.</li> <li> Coordinate work with architects, other engineering disciplines, and Owner representatives.</li> <li> Contribute to business development, marketing and liaising with Clients and Architects.</li> <li> Assist in determining the scope and fee for proposed engineering services.</li> <li> Lead proposal efforts for building structural and multi-discipline project pursuits. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></li> <li> Undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering, specializing in structural design, from an accredited post-secondary institution.</li> <li> Professional Engineer registered in Canada, and eligible for professional registration in Alberta.</li> <li> 10+ years of progressive experience in building structural design.</li> <li> Experience working in a consulting engineering environment.</li> <li> Experience as structural design lead and able to direct and oversee a team of engineers and technologists on projects.</li> <li> Experience working with a variety of structural materials, including concrete, steel, masonry, and wood.</li> <li> Experience working with prefabricated structures.</li> <li> Able to articulate the structural design requirements and oversee the progression of structural system layouts in Autodesk® Revit and AutoCAD.</li> <li> Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring staff.</li> <li> In-depth understanding of regulations, codes and standards associated with building structural design.</li> <li> General understanding of building mechanical and building electrical equipment.</li> <li> Team player and independent worker.</li> <li> Professional, energetic, organized and action-oriented.</li> <li> Experience in using Microsoft office products including MS Excel and MS Word.</li> <li> Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written.</li> <li> Experience in estimating engineering fees and schedules.</li> <li> Experience in writing engineering reports, proposals, letters and technical specifications.</li> <li> Proven success in developing business with new and existing clients, and maintaining positive relationships.</li> <li> Experience in project management and controls, with a proven record of client satisfaction and financial success.</li> <li> Experience in monitoring and adapting to industry trends and changing market conditions.</li> <li> Able to travel without restrictions.</li> <li> Willingness to engage in lifelong learning. <br/><br/> <strong>The following are considered assets:</strong>   <ul>    <li> LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP), Fellow or Green Associate.</li> <li> Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM).</li> <li> Experience in conducting field reviews and/or building condition assessments.</li> <li> Experience in Life Cycle Costing (LCC).</li> <li> Experience with structural finite element engineering software packages such as ETABS, SAP, SAFE, RAM or STAAD.</li> <li> Experience on projects certified to LEED, Living Building Challenge (LBC), Passive House, and/or Green Globes.</li> </ul>  </li>   </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!
Title: Building Structural Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div> <p> </p>  <p><br> At <strong>exp</strong>, we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong> <br> Your Challenge</strong><br>  </p>  <p><strong>Exp</strong> Global Inc. is searching for a Senior Design Engineer to join our Land Development / Infrastructure team in our Calgary, AB office. Reporting to the Discipline Manager, the successful applicant will undertake detailed design work in conjunction with Project Managers for large-scale development projects.</p>  <p><br>  <br> <strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></p>  <p> </p>  <p>Lead the design process and provide design oversight for complex Land Development and Infrastructure projects including large scale residential, industrial, and commercial developments in and around Calgary.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>Duties will include:<br> •Provide detailed engineering design solutions and input on the design process for key complex projects, including providing support to Project Managers and other design team members<br> •Write, sign and seal reports/drawings as required<br> •Review project designs, specifications, and contract documents at a Project Manager’s direction<br> •Monitor project schedule and budgets within your area of responsibility and report status to the senior project manager on a regular basis<br> •Liaise with clients, municipal approving authorities and contractors, as needed<br> •Pursue the obtaining of all necessary approvals and permits for projects, including those from municipalities and provincial (Alberta) agencies<br> •Have a strong working knowledge and extensive experience in AutoCAD Civil 3D<br> •Participate in business development efforts including writing and pricing proposal efforts, securing new projects/clients, as needed<br> •Coordinate design and field staff required for internal project teams, including directing, coordinating, and reviewing work done by staff<br> •Ensure health and safety policies are adhered to at all sites and report to Manager and Joint Health and Safety Committee Members</p>  <p><br>  </p>  <p><strong>The Skills and Knowledge You Bring</strong></p>  <p> </p>  <p>•Professional Engineer (P.Eng) or eligibility for license/equivalent<br> •Minimum 10 years of experience in the Land Development industry, with a focus on large development projects<br> •Brownfield redevelopment experience is an asset<br> •Strong detail orientation<br> •University Bachelor’s degree in Civil engineering<br> •Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills<br> •Project Management experience<br> •Fully conversant with Microsoft software applications<br> •Organized, works well under pressure and able to deal with situations with tact<br> •A valid driver's license and vehicle is required<br> •Demonstrated ability to perform individually or as a member of project teams<br> •Ability to multi-task is critical, must be able to meet deadlines<br>  </p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What exp Can Offer</strong></p>  <p><br>  <br> With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, <strong>exp </strong>provides professional, technical and strategic advisory services related to the world's built and natural environments in six key practice areas: Buildings, Earth & Environment, Energy, Industrial, Infrastructure, and Sustainability. Our heritage dates back to 1906, and today more than 3,300 creative professionals across North America and the globe provide the expertise and experience needed to deliver successful projects for clients.</p>  <p> <br> Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it's a promise we take seriously.<br>  </p>  <p>Join a dynamic team at <strong>exp</strong> that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what <strong>exp</strong> has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities.<br>  <br> For more information or to apply: www.exp.com<br>  <br> #LI-AO1</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Senior Design Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Mechanical/Process Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> Allnorth’s award winning multidisciplinary engineering and technical services team is fortunate to be part of the significant growth of the company over the past few years. Our continuous improvement philosophy, skilled professionals and technical experts have allowed us to take on challenging and exciting projects while servicing clients in the Mining, Oil & Gas, Infrastructure and Pulp & Paper sectors. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> As the successful candidate, you will be responsible for the preparation of industrial engineering designs and project management for a wide variety of oil and gas field facility projects. Duties will include project scoping and bid proposals; cost estimating and AFE preparation; engineering design preparation and review; regulatory permitting, construction management and cost controls; and project/operations troubleshooting. In addition, you will be responsible for project coordination with engineering, management and client operations, including start-up and commissioning assistance. Fostering and growing strong relationships with our clients is also an important aspect to this role. <br/><br/> Using your considerable organizational, communication and people skills, you will work with cross discipline teams to ensure projects are completed within allotted schedules and budgets, and to high quality standards. Mentorship of new and junior employees is also a key part of this role and our organization. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li> University degree in Mechanical or Chemical/Process Engineering or a related field;</li>   <li> 4+ years of relevant experience in directing engineering projects in the Oil & Gas industry;</li>   <li> Registered (or eligible to register) as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in Alberta and able to obtain status in BC and/or Saskatchewan as may be required by project load;</li>   <li> Project management and/or consulting engineering experience is an asset;</li>   <li> Knowledgeable about current regulatory requirements;</li>   <li> Excellent communication skills (interpersonal and written) and proven ability to collaborate with team members in a multi-disciplined environment;</li>   <li> Technical competency and strong attention to detail.</li>  </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> Allnorth is dedicated to its Triple Bottom Line of People, Clients & Partners and Profitability. We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team. Become part of our team and we will provide you the opportunities to develop both personally and professionally. At Allnorth, we encourage a culture of camaraderie and collaboration working together towards a common goal. You won’t get lost in the numbers here, but rather enjoy positive guidance as you learn, grow and create an impact. Now is an exciting time to join the Allnorth team. <strong>Apply</strong> today! <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Mechanical Engineer

Job_Description: Exergy Solutions is a different engineering design firm located in Calgary, Alberta. Exergy provides a unique blend of advice and skilled professionals to help customers improve their technical drawings and asset information. Exergy’s services include drafting as-builts, document management, field redlining, design and additive manufacturing. <br/><br/> Our team is growing! We are a team of talented individuals focused on delivering consistent quality to our customers. <br/><br/> We are looking for an Intermediate/Senior technologist, designer or engineer with knowledge in both Instrumentation and Controls. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Knowledgeable in control system design architecture including discipline P&ID input, loop drawings, shutdown key development and control philosophies</li> <li>Working knowledge in a wide range of Distributed Control Systems including Honeywell DCS, Rockwell, and other platforms</li> <li>Work with process, mechanical, electrical disciplines and control system development partners in creating automated designs.</li> <li>Verify consistency between control systems and the cause and effect diagrams</li> <li>Plan, coordinate and prepare for productive field visits to verify site documentation</li> <li>Prepare written reports of findings and documentation issues found in collaboration with other members of the design team.</li> <li>Manage multiple ongoing projects and keeping track of daily progress</li> <li>Support electrical design team members in verifying single line diagrams and area classification drawings</li> <li>Responsible for DCS development, design and programming for R&D projects and field pilots.</li> <li>Conscious promotion of Exergy Solutions to clients and prospects</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Experience</strong> <ul>  <li>Design Technologist with ASET, CET, RET, or P.Tech(Eng) or Engineer with a P. Eng accredited by APEGA</li> <li>10+ years for Senior – 6-10 years for Intermediate working in the Oil and Gas industry. Alberta gas and liquids processing experience will be considered first</li> <li>Degree or Diploma in Electrical, Automation, Instrumentation or Computer Science Engineering/Technology Diploma</li>  <li>Experience in both PLC and DCS configuration and graphic development, RTU experience would be an asset</li> <li>Labview experience would be an asset for R&D projects</li> <li>Excellent writing skills and experience preparing technical reports</li>  <li>Communication - solid command of the English language, persuasive, good negotiation skills, have the best interest of the company and client</li>  <li>Solid time management with ability to work on multiple projects</li> <li>Advanced software computer skills - Word, Excel, and Outlook</li> <li>Excellent work ethic, organizational skills and attention to detail</li> <li>Strong sense of responsibility and initiative is expected to drive results</li> <li>Travel up to 25% of the time within Western Canada. Must have valid drivers license</li>  </ul>

Job_Description: <div><div>  <div><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong></div><div>Reporting to the Geotechnical Design Supervisor, you will be responsible for producing designs of Mine Earth Structures, including but not limited to Dykes, Pit walls, Dumps, Civil infrastructure and tailings corridors for approval by the Alberta Energy Regulator. You will also be required to act as the Designer of Record (DOR) for the structures assigned, which is a regulatory requirement.</div><br/>  <div><strong>This position is based in Calgary, Alberta and is eligible for:</strong></div>  <li>Relocation to Calgary</li>  <div><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong> </div><br/>  <div><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong></div>  <li>Provide fit for purpose design solutions as needed in a short time frame to support operations, while maintaining regulatory compliance.</li> <li>Perform design tasks which typically include design basis preparation, site characterization (geology/geo-hazard), stability and seepage failure analysis, deformation modelling, reporting and drafting to construction drawing stage</li> <li>Act as the design focal for the assigned mine structures and work with the Engineer of Record to support operational needs during construction</li> <li>Work with the Engineer of Record to support performance monitoring plan and execution and provide design updates as needed</li> <li>Coordinate with Mine Planning and Operations to establish the design basis during early phase of the project</li> <li>Provide support as needed for geotechnical drilling</li> <li>Contribute to work standards, procedures and guidelines for the Quality Management Systems (QMS)</li> <li>Work with Planning and Projects to provide geotechnical parameters to support the development of the Business Plan</li> <li>Provide supports as required to generate the annual construction and performance reports to the Alberta Energy Regulator (AER)</li> <li>Maintain strong collaborative relationships with Geotechnical Engineering, Geotechnical Operations Support, Reporting Team, Mine and Tailings Planning, and Operations</li> <li>Travel to site, frequently, as required</li>  <strong><div>QUALIFICATIONS:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Bachelor’s degree in Geological or Civil Engineering; Masters degree in Geotechnical Engineering preferred.</li> <li>Registered Professional engineer with APEGA.</li> <li>Six to eight years of design and construction experience in operational or consulting environment; experience in design of tailings structures preferred.</li> <li>Fluent in the usage of GeoStudio, AutoCAD/Civil 3D, Microsoft (c) Office, and Vulcan</li> <li>Sound understanding of geotechnical principles, including soil strength, soil consolidation, slope stability, seepage management, groundwater flow, and field investigation techniques</li> <li>Experienced in geotechnical site investigation and instrumentation planning, including selecting appropriate drilling methods, selecting monitoring instrumentation and interpreting instrumentation data</li> <li>Detailed understanding of related disciplines: oil sands geology, hydrogeology, mining engineering, tailings engineering, mine operations</li> <li>Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with peers and stakeholders</li> <li>Abiility to produce high quality technical reports and construction drawings</li> <li>Ability to work in a busy multitask environment</li> <li>Striving for quality work and attention to detail</li>  <div>To see related Geology and Geophysics roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Geology-and-Geophysics</div><br/>  <div><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong> </div><br/>  <div>At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</div><br/>  <div>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</div></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Geotechnical Design Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><em>CIMA+ is seeking a highly motivated <strong>Project Manager / Senior Transportation Engineer - ITS </strong>to become part of our dynamic transportation team. As a part of our team, you will provide professional services to many municipal and provincial public sector clients. You are expected to actively participate in business development to grow the ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) Practice for CIMA.</em></p>  <p> </p>  <p> The opening is available in any of our Ontario or Western Canada offices.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong></p>  <p> </p>  <ul> <li>Business development with municipal and provincial clients in the area of ITS</li> <li>Supervision of ITS specific projects, including guidance of technical staff, client liaison, technical reviews, and problem-solving;</li> <li>Development and review of high quality technical reports</li> <li>Coordination and liaison with other transportation departments within CIMA</li> <li>Development of high quality proposals</li> <li>Execution and delivery of projects in the following areas:</li> <li>ITS Planning Studies and Strategic Plans</li> <li>ITS Transit Systems</li> <li>Evaluations of New/Emerging Technologies</li> <li>Development of Concept of Operations Reports</li> <li>Preparation of Preliminary Designs</li> </ul>  <p> </p>  <p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></p>  <p> </p>  <ul> <li>Have 7 or more years of related transportation engineering or ITS experience,</li> <li>Hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a related area of engineering or planning,</li> <li>Are currently registered with Professional Engineering Ontario (PEO),</li> <li>Have demonstrated experience in project management, client management, and people management,</li> <li>Are motivated to be actively involved in business development,</li> <li>Work well in a team environment with minimal supervision,</li> <li>As an asset are bilingual, and</li> <li>Have an attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture.</li> </ul>  <p> </p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div> </br>Apply Now!
Title: Project Manager / Senior Transportation Engineer - ITS

Job_Description: <strong>Career Opportunity Commissioning Manager/Engineer Infrastructure</strong> <br/><br/> Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <u><strong>About The Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> The<strong> ­­­­­­Commissioning Manager/Engineer</strong> reports directly to the Mechanical and Electrical Manager and will have an in-depth knowledge of Construction Testing, Commissioning, and Operations. <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Commissioning Manager/Engineer at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Participate in Engineering and Supplier Model Reviews and squad checks</li> <li>Represent Graham on multi stakeholder commissioning teams</li> <li>Ensure the Commissioning Plan is developed in line with Contract Requirements with consistent review/ auditing/ development with risk management in consultation with Project Stakeholders.</li> <li>Prepare demonstration test plans, incorporating all supplier warranty conditions</li> <li>Interrogate Process control narratives in the evolution of functional testing plans</li> <li>Identify, coordinate, assign and oversee all loop checks</li> <li>Own the functional testing process</li> <li>Define system limits by producing Scoped System Markups to P&IDs</li> <li>Obtain stakeholder buy in for test limits and protocols</li> <li>Coordinate Facility Performance testing, providing support staff, consumables, energy source management (Including LOTO), and test media.</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience: or Qualifications/Experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Peng, CET, or certified trade in either the Mechanical, Electrical, or Instrumentation disciplines, or have similar operational certification.</li> <li>10 years experience in field construction or operations</li> <li>5 years experience in Commissioning in a live plant environment</li> <li>5 years in a field supervisory capacity</li> <li>5 years experience in coordinating multi-stakeholder work teams</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long-term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <u><strong>About Us</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast-evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5190 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Code:</strong> LS-18-077 <br/><br/> #LI-LS
Title: Commissioning Manager/Engineer - Infrastructure

Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform. <br/><br/> <em><strong>But what makes us different?</strong></em> <br/><br/> Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. Thats what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Senior Software Engineer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong> <ul> <li>A unique and fun place to work flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li><li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul> <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Facilitate best practices for quality assurance such as code reviews and technical recommendations</li><li>Work with developers and designers to design new features and optimize the stability and scalability of our servers</li><li>Stay up to date and knowledgeable on the latest programming tools and practices</li><li>Write effective tests to find bugs quickly, and teach other developers to do the same</li><li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> </ul> <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years work experience in Python/Django or similar</li><li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li><li>Natural ability to find and exploit weaknesses in a system</li><li>Relentless pursuit of perfection in code and design</li><li>Highly skilled with latest DevOps tools and practices including: Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS</li><li>Experience with AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, React, Polymer)</li><li>Experience with testing tools such as CircleCI, mocha, unittest</li><li>Strong knowledge of database concepts</li><li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li><li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li><li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul> <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest</strong>

Job_Description: Summary <br/><br/> The person in this position will work on large, complex, and challenging projects for a leading engineering and environmental consulting firm with an expanding presence in the U.S. and Canada. <br/><br/> Multidisciplinary project team work will include providing geotechnical engineering analysis and designs for projects involving infrastructure, landslide and rockfall investigations and remediation, transportation, and flood diversion efforts. Clients will be from oil sands, potash, and other mining industries. Project tasks may include helping our clients understand their needs and risks; preparing subcontracts; preparing, staffing, and overseeing geotechnical site investigations; planning geomechanics laboratory testing; interpreting field investigations; collecting in-situ and instrumentation data; writing geotechnical engineering reports; estimating costs; providing geotechnical design; and performing geotechnical computer modeling. Project management activities will include overseeing project deliverables, conducting client communication, coordinating internal teams, mentoring junior staff, and assessing financial performance on projects. <br/><br/> This individual will also have an opportunity to play a lead role in day-to-day client service and business development in the Alberta market. Business development activities may include developing client relationships, tracking marketing leads and project opportunities, developing proposals and presentations, networking, and informing clients of the full range of capabilities offered by our firm. <br/><br/> While the position is located in Calgary, fulfillment of the position responsibilities will require periodic travel within Canada and the U.S. <br/><br/> NOTE: Applicants must be safety-conscious and able to work in locations that feature rough terrain typical of construction sites. Applicants must also be able to enter and work within facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Safety training will be provided before being assigned to work on these sites. <br/><br/> Minimum Qualifications  <ul> <li>BS in an engineering field with a geotechnical engineering emphasis or similar degree</li> <li>At least four years of relevant work experience related to geotechnical engineering and three or more years of mining and public infrastructure experience</li> <li>Field experience with cone-penetration testing, standard penetration testing, and other in-situ methods</li> <li>Laboratory experience, including strength and compressibility testing of clay and silt-size materials using a triaxial or ring shear apparatus</li> <li>Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) membership at the P.Eng. designation or the ability to obtain within one year</li> <li>Willingness to travel for work</li>   <li>Demonstrated project organization and management skills</li> <li>Demonstrated business development experience</li> <li>Demonstrated experience with training, mentoring and coaching other technical staff</li> <li>Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite of programs, especially Word and Excel</li> <li>Demonstrated experience with geotechnical analysis and geotechnical computer modeling (FLAC and, Plaxis, Geo-Studio, Soil Vision, Slide, LPile, APile)</li> <li>Experience with geotechnical site investigation and soil mechanics laboratory testing</li> <li>Flexible working style and willingness to modify personal schedules to meet project deadlines and client needs</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills</li>   <li>Legal authorization to work in Canada and the United States without the need for sponsorship or ability to obtain a TN work permit</li>   <li>Acceptable driving record</li> </ul> Preferred Qualifications  <ul>  <li>Graduate degree in geotechnical engineering</li>   <li>Five or more years of relevant work experience related to geotechnical engineering in mining and public infrastructure</li> <li>Demonstrated leadership skills</li> <li> Demonstrated ability to work with project teams in other offices</li> </ul> Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors that are not specifically listed. <br/><br/> We require proof of eligibility to work in Canada. <br/><br/> Barr Engineering Company strives to make www.barr.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance with completing the application process, please call 952-832-2600, or toll free at 800-632-2277. <br/><br/> Barr is an equal opportunity employer.

Job_Description: <strong>Internship Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Petroleum Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> As an Intern with IHS Markit, you will undertake work on a real business project intended to add value to your team as well as provide you with a great learning opportunity. <br/><br/> <strong>Overview of the Internship - Petroleum Engineer function:</strong> <br/><br/> Evaluate the practical use of reservoir or production engineering models within public literature. Work with a highly skilled team in designing and implementing reservoir flow models that are technically rigorous yet practical to use for petroleum engineers. Prototype implementations of these models and test models. <br/><br/> <strong>Required Education:</strong> <ul> <li>Master’s degree or higher (or equivalent experience) in Petroleum Engineering or related scientific discipline</li> </ul> <strong>Role Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> To be considered for this opportunity, candidates should demonstrate the following education, skills and experience <ul> <li>Excellent verbal communication skills</li><li>The ability to work to deadlines and prioritize a complex workload</li><li>Excellent research, analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Solid understanding of mathematical formulations for analytical and numerical reservoir models</li><li>Ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terms understood by non-specialists</li><li>Ability to program in C++, and scripting languages such as Python would be considered an asset</li><li>Experience with wellbore or pipeline hydraulics, PVT and its effect on reservoir dynamics would be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>2018 Summer Intern Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> To be eligible to apply for a place on our intern program, you must be able to answer ‘yes’ to the following questions: <ul> <li>Are you legally eligible to work for the duration of the intern program in the country for which you have applied?</li><li>Will you have completed your studies in either 2019 or 2020?This program is open to current students only.</li><li>If you do not reside in the IHS Markit office location for which you are applying, are you able to self-relocate in time for the program start date?</li> </ul> <strong>Program Dates:</strong> <br/><br/> Participation for the full duration of the 10-week program is expected. Please ensure you are available as per the dates below before submitting your application: <ul> <li>Canada– May 7th - Aug 24th</li><li>APAC – May 21 to July 27</li><li>EMEA – June 4 to August 10</li><li>India – May 21 to July 27</li> </ul> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Job_Description: Every power project is a community project—whether it’s a gas plant conversion, a transmission line corridor, or a wind development. Our goal is to improve industrial, business, and local communities through our project work. We see beyond the project at hand to where our work fits in the big picture. Join a team that does more than generate and deliver electricity through its work; join a team that powers growth and advances communities. <br/><br/> As a result of new and expanding business opportunities, Stantec's Power group is currently seeking a Civil Engineer in our Lethbridge or Calgary Office. As a member of our dynamic team you will be engaged in the execution of Wind and Solar projects, HV substation projects, transmission lines, and other renewable developments providing our clients with superior engineering design solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Develop project designs aligned with our client requirements and Stantec’s best practice standards</li><li>Conduct calculations and studies to develop preliminary and detailed design for various engineering stages; IFR, IFT, IFF, IFC and Record Drawings</li><li>Provide detailed design in the following areas:  <ul> <li>Site preparation including access road, fence, grading, clearing boundaries, and roadway and intersection designs, etc.</li><li>Manage and coordinate geotechnical investigations to meet project requirements</li><li>Supervise and provide input in to Storm Water Management Designs and Studies</li><li>Develop Component Transportation plans</li><li>Foundation Drainage systems</li><li>Coordinate and design foundation earthworks details</li><li>Cable trench and duct bank designs</li></ul></li> <li>Develop and evaluate the technical requirements for fabrication and construction tender packages</li><li>Review and approve equipment vendor drawings and structure shop drawings</li><li>Provide engineering support for proposals, estimating, procurement and construction</li><li>Coordinate with other engineering disciplines and project managers to successfully deliver projects</li><li>Mentor, coach and develop junior team members</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering coupled with a minimum of five years detailed design experience in site designs in North America</li><li>Eligibility and/or currently registered with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of AB, BC, and SK</li> <li>Proficient with MS Office applications & AutoCAD</li><li>Effective communication skills with the ability to successfully work in a team environment</li> <li>Valid Class 5 BC driver’s license or equivalent</li> </ul>
Title: Civil Engineer

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the Product Backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: <ul> <li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Product Manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Having a vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly expressing this vision in understandable Product Backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the Product Backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the Development Team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the Development Team understands items in the Product Backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Software Engineer (Product Owner), Senior - EvO (P4)

Job_Description: Your Opportunity<br/><br/>Whatever the distance, wherever the destination—our designs lead you there. Our Transportation group provides comprehensive planning, design, and engineering services for all phases of airport, bridge, rail, roadway, and transit projects. Join our team and help us keep communities connected. <br/><br/> An opportunity is available for a <strong>Civil Engineering Co-op Student</strong> to join our Infrastructure Management and Pavement Engineering (IMPE) team in <strong>Calgary, AB,</strong> beginning in May. This position may involve travel ranging from a few days to a week. Training will be provided to the successful applicant.<br/><br/>Your Duties   <ul>   <li>As the successful candidate, you have a sound technical background and are willing to take on a diversity of tasks which may include both field and office work;</li> <li>An understanding of transportation engineering, and more specifically pavement materials and pavement assessment procedures, would be an asset alongside previous experience with geotechnical investigations and/or pavement data collection;</li> <li>Ideally, candidates should be in their 2nd or 3rd year at an accredited post-secondary institution and are enrolled in a civil/transportation engineering program;</li> <li>Have strong communication skills, both written and verbal, along with excellent interpersonal abilities; and</li> <li>Demonstrate a strong working proficiency with the Windows operating system and Microsoft Office products.</li> <li>GIS Knowledge is preferred but not required.</li> </ul>  Your Capabilities and Credentials   <ul>   <li>Assist with report writing and conduct literature reviews.</li> <li>Assist Project Managers, with data analysis, Quality Control/Assurance of pavement performance data.</li> <li>Collect pavement investigation information, pavement performance data, material sampling, and other field activities.</li> <li>Organize and manage field and spatial data to ensure quality and consistency.</li> <li>Analyze pavement investigation information, pavement performance data, material sampling, and climatic data.</li> <li>Keep detailed project records and be responsible for organizing your work in the office and field.</li> </ul> With a big company comes big opportunities! Joining the IMPE team will allow the successful candidate to experience a wide range of office and field learning opportunities in the transportation engineering practice.
Title: Civil Engineering Co-op Student

Job_Description: Mechanical/Design Engineer Job, Calgary, Established Company, upto $90k <br/><br/> Your new company <br/> Hays Architectural and Engineering Recruitment is currently working with a national organization with an established office in Calgary, who are searching for a new Mechanical Engineer to join their team. This company is a well known local player in Calgary, and would be considered a mid-sized office in the industry. This would be an excellent, Calgary employer, for any Mechanical Engineer who is searching for a firm large enough to be stable and work on some great projects, as well as small enough to ensure that you are able to work on the complete project from start to finish. <br/><br/> Your new role <br/> Joining the team as a Mechanical Engineer for this Calgary Architecture and Engineering firm will have you being responsible for a number of aspects. A major component of your role will be Design. This firm is well known in Calgary for a number of great Commercial, Institutional, and Multi-Family Residential Projects. You will also be working directly with the client to ensure that the design of the Mechanical Systems of their new structure, is superb, and matches with the Client's requirements. This role will encompass both a Design Engineer responsibilities, as well as being a Project Engineer. <br/><br/> What you'll need to succeed <br/> In order to be suitable for this Engineer and Architecture firm as a Mechanical Engineer you will need to have at least 5 years of Mechanical Engineering experience, outside of the Industrial domain. You will also need to have a strong understanding of local building practices, Building Systems, and must be an expert in Plumbing Systems, Gas Systems, and HVAC Systems for large buildings. And should have a background working on a variety of commercial projects. This firm works in both Revit and AutoCAD, and therefore BIM / Revit experience would be an asset but not a requirement. It would also be an asset to be a P.Eng, or be a Professional Engineer, but again is not an absolute must <br/><br/> What you'll get in return <br/> You will receive a salary of up-to $90,000 depending on experience. This company gives you the opportunity to operate as a Design Engineer within the Mechanical Field, and yet offers a variety of day to day tasks, so that no 2 days will be the same. Due to their reputation and being well established in the industry, their ability to win projects will give you the opportunity to enhance your skills and further your career. <br/><br/> What you need to do now <br/> If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
Title: Mechanical/Design Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Department overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics is part of the IHS Markit group and provides industry leading risk analytics solutions to sell side institutions within the financial markets. Risk management and risk regulation is continuously driving demand for more accurate calculations and risk system vendors are continuously striving for improvements in performance and scalability. The product has been designed, built and continuously improved over a ten year period. It is carefully architected to scale from running on a single laptop for demonstration purposes right through to running on 1,000+ core distributed grids. <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics provides solutions for Credit Risk PFE, Market Risk VaR and sensitivities, Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), Initial Margin (IM) and regulatory calculations such as EC, RC, IRC and CRM, <br/><br/> <strong>Position summary</strong> <br/><br/> IHS Markit is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join the Financial Risk Analytics group. The successful candidate will be involved in all aspects of testing with emphasis on test automation. We are looking for a pragmatic advocate of quality and someone that is willing to take a lead role. As part of the Quality Assurance team, you will help develop automated tests for our suite of windows and linux software including grid-based simulation software. A programming (mandatory) and an investment banking background (ideal) as you work closely with financial engineering, product development groups, and work directly to support our customers. We are looking for a methodical problem solver that is comfortable mentoring and working with a team. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties & accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Develop detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts to support regression, functional, load and stress testing for rest, client/server, and computational grid-based applications.</li><li>Automation of testing including updates to and creation of automated test scripts for system, load and performance testing.Design and maintain automated test frameworks, including support of agile and test-driven development</li><li>Conduct full product testing (component, system, integration, performance, etc.) including automation of the testing wherever possible.</li><li>Help define and develop Quality Assurance strategies</li><li>Identify, document and track software defects to resolution</li><li>Establish and maintain multi-platform test environments</li><li>Support customers on all Financial Risk Analytics products</li> </ul> <strong>Business competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education and experience</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline</li><li>Strong knowledge of Quality Assurance concepts and methodologies</li><li>Minimum 8 years of testing experience in a software development organization</li><li>Understanding of the operating and data models of risk solutions, particularly in investment banking</li> </ul> <strong>Commercial awareness</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent knowledge of REST and network application testing.</li><li>Strong analytical ability and programming skills (preferably in PowerShell, Python)</li><li>Experience with performance and load testing tools.Jmeter expertise.</li><li>Experience with agile software development methodologies and test-driven development</li><li>Working knowledge Hadoop would be valuable.HBase, HDFS, Yarn, Hive, etc.</li><li>Exposure to Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Windows, Windows Server platforms and Linux.</li> </ul> <strong>Personal competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Personal impact</strong> <ul> <li>Strong organizational, planning, and analytical skills</li> </ul> <strong>Communication</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Must be able to communicate at a senior level with all areas of the company within the financial services risk management domain</li> </ul> <strong>Teamwork</strong> <ul> <li>Strong collaboration skills in a team environment</li> </ul> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
