<li>Assists the Project Manager to resolve conflict as required.</li><li>Communicates clearly with various project personnel and provides technical insight for resolution of problems.</li><li>Provides guidance and technical direction to the Junior Project Engineers and Engineering Technologists.</li><li>As required by the Engineering Manager, takes responsibility for areas of the technical direction and development of the engineering department including drafting.</li><li>Ensures appropriate quality and integrity of product design, including taking responsibility for the stamping of required drawings (P&ID, Line List, PSV Table, Piping Registration, Etc.).</li><li>Acts as one of the Responsible Members for the company’s permit to practice for APEGA.</li><li>Communicates effectively between various departments.</li> <li>Completes engineering deliverables on time and on budget.</li><li>Reviews all customer specifications that are applied to the project, ensures package is as sold and as built to customer agreed specifications.</li><li>Is responsible to update the project “Scheduler” and ensures engineering deliverables are completed.</li> <li>Is responsible for understanding the proposal and the clients’ project specifications that have been accepted.</li><li>Reviews the process simulation, checks or performs all major equipment sizing – vessel- compressor, driver, separators, pumps, filters, and heat exchangers.</li><li>Performs any additional process design including simulation to determine pipe sizing, and equipment blow-down rates.</li><li>Prepares vessel datasheets, performs sketch of internals, determines nozzle size and location, supervises vessel design, ensures vessel drawings are approved and issued to meet the project requirements.</li><li>Prepares equipment datasheets (Vessels, Exchangers, Pumps, Etc.).</li><li>Prepares and issues purchase requisitions to purchasing group as required and obtains comparative pricing for equipment where agreed.</li><li>Prepares draft P&IDs, supervises designers to prepare the drawing, arranges and chairs in-house P&ID review meeting going through P&ID checklist, submits P&ID to customer and arranges for revisions</li><li>Prepares the Bill Of Material (BOM), performs detail sizing of PSVs, control valves, Instrumentations Etc. and insures material selection, electrical classification, certification requirements are met</li><li>Issues BOM to purchasing, customer, designer and arranges for revisions.</li><li>Supervises the designers during preparation of the 3D model, GA, structural drawing and spool drawings in following customer’s specific requests and customer or in-house specs.</li><li>Prepares weight estimates, selects preliminary structural beam sizes and communicates with the third party structural engineer for optimization and final approval.</li><li>Arranges and chairs in-house 3D model review meeting with designers and manufacturing staff going through the design review checklist.</li><li>Prepares control philosophy and shutdown key.</li><li>Participates in safety studies such as HAZOP’s as required.</li><li>Captures and defines the scope of project change orders and communicates them to the Project Manager.</li><li>Prepares all project operating and maintenance manuals.</li> <li>Performs project final P&ID, walkthrough and signoff off our STA-ISO-010 Manufacturing Commissioning Sheet.</li><li>Completes project “Ship Loose List” in conjunction with manufacturing.</li><li>Participates in project “Closeout”, start-up and “Lessons Learned” meetings by providing feedback to Project Managers.</li> <li>Incorporates previous projects “Lessons Learned” into the engineering of current projects.</li> <li>Provides support to the service group during equipment commissioning and start-up which can include potential trip to site.</li> <li>Prepares any other calculations and technical documentation as required.</li> <li>Supervises third party engineering providers, review and approving all such work (Torsional analysis, Fugitive Emission Study, Stress Analysis, Vibration/Pulsation Study)</li><li>Reviews, approves and issues, via Document Control, all drawings according to Startec drawing approval procedures and in following project schedule.</li><li>Reviews and approves all vendor drawings in following project schedule.</li> </ul> We offer competitive wages, training, flexibility and a dynamic and exciting work environment. <br/><br/> It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Pro.file People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below: <br/><br/> <strong>http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=55094</strong> <br/><br/> We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior Project Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/>SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision. <br/><br/> SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field, and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. Within Canada, our Rail & Transit team has been selected to design and deliver most of the recent greenfield and brownfield LRT, ALRT and Light Metro jobs awarded in the last 10 years including the Canada Line, Calgary West LRT, Edmonton North LRT, Evergreen Line, Confederation Line, Eglinton-Crosstown, and the Réseau Express Métropolitain. <br/><br/> Our Rail Control Systems team, under the broader Rail & Transit Engineering division, deliver solutions which include rail signalling, train control, and communications systems. The Rail Control Systems team is expanding their capabilities into the Class 1 railway domain and is looking for a Senior Signalling Systems Engineer, reporting to the Manager, Signalling & Train Control Systems to join our growing team. This position can be based in Vancouver or Calgary. To perform this role successfully, the individual will be responsible for but not limited to the following: <ul> <li>Lead a group of technical specialists in the design of conventional railway signalling systems</li><li>Lead the review of client specifications and requirements</li><li>Lead the generation of technical specifications</li><li>Lead the production of signal designs including wiring plans, application software, and test plans</li><li>Interaction with clients, senior management and technical leads</li><li>Interaction with construction management and delivery leads</li><li>Support of construction and installation activities in the field</li><li>Support for Test & Commissioning and setting to work of Class 1 railway signalling systems</li><li>Support for System Assurance / Verification & Validation teams in the delivery of Class 1 railway signalling systems</li> </ul> <strong><strong>Skills and Experiences</strong></strong> <ul> <li>10+ years proven track record and experience in the design and development of Class 1 railway systems, with specific conventional signalling systems design experience and expertise in this domain.</li><li>Experience in design of interlockings and crossings in Canada and the US with working knowledge of relay and microprocessor based interlocking control systems.</li> <li>Ability to read, understand, and modify signal plans for traditional relay based signalling systems as well as application software for microprocessor based signalling systems.</li><li>Experience in the Testing & Commissioning of conventional signalling systems.</li><li>Knowledge of sub-system level technologies and wayside components of signalling systems, including: power switch machines, track circuits, and signals.</li><li>Knowledge of AREMA, CROR, Transport Canada, and FRA regulations/standards.</li><li>Able to lead, mentor and coach a team of signalling systems designers/engineers.</li><li>Able to lead discussions with the partners, clients and suppliers and to interact with senior discipline staff as overall delivery lead.</li><li>Excellent MS Office skills, especially Excel and Word.</li><li>Experience of multi-disciplinary technical environments, people management and financial management.</li><li>Excellent written, presentation and communication/briefing skills; able to present to large audiences of industry experts.</li><li>Excellent networking and client relationship management skills; able to influence and manage key stakeholders and build trust and advocacy with clients.</li><li>Excellent people management and interpersonal skills; able to engage staff and address difficult issue effectively and fairly.</li><li>Experience in the design of Positive Train Control (PTC) systems is considered an asset.</li><li>Experience in the design of Cab Signalling based systems is considered an asset.</li> </ul> <strong><strong> Travel:</strong></strong> <ul>  <li>Approximately 25% travel within Canada</li>  </ul> <strong> Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>P.Eng designation with EGBC or APEGA is required, Electrical or Mechanical degree</li> <li>SNC-Lavalin is one of the world's largest engineering and construction companies. Our Rail & Transit Engineering Unit is responsible for the development and execution of large transportation infrastructure projects valued at several billion. <br/><br/> We offer an opportunity to work on some of the largest projects in North America. You will work in an environment that will give you an opportunity to excel and advance in your career.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
Title: Senior Signalling Systems Engineer - Vancouver or Calgary based

Job_Description: <strong>Title</strong> <br/><br/> DevOps Engineer, Product Development and Delivery <br/><br/> <strong>Summary</strong> <br/><br/> We are seeking an outstanding DevOps Engineer to drive cloud automation and provide operational support of commercial software products within the Identity and Access Management domain. The DevOps Engineer fills a critical role within our product delivery team, and will partner with Software Engineers to design, implement, and execute cloud automation and operational support processes. This DevOps Engineer will be working directly with emerging public cloud technologies on a highly visible business-critical platform; providing substantial opportunity for technical skills development and career growth. <br/><br/> <strong>General Job Duties</strong> <ul> <li>Participate as part of a product development organization to design and implement cloud operations processes for moderately complex software platforms.</li><li>Follow industry good DevOps practices to ensure high quality of service.</li><li>Report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, and accept direction on corrective measures.</li><li>Foster inter-team cooperation as part of a project/program.</li><li>Continuously expand knowledge in area of specialization.</li><li>Perform other duties as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Specific Job Duties</strong> <ul> <li>Operate as a DevOps Engineer in a product development and delivery team for a cloud-based Identity and Access Management (IAM) services platform.</li><li>Assist in analyzing requirements and providing comprehensive cloud automation solutions to ensure high QoS.</li><li>Provide operational support for production and pre-production software systems hosted in the public cloud.</li><li>Drive process improvement through cloud automation.</li><li>Support and champion the Agile Scrum development methodology.</li><li>Collaborate with Software Development Leads and Engineers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, and IT Leadership.</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>Experience in production software system administration.</li><li>Background in both Linux/Unix and Windows environments.</li><li>Experience with automation/configuration management using Ansible or an equivalent.</li><li>Working knowledge of coding/scripting (eg. Java or C#, Python, Unix shell scripting)</li><li>Understanding of IT Operations best practices in mission-critical high-availability systems.</li><li>Ability to engage self-guided analysis and problem solving.</li><li>Passion and curiosity for solving technical problems.</li><li>Experience with public cloud infrastructure is a major plus (eg. AWS or Azure)</li><li>Professional certification is a plus.</li> </ul> <strong>Organizational Relationships</strong> <ul> <li>Reports to DevOps manager.</li><li>Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities.</li> </ul> <strong>External Relationships</strong> <ul> <li>Actively participates in industry forums and user groups.</li> </ul> <strong>FLSA Status – US Only</strong> <ul> <li>Exempt</li> </ul> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: DevOps Engineer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon is looking for an experienced web applications software engineer who is passionate about coding and technology to work on our Time Intelligence platform. We are building workforce management solutions for global enterprise customers and growing rapidly. The entire multi-tenant SaaS solution is built using modern AWS cloud tech stack utilizing open source technologies.</div>   <br/><strong><div>About you:</div>  <br/></strong> <br/> <div>You are passionate about technology and coding best practices. Self initiating, takes pride in ownership, naturally collaborative personality, shares knowledge, likes to learn new technologies, keeps up with technology trends and has worked on recent projects utilizing a modern tech stack. This is a crucial senior team member role that requires full ownership of taking solutions from requirements analysis to production deployment. <br/><br/> <strong>What else you need to bring:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Expertise in full stack web applications development</li>   <li>Expert coding skills across the entire stack UI, Services and Data</li> <li>Recent experience of working with cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google)</li> <li>Expertise in JavaScript, Node.js and your favorite modern UI development framework (we use React)</li> <li>Highly skilled in developing beautiful looking, rich interactive web user interfaces (modern CSS skills)</li> <li>Quick learner - we understand you will not know everything but should have demonstrated competency to learn and grow</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Extra credit:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>A portfolio of your accomplishments outside of work (Git repo, open source contributions, technical blog, presentations, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with Mobile Apps, UI development</li> </ul>  <strong><div>How we work:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>An agile development environment delivering functionality to production every week</li> <li>Collaborative team involving development, test automation and DevOps</li> <li>Continuous learning culture with Lunch & Learns and peer collaboration/mentoring</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Nodejs, React, AWS Position

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> Under minimal supervision, certifies and assures quality of new and existing products by executing test plans and scripts to verify that new or modified software programs function according to user requirements and conform to established guidelines. Communicates and coordinates results with impacted departments and tracks statistical information. At times, may be assigned to help coordinate test activities of others. <br/><br/> <strong>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS</strong> <ul> <li>Executes and creates test plans and clear, concise scripts for new products or enhancements to existing products. Defines comprehensive scenarios and variations in data to adequately perform testing.</li><li>Schedules and performs functional, integration, regression, and release testing; submits errors and issues to development for correction, and retests once errors have been corrected. Reports test results and status as appropriate. Track defects and causal analyses to closure. Acts independently to review and certify test results of other analysts and testers.</li><li>Reviews and provides feedback on requirements, design, or scope documents.</li><li>Helps set standards for test design.</li><li>Interacts with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and development teams to identify and refine test requirements.</li><li>Coordinates and performs highly complex testing projects from initiation through delivery. Ensures that testing projects are completed on schedule and within budget.</li><li>Serves as liaison between technical and non-technical departments to ensure that all targets and requirements are met.</li> <li>Supports and advocates established testing procedures and may provide input to establish those procedures.</li><li>Prepares test plans and test scripts for software corrections and enhancements. May review test plans and test reports.</li><li>Plans, coordinates, and reports the test activities of others as assigned. Performs test reviews.</li><li>Develops and creates test design frameworks and teaches team members how to implement testing processes.</li><li>Keeps abreast of software industry “Best Practices” and trends and communicates new information to QA team.</li><li>May assist with automated scripts from team members.</li><li>May assist with education and training with regard to software enhancements and conveying corrections to other employees.</li><li>May lead education and training, alpha and beta testing, and changes for documentation update or correction.</li><li>Cross-trains and mentors less experienced QA team members.</li><li>May create and maintain test libraries, databases, and test environments.</li><li>May assist with any software changes for documentation update or correction.</li><li>May assist with alpha and beta testing, may prepare enhancement test plans used at beta site.</li> </ul> <strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <ul> <li>High school diploma or equivalent required. Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree preferred.</li><li>Minimum of six to nine years of experience in quality assurance, software testing, or a related field; or</li><li>An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.</li> </ul> <strong>KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS</strong> <ul> <li>Has a wide range of experience and able to resolve complex issues. Works on complex and diverse projects. Analysis requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises good judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining solutions.</li><li>Excellent knowledge of software development lifecycle.</li><li>Excellent knowledge of software testing lifecycle.</li><li>Excellent understanding of test design and testing methodologies.</li><li>Able to facilitate the software quality certification function with accuracy and timeliness.</li><li>Able to review system and functional requirements and extract data to use in preparing test plans and scripts.</li> <li>Able to meet aggressive deadlines and handle multiple projects.</li><li>Able to use independent judgment to plan, prioritize and organize a diversified workload.</li><li>Able to define highly complex level test cases and scenarios.</li> </ul> <strong>WORKING CONDITIONS</strong> <ul> <li>Typical office setting, with environmentally controlled conditions.</li><li>Able to work extended hours as business needs dictate.</li><li>Occasional overnight travel required.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY CONFORMANCE STATEMENT</strong> <br/><br/> In performance of their respective responsibilities, all employees of Jack Henry and Associates are expected to: <ul> <li>Complete quality work within deadlines.</li><li>Interact professionally with other employees, customers and suppliers.</li><li>Work effectively as a team contributor on all assignments.</li><li>Communicate and coordinate work efforts with other employees, customers and suppliers.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li> <li>Attend work regularly based on the assigned schedule.</li> </ul> <strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Applicants for U.S. based positions with Jack Henry & Associates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Jack Henry & Associates, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and maintains a Drug-Free Workplace.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Females, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.</em>
Title: Sr. QA Analyst

Job_Description: We have an opening for full-time <strong>Project Manager/Engineer</strong> in our <strong>Calgary</strong> office that will be responsible for executing integrated construction projects while following corporate quality standards throughout the project life cycle within our Power & Building Solutions group. <br/><br/> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <ul>  <li>Manage large scale electrical based (low and medium voltage) projects such as Electrical and VFD buildings from quotation throughout design, construction, delivery and support.</li> <li>Act as project subject matter expert (SME) for supplied integrated equipment.</li> <li> Act as the primary point of contact for clients, subcontractors, senior management and the project team. Manage multiple stakeholders and vendors while maintaining and developing client relationships throughout the project and post-completion review.</li> <li>Be an active participant in the high level design, including general arrangements and optimizing building layouts. Manage and provide input on all drawing review cycles from IFA to As Built from the client, subcontractors and internal teams.</li> <li>Have a working knowledge of the document control process to properly expedite supplier and client data deliverables based on the approved Vendor Drawing and Data Requirements (VDDR) list.</li>  <li>Manage project execution to ensure adherence to budget, schedule, change management, risk management, scope and specifications.</li> <li>Chair and manage all project meetings including kickoff meetings, pre fabrication meetings, client status reviews and executive status updates.</li>  <li>Take an active role in the execution and construction of projects including subcontractor site visits, fabrication yard inspections and testing programs.</li> <li>Support the Inside Sales Team during the Request for Quotation (RFQ) process.</li> <li>Prepare periodic status and progress reports/presentations for clients and Tundra’s Executive Committee.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum 5-10 years of project management experience, focusing on industrial construction.</li> <li>A bachelor’s degree/diploma in engineering from an APEGA or ASET with a focus in electrical engineering.</li>  <li>PMP Designation is an asset.</li> <li>Thorough understanding of electrical design, schematics, specifications and codes/standards.</li> <li>Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills – both verbal and written.</li> <li>Applied understanding of document control processes and tracking change through the project life cycle.</li> <li>Proficiency of the Microsoft Office Suite including MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint.</li> <li>SAP experience an asset.</li> <li>Must have a valid driver’s license and passport.</li> <li>Minimal travel required.</li>  </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.
Title: Project Manager/Engineer

Job_Description: <div>Cisco people are not happy merely moving the security innovation needle a few millimeters – we want to blow it off the dial. Every day we look for new ways to merge innovative security technology with Cisco’s 25+ years of networking expertise to redefine network security. We need like-minded colleagues who dream big about transforming security and networks, and who expect to reap the rewards for their high-visibility creations. <br/><br/> <strong> Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to work within the Cisco AMP team on our AMP Private Cloud product. The Cisco AMP team has a dynamic work environment that inspires employees to create opportunities by daily honing their talents and skills. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company’s purposes and principles. You will be working within a team of exceptional software engineers, who are always ready to share their knowledge and skills. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Do</strong> <br/><br/> The Cisco AMP team is responsible for shipping client software for all flavours of Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android, supported by a Linux backend containing MongoDB, Cassandra, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Hadoop, Hive, RabbitMQ, Ruby, and custom C code, all Chef managed <ul> <li>We deploy across a cloud infrastructure including Amazon’s EC2 and our own hardware running Joyent’s SDC, and have condensed these services down into a single instance with our Private Cloud</li><li>Active participation in design and code reviews</li><li>Implementing product features and fixing existing bugs logged in the bug database</li><li>Developing and maintaining internal tools for automated functional, integration and performance testing</li><li>Supporting Tier 3 Technical support by debugging and bug fixing production issues</li><li>We know how to ship software and shipping software feels good</li><li>We are looking for a software engineer to join us, focusing on our Private Cloud appliance</li> </ul> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <ul> <li>Have high personal integrity and ethical standards</li><li>Strong team oriented</li> <li>Passionate about designing and building high-quality software</li><li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>An unquenchable desire to learn</li><li>2+ years of experience in software development</li><li>Experience with Unix shell scripting: sh and Bash</li><li>Experience with any of the following scripting programming languages: Ruby, Python, Perl</li><li>Experience with source control management systems: i.e., git, subversion, CVS</li><li>Practical experience with SQL</li><li>Good understanding of administrating Linux systems</li><li>Experience with system and application debugging and performance optimization</li><li>Good understanding of computer networking protocols</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Desired Skills:</strong></div><ul><li>Experience with compiled languages such as: C, C++, Go, Rust</li><li>Understanding of secure coding practices</li><li>Contributions to open source projects</li><li>Experience with system configuration management systems: Chef, CFengine, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack</li><li>Working knowledge with common compile, build, and packaging tools, i.e., gcc, make, rpmbuild</li><li>Working knowledge of some of the following technologies: memcache, NGINX HAproxy, MongoDB, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, MySQL, ElasticSearch</li><li>Understanding of modern PC hardware</li> </ul> About Cisco <br/><br/> The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.</div>
Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: Finding efficient, safe, and economical ways to develop and deliver oil and gas is an on-going challenge. From the Arctic to the Canadian oil sands and the US shale plays, our Oil & Gas team partners with clients to provide engineering, procurement, construction management (EPCM), permitting, survey, and environmental services across the upstream, midstream, and downstream oil and gas industry. We design facilities, pipelines, terminals, and refineries, as well as critical infrastructure like processing plants and field facilities. Through our partnerships, industry experience, and use of technology, we develop new and inventive ways to solve emerging issues, meet regulations, and increase productivity. Explore your career options with us. <br/><br/> Stantec's <strong>Calgary Oil and Gas office</strong> is currently looking for an <strong>Intermediate Automation Engineer</strong>. This individual will be an excellent communicator and skilled problem-solver with a strong attention to detail. This is a dynamic work environment where you will play a pivotal role in a diverse range of projects, from initial planning to design to construction. <ul> <li>Member of technical team developing instrumentation and controls deliverables including: shutdown keys; control narratives; control system architecture; control panel design; instrument datasheets; instrument index; calculations.</li><li>P&ID development</li><li>Attend / support HAZOP and various other process safety assessment, evaluation, and design sessions</li><li>Instrumentation commodity specifications and material requisition development</li><li>Control system equipment specifications and material requisition development</li><li>Controls configuration specification & scoping for internal or 3rd party programmers</li><li>Project team communication</li><li>Coordination with other disciplines to meet deliverables</li><li>Preparation of construction work packages</li></ul>  <ul> <li>5-10 years of I&C experience</li><li>Intools (SPI) experience is an asset</li><li>Experience in Alberta midstream pipeline, pumping, and compression projects is an asset</li><li>Experience in Alberta Heavy Oil / SAGD engineering industry is an asset</li><li>Engineering Degree in applicable field (Instrumentation, Electrical, Process Control) an asset, but willing to look at alternate qualifications / experience.</li> <li>Current Alberta engineering credential (P.Eng, P.L.(Eng.)) is an asset</li><li>DCS, PLC, & SCADA panel design & specification is an asset</li><li>A working knowledge of Microsoft Office will be beneficial in this role.</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate Automation Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><p></p></div><div>Aircraft Maintenance Engineer</div><div><p></p></div><div>Apply by Date: Apr 30, 2018</div><div><div></div></div><div><p></p></div><div><p></p></div><div>Primary Location: CA-TBD-TBD</div><div>Other Locations: CA-ON-Toronto, CA-BC-Vancouver, CA-AB-Calgary, CA-QC-Montréal, CA-NS-Halifax</div><div>Schedule: Full-time</div><div>Job Type: Permanent</div><div></div><div>Shift: Shift Work</div><div></div><div><p></p></div><div><div><b></b> </div> <div><b>National Recruitment Campaign</b></div> <div><b></b> </div> <div><b>Develop your career with the largest regional airline in Canada!</b></div> <div><b></b> </div> <div>If you are an Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) and value an organization that promotes safety as well as quality work life balance, then the Jazz hangar could be a great place to work for you! Jazz operates approximately 700 flights every day across Canada and into the United States. We carry 10 million passengers a year on our fleet of Canadian-made Bombardier CRJ, Q400 and Dash 8 aircraft. Jazz truly is Canada’s airline! We operate more flights to more Canadian destinations than any other carrier and have five locations: </div> <div>Halifax, Toronto, Montreal, Calgary and Vancouver.</div> <div> </div> <div><b>For a look behind the scenes of Jazz’s operation, watch our video ‘Beyond Ordinary’ at <b>www.youtube.com/jazzaviationlp</b> </b></div> <div> </div> <div><b>We are currently accepting resumes for Aircraft Maintenance Engineer positions across Canada. Our opportunities are permanent and full time. We are hiring Licensed and Apprentice AMEs with any level of experience in Mechanics, Avionics, and Structures.</b></div> <div><b></b> </div> <div>Jazz was named among Canada’s Safest Employers 2017 taking gold in the Transportation category! At Jazz, our safety culture is top of mind every day. Our success is due to all employees taking ownership for safety, without compromise. As an AME at Jazz you could apply to work in our maintenance, repair and overhaul facility in Halifax or join one of our Airline Line Maintenance bases maintaining our Air Canada Express Aircraft in an airworthy condition for our scheduled service.</div> <div> </div> <div><b>See video</b>: <b>Canada's Safest Employers 2017 – Transportation – Jazz Aviation</b></div> <div><b></b> </div> <div><b>Key Responsibilities: </b></div> <div><b></b> </div> <div><b>You will:</b></div> <ul> <li> <div>Carry out maintenance duties on Jazz aircraft; </div></li> <li> <div>Report on issues affecting the serviceability of aircraft; </div></li> <li> <div>Ensure aircraft are maintained in accordance with our company and Transport Canada regulations; </div></li> <li> <div>Maintain the shared work area in a neat and tidy condition; </div></li> <li> <div>Perform duties in accordance with our established policies and procedures while giving primary consideration to personal safety, the safety of co-workers and customers; </div></li> <li> <div>Other related duties as assigned. </div></li></ul> <div><b>Opportunities:</b></div> <ul> <li> <div>Our Apprentice AMEs are given the opportunity to complete all the tasks required to obtain their AME License. </div></li> <li> <div>When positions are available, AMEs are given the opportunity to transfer bases if desired.</div></li> <li> <div>Jazz offers opportunities for career advancement.</div></li></ul> <div><b> </b></div> <div><b>Wages:</b></div> <div> </div> <div>The positions in our Maintenance Department are unionized positions. Current pay scales are outlined in our collective agreement. </div> <ul> <li> <div>Pay scales are extremely competitive and progress every 6 months to 1 year. </div></li> <li> <div>In addition to experience based progression, our pay scales also provide cost of living increases.</div></li> <li> <div>AMEs qualify for a Technical Premium which is paid on top of the base wage for every hour worked. </div> <div> </div></li></ul> <div><b>What Jazz can offer you:</b></div> <ul> <li> <div>Profit Sharing</div></li> <li> <div>Travel Privileges </div></li> <li> <div>Employee Share Ownership</div></li> <li> <div>Pension Plan </div></li> <li> <div>Health & Dental Coverage</div></li> <li> <div>Short & Long-Term Disability </div></li> <li> <div>Life Insurance</div></li> <li> <div>Relocation Assistance may include:</div> <ul> <li> <div>Shipment of Tool Box to new base. </div></li> <li> <div>A one-way flight pass to the new base</div></li></ul></li></ul> <p> </p></div><div><p></p></div><div><div><b></b> </div> <div><b>Qualifications: </b></div> <ul> <li> <div><b>Apprentice</b> AMEs must be a graduate of an accredited Transport Canada approved Aircraft Maintenance Engineer program. We accept apprentices with any level of experience.</div></li> <li> <div>We are also looking for AMEs who are<b> Licensed</b> in any category; Mechanics, Avionics or Structures.</div></li></ul></div><div><p></p></div><div>Requisition ID: ONGOING-TBD-640-17</div><div><p></p></div></div>
Title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer

Job_Description: You want to be part of a team that designs the transportation routes you’ll be driving for years to come. You understand what’s involved in taking a complex transportation project from planning through to construction. You follow developments in transportation engineering with interest. You seek like-minded engineers who want to build better roads together. <br/><br/> Binnie is looking for a Highway Design Engineer to join our Alberta Division. Binnie has been recognized for notable projects including the role of Owner’s Engineer on the Port Mann Highway 1 Improvement Project, and detailed design of the Highway 99 at 16th Avenue Interchange in South Surrey in British Columbia. <br/><br/> From our office in downtown Calgary, you will provide highway and municipal road design engineering services for a broad spectrum of Alberta and British Columbia based transportation projects. The projects vary in scope and complexity from rural four-lane projects to large urban interchanges. <br/><br/> You will work alongside our talented team of Engineers, Project Managers, Designers and Technologists and apply your highway design expertise to develop optimal design solutions. You will utilize your previous experience with road and highway design projects in this dynamic, challenging role. <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR ROLE:</strong>  <ul> <li>Acting as the Engineer-of-Record on design projects or performing design work in consultation with the Engineer-of-Record</li> <li>Maintaining complete design records and project design files</li> <li>Reviewing work and completing quality control procedures as per Binnie's Organizational Quality Management Policy (OQM)</li> <li>Keeping up-to-date with knowledge of design engineering, legislation and codes</li>   <li>Guiding and directing staff involved with design process</li> </ul>  <div> <div><strong>WHAT YOU BRING:</strong>  <ul> <li>5 to 10 years of related experience in a civil engineering environment in a design capacity</li> <li>Experience with the City of Calgary and Alberta Transportation planning and design guidelines</li> <li>Registration as a P.Eng. with APEGA, or equivalent</li> <li>A strong working knowledge of AutoCAD and Civil 3D</li> <li>Strong communication and time management skills and ability to work concurrently on several different projects</li> <li>Excellent attention to detail to consistently produce accurate, high quality work</li> <li>Confidence to perform design work with minimal supervision</li> </ul>  <div><strong>ABOUT BINNIE:</strong> <br/><br/> We are the people behind the infrastructure you use every day. We’re small enough to know each other’s names, and big enough to be where we’re needed. As an employee-owned firm and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, we take pride in our work and are respected as one of the top engineering firms in Western Canada. We work with municipal and provincial governments, and with ports, forestry, transit, and hydro. Our projects extend from Metro Vancouver to Prince George, to Edmonton, Calgary, and rural Alberta. <br/><br/> We’re looking for professionals who want to build careers and communities that last. We can’t do it without you. <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong></div> </div> <br/>People come first. We support you with the education, mentoring, and growth opportunities you need to build an interesting career. As an employee-owned firm, we create a clear internal growth path that can keep up with even the most ambitious professionals. We are connected from our field staff to each of our six offices and we support communication between all staff, and across all divisions. You’ll be well connected to the rest of Binnie via phone, video conferencing, and our popular intranet. Whether it’s joining a book club, or writing about your experience in the field, everyone can get involved in their own way. <br/><br/> Interested in this job? <br/><br/> Let us know why you want to work at Binnie, and why you would be a fit as our next Highway Design Engineer. Submit your application below. <br/><br/> Thank you for your interest in Binnie. We look forward to reviewing your application.</div> <br/>
Title: Highway Design Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><div> <p>RESPONSIBILITIES:</p>  <p>•Ensure aircraft is maintained in accordance with all Manufacturers and Company recommendations and regulations;<br> •Complete all work order entries in a timely fashion;<br> •Ensure that approved equipment and materials are utilized and a high standard of workmanship is maintained.</p>  <p>QUALIFICATIONS: <br> •5 years experience or more in a similar role;<br> •Hold a valid AME license; Endorsement of Citation, particularly CJ4, aircraft preferred; Holder of current CIZR (Airport Red) pass and D/AR passes preferred.</p>  <p>IMP is committed to Employment Equity and our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative at all job levels. Title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (Citation CJ4)

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing for an exciting opportunity to deliver a world class secure next-generation communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Calgary is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops, tablets and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running Linux. The project includes all phases including System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The systems integration and verification and validation (SI V&V, or SI) team will consist of several smaller integration teams, each focusing on integration a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Systems integration teams will work closely with the software development teams and will follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will work together to design, implement, and test software features for the product. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary depending on experience, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Work cooperatively within a Scrum team or with multiple Scrum teams to take on new integration test tasks</li><li>Perform detailed design, implementation, and test activities in order to complete Sprint tasks</li><li>Share knowledge and skills with other Scrum (development and test) team members</li><li>Development of acceptance test cases and procedures that validate hardware, firmware, software, and system functionality</li><li>Ability to review system, subsystem and product requirement specifications, interface control documents, design documents and use cases in order to develop test cases</li><li>Executing test cases in a lab environment; analyzing, interpreting and documenting results</li><li>Writing defect and test summaries and test reports to demonstrate progress and communicate this as required</li><li>Some generation and maintenance of test scripts for automated testing</li><li>Analysis and management of requirements mapping to test cases</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Some understanding of test engineering, ideally with knowledge of SAFe agile and/or iterative development methods</li><li>Demonstrate strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Demonstrate strong problem solving and an ability to conduct detail analysis leading to good conclusions</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills, and takes pride and ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Has a desire to learn, and ideally experience in; defining, developing and executing integration tests for communications and networking systems.</li><li>Experience investigation and working collaboratively to resolve software defects</li><li>Experience with test engineering processes and tools</li><li>Knowledge and use of requirements writing tools and test writing tools, an asset</li><li>Familiarity with radios, voice/data networks and Internet Protocols (IP), an asset</li><li>Willing to develop knowledge and skills in automated test frameworks and implemented automated integration testing</li><li>An ability to adapt quickly</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li><li>Candidates with diplomas will be considered with adequate additional experience</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Junior System Integration (V&V) Engineer

Job_Description: In this entry level 12 month contract position as a Geomatics Verification Engineer with NovAtel Inc.'s Geomatics team you will design, implement, and explore ways to verify improvements on real-time GNSS algorithms. Collaborating with engineers across the NovAtel organization to implement algorithms that automate verification; collect and analyze data; and, participate in firmware qualifications. Your troubleshooting abilities and methodical problem solving approach will support ongoing business initiatives in our exciting high tech environment. <ul> <li>Work hands-on with NovAtel’s products to execute feature level tests</li><li>Analyze performance and functional data to product requirements. Includes statistical and graphical analysis.</li><li>Perform “Exploratory Testing” to create system knowledge and enhance product robustness</li><li>Create or update test procedures based on new FW features</li><li>Create & maintain automated system level tests</li><li>Compile high quality written reports using standard templates</li><li>Create or update the NovAtel test utilities and scripts using C++, Perl, Python, and other scripting languages</li><li>Perform field testing including testing in Kinematic, Static, and Backpack setups</li><li>Investigation of problems and potentially resolve system defects</li><li>Investigate reported field issues, and potentially perform customer service duties</li><li>Be able to think critically and analytically to perform ad-hoc testing on features</li><li>Some local field work outside of the NovAtel site may be required</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>B.Sc. in Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics</li> <li>Available for a minimum 12-month work term</li><li>Comfortable reading and writing code in scripting languages such as Python</li><li>Strong data analysis skills</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Valid driver’s license</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team</li><li>Innate sense of curiosity and conscientiousness</li><li>Excited by new technologies and new possibilities</li><li>Derive satisfaction from your work being used in demanding real-world applications</li><li>Sense of urgency to meet customer expectations</li><li>You are comfortable working individually but know when to ask for help</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience in C++ in a Windows environment using Microsoft Visual C++;</li> <li>Knowledge of GPS/GNSS/INS</li> </ul>
Title: Geomatics Verification Engineer - 1 Year Contract

Job_Description: ServiceCalgary, AB<br/><br/>Startec Refrigeration Services is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission critical compression and refrigeration systems for a variety of industries. Startec devotes their industry leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solve their clients’ most technically challenging needs. We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, which is a cornerstone of our business. <br/><br/> We are currently recruiting an experienced Project Engineer to join the Startec team. The Project Engineer ensures that Startec satisfies its’ customers’ needs in an efficient and professional manner. This role provides engineering and technical support to the Service department, sales and directly to the customer and acts as liaison between Service and the engineering group in the compression and process division.<br/><br/><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>P.Eng. designation with minimum five years’ experience in refrigeration and/or piping applications</li><li>Project management experience, a PMP designation would be an asset</li><li>Good knowledge of ASME/ANSI/codes, knowledge of CSA B-52 codes an asset</li><li>Microsoft Windows operating systems; Microsoft Office Suite, engineering design and drawing software</li><li>Strong technical, analytical and problem-solving capabilities.</li><li>Ability to communicate, influence, negotiate and resolve conflict</li><li>Capable of working with minimal direct supervision</li><li>Good interpersonal and communication skills.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills.</li> </ul>  <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Provide engineering support to the Startec Service group as required</li><li>Work directly with the Construction Manager in the project management execution of large capital projects to ensure projects are completed in accordance with acceptable engineering practices and Startec best practices.</li><li>Responsible for major equipment/component approval for all projects to ensure adherence to engineering best practices</li><li>Responsible for responding to bid technical clarifications during sales cycle</li><li>Resolve issues, provide direction and conduct quality assurance checks on project deliverables</li><li>Participate in pre-contract liaison with customer and may participate in negotiating with key customers regarding contract terms and conditions</li><li>Oversee drafting to prepare layouts and detail drawings</li><li>Responsible for project documentation including manuals and operating/control descriptions</li><li>Support the service group with commissioning and field issues</li><li>Keeping ahead of developments in the refrigeration industry by reading relevant journals, attending specialized training, industry conferences and courses</li> </ul>  <strong>JOB DUTIES:</strong><br/><br/><ul> <li>Prepare and maintain the project schedule identifying tasks, timelines and resources required for various projects</li><li>Maintain project cost control</li><li>Develop project bill of materials and approve all projects drawings</li><li>Provide help and advice to customers either directly or through use of internal resources</li><li>Analyze and compare customer, supplier, and Startec design specifications to identify areas on quotations and proposals where there are exceptions and/or additional costs.</li><li>Assist with inquiries from Startec sales agents and Startec customers related to requests for quotation</li><li>Mentor and assist with the development of junior engineering personnel</li><li>Develop and maintain relationship with major component suppliers</li><li>Negotiate price and delivery as required during development of quotation and standard product development</li><li>Investigate and solve customer problems where applicable to support operational activity</li><li>Develop standard product lines and design standards for refrigeration applications, including component selection, cost estimate and design.</li> <li>Develop process to include research & development, gathering market intelligence, and integration with Startec engineering and QC standards.</li><li>Preparation, review, and publication of design standards for refrigeration applications</li> </ul> We offer competitive wages, training, flexibility, and a dynamic and exciting work environment. Specialized technical training will be provided to the successful candidate. Please apply directly or forward your resume, quoting the job title above, in confidence to careers@startec.ca <br/><br/> It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Pro.file People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below: <br/><br/> <strong>http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=55677</strong> <br/><br/> We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Project Engineer

Job_Description: Summary <br/><br/> This position presents the opportunity to work on large, complex, and challenging projects for a leading engineering and environmental consulting firm with an expanding presence in Canada. Barr Engineering Company has been recognized as one of the "Best Environmental Services Firms to Work For" by CE News and Environmental Business Journal. <br/><br/> Barr is seeking an engineer to join its growing Calgary office. This person will work with multidisciplinary teams providing field support and engineering analysis and design for industrial clients in the oil sands and the mining industries. Project work may include coordinating technical programs for large-scale field pilot tests; overseeing on-site and bench-scale material testing; providing on-site construction observation; conducting onsite investigations of contaminated soil, sediment, and groundwater; evaluating and interpreting laboratory data; assisting with geotechnical and environmental designs; estimating costs; preparing plans and specifications; writing technical reports; and performing other duties as assigned by the company. While the position is located in Calgary, it will require routine travel. <br/><br/> NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in remote locations that feature rough terrain typical of construction and mining sites and to enter and work within facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Job assignments may involve work on waste-disposal sites and sites requiring cleanup of hazardous materials. Safety training will be provided before being assigned to work on these sites. <br/><br/> Minimum Qualifications  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in civil, environmental, geological, or chemical engineering with an interest in tailings and mine reclamation</li> <li>5 or more years of work experience directly related to the job responsibilities described above</li> <li>Professionally certified in Alberta (e.g., P. Eng.) or ability to obtain certification within one year</li> <li>Computer skills including word processing and complex spreadsheets</li>   <li>Strong technical and problem solving skills, excellent communication skills, ability to write well, and attention to detail</li> <li>Demonstrated project organization and leadership skills</li> <li>Flexible working style and willingness to modify personal schedules as required to meet project deadlines and/or client needs</li> <li>Acceptable driving record, as the position will include driving to conduct company business</li>   <li>Legal authorization to work in Canada and the United States without the need for sponsorship</li> </ul> Preferred Qualifications  <ul>  <li>Master’s degree in civil, environmental, geological, or chemical engineering</li> <li>Knowledge and experience in remediation and tailings management issues within the oil sands industry</li>   <li>Knowledge and understanding of industrial manufacturing processes such as petroleum refining, mining, and/or minerals processing</li>   <li>Familiarity with environmental regulations</li>    </ul> Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors that are not specifically listed. <br/><br/> We require proof of eligibility to work in Canada. <br/><br/> Barr Engineering Company strives to make www.barr.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance with completing the application process, please call 952-832-2600, or toll free at 800-632-2277. <br/><br/> Barr is an equal opportunity employer.

with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Job_Description: <div> Our Facilities Engineering group works on a wide range of diverse, cutting edge oil and gas projects; from a small well tie-in to a large multi-million dollar SAGD facility. <br/><br/> Due to the tremendous growth of our Facilities Engineering group we are looking for several experienced Project Engineers who are interested in working on challenging, fast-paced, and diverse projects. <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager of Project Engineering, you will be responsible for coordinating with the various internal disciplines, as well as the client to ensure the successful completion of the project. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Client interactions and single-point technical interface;</li>  <li>Guiding and coordinating the activities of the assigned engineering and design staff;</li>  <li>Coordinating with the various internal disciplines for initiation of performing complex engineering tasks including detailed calculations as required by the project;</li>  <li>Develop the Project Design Basis Memorandum and assist in the development of execution plan, budgets and schedules</li>  <li>Preparing P&IDs and Plot Plan</li>   <li>Ensuring appropriate multi-disciplinary review of project documents; approve all technical deliverables;</li>  <li>Conducting engineering quality control to meet WSP and Client quality standards;</li>  <li>Timely project reporting.</li>  </ul>  <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Our successful candidate will hold an engineering degree. We are looking for a candidate who has experience working as a Project Engineer on Gas Plant Projects in the Oil and Gas industry; ideally you will have a minimum of 10 years’ experience in a similar role. In addition you will also have:   <ul>  	<li>Superior communication skills;</li>   <li>Proven track record of working effectively with both internal and external clients;</li>  <li>Have a proven ability to multi-task and efficiently respond to changing priorities;</li>  <li>Familiarity with CSA Z662 and ASME B31.3;</li>  <li>P.Eng designation in Alberta.</li> </ul>  <div> Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong> World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>WSP Canada Inc.</strong></em></div> </div> </div><div></div>
Title: Project Engineer

Job_Description: At Williams Engineering we realize that having the right people is paramount to our ability to provide exceptional service to our clients. As our people are the most important part of our business; we make sure they are provided with fair compensation, training, advancement opportunities, in a positive team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Purpose:</strong> Responsible for providing strategic direction to the branch, cross-discipline marketing and business development, and developing a strong team of engineers and technologists to support the ongoing growth of the organization. <br/><br/> This role serves as an integral link between the Regional Director and the Engineering Director by providing both inter-disciplinary coordination and client leadership at the branch level. <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Responsibilities Include:</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Service Line Accountabilities – Workload Management and Engineering Quality</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Regional Accountabilities - Client Relationships and Operational Management</strong></div> <div>With advice from the Team Lead(s), forecast workload for staffing targets and participate in recruitment and termination of staff. <br/><br/> Lead the preparation of proposals for major projects.</div> <div>Manage cost and time components of each discipline to ensure profitability. <br/><br/> Working with the Regional Director to support the development of lasting relationships with clients. </div> <div>Overseeing the design process provide effective options and solutions to design problems, and ensuring quality engineering. <br/><br/> Prepare and maintain business plans for the branch that are in alignment with the company and service line business and strategic plan objectives.</div> <div>In conjunction with the Branch Administrator, Team Leads, and other WEC managers develop standards and procedures for, quality, efficiency, safety, cost reduction, client service and ensure they are followed by your branch. <br/><br/> Coordinate branch workload with other branches as necessary to optimize performance of each service line.</div><div>Contribute to, and coordinate with, marketing and business development initiatives that cross regional and geographic boundaries.</div> <div> Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative solutions.</div> <div>Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.</div> <div> Manage, motivate, train, mentor, and discipline direct reports according to company policies and guidelines.</div> <div> Develop direct reports’ Career Paths and provide performance appraisals, with input from the Regional Director.</div><div> Employees are required to adhere to the company and client safety policies and practices in effect at any given time.</div>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or diploma in Engineering Technology.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>12+ years’ experience in Consulting Engineering or related field.</li><li>Experience in a leadership, supervisory or mentorship role.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills; a person who listens well, respects diversity of opinions and has an open, clear and succinct communication style.</li><li>Strong presentation and project management skills.</li><li>The ability to recognize and accurately define problems and solutions by collecting data and establishing facts to draw valid conclusions.</li><li>A results oriented and decisive individual with the ability to delegate effectively.</li><li>A people oriented leader with a reputation for successfully attracting, mentoring and motivating a team.</li><li>Understand the principles of sustainable infrastructure and apply them when involved with projects, as well as business development</li><li>Effective organizational and time management skills in handling multiple priorities, performing a variety of tasks, and meeting required deadlines.</li><li>Strong contacts in the engineering community and a persuasive presentation and communication style.</li><li>Experience and good judgement to plan and accomplish ambitious but achievable goals.</li><li>Ability to represent the company to the staff, clients and community by ensuring the best image is presented.</li><li>Understands basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections and makes decisions accordingly.</li> <li>Understands our pricing model and billing procedures.</li> <li>Ability to facilitate team and client meetings effectively.</li> <li>Possesses strong understanding in the area of at least one engineering discipline.</li> <li>Application knowledge of WEC systems and programs (including Gnosis, Vision, Career Path, Office 365, Newforma, Planifi, Octiv, MS Dynamics, discipline specific drafting/design software, etc.)</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <ul>    <ul>  <li> <strong>Reference Number</strong>: Project Engineer</li> <li> <strong>Location</strong>: Calgary, ALberta, Canada</li> <li> <strong> Salary</strong> : Negotiable contract rates</li> <li> <strong>Sector</strong>: Oil and Gas Recruitment</li> </ul>    </ul>  <div> We are currently recruiting for a Project Engineer to be based on a long term contract basis in Calgary. The position will work from the Calgary office with occasional travel to site to ensure that all engineering, procurement, and fabrication works are completed to schedule and budget targets. This position will be working on a 2 year contract and will report to the Engineering Manager.The Project Engineer will be responsible for;  <ul>    <ul> <li>Reviewing engineering design, RFQ, bid evaluations, purchase orders, RFI, MOC documentation.</li> <li>Reviewing and providing input to design and project execution plans, EP schedules, and man hour budgets.</li> <li>Reviewing procurement and fabrication works, site and vendor shops, and testing and quality assurance activities.</li> <li>Monitoring and qualifying design changes to ensure only necessary changes are made in relation to safety and compliance regulations.</li> <li>Working with the Supply Chain Management team to ensure changes to vendor design, cost, schedule or execution are recorded.</li> <li>Managing the design development budget.</li> <li>Providing input to all detailed design drawing and 3d model reviews, process hazard assessments, constructability, operability, and maintainability reviews.</li></ul>   </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Reference Number (Copy from above – required) </div></div>
