Job_Description: Vertica Presales Engineer - Big Data Products, Canada<br/><br/><strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> PRESALES ENGINEER, BIG DATA PRODUCTS <br/><br/> Micro Focus <br/><br/> Toronto, Ontario, Canada or other Canadian locations <br/><br/> Discover the new Micro Focus – now the world’s 7th largest pure-play software company. By combining HPE Software and Micro Focus offerings, we have built a brand new company with a stronger, bigger portfolio that delivers customer-centered innovation. We are now uniquely positioned to help enterprise customers solve their most pressing business problems and operate in the Hybrid environment—from mainframe to mobile to cloud. <br/><br/> Our portfolio spans the following areas: <br/><br/> <strong>DevOps | IT Operations| Cloud | Security | Information Governance | Big Data, Machine Learning, and Analytics</strong> <br/><br/> Take charge of your future and join our dynamic, motivated sales team as we go to market with a best-in-class portfolio that will help shape the world’s software landscape. <br/><br/> #discoverthenew <br/><br/> <strong>Are you a data rockstar?</strong>  Do you want to work with the world's best data analytics platform founded by Turing Award winner Dr. Michael Stonebraker with customers such as Uber, AT&T, Cerner, Dreamworks, and Intuit? <br/><br/> Join our sales engineering team responsible for breaking down the technical barriers for adopting the Vertica platform and focused on being the trusted adviser to our customers. <br/><br/> You are a self-starter and a go-getter. <br/><br/> You love solving challenging data, analytics, or machine learning problems in an extremely demanding customer facing position. <br/><br/> You will partner with a world class sales and engineering team and make an immediate impact. <br/><br/> You will be a hands-on customer facing technologist and not just be slinging slideware. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> - Communicate and demonstrate the Vertica story, vision, and technology to prospects and customers <br/><br/> - Work hands-on with prospects and customers to show business value throughout the sales cycle, from demo to proof of concept to solution architecture to customer success <br/><br/> - Continuously learn quickly evolving technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), Machine Learning <br/><br/> - Become the voice of our customers internally to drive product enhancements and road map <br/><br/> - Travel approximately 50% <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> - Bachelor's degree in a technical area or equivalent practical experience <br/><br/> - Proven extensive experience to develop strong relationships with key decision makers & influencers within elite organizations <br/><br/> - Expert in Data Warehousing, Big Data, or BI / Analytics <br/><br/> - Excellent communication and presentation skills to present to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a white-board or using presentations and demos <br/><br/> - Highly effective listening and critical thinking skills <br/><br/> - Hands-on, complex problem solver <br/><br/> - Have the technical chops and innate curiosity to learn new technologies quickly in the dynamic big data and analytics space <br/><br/> <strong>The Unique Value of Micro Focus</strong> <br/><br/> At Micro Focus we provide our customers with a best-in-class portfolio of enterprise-grade scalable software with analytics built in. We put customers at the center of our innovation and build high quality products that our teams can be proud of. <br/><br/> Through our breadth of solutions, we are uniquely positioned to help our customers solve business problems and deliver against the needs and opportunities of Hybrid IT, from mainframe to mobile to cloud. We’re a pure-play software company –we have a level of focus that other technology companies don’t have, we are designed from the ground up to build, sell and support software. <br/><br/> We also have the strong operational foundation, proven over a combined 40 years of experience, to deliver on our commitments to our customers. Our scale is global—we have the reach and the capabilities to support customers in a global market. We are the 7th largest software company in the world, and the largest technology company listed on the FTSE. With 4,000 employees working on R&D, we can focus on innovating in solving the most complex technology problems for customers. <br/><br/> At its heart, Hybrid IT is about letting customers choose what’s right for them, without the need to compromise. Our job is to help them, and to enable that hybrid model to bridge the old and the new to maximize the value of existing investments. <br/><br/> Micro Focus is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Prospective employees will receive consideration without discrimination because of race, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. <br/><br/> *LI-JG1 <br/><br/> <strong>Job:</strong><br/><br/>Sales<br/><br/><strong>Job Level:</strong><br/><br/>Expert<br/><br/><strong>Micro Focus is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.</strong> <br/><br/> Micro Focus will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.
Title: Vertica Presales Engineer - Big Data Products

Job_Description: Are you excited by the challenge of protecting people against advanced computer security threats? Do you have the programming skills and experience to improve the advanced detection capabilities of our cloud security platform? <br/><br/> <strong>Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> Billions of times a day, computers around the world communicate with the Cisco Advanced Malware Protection Cloud and rely on the AMP product to protect them against advanced forms of malware. Some malware is straightforward to identify, but antivirus has done that forever. Our customers need protection against malware that’s tricky to identify: <ul>  <li>Viruses that generate different binaries on every machine they infect</li> <li>Things that seem benign until you start looking closely at their behaviour</li> <li>Malicious programs that have invented new ways of hiding themselves</li> </ul> To make the problem even more interesting: it may only become clear after a few days that a program or behavior was malicious. Does that sound fun to you? <br/><br/> The AMP Data Team is responsible for running advanced malware identification algorithms on incoming event data streams and storing and indexing that data. We index that data both for future detailed investigations of malware incidents, and to retrospectively detect previously unidentified malware in stored data. We strive for sub-second processing latencies in our streaming platforms and databases as they handle data volumes of >100TB/month and growing. <br/><br/> Do you love learning and working with technologies like the following? <ul>  <li>Kafka</li> <li>Cassandra</li> <li>Flink</li> <li>Storm</li> <li>Linux</li> <li>JRuby</li> </ul> If using those to help improve computer security sounds exciting, this is the place for you. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> Our team is looking for a Software Developer who will help scale our infrastructure as the business grows, make server-side code changes for new features, develop and maintain research tools, and take proof-of-concept detections from our researchers and apply their power to protect our customers. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. You’re passionate about back-end development and enjoy collaborating in a team based environment. You have fun learning new technologies. You want to get to the bottom of things, understand what’s going on, and make a difference. You are someone who doesn’t give up when faced with complex problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Must-haves</strong> <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, or Physics</li> <li>Enjoy writing server-side code and unit tests</li> <li>Knowledge of algorithmic complexity</li> <li>Able to debug, diagnose, and resolve occasional production problems</li> <li>Have 2–8 years experience writing object-oriented code and are ok working in Ruby, Java, JRuby, and Scala</li> <li>Experience with Linux command-line and system administration basics: ssh, permissions, packages, log files, &c.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have</strong> <ul>  <li>Master’s degree or PhD</li> <li>Experience detecting malware in event streams</li> <li>Experience with cloud systems architecture</li> <li>Able to smash the stack, use heap sprays, &c., to control EIP</li> <li>Real-world experience with streaming platforms like Storm, Flink, and Kafka Streams</li> <li>Production experience with distributed databases like Mongo and Cassandra</li> <li>Open-source contributions</li> <li>Peer-reviewed publications</li> </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it is transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will influence everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco. <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status <br/><br/> <strong>@CiscoCareers #CalgaryJobs #CiscoJobs</strong>
Title: Software Engineer III

Job_Description: Tracking Code <br/><br/> 1151-146 <br/><br/> Job Description<br/><br/><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul> <li>Design and optimization of mechanical components</li> <li>Analysis of mechanical systems for structural issues</li> <li>Analysis and specification of mechanical and hydraulic systems</li> <li>Develop manufacturing drawings in accordance with applicable standards</li> <li>Interface with outside vendors for component selection, manufacturing, and assembly</li> <li>Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics, and computer-generated reports</li> <li>Work with system engineers and other personnel to implement operating procedures, resolve system malfunctions, and provide technical information</li> <li>Research and analyze customer design proposals, specifications, manuals, and other data to evaluate the feasibility, cost, and maintenance requirements of designs or applications</li> <li>Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications</li> <li>Support Sales in presenting new products to market</li> <li>R&D development, bringing a theoretical concept to a final product that is ready for market</li> <li>Review and correct engineering documents (drawings, manuals, etc…)</li> <li>Oracle administration</li> </ul>  o Create item catalogues <br/> o New item and New BOM set up <br/> o Maintain BOMs<br/><br/>Required Skills<br/><br/><strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> • Degree in Engineering   <ul> <li>Design plans using computer-aided design and drafting (CADD) software<br/><br/>Required Experience</li> </ul>    <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years’ experience with new product design in a manufacturing environment</li>  <li>Familiarity with ERP systems•</li>  <li>Experience with PCP products</li> </ul>  Job Location <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta, Canada <br/><br/> Position Type <br/><br/> Full-Time/Regular
Title: Design Engineer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. To meet the rapidly growing demand and interest in our investment solution, we have recently set-up a development center in Calgary. Come join a fast growing San Francisco based-company and help build SigFig Calgary’s team. Help us define the next generation of investing!</div> <br/> <div>As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. You’ll help us Platformize (yes that’s a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs. It’s not easy, but it’s an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.</div></div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:</strong></div><div>   <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain services around SigFig’s Wealth Management Platform.</li> <li>Integrate SigFigs Wealth Management systems into a diverse set of third-party enterprise systems.</li> <li>Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill.</li> <li>Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code.</li> <li>Participating in SigFig’s agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).</li> </ul> <strong>WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH:</strong>  <ul> <li>You possess a BTech/BE in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices.</li> <li>Good experience with JVM languages (Scala, Java) and relational databases (ability to design, query, transform and optimize).</li> <li>Great Communication Skills — You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well.</li> <li>Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.</li> <li>Knowledge of modern web technologies including Javascript, AngularJS is a plus.</li> <li>Familiarity working with SSO solutions (SAML, OAuth, OpenID), CRM vendors, email systems, e-signature providers, or financial data (FIX, OFX), web infrastructure (firewalls, VPNs, proxies) and hosting is a plus.</li> <li>Domain Experience is a plus — You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry.</li> <li>Passion for finance and investing is a plus.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>ABOUT SIGFIG</strong></div> <br/> <div>SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the world’s largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients.</div> <br/> <div>Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com.</div></div> </div> <br/>
Title: Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: <STRONG>Cisco Systems Engineer - Network & Security</STRONG> <br/><br/> The Cisco Systems Engineer - Network & Security will be responsible for understanding client requirements, architecting, deploying, and supporting Cisco Security and Network solutions and services. Presales support will be required as well, including requirements gathering and documentation, and providing input into creating and reviewing professional services Statements of Work. <br/><br/> The Cisco Systems Engineer - Network & Security must possess in-depth knowledge, relevant industry certifications, and hands-on experience with designing and implementing services and solutions using some or all of the following technologies (while this is a Cisco-focused role, knowledge of Aruba/HPE, Fortinet, Palo Alto, Brocade and other Tier 1 vendor solutions is very desirable):  <ul> <LI>Cisco ASA NGFW & IPS/IDS, Firepower Services (experience with FTD is valuable)</LI><LI>Cisco Routing and Switching Platforms</LI><LI>Cisco Wireless (Controller and Controller-less)</LI><LI>Cisco Meraki Suite</LI><LI>Cisco Data Center Platforms (UCS, Nexus, MDS, etc…)</LI><LI>VMware ESXi and NSX</LI><LI>Cisco Identity Services Engine</LI><LI>Remote Access / Site-to-Site VPN Technologies (DMVPN, EZVPN, and AnyConnect)</LI><LI>Email and Web Security such as Cisco Ironport, Websense, Barracuda, etc…</LI><LI>SD-WAN and SDN, WAN Optimization (Cisco, Riverbed or Citrix preferred)</LI><LI>Application Delivery, DNS and Load Balancing (Citrix Netscaler, F5, etc…)</LI><LI>Security Information and Event Management Platforms (Splunk, ArcSite, Logrythm, QRadar, etc…)</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>As our Cisco Systems Engineer - Network & Security<STRONG>,</STRONG> you’ll drive:</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>An ability to proactively review work done in order to ensure excellent quality of service</LI><LI>Client focus, strong organizational, project management, and problem solving skills, and knowledge of the Softchoice Professional Services organizational structure, processes, and strategies</LI><LI>Strong communication and writing skills</LI><LI>Knowledge and broad understanding of industry security and network standards and IT Service Delivery concepts, and the ability to envision, design, and implement robust security and network solutions</LI><LI>An ability to understand each client’s particular business requirements and then articulate the entire breadth of the relevant security or network technology feature set to customers at both the business and technical</LI><LI>level</LI><LI>Strong influencing and leadership skills are also required</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>As our ideal candidate you’ll also have:</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science or management information systems is desirable</LI><LI>Relevant Cisco Certifications (recommended/required): CCNP or higher, CMNA, (Cisco ISE Field Engineer is a nice to have)</LI><LI>5+ years related work experience</LI><LI>Experience working in services delivery and IT consulting</LI><LI>Excellent analytical and problem solving skills</LI><LI>Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills</LI><LI>Excellent technical writing skills with the ability to create written documentation</LI><LI>Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail</LI><LI>Highly self-motivated and directed</LI><LI>Strong customer service orientation</LI><LI>Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment</LI><LI>Delivery of high quality security and network integration services to clients’ IT environments</LI><LI>Installation and configuration of security and network technologies based on best practices</LI><LI>Ability to review customers’ existing configurations and day-to-day operations procedures and make recommendations to improve system performance and operational efficiency including automation, where possible</LI><LI>Ability to performing system health checks</LI><LI>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</LI><LI>A high level of commitment to exceptional customer service</LI><LI>Ability to embrace a dynamic work environment</LI><LI>Ability to problem solve, take ownership of issues and drive them to resolution</LI><LI>Ability to be resourceful and appropriately escalate issues to solve them with assistance from peers, and colleagues</LI><LI>Ability to prioritize and work well under pressure</LI><LI>Ability to pay close attention to detail</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>How Do We Hire Great People?</STRONG> <br/><br/> We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Once you’ve applied for a position, our team of Talent Advisors will review your resume and application against all open roles at Softchoice. We also keep in mind any future or upcoming roles you may be a fit for. As part of our selection, onboarding and development process, we utilize tools to help us better match candidates with our roles. <br/><br/> Applying for a role at Softchoice is not complete until you have completed both the formal online application and the Predictive Index tool (PI). Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time. <br/><br/> If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Need more convincing this is the right next step in your career? Here are the reasons why folks love working here!</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Softchoice has been recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 12 consecutive years</LI><LI>Softchoice certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States (2016)</LI><LI>Meaningful work that drives professional development</LI><LI>Ability to enter and grow within the technology industry</LI><LI>Being part of a winning, high performance team</LI><LI>Every employee gets two paid volunteer days per year</LI><LI>We serve large and mid-sized clients from a variety of industries</LI><LI>We’ve raised over $2 Million through our staff-run charity Softchoice Cares</LI><LI>1 in 5 employees have invested in an ownership position in Softchoice</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>About Softchoice</STRONG> <br/><br/> Softchoice is one of the largest IT solutions and Managed Services providers in North America! We are an influential, growth-oriented organization determined to enable our people, our clients, our partners and the communities we serve to realize their potential. Our unique culture fosters a friendly, open-minded workplace where employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. As a member of a dynamic, high-performing team, each Softchoice employee is hungry to learn, valued for their contribution, and approaches each day excited to make an impact. <br/><br/> We would like to thank you personally for applying to Softchoice. <br/><br/> Please note that we will review your application and only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise. Again, thank you for your interest in a career at Softchoice!   <ul> <li>Note: Completion of a satisfactory criminal record check, education verification and reference checks are required prior to employment.</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <p></p><b>Job Description</b><p></p><p></p><p>Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is one of the leading engineering and construction groups in the world and a major player in the ownership of infrastructure. From its offices in over 40 countries, SNC-Lavalin provides EPC and EPCM services to clients in a variety of industry sectors, including mining & metallurgy, oil & gas, environment & water, infrastructure and clean power. In many cases, SNC-Lavalin combines these services with its financing and operations & maintenance capability to provide a complete end-to-end project approach.</p><p></p><p>SNC-Lavalin maintains exceptionally high standards for health and safety, ethics and compliance and environmental protection, and is committed to delivering quality projects on budget and on schedule to the complete satisfaction of its clients.</p><p></p><p>At SNC-Lavalin, infrastructure sector doesn’t just create great buildings and facilities - we finance, design, build, operate and maintain buildings and facilities that directly enhance and support the well-being of the communities where we live and work. Using the highest technical standards and the most sustainable, efficient and safest project management approaches, we deliver world-class aircraft hangars, educational institutions, medical facilities, industrial and commercial developments, and recreational and cultural centers.</p><p></p><p>Our Complex Buildings Unit in Calgary is looking for a Structural Engineer for future opportunities.</p><p></p><p><b>Responsibilities</b></p><p></p><p>To perform this role successfully, the Structural Engineer will be responsible for but not limited to the following:</p><ul><li>Selection of building structural systems based on loads and sound engineering judgment</li><li>Perform design and preparation of structural contract documents</li><li>Carry out inter-disciplinary coordination activities</li><li>Provide technical guidance and engineering support for construction activities</li><li>Ensure the quality, consistency, accuracy, and neatness of contract document deliverables</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Requirements</b></p><p></p><p>The ideal applicant will have the following qualifications and skills:</p><ul><li>Professional Engineer (P. Eng), designation with at least 10 years of industry-related experience</li><li>Competent leadership & business skills</li><li>Working knowledge of Canadian building codes and industry standards</li><li>Experience in structural design of buildings and other structures</li><li>Experience in construction contract administration</li><li>Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects in a fast-paced team environment</li><li>A high level of interpersonal communication skill, both verbal and written. Knowledge of French would be an asset</li><li>Ability to make decisions using sound engineering and business judgment</li><li>Able to work independently and in a team environment, such as working with architects and other building engineering disciplines</li></ul><p></p><b>Worker Type</b>Employee<p></p><b>Job Type</b>Regular<p></p><p></p><p>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences. </p>
Title: Structural Engineer

Job_Description: As a leading Nation wide multi-trade contractor we are seeking Electrical Journeymen and Apprentices to add to our Alberta branch. We offer an exciting opportunity to develop and grow along with our Alberta business. <br/><br/> Utilize your experience and technical skills to perform new installations, preventative maintenance of electrical systems in industrial and commercial projects/facilities. <br/><br/> We are seeking the very best in your trade, you are known form a high level of reliability and pride yourself in the development of cost-effective schedules and execution plans. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description;</strong>  <ul> <li>Able to perform troubleshooting services and/or installation of power distribution systems, high voltage switchgear, breakers, high level security system and low voltage systems.</li><li>Coordinate with management and vendors in delivery of new build projects, service and maintenance works.</li><li>Adhere to company standards, client's site protocols and design specifications.</li><li>Conduct technical evaluation of electrical systems and components and provide reports and recommendations for repair and maintenance to maintain performance or meet client's demands.</li><li>Performs electrical work required for installation and maintenance of equipment, systems and facilities in accordance with diagrams, sketches, operation manuals and manufactures specifications.</li><li>Performs preventative maintenance on, and repairs electical distribution systems equipment including generators, transformers, switchboards, and controllers, alarm systems, UPS, security system and lighting systems.</li><li>Makes standard computations relating to load requirements of wiring and electrical equipment.</li><li>Performs electrical repairs of starters, switchers, receptacles, and wiring.</li><li>Performs installation, re-lamping and/or repairs of light fixtures.</li><li>Installs and traces wire pulls for phone and data drops.</li><li>Ensure all installations meet safety codes and have applicable permits, inspections and test reports.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications;</strong>  <ul> <li>Alberta Journeyman Red Seal Certification</li><li>Commercial and Industrial Experience</li><li>Valid Alberta Driver's License</li><li>Fire Alarm and Controls Experience an Asset</li><li>Available for work in Calgary and Surrounding Areas</li></ul>

Job_Description: <div> Sr. Project Engineer (Petrochemical/ Refinery)<br/>   <div> Job title: Sr. Project Engineer (Petrochemical/ Refinery)</div> <div> Contract Type: Permanent</div> <div> Location: Calgary, Canada</div> <div> Industry: <div> Chemical <br/>  ,</div><br/>  <div> Petrochemical</div>  </div> <div> Salary: CAD160000 - CAD170000 per annum</div> <div> Reference: 81355</div> <div> Contact Name: Jessica Harper</div> <div> Phone Number: +1 403 984 0912</div> <div> Job Published: about 15 hours ago</div> </div>  <br/>Job Description <br/>  NES Global Talent is a leading global technical recruitment company providing professional contract and permanent staff to a diverse world-wide client base within the oil & gas Industry. Our client, a large Oil and Gas Company, has a full time role for a Project Engineer for a Petrochemical facility. <strong>This role will be based for 18 months in Germany. Individuals need to be able to relocate for that duration but hold a P.Eng in Alberta Canada.</strong>  <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Support the Project Manager in development of the overall Project Execution Plan (PEP) and coordinate the input from various disciplines as required</li><li>Support the Project Manager in development of the construction contract scopes of work and bid packages</li><li>Control and manage engineering scope. Develop strategies to execute within approved budgets or minimize scope growth when it is evident that growth is required</li><li>Monitor technical design changes to reduce cost over-runs such that only necessary changes are made as they apply to safety, code/specification compliance, maintainability or operability</li><li>Responsible for adherence to the EPC phase schedule. The Project Engineer 'owns' the schedule</li><li>Establish sound philosophies, strategies and plans so as to minimize / eliminate the need for change during the execution and construction phases</li><li>Provide timely involvement of key end-users, customers and stakeholders (Logistics, Commissioning & Start-up, Construction, Operations, Maintenance etc.) in support of the design development process thereby mitigating cost and schedule impacts due to preventable late changes</li><li>Manage all interfaces touching the EP Contractor scope and make decisions regarding scope, schedule and cost and working with the Engineering Manager will assist in resolving issues related to engineering design</li><li>Proven interpersonal, communication, negotiation and leadership skills to act independently in a technical role in an open, honest and ethical manner</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li><strong>B. Sc. in Engineering</strong></li><li><strong>P. Eng. designation in the province of Alberta</strong></li><li>Minimum 15 years of experience with progressive responsibility that includes at least 5 years of capital project experience on large oil & gas or petrochemical projects in the province of Alberta over $500 million</li><li>Extensive experience working on Refinery and Petrochemical projects</li> <li>A significant portion of this role will be interfacing with the EP Contractor on procurement of equipment and multidisciplinary coordination</li><li>Extensive demonstrated experience as a representative on an Owners project management team for large, complex projects and business processes involving internal and external stakeholders</li><li>Must possess a strong working knowledge of the regulatory requirements for working in Alberta and Canada</li><li>Experience working in an EPCM environment is an asset</li><li>Experience working on a job site with contractor management/oversight on greenfield and brownfield projects is an asset</li><li>MUST be able to relocate to Germany for 18+ months</li> </ul>  <div> <div> <div> <div> Apply for this job</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/>
Title: Sr. Project Engineer (Petrochemical/ Refinery)

Job_Description: Wood's Downstream & Chemicals office in Calgary is looking for a Technical Safety Engineer (part-time) to join our team to provide expertise for our projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Familiarity with system design for firewater, fire and gas detection and fireproofing</div></li><li><div>Undertake consequence modeling (PHAST, FRED)</div></li><li><div>Quantified Risk Assessments (QRA)</div></li><li><div>Participate in HAZOP reviews</div></li></ul>  <ul> <li><div>4 - 15 years' experience in a similar role</div></li><li><div>Registration in Alberta as a Professional Engineer</div></li><li><div>Must reside within 75 km of Calgary, Alberta</div></li><li><div>Must be able to work in Canada legally at time of application</div></li> </ul> Wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. We operate in more than 60 countries, employing around 55,000 people, with revenues of around $10 billion. We provide performance driven solutions throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to decommissioning across a broad range of industrial markets including the upstream, midstream and downstream oil & gas, power & process, environment and infrastructure, clean energy, mining, nuclear and general industrial sectors. We strive to be the best technical services company to work with, work for and invest in. <br/><br/> www.woodplc.com <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Civil EIT / Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> Allnorth’s award winning multidisciplinary engineering and technical services team is fortunate to be part of the significant growth of the company over the past few years. Our continuous improvement philosophy, skilled professionals and technical experts have allowed us to take on challenging and exciting projects while servicing clients in the Mining, Oil & Gas, Infrastructure and Pulp & Paper sectors. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Our Calgary division is seeking a highly capable Civil EIT / Engineer to join their team. As the successful candidate, you will have the opportunity to plan, coordinate and execute the design of a wide variety of civil projects. You will be capable of scoping, budgeting, designing and managing civil projects for public and private sector clients such as municipal, roadway improvement, grading, drainage, stormwater, water and wastewater systems. <br/><br/> Your duties will include:  <ul> <li>Managing a wide variety of projects including municipal infrastructure upgrades, subdivision developments, and resource developments which will likely include the design and construction of water, sewer, drainage, land development and transportation infrastructure</li>  <li>Managing multi-disciplinary teams in completion of preliminary and detailed design projects</li>   <li>Preparing correspondence, reports, proposals, expressions of interest, specifications and meeting minutes</li>   <li>Managing projects including project team direction, co-ordination, monitoring schedules and budgets, and invoice preparation</li>   <li>Performing business development and marketing activities to current and potential clients in order to generate future business</li>  </ul> Using your considerable organizational, communication and people skills, you will collaborate with multi-discipline teams to ensure projects are completed within allotted schedules and budgets, and to high quality standards. Mentorship of new and junior employees is also a key part of our organization. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;</li>   <li>Must be registered (or eligible to register) as a Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) in the province of Alberta;</li>   <li>3+ years of experience in municipal engineering and project management;</li>   <li>Knowledge of and experience with application of AB/Canadian engineering standards;</li>   <li>Strong project management, technical and analytical skills;</li>   <li>Strong technical writing skills; experienced in the preparation of correspondence, reports and proposals;</li>  <li>Effective verbal communicator, including presentation, facilitation and listening skills;</li>   <li>Strategic, analytical and practical thinker.</li>  </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> Allnorth is dedicated to its Triple Bottom Line of People, Clients & Partners and Profitability. Empowered and motivated employees are the source of our success and the basis for our growth. We’re proud of our team and committed to providing opportunities for employees to develop both personally and professionally in addition to offering a competitive salary and benefits package. You won’t get lost in the numbers here, but rather enjoy positive guidance as you learn, grow and create an impact. Now is an exciting time to join the Allnorth team. <strong>Apply</strong> today! <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Civil Engineer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> The Cisco AMP engineering team is composed of highly skilled individuals who are comfortable working in a fast paced and technically challenging environment. The AMP team is a highly performant group that are involved with all stages of the product development process from solving complex engineering problems to working directly with customers. <br/><br/> Cisco enjoys a unique position and is leveraging an unprecedented capability to secure the network through intelligence derived from data collected on a global scale. Engineers on the ThreatGRID and Cisco Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) teams are leading the way in their capacity to invent, prove-out, and enable new technologies in big data analytics and threat intelligence. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Do</strong> <br/><br/> This is an exciting opportunity to work with the Cisco AMP engineering group based in Calgary to maintain, grow and scale the AMP infrastructure. The successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our AWS footprint through SaltStack. In addition, the selected applicant will be responsible for monitoring our production environment and resolving issues through established playbooks. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Minimum Qualifications</em> <ul> <li>4+ years experience in the administration of enterprise-grade AWS infrastructures</li><li>Familiarity with software orchestration: SaltStack</li><li>Very strong Debian Linux system administration skills</li><li>Experience in Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana</li><li>Proficiency in infrastructure, service and application monitoring tools</li><li>Ability to be on-call 24x7</li> </ul> <em>Desired Skills</em> <ul> <li>Familiarity with JVM performance monitoring using JMX</li><li>Familiarity with Kafka and Zookeeper</li><li>Python background</li><li>Experience with Datadog</li> </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/><br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.</div>
Title: Site Reliability Engineer

The Senior Geotechnical Engineer will play a critical role in managing technical projects and client relationships while mentoring and developing junior engineers. The Senior Engineer is a key component of delivering on our strategic geotechnical growth plans. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Perform all aspects of geotechnical investigations for buildings, highways, bridges, retaining walls, slope stability, and municipal infrastructure;</li>  <li>Responsible for review of construction materials testing and field monitoring of geotechnical aspects of construction projects;</li>  <li>Prepare proposals, cost estimates and timelines for projects;</li>  <li>Lead the planning, field support and completion of geotechnical site investigations;</li>  <li>Review and interpret the monitoring information from geotechnical instrumentation and testing programs;</li>  <li>Provide geotechnical design recommendations and parameters for analyses and design of structure foundations;</li>  <li>Write and/or review technical design reports;</li>  <li>Provide technical assistance in troubleshooting construction related problems;</li>  <li>Assist project managers with quality control or quality assurance testing issues;</li>  <li>Participate in site visits, meetings, etc. to determine <li>Experience of investigation and geotechnical design on Canadian buildings, transportation, and municipal infrastructure projects;</li>  <li>Previous Leadership roles would be considered and asset;</li>  <li>Adept at building relationships within the various technical communities in Alberta;</li>  <li>The ability to work with and mentor junior staff is essential;</li>  <li>Proven ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines;</li>  <li>Highly organized with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously;</li>  <li>Excellent written and oral communication of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong>World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Job_Description: <strong>Business Line</strong> Transportation <br/><br/> <strong>Position Title</strong> Civil Engineer/Technologist <br/><br/> Canada - Alberta <br/><br/> Calgary <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM's Transportation Engineering Group in Calgary is currently seeking a Roadway Designer. Working within the Transportation team, this position is ideal for someone who wants to learn from experienced professionals and have the opportunity to grow a career with a leading design firm. <br/><br/> The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Using Civil3D to develop roadways, highways, intersections, transit, utilities and other transportation project designs and 3D design models</li>  <li>Develop project specific design criteria and verify that applicable codes and engineering standard practices are being met</li>  <li>Ensure that quality project designs are completed on time and on budget through implementation of quality reviews</li>  <li>Take direction from Management and Project Managers</li>  <li>Efficiently work as part of a multi-disciplinary team</li>  <li>Independently evaluating, selecting, and applying standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria and using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications</li>  <li>Overseeing\Managing certain aspects of design for roadway projects</li>  <li>Develop reports, plans, specifications and cost estimates</li>  <li>Participate in developing project proposals</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Technical or Associates degree or equivalent.</li>  <li>4+ years of experience of direct transportation engineering design and strong familiarity of Canadian design standards</li>  <li>Strong proficiency in CIVIL 3D and AutoTURN for roadway design and other design software</li>  <li>Experience includes transportation project related contract specifications and interdisciplinary coordination</li>  <li>Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Undergraduate Engineering degree or diploma from a recognized post-secondary institution</li>  <li>8+ years of direct experience with transportation engineering design and strong familiarity of Canadian design standards</li>  <li>Proficiency in Civil 3D and AutoTURN</li>  <li>Proficiency with 3D corridor Modeling using Civil3D</li>  <li>Design experience with Alberta Transportation, City of Calgary, British Columbia Ministry of Transportation</li>  <li>Skills in MicroStation/InRoads and other design software are advantageous</li>  <li>Familiarity with stormwater/utility design, erosion and sediment control design</li>  <li>Familiarity of Microsoft Office</li>  <li>Member of Professional Association with either APEGA or ASET</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Engineering - Transportation</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>178646BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

controls <br/> Install conduit and wire to supply power to equipment <br/> Execute regular preventative maintenance and safety inspections on shop equipment and facilities electrical systems <br/> records in the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) <br/> Ensure PM schedules are maintained <br/> Assist with mechanical maintenance as needed <br/> Must be able to work in a high pressure, fast-paced environment <br/> Maintain a clean safe work environment <br/> Work closely with others on the team to help develop new skills and knowledge <br/> Communication within the team as well as the organization <br/> Implementation of new machines and maintenance programs <br/> Tracking and logging maintenance and repairs to machinery <br/> Procurement and inventory control <br/> Comply with and implement Safety and Health regulations in the workplace <br/> After hours on call responsibilities <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Red Seal <br/> Journeyman electrician with controls, PLC, and troubleshooting experience <br/> Mechanically minded and safety conscious <br/> 3 years technical experience with CNC, wood working and metal equipment <br/> Must be flexible to working overtime <br/> Excellent people and organizational skills <br/> Be prepared to work a 4on 4 off day shift rotation <br/> Ability to think logically, analytically and solve problems <br/> Ability to work with daily/monthly deadlines and time constraints on an ongoing basis <br/> Team player with the ability to work with diverse trades <br/> Good computer skills <br/><br/> Asset <br/><br/> 5 years plus experience in manufacturing maintenance environment <br/><br/> Mechanical experience with a working knowledge of hydraulics, pneumatics, welding and machining <br/> Millwright experience <br/><br/> To apply for this exciting new position please email us at: careers@dirtt.net. Please quote the position title in your subject line. <br/><br/> DIRTT Environmental Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and appreciates applications from all interested applicants. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job_Description: <div> <div> Job Description <br/>  <div> Envista Forensics addresses the growing demand by insurance claims and legal professionals for a global, multi-disciplinary and highly-skilled forensic consulting partner. Envista Forensics is a global forensic consulting firm that provides a comprehensive array of technical services to the insurance and legal communities. <br/><br/> <strong>Our mission is simple:</strong> <ul> <li>We deliver certainty to our clients when they need it most: When equipment, systems, structures, or data have been threatened by catastrophe or litigation.</li><li>We determine cause and responsibility; we identify the nature and extent of damage or loss and provide a full range of solutions to protect their assets.</li><li>Our technical experts are trusted advisors and industry leaders. Their expertise is broad and deep, capable of withstanding all forms of scrutiny. Our services are available globally so that certainty is assured no matter where in the world it is needed.</li> </ul> As the recovery from disasters has grown more complex, Envista Forensics has developed a comprehensive array of services to help our clients and has associates located around the globe to provide our clients assurance no matter the type of loss or location of the disaster. <br/><br/> Our entire staff is dedicated to providing the best possible service, vast experience, and Certainty in an Uncertain World. <br/><br/> We are an equal Opportunity Employer offering competitive pay and benefits and an environment where teamwork, ongoing professional development, continuous improvement, and exceptional service are valued and rewarded. <br/><br/> We currently have an outstanding career opportunity for a Structural Engineer. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Investigates residential and commercial sites to determine the cause and origin of structural failures, damages or defects.</li><li>Analyzes damages to structures that have been threatened by catastrophes.</li><li>Prepares accurate, clear, thorough, and concise reports and letters outlining the cause and origin of the damages to clients. Follows established policies, procedures, and processes in preparing information, exercising sound judgment in applying these to potentially unusual or complicated situations, and submit reports and documents in a timely manner and in accordance with client’s standards and expectations.</li><li>Stays abreast of company policies, procedures, and practices; participates in ongoing training and development as assigned or approved to assure knowledge and skills remain current and comprehensive.</li><li>Functions as an effective member of the team, assisting co-workers as needed and learning from colleagues and supervisors; supports the goals of the department, division, and organization; participates in special assignments and activities as required or approved; demonstrates initiative in the interest of the client and the organization.</li><li>Adheres to all applicable federal, state, and local laws as well as applicable regulations and standards.</li><li>Establishes trusted working relationship with clients and interacts socially at mixed engagements with regional clients.</li> </ul> </div></div></div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Requirements  <ul> <li>Baccalaureate degree in Civil or Structural Engineering is required. MS in Structural Engineering is a plus.</li><li>Skills in analyzing, interpreting, synthesizing, prioritizing, and reporting pertinent information, discerning the essential from the non-essential, and grasping complexities of unusual or complicated cases; research and investigative abilities</li><li>Significant experience (typically 7 plus years) as a design/structural engineer (residential, industrial and commercial buildings).</li> <li>Design-build experience desired.</li> <li>Experience with commercial, institutional, healthcare, high-rise and governmental facilities is desired.</li><li>Active Professional Engineering (P.Eng) license is required.</li></ul></div> </div>  <br/>
Title: Forensic Structural Engineer in Calgary at Envista Forensics

Job_Description: <div><div>As a <strong>Geotechnical Engineer with advanced numerical modeling capability,</strong> you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical Engineering team who are working on our strong portfolio of major water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and infrastructure projects in Canada and internationally. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Gain experience working on our portfolio of projects including water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and geohazard risk mitigation.</li>  <li>Develop and oversee site investigations and monitoring programs, complete engineering studies, and undertake conceptual to detailed engineering designs.</li>  <li>Lead and oversee advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling assignments.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving and modeling skills to find innovative solutions to complex technical issues.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry.</li>  <li>Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff.</li>  <li>Build and maintain strong relationships with our Clients and our multidisciplinary project teams.</li>  <li>Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations.</li> </ul> <strong>If you have more than five years of relevant experience and are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and hold a</strong><strong> Masters degree or Ph.D. in geotechnical engineering with a strong emphasis on numerical modeling and analysis, preferably related to dams,</strong><strong> tailings management in the oil sands, mining, hydropower or related industries, we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Working knowledge and demonstrated practical application of advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling software, including FLAC, to define the problem and develop solutions.</li>  <li>Solid understanding of soil and rock characteristics and behavior.</li>  <li>Technical experience in dam engineering and tailings and mine waste engineering including liquefaction susceptibility and deformation assessments.</li>  <li>Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success.</li>  <li>Superior verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing engineering reports and technical papers, preparing and delivering technical presentations to clients and Review Boards, and overseeing preparation of design drawings.</li>  <li>Exceptional team spirit, interpersonal skills and your ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients and our project teams.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number <strong>1331-A18</strong>. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Advanced Numerical Modelling

Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are:</strong> <br/><br/> You love developing elegant solutions to complex problems. You are a developer who enjoys coding and find yourself exploring the latest code development practices, platforms and design patterns because it's fun. You regularly read code blogs to stay in touch with the development community and are passionate about finding ways to improve quality, performance and delivery times. You are well established as an excellent individual contributor, but do your best work as a member of an effective team. You have a great mix of technical and soft skills which allows you to excel in a highly collaborative, agile work environment. Software craftsmanship means something to you. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Next Challenge:</strong> <br/><br/> Be a part of development and maintenance of project code including: <ul> <li>Take an active role in all aspects of the development life cycle</li><li>Utilize TDD and BDD</li><li>Work within a continuous integration release cycle</li><li>Create and maintain project documentation, in accordance with established standards</li> </ul> Participate in implementation of a high volume, high traffic web based application including: <ul> <li>Develop proprietary and open-sourced technologies</li><li>Have impact on the direction of projects and features</li><li>Work in an agile environment utilizing the LEAN/KANBAN process</li><li>Work on a development team that is within a larger technology organization</li>  </ul> <strong>What You’ll Need:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong understanding of object oriented programming (OO) with real world enterprise web development experience</li><li>Ruby with RoR experience is a must</li><li>Must have experience with Javascript, jQuery, AJAX and ideally Angular.js</li> <li>Must have experience with HTML5, CSS3 and other front end tools (Sass, Less, etc)</li><li>Experience using Git or a similar version control system</li><li>Strong creative problem-solving ability</li><li>Ability to contribute to cross functional team discussions</li><li>BSc. in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience</li><li>Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills</li><li>Experience with C#, Visual Studio, PHP or Java is a definite asset</li> </ul> <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 200 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com. The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. <br/><br/> Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery. <br/><br/> Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.
Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: <STRONG>Microsoft Cloud Systems Engineer</STRONG> <br/><br/> Engineering journeys to the Microsoft cloud <br/><br/> Ideas are a dime a dozen. But an expertly-crafted plan — aligned with the unique objectives and needs of our customers — has the power to transform a business, for good. <br/><br/> That’s where you come in, as our newest Microsoft Cloud Systems Engineer. Working alongside one of North America’s most trusted teams of Microsoft architects, sales professionals and project managers, your role is to connect the dots of a customer’s master vision and deliver on their Statement of Work (SOW), with incomparable attention to detail, expertise and business acumen. <br/><br/> It all begins with the customer. You work closely with our pre-sales architects and outbound sales team to meet with customers, develop a deep understanding of their objectives and spot new opportunities when possible. Many technical roles happen in the back office — not this one! You act as the face of Softchoice and must be able to go above and beyond to better serve your customers and your team, at all times. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Putting plans into action:</STRONG> You’ll put your deep Microsoft expertise and experience to work, developing a detailed, actionable Statement of Work alongside Microsoft architects and project managers. We deliver on what we promise, and it’s your job to make those promises bold, transformational and realistic. You do this by staying on top of new trends, system updates and the minutiae of core Microsoft technologies. You also continually fine tune your delivery, adoption and problem-solving skills along the way. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Sharpening your value:</STRONG> Softchoice is Microsoft Gold Partner with an intimate relationship spanning decades. Here, you’ll find a bevy of career development opportunities and unique high-level industry access to the newest technologies and brightest minds at Microsoft. <br/><br/> <STRONG>As our ideal candidate, you will have:</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in a relevant field or equivalent industry experience.</LI><LI>Strong communication, presentation and consulting skills, including technical writing.</LI><LI>Microsoft technical certifications, including the MCSE, MCSA, and MCITP certifications.</LI><LI>Travel expectation up to 25% - dependent on customer needs.</LI><LI>Experience with Tenant to Tenant Migrations (O365/Exchange, Azure/On-Premise, etc…).</LI><LI>Data center storage and server platform experience (NetApp, Dell, EMC, PureStorage, Veeam, etc…)</LI><LI>Virtualization experience with Hyper-V, VMware ESXi, etc…</LI><LI>Understanding and experience with networking is required.</LI><LI>Migrations from Domino, GroupWise, or Google a plus.</LI><LI>Experience with Quest Tools or BitTitan is a plus.</LI><LI>Cloud Security and Governance experience is a plus.</LI><LI>Have excellent verbal and written communication skills</LI><LI>Possess a high level of commitment to exceptional customer service</LI><LI>Embrace a dynamic work environment</LI><LI>Problem solve, take ownership of issues and drive them to resolution</LI><LI>Are resourceful and appropriately escalate issues to solve them with assistance from peers, and colleagues</LI><LI>Prioritize and work well under pressure</LI><LI>Pay close attention to detail</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>How Do We Hire Great People?</STRONG> <br/><br/> We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Once you’ve applied for a position, our team of Talent Advisors will review your resume and application against all open roles at Softchoice. We also keep in mind any future or upcoming roles you may be a fit for. As part of our selection, onboarding and development process, we utilize tools to help us better match candidates with our roles. <br/><br/> Applying for a role at Softchoice is not complete until you have completed both the formal online application and the Predictive Index tool (PI). Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time. <br/><br/> If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Need more convincing this is the right next step in your career? Here are the reasons why folks love working here!</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>Softchoice has been recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 12 consecutive years</LI><LI>Softchoice certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States (2016)</LI><LI>Meaningful work that drives professional development</LI><LI>Ability to enter and grow within the technology industry</LI><LI>Being part of a winning, high performance team</LI><LI>Every employee gets two paid volunteer days per year</LI><LI>We serve large and mid-sized clients from a variety of industries</LI><LI>We’ve raised over $2 Million through our staff-run charity Softchoice Cares</LI><LI>1 in 5 employees have invested in an ownership position in Softchoice</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>About Softchoice</STRONG> <br/><br/> Softchoice is one of the largest IT solutions and Managed Services providers in North America! We are an influential, growth-oriented organization determined to enable our people, our clients, our partners and the communities we serve to realize their potential. Our unique culture fosters a friendly, open-minded workplace where employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. As a member of a dynamic, high-performing team, each Softchoice employee is hungry to learn, valued for their contribution, and approaches each day excited to make an impact. <br/><br/> We would like to thank you personally for applying to Softchoice. <br/><br/> Please note that we will review your application and only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise. Again, thank you for your interest in a career at Softchoice!   <ul> <li>Note: Completion of a satisfactory criminal record check, education verification and reference checks are required prior to employment.</li> </ul>
Title: Microsoft Cloud Systems Engineer

Job_Description: Who You'll Work With <br/> The Advanced Threat Security Team in Cisco's Security Business Group is building a global scale, multi product security platform with an emphasis on Threat Intelligence and Incident Response support. <br/> Our system runs as a distributed cluster in the cloud and shrunk down to a single on-premises appliance. This keeps us focused on simple solutions, clear abstractions between services, composition of services, functional data processing, and minimal state. <br/> Our team is distributed across the U.S. and works from home with occasional office visits and travel -- this requires excellent written communications, self-confidence, trust in your co-workers, and assuming ownership of the problems you encounter. <br/>  <br/> What You'll Do <br/> This is an exciting opportunity to work with the Cisco AMP engineering group based in Calgary to assure quality for the Advanced Malware Protection platform. The hired employee will be responsible for testing on Windows, Linux, and Mac platforms as well as operating within a cloud architecture in both a manual and automated fashion. Furthermore, that person will be required to read technical documents, create test cases/test plans, contribute to overall design, and perform other tasks to improve software quality. <br/><br/> Who You Are   <ul> <li>Ability to work independently when writing test cases, test plans, and other supporting documentation</li> <li>Prior experience in collaborating with both technical engineers and non-technical customers</li> <li>Experience testing in mixed OS environments including Windows, Mac, and Linux</li> <li>Development or automated testing experience in either Ruby or Python</li> <li>Testing and/or configuration of security products</li> </ul>  Why Cisco <br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/>  <br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. <br/>  <br/> We Are Cisco.<br/>  <div>dicedev #GD2015</div>
Title: Software Engineer in Test II

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Responsible for all engineering activities on the project.</li><li>Maintain highest standard of relationship with the client.</li><li>Implement standards, execution plans, quality plans, procedures and, other methods, as required, to maintain the required levels of technical quality.</li><li>Coordinate engineering discipline input in the preparation of project schedules, identify risks and suggest mitigation recommendations.</li><li>Recognize impact of design not only on technical side, but also cost and schedule. Coordinate with project engineers to consider cost and schedule impacts before proceeding with design changes.</li><li>Ensure a good flow of communication and coordination between the engineering disciplines and other departments on the project.</li><li>Participate and, ensure participation of various engineering discipline leads and specialists and provide valuable input to the design development, design/engineering reviews (i.e. P&IDs, HAZID, HAZOP, Constructability, 3D Model, Value Improvement Practices etc.).</li><li>Coordinate and supervise the activities of the discipline leads by ensuring that they effectively monitor the technical excellence of Engineering work within their disciplines, respect their budgets, maintain schedule and communicate among themselves.</li><li>Ensure discipline leads update their manpower requirements regularly.</li><li>Review engineering documents (i.e. estimates, design criteria, specifications, data sheets, requisitions, drawings, etc.) for completeness and general consistency with project procedures.</li><li>Provide data for monthly progress reports, as related to engineering.</li><li>Ensure timely reply to vendors’ and construction queries to assure them that the intent of the design is implemented.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>University degree in Engineering.</li><li>Registered professional engineer or eligible for registration in the province of Alberta.</li><li>Minimum of 12 years of relevant engineering experience; minimum of 4 years of experience as a Project Engineering Manager.</li><li>Computer Skills - Word, Excel, Outlook, etc</li> </ul>  <strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and environmental, sectors. Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>Pason is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to join the team in improving the reliability of Pason’s DataHub infrastructure. This role requires a combination of Linux system administration, configuration management (Ansible and Puppet) as well as scripting and automation skills to support Pason’s goals of improved uptime and disaster recovery timeframes. In addition, a solid understanding of Dev/Ops and Agile principles including Continuous Integration and Test-Driven Development in a cloud-based environment are highly valued.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Ensure our cloud infrastructure is running without interruption and with proper monitoring and visibility</li> <li>Collaborate with developers to design fault-tolerant, load balanced services that can be deployed automatically to various cloud providers</li> <li>Identify and remove all manual deployment steps from existing services by moving all configuration to version control and configuration management systems</li> <li>Manage and evolve our OpenStack private cloud platform</li> <li>Improving disaster recovery timeframes and capabilities by migrating services to Ubuntu, Puppet and Amazon Web Services</li> <li>Improve system health and recovery times by improving monitoring and system visibility for all systems</li> <li>Participate in an 24/7 on-call rotation</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Experience with the following technologies: Python, Bash, OpenStack, AWS, MySQL, Linux (Ubuntu), VMWare, InfluxDB</li> <li>Experience with configuration management and version control (Puppet, SVN, Git) is highly valued</li> <li>Experience with Amazon EC2 and S3</li> <li>Experience working with load balancers</li> <li>Experience working with or on software development teams</li> <li>Organizational skills and the ability to work on multiple tasks & projects and adapt to frequent change</li> <li>Ability to work as a member of a team and independently with limited direct supervision in a self-motivated and self-directed manner</li> <li>Self-awareness, with a desire for constant self-improvement</li> <li>Strong advocate for quality on the team and motivated to deliver top quality results</li> <li>Strong problem-solving skills</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment</li> </ul>
Title: Site Reliability Engineer

Please note, this position is located at Spectrum?s office on 285175 Kleysen Way in Rocky View County, Alberta (just off 84th Street in SE Calgary) and is not currently serviced by public transit so a reliable means of transportation is required. <br/><br/> <strong>Applications are being accepted and resumes should be submitted to:</strong>
