Job_Description: Nalco Champion, an Ecolab Company, has an immediate opportunity for a Group Leader in our Energy Services – Oilfield Chemicals group, located in Calgary, AB. If you are a dedicated technology leader with a proven track record of success we invite you to apply. This is your opportunity to join a large growing company offering competitive base salary and benefits. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Job Overview:</strong></strong> <br/><br/> Primarily responsible for: Leading the section’s technical effort under the guidance of the Director, utilizing experiences in laboratory and field work, project management, and people management. Efforts will be aligned with Nalco Champion’s business strategy by working to achieve RD&E, sectional and individual goals. <br/><br/> <strong><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></strong>  <ul> <li>Ensure that all the operations of the section are carried out in a safety orientated environment.</li> <li>Demonstrate visible safety leadership by achieving Canada safety goals.</li> <li>Responsible for section’s achievement of Canada safety goals.</li> <li>Accountable for the training and development of members of the section</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Apply performance management guidelines for setting performance goals, evaluating and promoting career growth and development, conducting performance appraisals, and recommending salary and performance adjustments for direct and indirect reports.</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Project management duties which include assessing and approving project requests, insuring timely completion of projects, project portfolio reviews, and following up on feedback.</li> <li>Serve as senior technical advisor on sales calls.</li> <li>Collaborate with other sections to share expertise to solve unique and complex problems. Inform others of new technologies, scientific advancements, and market developments.</li> <li>Collaborate with sales and marketing to identify needs and gaps in the phase separation product line and phase separation dependent market segments.</li> <li>Lead the development and improvement of product-line chemistries and manufacturing processes.</li> <li>Responsible for jointly developing and executing technology plans in conjunction with other technology teams supporting Canada.</li> <li>Technically lead necessary work to be done for at-risk customers during crisis situations.</li> <li>Plan and prepare the annual budget.</li> <li>Collaborate with global technology teams to identify new technologies and opportunities for improvement.</li> <li>Embrace and drive Innovation throughout the RD&E organization.</li> <li>Promote Collaboration between various teams inside and outside the Canadian RD&E organization.</li> <li>Actively showcase our RD&E technical capabilities/ offerings to internal and external customers.</li> <li>Drive and promote engagement within your RD&E section.</li> </ul> <strong><strong>Qualifications:</strong></strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, engineering, or sciences required.</li> <li>Minimum ten years industry experience required.</li> <li>Proven supervisory, project management and organizational skills.</li> <li>Demonstrated effective interpersonal/communication skills to interface with sales, technical, marketing, manufacturing, SH&E, and customer personnel.</li> <li>Provide solutions to unique and complex problems through acquired skill-sets.</li> <li>Successful experiences on teams that have been tasked with highly technical work output.</li> <li>Experience in laboratory work and techniques, basic research, and product development.</li> <li>Working knowledge and project experience in a chemical manufacturing setting.</li> <li>Provide solutions to unique and complex problems through acquired skill-sets.</li> <li>Solid technical writing skills.</li> <li>Proficiency with MS Office Suite.</li> <li>Travel to other areas 15-40%.</li> </ul>
Title: Research, Development & Engineering Group Leader, Product Maximization

Job_Description: <div><div>As a <strong>Geotechnical / Civil Engineer</strong>, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical/Civil Engineering team working on world-class mining projects which are at the leading edge of emerging technologies in the industry. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work on a variety of projects including tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning support, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design, site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability assessments, seepage analyses, numerical modeling, and foundation design.</li>  <li>Lead project designs including the preparation of technical reports and the development of construction drawings and tender packages.</li>  <li>Build and develop strong relationships with our Clients, our multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors and other project stakeholders.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving skills to find innovative solutions to technical issues.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry.</li>  <li>Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff.</li>  <li>Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations.</li> </ul> <strong>If you are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering and a minimum of 6 years of related tailings and dam engineering experience in mining, we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong initiative and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive towards achieving long-term success.</li>  <li>Demonstrated leadership, project management, decision-making and coaching skills, especially your ability to engage, train and mentor young professionals.</li>  <li>Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to travel and passion for learning.</li>  <li>Ability to work in a performance focused, collaborative team environment.</li>  <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing technical reports and preparing tender documents.</li>  <li>Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W or Seep/W.</li>  <li>Experience with 2D and 3D numerical modeling programs relating to slope stability and deformation analysis such as Clara or FLAC.</li>  <li>Ability to execute projects to meet Client requirements.</li>  <li>Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients.</li>  <li>Strong business acumen.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1324-A18. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Geotechnical / Civil Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the Manager, Facilities Engineering as an Intermediate Project / Process Engineer at Integrated Sustainability Consultants Limited, you will be an integral part of the Facilities Engineering Team, developing technical solutions in the water, waste and energy fields. <br/><br/> Your extensive process engineering and design experience in industry and/or consulting, as well as your project and team management skills will allow you to take a leadership role in a challenging and dynamic team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Integrated Sustainability:</strong> <br/><br/> Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd. is an innovative leading provider of professional services based out of Calgary that integrates world-class front-end project consulting and delivery teams to execute sustainable <em>Water, Waste</em> and <em>Energy</em> solutions. Our goal is to engage public, industrial, and natural resource sector clients from early project thinking to successfully engineered project delivery completion by an employee owned team who value long-term social and environmentally sustainable solutions. <br/><br/> We are passionate about managing the water lifecycle from source protection and resource management, to water and wastewater treatment and disposal. We strive to find total lifecycle solutions through a risk management approach, while implementing efficient fit-for-purpose engineering design and scientific solutions. To meet these challenges, we have attracted a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are highly recognized specialists in their field of expertise and love coming to work every day! <br/><br/> We have been recognized as a <em>Top Service Provider (Environmental Consultants)</em> by the Consumer Choice awards in for the last two years, as the <em>2015 Water Management Company of the Year</em> through the Oil & Gas Awards and the <em>2014 ATB Small Business of the Year</em> through the Calgary Chamber of Commerce and are committed to employing the best people. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in process, chemical, or mechanical engineering from an accredited post secondary institution</li> <li>5-10 years applicable engineering experience in North American industrial water treatment, oil and gas, mining, or other process industries, including at least 3-5 years in engineering or consulting</li> <li>Registration with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or equivalent;</li> <li>Excellent English communication skills, and experience in preparing and reviewing technical reports</li> <li>Proven leadership and communication skills, with business development and client communication skills</li> <li>Thorough understanding of other disciplines’ roles in the design process</li> <li>Ability to work under own initiative to meet deadlines and manage priorities</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Coordinate small to large sized teams and projects with water, waste and energy as central concepts</li> <li>Undertake and oversee detailed data characterization and analysis</li> <li>Complete front end feasibility, preliminary and detailed engineering design in a variety of technical contexts</li> <li>Undertake construction management and system optimization where required to meet clients’ requirements</li> <li>Develop and implement complex science, engineering and field programs</li> <li>Foster critical relationships with clients, technical and non-technical staff, government representatives, and technology suppliers</li> <li>Supervise junior technical and field staff</li> <li>Establish cost and schedule for project deliverables</li> <li>Preparing Progress reports</li> <li>Works and communicates well in a team oriented setting within a rapidly changing environment and with minimum supervision</li> <li>Interface with other departments as required to develop and implement multi-disciplinary project strategies</li> <li>Assisting in field during construction and commissioning</li> <li>Undertake process lead roles for process & facilities deliverables: Design Basis, PFDs, Material Balance, Process Narratives, P&IDs, Line Lists, Tie-In Lists, Mechanical Equipment Lists, Instrument Datasheets</li> <li>Sizing equipment, hydraulic analysis, process analysis, process modeling and plant optimization projects</li> <li>Preliminary design, and detailed design of process plants and water treatment plants in western Canada and elsewhere</li> <li>Process optimization studies including process simulation and troubleshooting</li> <li>Must be fluent in English and legally able to work in Canada</li> </ul> To apply, please send your resume with cover letter to careers@integratedsustainability.ca <br/><br/> <strong>Please ensure to include the job number (PRINT0309) in the email subject line.</strong> <br/><br/> We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Intermediate Process/Project Engineer – Job No. PRINT

Job_Description: As Software Verification & Validation (V&V) Engineer, reporting to the V&V team lead, you will influence business success by applying your extensive engineering background and expertise in software testing strategies within a high-tech industry. Your work will impact all phases of the product development and deployment lifecycle. You will support planning activities and deliverables for ongoing release cycles; supporting an exciting new range products; carry out tasks and activities across the product verification teams located in Calgary. <ul> <li>Execute test deliverables in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams and our global customer base.</li><li>Develop validation and verification plans for Safety Critical Systems products.</li><li>Develop test specifications, test reports, test metrics and validation protocols for integration and performance testing.</li><li>Implement and document effective processes to enable robust validation and verification of software products.</li><li>Execute tests using automated and manual verification methods for both software and hardware.</li><li>Establish test case traceability to requirements and specifications.</li><li>Support testing done across the hardware, software and systems disciplines to ensure new products meet or exceed their performance and quality goals.</li><li>Collaborate with other team members to set up and execute technology demonstrations to existing and potential new customers.</li><li>Conduct occasional dynamic testing of GPS/GNSS technology.</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul>  <li>Post-secondary degree in a technical field, preferably in Computer Science, Electrical, Computer, Software Engineering.</li> <li>Validation and Verification experience within a cross functional development team environment.</li> <li>Software test tool development experience (including use of C/C++, Python, LabView).</li> <li>5+ years of experience in a high technology manufacturing environment.</li> <li>Knowledge of GPS/GNSS technology</li> <li>Valid Driver's License</li> <li>Ability to travel approximately 10% (mostly North America, possibly international)</li>  </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions to others.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Ability to multitask and manage multiple project paths.</li><li>Strong English language communication skills, both oral and written.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>An understanding of real time operating systems and embedded firmware development</li> <li>Understanding of signal processing algorithms</li><li>Knowledge of, or some experience in, the automotive industry</li><li>Knowledge of ISO 26262/ASPICE PAM 3.0</li> </ul> NovAtel designs, manufactures and sells high precision OEM positioning technology. Our GNSS products and services are used in more than 60 countries around the globe to deliver precise positioning solutions in precision agriculture, defense, mapping, autonomous vehicles, survey and many other industries.
Title: Verification & Validation Engineer

Eng.).</li>  <li>Ability to travel on occasion.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!

Less, etc)</li><li>Experience using Git or a similar version control system</li><li>Being considered a technical lead is not foreign to you, in fact you strive for it</li><li>Experience with C# and Visual Studio and/or PHP is a definite asset</li><li>Strong creative problem-solving ability</li><li>Ability to contribute to cross functional team discussions</li><li>BSc. in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience</li><li>Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills</li> </ul> <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Getty Images is the most trusted and Title: Senior Software Engineer

Job_Description: Summary <br/><br/> Barr is seeking an engineer with demonstrated experience leading, managing, and mentoring multi-discipline project teams as a practice builder. This position provides the opportunity to build a practice around a core team to work on a variety of consulting projects involving traditional geotechnical engineering designs such as shallow and deep foundations; slope stability; seepage; bearing capacity; settlement; pavements; retaining walls; and dams. Projects focus on geotechnical and civil engineering design and analysis and include the preparation of plans and specifications, planning and oversight of investigations and analysis, writing technical reports, and cost estimating. The position will include project management for scope, schedule, and budget compliance, and will require working with engineers in other Barr offices. Administrative responsibilities such as business development, project management, mentoring and coaching, project planning and scheduling, and workload estimating make up a significant part of this role. This position will require out-of-town work assignments to meet the needs of our clients including field work such as client meetings and presentations, construction review, and facility inspections. <br/><br/> NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature the rough terrain typical of construction sites and to enter and work within facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. While the position is located in the Calgary office, fulfillment of the position responsibilities will require periodic travel. Applicants may be asked to participate in a drug screening program at the request of specific clients. <br/><br/> Minimum Qualifications  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in civil engineering with a geotechnical emphasis</li> <li>10+ years of relevant work experience involving geotechnical engineering</li>   <li>Professional member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or ability to obtain membership within one year</li> <li>Strong technical understanding of a wide range of civil engineering such as structural, water resources with an emphasis on geotechnical analysis and design</li> <li>Demonstrated flexibility, willingness to modify schedule as required to meet deadlines and/or client needs</li>   <li>Demonstrated technical project leadership, management, and organizational skills</li> <li>Demonstrated client relationship development/business development experience</li> <li>Desire to help build the geotechnical group in our Calgary office</li> <li>Computer skills including modeling software (such as FLAC, Plaxis, MODFLOW and/or GeoStudio), word processing and spreadsheets</li> <li>Willingness to travel domestically and internationally to support project needs</li> <li>Good verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Acceptable driving record</li> <li>Legal authorization to work in Canada without the need for sponsorship</li>   <li>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship</li>    </ul> Preferred Qualifications  <ul>  <li>15+ years of relevant work experience</li> <li>Graduate degree in geotechnical engineering</li>   <li>Experience with civil infrastructure including roadway, foundation, retaining wall, and bridge design</li> <li>Experience with dams, including hydropower and tailings dam design, management and operation</li> <li>Experience or familiarity with geotechnical engineering in support of buried pipelines</li> <li>Engineering consulting or related experience</li> <li>Knowledge of the geotechnical markets in western Canada</li> <li>Strong, proven business development skills</li> <li>Strong relationships with clients and the ability to foster ongoing relationships</li> <li>Desire to become involved in the greater geotechnical community by performing research, giving presentations, and preparing publications</li> <li>Proven experience collaborating and maintain relationships across offices</li>    </ul> Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, Job_Description: As a Geomatics Engineer with NovAtel Inc.'s Positioning Algorithms team you will design, implement, explore and verify improvements to real-time GNSS positioning algorithms. You will have opportunities to collaborate with other engineers across the NovAtel organization, investigate escalated customer issues, implement algorithm enhancements, perform data analysis, and participate in firmware qualifications. Your previous experience in implementing positioning algorithms, troubleshooting abilities, and methodical problem solving approach will support ongoing business initiatives in our exciting high tech environment. <ul> <li>Implement new features and improvements; driving the design, implementation and verification of the feature throughout the product lifecycle.</li><li>Interface with marketing, product managers and systems team to create robust and complete requirements</li><li>Collaborate with verification designers to plan, execute tests and develop automated test suites.</li><li>Support customer service and customers of existing products through problem investigation, defect resolution and testing.</li><li>Create and review design documentation which includes conceptual ideas, design specifications, test plans and test results.</li><li>Analyze real world and test environment data to make data driven decision</li><li>Explore new advancements in GNSS positioning and find ways to incorporate it into our products</li><li>Innovate new ideas to enhance positioning performance</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>B.Sc. in Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics</li> <li>Knowledge of GNSS systems and filtering techniques (least squares, Kalman filtering, etc.)</li><li>Knowledge of coordinate systems and reference frames</li><li>Comfortable reading and writing code in C/C++ and scripting languages such as Python</li><li>Strong data analysis skills</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team</li><li>Innate sense of curiosity and conscientiousness</li><li>Excited by new technologies and new possibilities</li><li>Derive satisfaction from your work being used in demanding real world applications</li><li>Sense of urgency to meet customer expectations</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>M.Sc or Ph.D in Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Mathematics</li> <li>5+ years of working in a technology development environment;</li><li>Experience with Precise Point Positioning technologies</li><li>Knowledge of embedded systems</li><li>Experience working in development environments that follow standards such as ISO-16949</li> </ul>
Title: Geomatics Engineer

Job_Description: <div>SCADA Engineer / Technologist All Levels</div>  <p>True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems.</p>  <p>Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone.</p>  <p>Position</p>  <p>We are currently recruiting for a <strong>SCADA Engineer / Technologist</strong>. This challenging opportunity is to be an integral part of our SCADA project team. The successful candidate will be responsible for specification, configuration and commissioning of SCADA systems.</p>  <p>Main Responsibilities</p>  <ul>  <li>Design and configuration of complete SCADA systems from the RTU's to the Host.</li>  <li>Manage project scope, schedule and budget on projects.</li>  <li>Perform ongoing maintenance and support on previous projects.</li>  <li>Commissioning, testing and troubleshooting remotely and on-site.</li>  <li>Maintain 100% customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul>  <p>Qualifications</p>  <ul>  <li>Bachelors in Engineering or a Diploma in Technology in a related field.</li>  <li>Experience with one or more of the following: FactoryLink, ClearSCADA, PcView, CygNet, Factory Talk, SCADAvantage</li>  <li>Experience with one or more of the following: SCADAPack's, Fisher ROC's, Bristol's, ABB Totalflow's.</li>  <li>Experience in all types of communications and networking: MDS, Freewave and others an asset.</li>  <li>Strong software computer proficiencies: MS Office, SQL, VBScript, Access.</li>  <li>Superb written and spoken communication skills.</li>  <li>Able to adapt to various situations quickly, while adhering to daily deadlines.</li>  <li>Availability to Travel approximately 20% of the time and a valid driver's license.</li>  <li>Experience in Oil/Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Forestry, Waste Water, Water, Food and Beverage an asset.</li>  </ul>  <p>Please submit your cover letter and resume with "SCADA Engineer / Technologist" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com</p>  <p>We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.</p>

Typical business development activities include building and maintaining client relationships, tracking marketing leads and project opportunities, developing and presenting proposals and presentations, and networking and sharing Barr’s capabilities with existing and potential clients. The work may at times involve short-term out-of-town assignments. <br/><br/> NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature rough terrain typical of construction sites and facilities that have limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Assignments may involve work on waste disposal sites and sites requiring cleanup of hazardous materials. A physical exam may be required; safety training will be provided. <br/><br/> Minimum Qualifications  <ul> <li>BS in Civil Engineering or related degree</li>   <li>10 or more years of relevant work experience</li> <li>Professional member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or ability to obtain membership within one year</li> <li>Flexible working style, self-initiative, self-motivation, and a willingness to work with teams to meet clients' needs and project schedules</li> <li>Demonstrated experience meeting timelines and achieving project expectations</li>   <li>Demonstrated client relationship development skills</li> <li>Conscientiousness concerning the accuracy, appropriateness, and timeliness of results</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills</li> <li>Demonstrated technical project leadership, management, and organizational skills</li> <li>Legal authorization to work in Canada without the need for sponsorship</li> <li>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship</li> <li>Acceptable driving record</li> </ul> Preferred Qualifications  <ul>  <li>15 or more years of relevant work experience</li> <li>Alberta public infrastructure or transportation related work experience</li> <li>Mining infrastructure related work experience</li> <li>Demonstrated project leadership and management experience on multi-discipline project teams</li> <li>Demonstrated strong business-development skills</li> <li>Engineering consulting or related experience</li> <li>M.S. in Title: Civil Engineer - Senior Level

Job_Description: Your Opportunity<br/><br/>Finding efficient, safe, and economical ways to develop and deliver oil and gas is an ongoing challenge. From the Arctic to the Canadian oil sands and the US shale plays, our Oil & Gas team partners with clients to provide engineering, procurement, construction management (EPCM), integrity, permitting, survey, and environmental services across the upstream, midstream, and downstream oil and gas industry. We design and support the lifecycle maintenance of facilities, pipelines, terminals, and refineries, as well as critical infrastructure like processing plants and field facilities. Through our partnerships, industry experience, and use of technology, we develop new and inventive ways to solve emerging issues, meet regulations, and increase productivity. Explore your career options with us. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking a <strong>Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer</strong> to join our <strong>Oil & Gas</strong> group in <strong>Southeast <strong>Calgary.</strong> </strong> <br/><br/> The Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer shall have strong technical, organizational and people skills, with a focus on integration of fracture mechanics into the integrity assessments and integrity program development. At all times, the focus will be efficient, timely and high quality deliverables to the client through an attention to details. <br/><br/> The role will require selection and application of appropriate materials testing, Fitness-for-Service and engineering methods and principles to conduct detailed engineering assessment of material imperfections relating to steel and pipe manufacturing, construction and joining as well as environmental and mechanical effects. Project experience with low-frequency long seam ERW and fatigue will be an asset. The candidate shall have a strong work ethic, enjoy working in a team environment and will desire to have a career in the integrity management field.<br/><br/>Your Duties   <ul>   <li>Application of Pipeline Facility Fitness-for-Service codes and standards</li> <li>Project management, responsible for overall project cost, schedule and deliverables</li> <li>Sharing knowledge through informal presentations and one-on one coaching & mentoring</li> <li>Set an example through responsible, safety-conscious conduct</li> <li>Meet all requirements of Client and Stantec Quality Systems</li> <li>Strengthen technical knowledge through on-the-job, informal and formal training</li> <li>Be familiar with and ensure appropriate industry-accepted methods are utilized at all times</li> <li>Be familiar with applicable codes and regulations</li> <li>Liaise and interact with Stantec peers</li> <li>Establish and maintain positive client relationships</li> </ul>  Your Capabilities and Credentials   <ul>   <li>Graduate or Post-graduate Engineering Degree in Fracture Mechanics</li> <li>Eligible for P.Eng. registration with APEGA</li> <li>3+ years of laboratory experience in tensile, Charpy V-notch, CTOD, metallurgical and fractography analysis</li> <li>Crack Defect assessment experience, including application of CorLas, BS7910, API 579, API 1104, CSA Z662 Annex K</li> <li>BMT Flawcheck and Quest Signal software</li> <li>Experience with Canadian standards, practices and applicable legislation</li> <li>Demonstrated technical proficiency</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem solving skills</li> <li>Demonstrated process improvement skills</li> <li>Demonstrated initiative, flexibility and adaptability</li> </ul> <em>We would like to thank all candidates who apply; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.</em>
Title: Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer

Job_Description: Your Opportunity <p>Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system.</p> <p> </p> <p>Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>Stantec is currently looking to add a<strong> Civil</strong> <strong>Engineer in Training</strong> to support our growing Water Resources practice. We encourage you to apply if you possess or would like to gain experience in a broad range of water-related engineering projects, with specific emphasis on industrial stormwater management water resources infrastructure projects. Applicants should be capable of working effectively with teams and clients, and be willing to learn from peers and supervisors</p> <p> </p> Your Duties <p>• Cooperatively support multidisciplinary teams on small- to mid-sized projects and work on several projects concurrently.</p> <p>• Perform preliminary and detailed analysis for industrial stormwater runoff.</p> <p>• Perform detailed analysis for hydraulic and hydrologic modeling using PCSWMM modeling software.</p> <p>• Preparation of studies, design criteria, design reports, plans and specifications, and quality assurance reviews of related designs and construction plans to ensure technical accuracy.</p> <p>• Inspect construction for compliance with design drawings and specifications.</p> <p>• Assist in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, preparing proposals and budgets, and completing progress reports.</p> <p>• Evaluate alternatives and resolve technical questions.</p> <p>• Work in a manner to ensure your personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guideline and policies.</p> <p> </p> Your Capabilities and Credentials <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil or Water Resources Engineering.</li>  <li>Registration as an Engineer-in-Training with APEGA or qualifications to obtain this registration at the start of employment.</li>  <li>Strong organizational skills and multitasking ability. </li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with engineering staff at all levels. </li>  <li>Ability to prepare complete, concise and organized engineering calculations and analyses.</li>  <li>Desire to grow in your career in a challenging environment that fosters self-improvement though leadership, mentoring, and a diversity of experience.</li>  <li>Strong willingness to be a part of a large global engineering company, and to work with teams in other offices around the world.</li> </ul> <p>You will be based out of Calgary, but the position may require occasional project travel throughout western Canada</p> <p>Qualified candidates who are highly motivated and eager to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to become a Top 10 global design firm should submit their resume and cover letter online at www.stantec.com/careers. </p> <p> </p>
Title: Civil Engineer EIT

Job_Description: <strong>Career Opportunity Senior Field Engineer Infrastructure</strong> <br/><br/> Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <u><strong>About The Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Senior Field Engineer at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Assist Project Managers and Estimators in pursuing and securing new work.</li> <li>Take an active role in transitioning new projects from the pursuit phase to the execution phase with the support of the Project Manager and Superintendent.</li> <li>Take on a field-based leadership role during the execution of projects, supporting the Superintendent and Project Manager in any capacity required to ensure that the projects objectives are successfully achieved.</li> <li>Assist with the development and maintenance of project schedules using P6 software.</li> <li>Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets and overall project performance.</li> <li>Implement project-specific safety and quality plans and update them as required during the project.</li> <li>Assist the Superintendent in developing workface plans for critical construction tasks.</li> <li>Manage project documentation requirements; proactively address submittals, RFIs, and other project documentation in order to ensure that construction work can proceed without delay.</li> <li>Assist with surveying and project layout as required; maintain and update red-line drawings.</li> <li>Assist with coordinating subcontractors, vendors, and field staff.</li> <li>Attend relevant project meetings and liaise with clients and consultants to the extent required.</li> <li>Prepare memos, letters, meeting minutes, subcontracts, and other forms and documents.</li> <li>Assist with estimating and soliciting subcontractors and/or suppliers for information and pricing</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Have a degree relevant to the construction industry. Civil, Structural, or Mechanical engineering is preferred. A Professional Engineering designation is considered an asset.</li> <li>5 - 8 years of relevant construction field experience.</li> <li>Willing to relocate and/or travel to projects in various locations throughout Alberta.</li> <li>Experience working at a General Contractor, including construction management knowledge of projects in the water/wastewater and/or transportation sectors.</li> <li>Good communication, problem-solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Primavera P6, and AutoDesk.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <u><strong>About Us</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5190
Title: Senior Field Engineer - Infrastructure

Requirements</strong><br/> <div> <div>The successful candidate will have experience in these functionalities, and have an accredited college degree relative to industry knowledge of corrosion engineering. <br/><br/> · Authorizing reports for issue <br/><br/> · Supervising staff and allocating work to engineers <br/><br/> · Maintain reimbursability throughout the year <br/><br/> · Develop and support staff business/technical mentoring system <br/><br/> · Development and submission of proposals <br/><br/> · Ensure projects are completed on time and within budget <br/><br/> · Management personal KPI’s <br/><br/> · Involvement with industry associations and academic institutions</div> </div> <br/><strong>Additional Details</strong> <br/><br/> The Company embraces diversity in our Job_Description: Environmental Engineer/Scientist <br/> <br/>  Dillon is a well established, employee-owned professional consulting firm operating across Canada and internationally. We provide a wide range of consulting and design services related to the infrastructure, real estate, resource, industrial and government sectors in Canada and abroad.<br/><br/>We are currently seeking candidates for the position of <strong>Environmental Engineer/Scientist</strong> inour <strong>Calgary, Alberta</strong> office.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Coordination and management of environmental projects including environmental site assessments (ESAs), ongoing monitoring programs, hydrogeological studies, and site remediation projects</li> <li>Design and implementation of environmental investigation/sampling programs</li> <li>Development of remedial action plans and assistance in the design of site remediation options, including completion of feasibility studies of environmental remediation options</li> <li>Completion of environmental field activities including data collection, soil vapour, groundwater, surface water, and soil sampling</li> <li>Management and interpretation of data, including lab coordination</li>  <li>Preparation of written reports, compilation and revision of contracts and other supporting documentation</li> <li>Input to the career development of junior staff including providing technical direction, training recommendations, coaching and mentoring</li> <li>Supervision of field staff and field programs, including sub-contractor coordination</li>  <li>Contributions to Dillon’s corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees</li> <li>Business travel upon request</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>A degree in geology, civil or environmental engineering, hydrogeology, or another relevant environmental science</li> <li>Ideally licensed to practice as a Professional Engineer (P. Eng.) or Geoscientist (P.Geo.) in the province of Alberta</li> <li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience, preferably with at least 2 years in consulting and/or environmental related fields</li> </ul>  Experience  <ul>  <li>Strong background in several of: project management, contracting/construction, chemistry, geotechnical concerns, geology, hydrogeology, remediation engineering, site characterization, waste management, landfill design, health and safety</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication, and organizational skills</li> <li>Demonstrated capabilities in multidisciplinary teamwork well as the ability to work independently</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office</li>  <li>Proficiency in AUTOCAD, GIS, Surfer, GINT or database abilities will be an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of relevant municipal, provincial, and federal environmental legislation and policies will be considered an asset</li> </ul>  Related Services<br/><br/>Remediation and Risk Control <br/> <br/>  Environmental Sciences <br/> <br/>  Environmental Risk Identification and Evaluation and Groundwater Management
Title: Environmental Engineer/Scientist

Job_Description: <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Area</strong>: Design and Testing of Erosion and Nano-coating <br/> <strong>Duration</strong>: One Year <br/> <strong>Start</strong> <strong>Date</strong>: immediate until the position is filled <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Mechanical and Manufacturing</strong> in the <strong>Schulich School of Engineering</strong> at the University of Calgary is accepting applications for a <strong>Postdoctoral</strong> <strong>Fellow</strong> in the areas of electronics, circuits, signal processing, and control specifically dealing with nanocomposites based sensor applications<strong>.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> A position is available in the Micro Engineering Dynamics Automation Lab (MEDAL) at the University of Calgary for a postdoctoral researcher to join an interdisciplinary team developing and testing of novel nanocoatings and erosion setup for oil and gas industry. Specifically, the researcher will be responsible for new methods for cost effective coating of steel for erosion resistance and investigate erosion effects at elevated temperature. The work will also involve with developments, design, fabrications, and micro/nano engineering aspects and the researcher will be closely collaborating with the sponsoring company. In addition, the researcher would mentor other team members. <br/><br/> This project is a partially supported by MITACS program. <br/><br/> The potential candidates should be prepared to relocate, if necessary, and begin work with us as soon as possible. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must have a Ph.D. in engineering field with focus (one or more) in vibrations, design, erosion, tribology, mechatronics, signal processing, electronics, manufacturing, nano engineering, and numerical modeling. Hands on Experience with coating and test apparatus development is advantageous. The successful candidates will have a proven record of success and be able to conduct research independently as well as part of a team. Good oral and written communication skills are essential. <br/><br/> Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled. <br/><br/> <strong>Application details:</strong> <br/><br/> Interested individuals should send a cover letter, detailed CV, a general research/goals statement, sample publications or manuscripts, and the contact information (including email addresses) for two references to: <br/><br/> Dr. Simon Park (simon.park@ucalgary.ca). Dr. Park will seek additional information to the potential candidates. <br/><br/> Micro Engineering Dynamics Automation Lab (MEDAL) www.ucalgary.ca/medal investigates micro and nano engineering specifically dealing with fabrication and development of novel applications, pipeline engineering, vibrations, etc. There are approx. 20 people working in the lab. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about academic opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Academic Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Schulich School of Education visit <strong>Careers in the Schulich School of Education</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About Calgary, Alberta</strong> <br/><br/> Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.
Title: Post Doctoral Fellowship, Design and Testing of Erosion and Nano-coating, Department of Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering

Job_Description: <div><div>As a <strong>Senior Civil or Water Resources Engineer</strong> in KCB’s Water, Power and Transportation Group, you will use your exceptional technical, project management, and client liaison skills to, not only inspire and expand our civil projects group in Calgary but also, advance your career aspirations in a growing international enterprise. Through your solid reputation in the industry and with clients, you will bring in and execute mine water management infrastructure and river engineering projects in the oil sands, mining, and water resources sectors. <br/><br/> <strong>If you are registered as a Professional Engineer in Canada, have at minimum a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering and a minimum of 10 years of related experience in Civil and Water Resources Engineering, we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Passion for continuous growth and drive toward long-term success.</li>  <li>Solid reputation in the oil sands and mining industries.</li>  <li>Extensive first-hand design and construction experience in clean and dirty water collection systems (i.e. dewatering, collection, and diversion ditches) and related structures (i.e. drop structures, culvert crossings), sedimentation/attenuation ponds, pump and pipeline systems, mine closure drainage systems, river/creek diversions, and channel stabilization and erosion protection works.</li>  <li>Technical excellence and proven experience taking projects from concept to operation.</li>  <li>Proven time management, project management and organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to meet project schedules and budgets.</li>  <li>Working knowledge of relevant engineering design standards, codes and manuals, best practice guidelines, standard construction specifications, and engineering drawing standards.</li>  <li>Demonstrated leadership, decision-making and coaching skills, especially your ability to train and mentor young professionals.</li>  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English including your experience in writing proposals, technical reports, and construction specifications</li>  <li>Strong business acumen and your ability to expand our services and business.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, hydropower, environmental, transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and water resources sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the Oil and Gas industry, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Mining. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1276-A17. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Senior Civil or Water Resources Engineer

own the business, own the result</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> On the job training, mentoring and coaching</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Global projects and travel opportunities</li>  </ul>  <br/><br/> <strong> One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years</strong>  <br/><br/> Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors. <br/><br/> Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request. <br/><br/> <strong> To learn more about our company and culture click here to view</strong>  <strong> The Promise of Golder</strong>  <strong> video.</strong>  <br/>

Job_Description: Longview Aviation Asset Management (LAAM) was established in 2016 to provide attractive financing and lease options, as well as trade-in aircraft capabilities, for aircraft supported and manufactured by Viking Air Limited (Viking). <br/><br/> In 2018, LAAM, in partnership with Viking, formally launched the CL-415EAF "Enhanced Aerial Firefighter" conversion program. The CL-415EAF combines the proven performance of the CL-215 airframe with modern upgrades to create the next generation of the worlds only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform. <br/><br/> <strong>MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Follow the policies and procedures laid out in the Company's Transport Canada Approved Maintenance Policy Manual to ensure the Company is in full compliance with the current Canadian Aviation Regulations;</li> <li>Be responsible to their assigned Charge Hand</li> <li>Disassemble, inspect, record discrepancies, recommend and record methods of repair</li> <li>Repair, fabricate parts and components</li> <li>Install, rig and carry out all other mechanical and structural functions and test in accordance with manufacturer's specifications</li> <li>Ensure that all applicable airworthiness requirements are met</li> <li>Maintain a clean work area, and alert the Supervisor of any safety concerns</li> <li>Responsible for ensuring both accuracy and traceability of parts removed or installed on Aircraft</li> <li>For those AME's possessing certifying authority, perform and/or certify work performed within the scope of this Aircraft Maintenance Organization</li> <li>Perform any other work assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Have experience with the CL 415/215T/215 aircraft</li> <li>Have experience with CL 415/215T/215 systems</li> <li>Have experience with general aircraft repair, fabrication and installation</li> <li>Possess knowledge expected of an AME S on aircraft types handled by the Company</li> <li>Shall hold a valid AME S Transport Canada License; M2 is preferred or be eligible to be an apprentice to achieve this license</li> </ul> Interviews start ASAP! Apply today for consideration! (No cover letter required)
Title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME-S)
