Job_Description: Whatever the distance, wherever the destination—our designs lead you there. Our Transportation group provides comprehensive planning, design, and engineering services for all phases of airport, bridge, rail, roadway, and transit projects. Join our team and help us keep communities connected. <br/><br/> An opportunity is available for a <strong>Civil Engineering Co-op Student</strong> to join our Infrastructure Management and Pavement Engineering (IMPE) team in <strong>Calgary, AB,</strong> beginning in May. This position may involve travel ranging from a few days to a week. Training will be provided to the successful applicant. <ul> <li><div>As the successful candidate, you have a sound technical background and are willing to take on a diversity of tasks which may include both field and office work;</div></li><li><div>An understanding of transportation engineering, and more specifically pavement materials and pavement assessment procedures, would be an asset alongside previous experience with geotechnical investigations and/or pavement data collection;</div></li><li><div>Ideally, candidates should be in their 2nd or 3rd year at an accredited post-secondary institution and are enrolled in a civil/transportation engineering program;</div></li><li><div>Have strong communication skills, both written and verbal, along with excellent interpersonal abilities; and</div></li><li><div>Demonstrate a strong working proficiency with the Windows operating system and Microsoft Office products.</div></li><li><div>GIS Knowledge is preferred but not required.</div></li></ul>  <ul> <li><div>Assist with report writing and conduct literature reviews.</div></li><li><div>Assist Project Managers, with data analysis, Quality Control/Assurance of pavement performance data.</div></li><li><div>Collect pavement investigation information, pavement performance data, material sampling, and other field activities.</div></li><li><div>Organize and manage field and spatial data to ensure quality and consistency.</div></li><li><div>Analyze pavement investigation information, pavement performance data, material sampling, and climatic data.</div></li><li><div>Keep detailed project records and be responsible for organizing your work in the office and field.</div></li> </ul> With a big company comes big opportunities! Joining the IMPE team will allow the successful candidate to experience a wide range of office and field learning opportunities in the transportation engineering practice.
Title: Civil Engineering Co-op Student

Job_Description: <strong>Career Opportunity Field Engineer Infrastructure</strong> <br/><br/> Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <u><strong>About The Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Field Engineer at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Assist Project Managers and Estimators in pursuing and securing new work.</li> <li>Take an active role in transitioning new projects from the pursuit phase to the execution phase with the support of the Project Manager and Superintendent.</li> <li>Take on a field-based leadership role during the execution of projects, supporting the Superintendent and Project Manager in any capacity required to ensure that the projects objectives are successfully achieved.</li> <li>Assist with the development and maintenance of project schedules using P6 software.</li> <li>Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets and overall project performance.</li> <li>Implement project-specific safety and quality plans and update them as required during the project.</li> <li>Assist the Superintendent in developing workface plans for critical construction tasks.</li> <li>Manage project documentation requirements; proactively address submittals, RFIs, and other project documentation in order to ensure that construction work can proceed without delay.</li> <li>Assist with surveying and project layout as required; maintain and update red-line drawings.</li> <li>Assist with coordinating subcontractors, vendors, and project support staff.</li> <li>Attend relevant project meetings and liaise with clients and consultants to the extent required.</li> <li>Prepare memos, letters, meeting minutes, subcontracts, and other forms and documents.</li> <li>Assist with estimating and soliciting subcontractors and/or suppliers for information and pricing</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Degree in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering Technology.</li> <li>2 - 5 years of relevant construction field experience.</li> <li>Willing to relocate and/or travel to projects in various locations throughout Alberta.</li> <li>Experience working at a General Contractor, including construction management knowledge of projects in the water/wastewater and/or transportation sectors.</li> <li>Good communication, problem-solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Primavera P6, and AutoDesk.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <u><strong>About Us</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5190
Title: Field Engineer - Infrastructure

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong>We have a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, and our team is committed to providing solution driven environmental services to help our clients in planning, managing and conducting their projects. Our growing organization needs motivated people to help us continue to grow, while maintaining the quality results our clients have come to expect. <br/><br/> With the above vision in mind, SNC-Lavalin is looking for career-oriented, intermediate-level project staff in our Edmonton office<br/><br/>JOB DUTIES: <br/><br/> Intermediate Environmental Scientist/Engineer/Geologist/Agrologist/Technologists are required to complete fundamental tasks related to Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments. Other technical responsibilities may include assistance with remedial system operations and maintenance and report preparation for peer review. <br/><br/> Work locations will depend on where project needs arise (i.e. locations in and around Alberta, Saskatchewan, or Manitoba) so candidates must be willing to travel for up to two week periods. <br/><br/> The Intermediate Environmental Scientist/Engineer/Geologist/Agrologist/Technologist responsibilities may include the following: <ul> <li>Historical data review and subsequent site inspections</li><li>Groundwater monitoring and sampling</li><li>Hydraulic conductivity testing</li><li>Aquifer testing</li><li>Surface water sampling</li><li>Soil vapour sampling</li><li>Surface soil sampling</li><li>Oversite of drilling investigations</li><li>Installation of groundwater monitoring wells</li><li>Oversite of remedial excavations</li><li>Photographic and written documentation of site activities</li><li>Communication with on-site supervisors and the Project Managers</li> </ul> QUALIFICATIONS <ul> <li>Diploma or Degree from a program with relevant subject matter.</li><li>Demonstrated technical skills in field activities related to Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments (ESA) including soil and groundwater monitoring and sampling techniques, various drilling techniques, soil descriptions and terminology, and quality assurance / quality control. Experience with remedial systems is desired but not required.</li><li>Strong communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.</li><li>Candidates must possess a Valid Class 5 Full driver’s license and be 21 or older in order to meet vehicle rental requirements</li> </ul> POSITION: Intermediate Scientist/Engineer/Geologist/Agrologist/Technologist <br/><br/> EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Regular - Full Time (40 hours per week) <br/><br/> EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Diploma or Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Environmental Sciences, Biology, Geology or relevant field <br/><br/> LOCATION: Edmonton, AB <br/><br/> WORK EXPERIENCE: 3 to 5 years <br/><br/> FIELD OF STUDY: Engineering, Geology, Agrology, Biology or Environmental Sciences <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ​<br/><br/><strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
Title: Intermediate Environmental Scientist/Engineer/Geologist/Agrologist/Technologist

Job_Description: GHD is one of the world’s leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Privately owned by our people</STRONG>, GHD provides engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services to private and public sector clients across five continents. Focused on creating lasting community benefit, our connected global network of 9,000 people delivers projects with high standards of safety, quality and ethics. Committed to sustainable development, GHD improves the physical, natural and social environments of the many communities in which we operate. <br/><br/> Our <STRONG>Edmonton or Calgary</STRONG> offices are seeking a <STRONG>Senior Solid Waste Engineer</STRONG> ready to join one of our fastest-growing Canadian Operations. The candidate would join our North American solid waste group of 120 professionals. The candidate would be expected to reach out to new clients and prospects to grow the business of the solid waste practice in Western Canada. This position is specifically-focused on expanding traditional solid waste work as well as alternative waste management work such as organics management through composting and anaerobic digestion. This position will also work closely with GHD’s solid waste planning group as part of an integrated vision-through-implementation team that closely relates solid waste planning to engineering. <br/><br/> GHD has a strong mentorship program and this candidate will be working directly for a Principal/Vice-President in the solid waste group. Professional development opportunities through the GHD Business School including internal global technical conferences and external training are available, and participation in relevant industry associations is supported and encouraged. Working for GHD includes a competitive benefits package including RRSP matching, MSP premiums, commuter incentive, wellness reimbursement, and professional designated dues reimbursement. This position is a great opportunity to be part of an established and growing solid waste practice in Western Canada with a bright future ahead, as well as to interface with the North American solid waste team on a number of high-profile projects throughout Canada and the United States. We are seeking a technically strong senior solid waste engineer who wants to play an active role in further growing our solid waste team and to leverage GHD’s significant experience in new and innovative technologies in the solid waste space. <br/><br/> <STRONG>Responsibilities</STRONG> <br/><br/> Reporting to a Principal, the successful candidate will complete tasks including the following: <br/><br/> • Establishing long-lasting client relationships with municipal and industrial clients, working together with the Regional Business Development manager to help lead proposals for new projects together with the team <br/><br/> • Project manage solid waste projects on time and on budget for municipal and industrial clients requiring permitting, operations support, detailed design, construction management and inspection, and environmental studies <br/><br/> • Lead GHD’s solid waste projects including planning and design of landfills, transfer stations, composting facilities and anaerobic digestion facilities. Further extend to Western Canada GHD’s core strength in alternative waste technologies, especially in organics management <br/><br/> • Interface with GHD’s solid waste planning team to undertake the technical component of master plans <br/><br/> • Manage the preparation of technical reports and complete peer reviews of designs completed by others in the Solid Waste group <br/><br/> • Coordinate technical resources and personnel including drafters, 3D designers, GIS and database technicians, chemists, geotechnical engineers, hydrologists, hydrogeologists, biologists, and planners to complete solid waste facility designs and plans <br/><br/> • Effectively communicate and connect with existing and prospective clients <br/><br/> • Peer review complete quantity takeoffs and cost estimates <br/><br/> • Develop and administer construction contract documents <br/><br/> • Conduct construction inspections and chair construction progress meetings <br/><br/> • Complete regulatory conformance reviews <br/><br/> • Project management of studies and designs to support permitting applications <br/><br/> • Undertake liaison activities with regulators <br/><br/> • Provide mentorship and leadership to intermediate and junior technical staff across our offices in Western Canada <br/><br/> • Provide internal leadership in the growth and direction of the North American Solid Waste Team <br/><br/> <STRONG>Qualifications</STRONG> <br/><br/> • Civil or environmental engineer with a P.Eng. in AB and BC (preferably both), or be eligible <br/><br/> • 10-15 years of experience in the solid waste industry <br/><br/> • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in a consulting role <br/><br/> • Valid class 5 drivers license with driving record in good standing <br/><br/> • Willingness and ability for overnight travel and to conduct field work, as required <br/><br/> • Proficiency in MS Office, Word , Excel, Project, PowerPoint <br/><br/> • Excellent verbal and written communications skills and ability to work in a highly-skilled and diversified project team <br/><br/> • Experience designing Class 1 and II landfills in conformance with the Standards for Landfills in Alberta is considered an asset <br/><br/> • Experience in organic waste processing and waste technologies is considered an asset <br/><br/> We offer a professional working environment and culture, and we believe that work / life balance is critical to the success and happiness of our people. As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. <br/><br/> As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. <br/><br/> #LI-LL1
Title: Senior Solid Waste Engineer

Job_Description: Our role is to provide top level technical talent to some of the planets strongest companies in the energy and technology industries, as well as the public sector. This is where you come in. We have a distinctly different approach to our contractor engagement and have a team of specialists to ensure success on your assignment. <br/> Our Calgary Downtown Energy client is seeking a Reliability Engineer to support with a push of 6-7 projects that require execution in 2018. As a Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing SAGD oil sands operating data, maintenance history, and reliability data to identify opportunities and propose recommendations. This role will work alongside 4 other Reliability Engineers with blended experience in both Analytics and Steam who are highly collaborative, share knowledge, and driven to impact the bottom line. <br/> With standard working hours, this is a 10-month contract, based out of our clients Calgary office with some travel to Sunrise Oilsands required (once every several months). The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, focused, collaborative, and highly analytical with the ability to read, analyze, and identify data into tangible information. <br/> Job Responsibilities include:Analyze equipment performance based on operating data and maintenance history. Ensure that equipment is operating close to design parameters to identify efficiency degradation, optimize energy consumption, and minimize waste. <br/> Periodically review equipment maintenance records to identify recurring problems. Evaluate preventive (PM) and predictive (PdM) maintenance programs and recommend solutions. <br/> Review SAP data and make recommendations about the quality of data - problem description, cause and damage codes, and work description. High quality SAP data is essential to applying reliability concepts and analytics. <br/> Perform asset criticality review and validate existing FMEA to confirm relevance of the FMEA <br/> Apply engineering concepts and operational knowledge to resolve equipment performance and reliability issues. <br/><br/> Qualifications:4 to 6 years of experience with SAGD technologies and processes <br/> Knowledgeable about Defect Elimination (DE), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) processes <br/> Demonstrated experience with developing business cases based on reliability data <br/> Knowledgeable about the concepts of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) <br/> Good working knowledge of MS Office <br/> Proficiency within SAPs PPM module <br/> Effective interpersonal, innovation, and organizational skills <br/> Strong presentation skills; the ability to understand audiences and relay messages/goals in a way thats understood <br/><br/> Education/Experience:2 or more years of experience with conventional and/or heavy oil production, and/or refining technologies and processes <br/> P.Eng or eligibly to register as a P.Eng <br/> Experience working within reliability software such as Meridium <br/> Knowledgeable about condition monitoring technologies such as vibration, ultrasound, infrared, and lubricant analysis <br/><br/> <strong>About the Ian Martin Group:</strong> <br/> Founded by engineers to support the needs of technical organizations, the Ian Martin Group has been creating authentic connections around meaningful work since 1957. As North Americas most progressive recruitment and project-staffing firm, we specialize in engineering and IT recruiting to help organizations of all sizes hire better. The Ian Martin Group is a certified B Corporation, which means we meet comprehensive standards that measure our impact on employees, suppliers, community, and the environment. <br/> We will review applications as they are received, and we will contact candidates whose skills and experience best suit this role. <br/> <strong>EWEMI</strong>
Title: Reliability Engineer

we sincerely thank all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job_Description: Contribute to the company’s success by automating the testing of hardware and software to improve the consistency and coverage of testing on all Frac Automation products. <ul>  <li>Design, Document, Implement, and maintain test automation systems.</li> <li>Track and improve quality metrics.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <li> Professional Engineer or Professional Technologist</li> <li>Bachelor of Science or related degree from an accredited university or technical school.</li><li>A minimum of 2 years experience writing and creating test automation software in a manufacturing environment.</li><li>Experience in designing cables, and fixtures used to automate testing of products.</li><li>Knowledge of programming languages like C/C++, C# (.net), VB, Java, LabView.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of schematics, P&IDs, process flow diagrams Strong analytical and troubleshooting.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel as required, approx. up to 4 weeks per year.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel to fracturing jobs and manufacturing sites.</li> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Comprehensive benefits including paid vacations and holidays, supplemental healthcare including paramedical and health savings account, dental; vision, prescriptions, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with generous company match, long and short term disability and life insurances, etc.,
Title: Test Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Join our team in Southern Alberta!</strong> <br/><br/> Pacific Coastal Airlines is seeking<strong> <u>Licensed Aircraft Maintenance Engineers</u></strong> to be based in <strong>Calgary</strong> to support our new operations in the region. We are seeking candidates who are looking to enjoy a family-oriented, dynamic and rewarding work environment. We are excited to welcome safety-oriented and customer service minded candidates to continue their career with our growing company. <br/><br/> Pacific Coastal Airlines is headquartered at the South Terminal building at Vancouver International Airport. Under the Pacific Coastal banner we fly scheduled and charter service between busy international airports, remote destinations, and beautiful communities in the province of British Columbia. Our new operations in Southern Alberta create an exciting opportunity for candidates desiring to be based in the region to join the Pacific Coastal team. <br/><br/> A position in the Pacific Coastal Airlines maintenance department requires adherence to the highest level of aviation safety standards and the ability to execute aviation policies and procedures, utilizing skill and aviation knowledge to identify and prioritize problem areas. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>Must hold a valid transport Canada AME license</li><li>Preference given to applicants with SAAB 340 experience</li><li>Experience on system installations and Troubleshooting of various systems an asset</li><li>Must be familiar with the use of specialty equipment required for the position</li><li>Must be able to obtain a RAIC and AVOP</li><li>Must be willing to travel as required to service all Aircraft in Pacific Coastal Airlines' fleet</li><li>Must be willing and able to work shift work</li><li>Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to work well in a team environment</li><li>Ensure proper paperwork is in order and submitted on time; ie: all certifications and recertification's must be recorded prior to releasing aircraft into service</li><li>Must stay current on Comany Maintenance Control Manuals and other industry related manuals/materials</li> </ul> <strong><em>Why Pacific Coastal Airlines?</em></strong> <br/><br/> <u>Company Culture</u>: We honour our company motto of <em>People Friendly, People First</em> for both our employees and our passengers. We encourage a positive, caring workplace and put a high value on collaboration, accountability, and loyalty. We are inclusive, respectful, and have a friendly corporate culture. <br/><br/> <u>Compensation:</u> We recognize and value industry experience by offering competitive compensation commensurate with prior experience. We offer long term pay progression to recognize years of service as well as a company match Group RRSP for retirement planning. <br/><br/> <u>Health Benefits</u>: We offer a standard benefits package for permanent employees consisting of extended health, dental, vision, travel medical, BC MSP (if applicable), life insurance, AD&D, short-term disability, long-term disability, an employee and family assistance program, paid sick days, and paid personal emergency days. <br/><br/> <u>Travel Benefits</u>: We offer excellent travel perks within the Pacific Coastal network for employees, their eligible family members, and their buddies. Also available to employees and their eligible family members is standby travel on other airlines across the world. Additionally, employees are eligible for discounts with various hotels and restaurants within the communities we serve as well as steeply discounted cargo shipping within the Pacific Coastal Airlines network. <br/><br/> <u>Employee Programs:</u> We have employee recognition and reward programs, a milestone service recognition program, employee appreciation events throughout the year, and an online learning and development program. <br/><br/> Please submit a cover letter and resume with your application by clicking on: https://pacificcoastal.prevueaps.com/jobs/ <br/><br/> <em>Pacific Coastal Airlines is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to a policy of non-discrimination in all of our employment practices. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, disability or any other identifying characteristic.</em> <br/><br/> While we thank all candidates interested in joining the Pacific Coastal Airlines team, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Aircraft Maintenance Engineers

Job_Description: EVRAZ is seeking a Senior Process Engineer, Threading for our Calgary facility. The incumbent will provide technical support to the mill operations in areas involving primarily threading processes (thread tooling design, pipe threading, etc.). This person is responsible for identifying opportunities for current process improvement and interfaces with Engineering, Quality Assurance and operations personnel to define the actual process changes. During process improvement activities, the Senior Process Engineer is responsible for leading root cause assessment, process mapping, fishboning, trial planning and real-time process control initiatives. Written summaries of the key findings and recommendations is also an important aspect of the work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Develop product capability studies of key threading attributes (thread dimensions, etc.) periodically, to identify how the threading processes are performing</li><li>Develop trending for quality KPI's such as rejects, rework, downgrades by mill/product, and key process factors, correlate this data to process conditions, publish update reports and provides analysis of the data with necessary action items and work with operations/quality team to improve trends</li><li>Supports Tubular Products Group product development activities concerning new or upgraded threaded connections when required</li><li>Promotes the continual education of our QA personnel by providing annual training programs in the areas of thread measurement, Torque-turn review, gage management, etc.</li><li>Lead brainstorming sessions (A3, and FMEA types) with operations and quality personnel during the initial stages of the process control effort or efforts to improve the process</li><li>Conduct process optimization trials at EVRAZ tubular mills using statistical methods (Design of Experiments) as necessary</li><li>If financial investment is required, provide support to the QA/Operations teams to define the potential savings of process improvements</li><li>Work with the Quality Assurance and Operations teams to ensure that shop floor documents and training identify the features of process control of the primary process parameters</li><li>Attend six sigma, lean manufacturing and process control equipment conferences to stay abreast of process control techniques/advancements/that can be used in our manufacturing processes to continually improve our performance</li></ul> <ul> <li>Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent</li><li>5 years' experience working in a Quality Assurance or Engineering team</li><li>Familiar with ISO Quality standards and Quality Management Systems including quality control planning for new products</li><li>Demonstrated experience in applying root cause problem solving methods (Ford 8D, Ishikawa diagrams, Failure Mode Effects Analysis etc.) to manufacturing problems</li><li>Demonstrated experience using MS Excel or Minitab to analyze numerical data and draw conclusions</li><li>Excellent presentation skills, experience giving presentations to management regarding project results</li><li>Experience writing technical reports summarizing key findings and identifying next steps</li><li>Strong ability to establish effective working relationships at all levels, experience working with interdepartmental teams at all levels of management to accomplish tasks</li><li>Knowledge of pipe/steel mill processes and threading operations a plus</li><li>Knowledge of tubular industry standards including API, CSA, and ASTM a plus</li><li>Six Sigma green belt qualification a plus</li><li>Proficient in MS Office tools such as MS Word and PowerPoint</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Process Engineer, Threading
